original: Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa🔽Majjhimanikāye
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa  majjhima nikāye
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One🔽In the Middle Length Sayings

original: Majjhimapaṇṇāsaṭīkā
translated: Commentary on the Middle Fifty

original: 1. Gahapativaggo
analyzed: gahapati vaggo
translated: The Householder Chapter

original: 1. Kandarakasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kandaraka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Explanation of the Kandarakasutta

original: 1. Ārāmapokkharaṇīādīsūti ārāmapokkharaṇīuyyānacetiyaṭṭhānādīsu. Ussannāti bahulā.
analyzed: ārāma pokkharaṇī ādīsu iti ārāma pokkharaṇī uyyāna cetiya ṭṭhāna ādīsu ussannā ati bahulā
translated: The phrase “in the pleasure park, lotus pond, etc.” refers to pleasure parks, lotus ponds, pleasure groves, shrines, and so on. “Abundant” means plentiful.

original: Asokakaṇikārakoviḷārakumbhīrājarukkhehi sammissatāya taṃ campakavanaṃ nīlādipañcavaṇṇakusumapaṭimaṇḍitanti
analyzed: asoka kaṇikāra koviḷāra kumbhī rājarukkhehi sammissa tāya tam campaka vanam nīla ādi pañca vaṇṇa kusuma paṭimaṇḍitan ti
translated: The Campaka Wood is adorned with flowers of the five colors, blue, etc., because it is mixed with the Asoka, Kanikara, Kovidara, and Kumbhira trees.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ, na campakarukkhānaṃyeva nīlādipañcavaṇṇakusumatāyāti vadanti. Bhagavā
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam na nīla ādi pañca vaṇṇa kusuma tāya iti vadanti bhagavā
translated: It should be seen in this way, they say, not that the Campaka trees themselves have flowers of the five colors, blue, etc. The Blessed One

original: kusumagandhasugandhe campakavane viharatīti iminā na māpanakāle eva tasmiṃ nagare
analyzed: kusuma gandha sugandhe campaka vane viharati iti na māpana kāle eva tasmin nagare
translated: dwells in the Campaka Wood, fragrant with the sweet scent of flowers. By this he shows that not only at the time of its foundation

original: campakarukkhā ussannā, atha kho aparabhāgepīti dasseti. “Pañcasatamattehi aḍḍhateḷasehī”ti
analyzed: campaka rukkhāḥ ussannāḥ atha kho apara bhāge pi iti dasseti pañca sata mattehi aḍḍhata iḷasehi iti
translated: but also in later times the Campaka trees were abundant in that city. “With a little over five hundred”

original: evaṃ adassitaparicchedena. Hatthino cāreti sikkhāpetīti hatthācariyo hatthīnaṃ sikkhāpako,
analyzed: evam a dassita paricchedena hatthino cāreti sikkhāpeti iti hatthācariyaḥ hatthīnam sikkhāpako
translated: is the number given without specifying. “Elephant trainer” is one who trains elephants, a trainer of elephants.

original: tassa puttoti āha “hatthācariyassa putto”ti. Tadā bhagavā tesaṃ pasādajananatthaṃ
analyzed: tassa putto ti āha hatthācariyassa putto ti tadā bhagavā tesam pasāda janana attham
translated: He was the son of a master elephant trainer, and so the Elder said, “The son of a master elephant trainer.”🔽At that time the Blessed One was sitting there, not concealing his own Buddha glory, but showing it, in order to generate confidence in them.

original: attano buddhānubhāvaṃ aniguhitvāva nisinnoti dassento “chabbaṇṇānaṃ ghanabuddharasmīna”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: attanaḥ buddha anubhāvam a niguhitvā ava nisinnaḥ ti dassentaḥ chabbaṇṇānam ghana buddha rasmīnaṃ ti ādim āha
translated: “With the six-colored rays of the Buddha’s glory” is said.

original: Bhagavato ceva gāravenāti bhagavato garubhāvena, bhagavati gāravenāti vā pāṭho.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca iva gāravena ati bhagavataḥ garu bhāvena bhagavati gāravena ati vā pāṭhaḥ
translated: “Out of respect for the Blessed One”: because of the Blessed One’s greatness, or because of the Blessed One’s respect.

original: Niccaṃ na hotīti abhiṇhaṃ na hoti, kadācideva hotīti attho. Abhiṇhaniccatā hi idha
analyzed: niccam na hoti iti abhiṇham na hoti kadācid eva hoti iti atthaḥ abhiṇha nicca tā hi idha
translated: “It is not permanent”: it is not always so; the meaning is that it is sometimes so. For here

original: adhippetā, na kūṭaṭṭhaniccatā. Loke kiñci vimhayāvahaṃ disvā hatthavikārampi karonti,
analyzed: adhippetāḥ na kūṭaṭṭha nicca tā loke kiñci vimhayā āvaham disvā hattha vikāram pi karonti
translated: what is intended is the permanence of repetition, not the permanence of stability. In the world, when they see something that is a cause of wonder, they make a gesture with their hands,

original: aṅguliṃ vā phoṭayanti, taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “accharaṃ paharituṃ yutta”nti. Abhūtapubbaṃ
analyzed: aṅgulim vā phoṭayanti tam sandhāya vuttam accharam paharitum yuttam ti abhūta pubbam
translated: or they snap their fingers. With that in mind it was said, “It is fitting to snap one’s fingers.”

original: bhūtanti ayaṃ niruttinayo yebhuyyena upādāya ruḷhīvasena vuttoti veditabbo. Tathā
analyzed: ayam nirutti nayaḥ yebhuyyena upādāya ruḷhī vasena vuttaḥ iti veditabbaḥ tathā
translated: “What has not been before”: this explanation should be understood as given for the most part according to the usage of the world.

original: hi pāḷiyaṃ “yepi te, bho gotama, ahesuṃ atītamaddhāna”ntiādi vuttaṃ, kiñci akattabbampi
analyzed: hi pāḷiyam ye pi te bho gotama ahesum atītam addhāna nti ādi vuttam kiñci a kattabbam pi
translated: For in the text it is said, “Those who were in the past, Master Gotama” and so on. And although there is nothing to be done

original: kariyamānaṃ dukkarabhāvena vimhayāvahaṃ hoti, tathā kiñci kattabbaṃ, purimaṃ garahacchariyaṃ,
analyzed: kariyamānam dukkara bhāvena vimhaya āvaham hoti tathā kiñci kattabbam purimam garaha chariyam
translated: and it is a wonder that it is done, since it is hard to do. So too, some action is to be deprecated, and some is to be commended.

original: pacchimaṃ pasaṃsacchariyaṃ, tadubhayaṃ suttapadaso dassetuṃ “tatthā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pacchimam pasaṃsat śariyam tat ubhayam sutta padasaḥ dassetum tattha atiādi vuttam
translated: In order to show both of these by the words of the text, the following is said:🔽“In the right way”: established in the right way. This way is the highest: this is the highest development.

original: Sammā paṭipāditoti sammāpaṭipadāyaṃ ṭhapito. Esā paṭipadā paramāti etaparamaṃ, bhāvanapuṃsakaniddesoyaṃ
analyzed: sammā paṭipādito ti sammā paṭipadā ayam ṭhapito esā paṭipadā paramā ti eta paramam bhāva napuṃsaka niddesaḥ yaṃ
translated: The masculine form is used in the sense of the neuter.🔽Just as in the passage, “The sun and moon move irregularly” .

original: yathā “visamaṃ candimasūriyā parivattantī”ti. Ayañhettha attho – bhagavā bhikkhusaṅgho
analyzed: yathā visamam candima sūriyā parivattanti iti ayam ha ittha atthaḥ bhagavā bhikkhu saṅghaḥ
translated: The meaning here is this: The Blessed One has established the bhikkhu Saṅgha in the right way.

original: paṭipadāya tumhehi paṭipādito, atītepi kāle buddhā etaparamaṃyeva bhikkhusaṅghaṃ
analyzed: paṭipadāya tumhehi paṭipāditaḥ atīte api kāle buddhāḥ eta paramam yeva bhikkhu saṅghaṃ
translated: In the past, too, the Buddhas established the bhikkhu Saṅgha in the right way, which is the highest.

original: sammā paṭipādesuṃ, anāgatepi kāle etaparamaṃyeva bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sammā paṭipādessantīti
analyzed: sammā paṭipādesuṃ anāgate pi kāle eta paramam yeva bhikkhu saṅgham sammā paṭipādessanti iti
translated: In the future, too, they will establish the bhikkhu Saṅgha in the right way, which is the highest.

original: paribbājako nayaggāhena diṭṭhena adiṭṭhaṃ anuminanto sabbesampi buddhānaṃ sāsane
analyzed: paribbājakaḥ naya ggāhena diṭṭhena adiṭṭham anuminantaḥ sabbesam pi buddhānam sāsane
translated: The wanderer, inferring from what he had seen by the method of identity of nature, said that in the dispensation of all the Buddhas

original: saṅghasuppaṭipattiṃ majjhe bhinnasuvaṇṇaṃ viya samasamaṃ katvā dasseti, evaṃ dassento
analyzed: saṅgha su paṭipattim majjhe bhinna suvaṇṇam viya samasamam katvā dasseti evam dassentaḥ
translated: He shows the Order’s good practice as being even like well-refined gold,

original: ca tesaṃ sudhammatañca tathā dasseti evāti veditabbo, buddhasubuddhatā pana nesaṃ
analyzed: ca tesam su dhamma tañca tathā dasseti eva ati veditabbaḥ buddha su buddha tā pana nesam
translated: and in showing it thus he shows their excellence too, it should be understood. But the excellence of the Enlightened One and the excellence of the True Idea and the excellence of the Community are shown in their own nature.

original: sarūpeneva dassitāti. Na ito bhiyyoti iminā pāḷiyaṃ etaparamaṃyevāti avadhāraṇena
analyzed: sarūpena iva dassitā ati na itas bhiyyas iti iminā pāḷiyam avadhāraṇena
translated: ‘No more than this’ : by this he shows that the limitation is stated in the text by the word ‘only’ .

original: nivattitaṃ dasseti sīlapadaṭṭhānattā samādhissa, samādhipadaṭṭhānattā ca paññāya
analyzed: nivattitam dasseti sīla padaṭṭhāna ttā samādhissa samādhi padaṭṭhāna ttā ca paññāya
translated: Because concentration has virtue for its footing and understanding has concentration for its footing,

original: sīlepi ca abhisamācārikapubbakattā ādibrahmacariyakassa vuttaṃ “ābhisamācārikavattaṃ ādiṃ katvā”ti.🔽2. Pucchānusandhiādīsu anantogadhattā “pāṭiekko anusandhī”ti vatvā tamevatthaṃ pākaṭaṃ
analyzed: sīle api ca abhisamācārika pubbaka ttā ādibrahmacariyakassa vuttam ābhisamācārika vattam ādim katvā iti  puccha anusandhi ādīsu anusandhi iti vatvā tam eva attham pākaṭam
translated: and because the first-beginning-of-life-as-a-monk’s practice has the observance-of-virtue for its first beginning, it is said ‘ Beginning with the observance of virtue ‘.

original: kātuṃ “bhagavā kirā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Upasantakāraṇanti upasantabhāvakāraṇaṃ. Tañhi ariyānaṃyeva
analyzed: kātum bhagavā kirāti ādi vuttam upasanta kāraṇam ti upasanta bhāva kāraṇam tat hi ariyānam yeva
translated: As to the questions and so on, since the connexion is not endless, he said ‘ The connexion is not endless ‘, and then in order to make that meaning clear he said ‘ The Blessed One, it seems ‘, and so on. The reason for the peace is the cause for the state of peace. For that is the province of Noble Ones only,

original: visayo, tatthāpi ca buddhānaṃ eva anavasesato visayoti imamatthaṃ byatirekato anvayato
analyzed: visayo tattha api ca buddhānam eva anavasesataḥ visayo ti imam attham byatirekataḥ anvayato
translated: and even there it is the province of Buddhas only without remainder. This is the meaning. He shows this by a distinction and by a connexion.

original: ca dassetuṃ na hi tvantiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha ñātatthacariyā kākajātakādivasena veditabbā,
analyzed: ca dassetum na hi tva ntiādi vuttam tattha ñāta attha cariyā kāka jātaka ādi vasena veditabbā
translated: and “You are not able to show” is said. Herein, the conduct of the known meaning should be understood by way of the Crow Birth Story, etc.,

original: lokatthacariyā taṃtaṃpāramipūraṇavasena, buddhatthacariyā mahābodhijātakādivasena.
analyzed: lokattha cariyā taṃtaṃ pārami pūraṇa vasena buddhattha cariyā mahā bodhi jātaka ādi vasena
translated: the conduct of the world meaning by way of the fulfilment of the various perfections, and the conduct of the Buddha meaning by way of the Great Bodhi Birth Story, etc.

original: Acchariyaṃ bho gotamātiādinā kandarakena kataṃ pasādapavedanaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: acchariyam bho gotamāti ādinā kandarakena katam pasāda pavedanam dasseti
translated: “It is wonderful, Master Gotama!” etc., he shows the expression of his confidence by Kandaka.

original: Yepi tetiādinā tena vuttamatthaṃ paccanubhāsantena bhagavatā sampaṭicchitanti caritattā
analyzed: ye pi te iti ādinā tena vuttam attham paccanubhāsantena bhagavatā sampaṭicchitam ti carita ttā
translated: “Those who have gone forth,” etc., the Blessed One, by repeating what was said by him, shows his acceptance of it.🔽“There is a reason for this,” he says, “which is a separate connection.”

original: āha – “santi hi kandarakāti ayampi pāṭiyekko anusandhī”ti. Yo hi kandarakena bhikkhusaṅghassa🔽upasantabhāvo kittito, taṃ vibhajitvā dassentopi tena apucchitoyeva attano ajjhāsayena🔽bhagavā “santi hī”tiādinā desanaṃ ārabhi. Tenāha “bhagavato kira etadahosī” tiādi.
analyzed: āha santi hi kandarakā ti ayam pi pāṭiyekkaḥ anusandhi iti yaḥ hi kandarakena bhikkhu saṅghassa  upasanta bhāvaḥ tam vibhajitvā dassentaḥ api tena a pucchitaḥ yā iva attanaḥ  bhagavān santi hi itiādinā desanam ārabhi tena āha tiādi
translated: For what was extolled by Kandaka as the peacefulness of the Community of Bhikkhus,🔽the Blessed One, without being asked by him, shows it by dividing it up,🔽and he begins his teaching with “There are, indeed,” by way of his own intention. Therefore he says, “It occurred to the Blessed One, it seems,” etc.

original: Kappetvāti aññathā santameva attānaṃ aññathā vidhāya. Pakappetvāti sanidassanavasena
analyzed: kappetvā ti aññathā santam eva attānam aññathā vidhāya pakappetvā ti sanidassana vasena
translated: “Having made a show”: having made a show of himself as being otherwise than he really is. “Having made a display”: having made a show of himself by way of the visible.

original: gahetvā. Tenāha “kuhakabhāvenā”tiādi. Paṭipadaṃ pūrayamānāti kāmaṃ avisesena sekkhā
analyzed: gahetvā tena āha kuhaka bhāvena atiādi paṭipadam pūrayamānā ati kāmam avisesena sekkhā
translated: and he said “by the state of being a cheat” and so on.

original: vuccanti, te pana adhigatamaggavasena “pūrayamānā”ti na vattabbā kiccassa niṭṭhitattā.
analyzed: vuccanti te pana adhigata magga vasena pūrayamānā ati na vattabbā kiccassa niṭṭhita ttā
translated: Practising the way: although in general those who are training are called “practising the way,” they cannot be called “practising the way” in the sense of the path that has been reached, because the task has been completed.

original: Maggo hi ekacittakkhaṇikoti āha “uparimaggassa vipassanāya upasantā”ti. Ito muttāti
analyzed: maggaḥ hi eka citta kkhaṇikaḥ ti āha upari maggassa vipassanāya upasantā ati itas muttā ati
translated: For the path is a single moment of consciousness. That is why he said “who are calmed by insight into the higher path.”

original: maggenāgatūpasamato muttā. Kalyāṇaputhujjane sandhāya vadati. Tenāha “catūhi satipaṭṭhānehi upasantā”ti.
analyzed: maggena āgata upasamataḥ muttā kalyāṇa puthujjane sandhāya vadati tena āha catūhi sati paṭṭhānehi upasantā iti
translated: Free from here: free from the peace that has come with the path. He speaks with reference to good ordinary men. That is why he said “who are calmed by the four foundations of mindfulness.”🔽Constant virtue: unbroken virtue. For their virtue is unbroken, etc., in the sense of being beyond reproach.

original: Satatasīlāti avicchinnasīlā. Sātisayo hi etesaṃ sīlassa akhaṇḍādibhāvo. Suparisuddhasīlatāvasena🔽santatā vutti etesanti santatavuttinoti āha “tasseva vevacana”nti. Evaṃ sīlavuttivasena
analyzed: satata sīlā ati avicchinna sīlā sa atisayaḥ hi etesam sīlassa akhaṇḍa ādi bhāvo su parisuddha sīla tā vasena  santatā vutti etesanti santata vuttino ti āha tassa iva evam sīla vutti vasena
translated: They are constant in conduct because of their extreme purity of virtue.🔽That is why he said “it is a synonym for that.”

original: “santatavuttino”ti padassa atthaṃ vatvā idāni jīvitavuttivasena dassento “santatajīvikāvāti
analyzed: santata vuttino ti padassa attham vatvā idāni jīvita vutti vasena dassento santata jīvikā vā ati
translated: Having stated the meaning of the expression “constant in conduct” in terms of virtue and conduct, he now shows it in terms of livelihood and life by saying “constant in livelihood and life.”

original: attho”ti āha. Sāsanassa jīvitavutti sīlasannissitā evāti āha “tasmi”ntiādi.
analyzed: atthaḥ ti āha sāsanassa jīvita vutti sīla sannissitā eva ati āha tasmin tiādi
translated: That is why he said “therein” and so on.

original: Nipayati visoseti rāgādisaṃkilesaṃ, tato vā attānaṃ nipātīti nipako, paññavā. Tenāha
analyzed: nipayati visoseti rāga ādi saṃkilesam tatas vā attānam nipāti iti nipako paññavā tena āha
translated: He removes, he sorts out, the defilements of lust, etc., or he throws himself into that, thus he is “wise” , discerning. Hence it is said:🔽“He is discerning” .

original: “paññavanto”ti. Paññāya ṭhatvā jīvikākappanaṃ nāma buddhapaṭikuṭṭhamicchājīvaṃ pahāya🔽sammājīvena jīvananti taṃ dassento “yathā ekacco”tiādimāha. Tattha yaṃ vattabbaṃ,
analyzed: paññavanto ti paññāya ṭhatvā jīvikākappanam nāma buddha paṭikuṭṭham icchājīvam pahāya  sammājīvena jīvananti tam dassentaḥ yathā ekacco ti ādim āha tattha yam vattabbam
translated: Having stood by means of understanding, he makes his living by the right livelihood that is the opposite of the wrong livelihood of Buddha’s disciples.🔽He lives by the right livelihood. Showing that, he said “Just as a certain man” and so on. Herein, what is to be said has been said in the Visuddhimagga and in the commentary on that.

original: taṃ visuddhimagge taṃsaṃvaṇṇanāyañca vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ. Rathavinītapaṭipadādayo
analyzed: tat visuddhi magge tad saṃvaṇṇanāyan ca vutta nayena iva veditabbam ratha vinīta paṭipad ādayaḥ
translated: The road-systems of the chariot, etc.,🔽should be understood in the way stated in the various suttas.

original: tesu tesu suttesu vuttanayena veditabbā. Ito aññattha mahāgopālakasuttādīsu lokuttarasatipaṭṭhānā
analyzed: tesu tesu suttesu vutta nayena veditabbā itas aññattha mahāgopālaka sutta ādīsu lokuttara sati paṭṭhānā
translated: The supramundane kinds of mindfulness have been taught elsewhere, in the Mahāgopālaka Sutta, etc.

original: kathitāti āha – “idha pana lokiyalokuttaramissakā satipaṭṭhānā kathitā”ti, satipaṭṭhānasuttepi
analyzed: kathitā iti āha idha pana lokiya lokuttara missakā sati paṭṭhānā kathitā iti sati paṭṭhāna sutte pi
translated: That is why he said “Herein, however, the kinds of mindfulness are taught as a mixture of mundane and supramundane” .🔽In the Satipaṭṭhāna Sutta too they are taught as a mixture.

original: vomissakāva kathitāti. Ettakenāti ettakāya desanāya.
analyzed: kathitā ati ettakena ati ettakāya desanāya
translated: “To this extent” : to this extent in the teaching.

original: 3. Kārakabhāvanti paṭipattiyaṃ paṭipajjanakabhāvaṃ. Mayampi nāma gihī bahukiccā samānā
analyzed: kāraka bhāvanti paṭipattiyam paṭipad janaka bhāvam mayam pi nāma gihī bahu kiccā samānā
translated: We householders, though we have many duties,

original: kālena kālaṃ satipaṭṭhānesu suppatiṭṭhitacittā viharāma, kimaṅgaṃ pana vivekavāsinoti
analyzed: kālena kālam sati paṭṭhānesu su patiṭṭhita cittāḥ viharāma kim aṅgam pana viveka vāsinaḥ ti
translated: from time to time dwell with our minds well established in the establishments of mindfulness. How much more so those who dwell in seclusion!

original: attano kārakabhāvaṃ pavedento evaṃ bhikkhusaṅghañca ukkhipati. Tenāha “ayañhettha
analyzed: attanaḥ kāraka bhāvam pavedentaḥ evam bhikkhu saṅgham ca ukkhipati tena āha ayam ha ittha
translated: Thus, by proclaiming his own state of being a doer, he extols the bhikkhu-saṅgha. Therefore it is said: “This is the meaning here.”

original: adhippāyo”tiādi. Nānārammaṇesu aparāparaṃ uppajjamānānaṃ rāgādikilesānaṃ ghanajaṭitasaṅkhātākārena🔽pavatti kilesagahanena gahanatā, tenāha “anto jaṭā bahi jaṭā, jaṭāya jaṭitā pajā”ti.🔽Manussānaṃ ajjhāsayagahaṇena sāṭheyyampīti dassento āha “kasaṭasāṭheyyesupi eseva
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ ti ādi nānā ārammaṇesu apara aparam uppajjamānānam rāga ādi kilesānam ghana jaṭita saṅkhāta ākārena  kilesa gahanena gahana tā tena āha antar jaṭā bahi jaṭā jaṭāya jaṭi tā pajāti  manussānam ajjhāsaya gahaṇena sāṭheyyam pi iti dassentaḥ āha kasaṭa sāṭheyyesu pi esā eva
translated: The state of being dense is the occurrence in the form of a thick entanglement of the defilements such as lust, etc., which arise in succession with regard to various objects.🔽Thus it is said: “Tangles within, tangles without, the people are entangled in tangles.”🔽Showing that the state of being dense is also deceitfulness by way of grasping the thoughts of men, he says: “The same method applies to deceitfulness and fraudulence.”

original: nayo”ti. Yathā sappimadhuphāṇitādīsu kacavarabhāvo, so kasaṭoti vuccati, evaṃ santāne
analyzed: nayo ti yathā sappi madhu phāṇita ādīsu kacavara bhāvo so kasaṭaḥ ti vuccati evam santāne
translated: Just as the state of being a husk is called “fraudulence” in ghee, honey, molasses, etc., so in the mental continuum.

original: aparisuddho saṃkilesabhāvo kasaṭanti āha “aparisuddhaṭṭhena kasaṭatā”ti. Attani asantaguṇasambhāvanaṃ🔽kerāṭiyaṭṭho. Jānātīti “idaṃ ahitaṃ na sevitabbaṃ, idaṃ hitaṃ sevitabba”nti vicāreti🔽deseti. Vicāraṇatthopi hi hoti jānāti-saddo yathā “āyasmā jānātī”ti. Sabbāpi…pe…🔽adhippetā “pasupālakā”tiādīsu viya. Idha antara-saddo “vijjantarikāyā”tiādīsu viya
analyzed: aparisuddhaḥ saṃkilesa bhāvaḥ kasaṭanti āha aparisuddha aṭṭhena kasaṭa tā ti asanta guṇa sambhāvanam  kerāṭiya ṭṭhaḥ jānāti iti idam ahitam na sevitabbam idam hitam sevitabbanti vicāreti  dese ti vicāraṇa atthaḥ api hi hoti jānāti saddaḥ yathā jānāti iti  adhippetā pasupālakā ati ādīsu viya idha antara saddaḥ vijjantarikāyā ati ādīsu viya
translated: The state of being impure, of being defiled, is the dirt. The meaning of “not pure” is the meaning of “dirt.”🔽The meaning of “pretense” is the meaning of “fraud.”🔽“He knows” means he considers: “This is unbeneficial and should not be practiced; this is beneficial and should be practiced.”🔽The word “knows” has the meaning of “to consider,” just as in the expression “the venerable one knows.”🔽All means all, as in the expression “all beings.”🔽Here the word “between” has the meaning of “existing,” as in the expression “between the eyebrows.”

original: khaṇatthoti āha “yattakena khaṇenā”ti. Tenāti hatthinā. Tānīti sāṭheyyādīni.🔽Atthato kāyacittujukatāpaṭipakkhabhūtāva lobhasahagatacittuppādassa pavattiākāravisesāti🔽tāni pavattiākārena dassetuṃ “tatthā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha yassāti pāṇabhūtassa assassa🔽vā hatthino vā. Ṭhassāmīti tattheva sappaṭibhaye ṭhāne gantvā ṭhassāmīti na hoti.
analyzed: āha yattakena khaṇena ati tena ati hatthinā tāni iti sāṭheyya ādīni 🔽atthataḥ kāya cittujuka tā paṭipakkha bhūtā ava lobha sahagata cittuppādassa pavatti ākāra visesā ti 🔽tāni pavatti ākārena dassetum tattha atiādi vuttam tattha yassa ati pāṇa bhūtassa assassa 🔽vā hatthinaḥ vā ṭhassāmi iti tattha iva sa paṭibhaye ṭhāne gantvā ṭhassāmi iti na hoti
translated: The state of being impure, which is the state of being defiled, is the mud. The meaning of “mud” is the meaning of “impurity.” The meaning of “crookedness” is the meaning of “crookedness of mind.” The meaning of “fraud” is the meaning of “pretense.” The meaning of “pretense” is the meaning of “pretending to be what one is not.” The meaning of “deception” is the meaning of “deception of mind.” The meaning of “deception of mind” is the meaning of “deception.” The meaning of “dissimulation” is the meaning of “dissimulation of mind.” The meaning of “dissimulation of mind” is the meaning of “dissimulation.” The meaning of “dissimulation” is the meaning of “concealment.” The meaning of “concealment” is the meaning of “concealment of mind.” The meaning of “concealment of mind” is the meaning of “concealment.” The meaning of “concealment” is the meaning of “concealing.” The meaning of “concealing” is the meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed.” The meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed” is the meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed.” The meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed” is the meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed.” The meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed” is the meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed.” The meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed” is the meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed.” The meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed” is the meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed.” The meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed” is the meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed.” The meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed” is the meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed.” The meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed” is the meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed.” The meaning of “concealing what is seen, heard, or sensed” is

original: Imassa sāṭheyyatāya pākaṭakaraṇaṃ vañcanādhippāyabhāvato. Tathā hi catūsu ṭhānesu
analyzed: imassa sāṭheyya tāya pākaṭa karaṇam vañcana adhippāya bhāvato tathā hi catūsu ṭhānesu
translated: The purpose of the deception is to make it obvious that he is a cheat. For it is said in the four lines beginning, “Having deceived,”

original: “vañcetvā” icceva vuttaṃ, niguhanto pana tattheva gantvā tiṭṭheyya. Esa nayo sesesupi.
analyzed: vañcetvā iccā iva vuttam niguhanto pana tattha iva gantvā tiṭṭheyya esa nayo sesesu pi
translated: that he should go and stand there concealing himself. The same method applies to the rest.🔽“One who wants to go back by the way he came”: one who wants to go back by the way he came and return home.

original: Paṭimaggaṃ ārohitukāmassāti āgatamaggameva nivattitvā gantukāmassa. Leṇḍavissajjanādīsu
analyzed: paṭimaggam ārohitu kāmassa ati āgata maggam eva nivattitvā gantu kāmassa leṇḍa vissajjana ādīsu
translated: In the case of the “discharging of the load,” etc.,

original: kālantarāpekkhābhāvaṃ “tathā”ti iminā upasaṃharati.🔽Antojātakāti attano dāsiyā kucchimhi jātā. Dhanakkītāti dhanaṃ datvā dāsabhāvena
analyzed: kāla antara apekkhā bhāvam tathā iti iminā upasaṃharati  antojātakā ati attanaḥ dāsiyā kucchimhi jātā dhana kkītā ati dhanam da tvā dāsa bhāvena
translated: the fact that he is looking for a time to desert them is included by the word “thus.”

original: gahitā. Karamarānītāti dāsabhāvena karamaraggāhagahitā. Dāsabyanti dāsabhāvaṃ. Pessāti
analyzed: gahitā karamara ānītā ati dāsa bhāvena karamara ggāha gahitā dāsabyanti dāsa bhāvam
translated: “Born in the house”: born in the house of his own slave. “Bought with money”: bought as a slave by giving money. “Bought by the hand”: bought as a slave by working for wages. “Slavery”: the state of being a slave. “A servant”:

original: adāsā eva hutvā veyyāvaccakarā. Imaṃ vissajjetvāti imaṃ attano hatthagataṃ vissajjetvā.
analyzed: adāsāḥ eva hutvā veyyāvaccakarā imam vissajjetvā iti imam attanaḥ hattha gatam vissajjetvā
translated: one who is not a slave but works for wages. “Having discharged this”: having discharged the one in his own hands.

original: Imaṃ gaṇhantāti imaṃ tassa hatthagataṃ gaṇhantā. Sammukhato aññathā parammukhakāle
analyzed: imam gaṇhantā ati imam tassa hattha gatam gaṇhantā sammukhataḥ aññathā parammukha kāle
translated: “Taking that”: taking the one in the other’s hands. “In the presence of the other”: at a time when the other is present.

original: kāyavācāsamudācāradassaneneva cittassa nesaṃ aññathā ṭhitabhāvo niddiṭṭhoti veditabbo.
analyzed: kāya vācā samudācāra dassanena iva cittassa nesam aññathā ṭhita bhāvaḥ niddiṭṭhaḥ ti veditabbo
translated: And the fact that their minds are otherwise disposed should be understood to be indicated by the fact that their bodily and verbal conduct are otherwise disposed.

original: 4. Ayampi pāṭiyekko anusandhīti etthāpi anantare vuttanayeneva anusandhiyojanā veditabbā.
analyzed: ayam pi pāṭiyekkaḥ anusandhi iti ettha api anantare vutta nayena iva anusandhi yojanā veditabbā
translated: This is another sequence. Here too the sequence should be understood as stated in the preceding sutta.

original: Tenevāha “ayañhī”tiādi. Catuttho hitapaṭipadaṃ paṭipannoti yojanā. Puggalasīsena
analyzed: tena iva āha ayam hi itiādi catutthaḥ hita paṭipadam paṭipannaḥ iti yojanā puggala sīsena
translated: Hence he says, “For this reason,” etc. The application is: “The fourth one practices the way of welfare.”

original: puggalapaṭipattiṃ dassento “puggale pahāyā”ti āha. Paṭipatti hi idha pahātabbā, na
analyzed: puggala paṭipattim dassentaḥ puggale pahāya iti āha paṭipatti hi idha pahātabbā na
translated: Showing the individual practice, he says, “Having abandoned the three kinds of persons.” For here the practice is to be abandoned, not the persons.

original: puggalā. Yathā assaddhādipuggalaparivajjanena saddhindriyādibhāvanā ijjhanti, evaṃ🔽micchāpaṭipannapuggalaparivajjanena micchāpaṭipadā vajjitabbāti āha – “purime tayo
analyzed: puggalāḥ yathā assaddha ādi puggala parivajjanena saddhi indriya ādi bhāvanāḥ ijjhanti evam  micchā paṭipanna puggala parivajjanena micchā paṭipadā vajjitabbā ti āha purime tayo
translated: Just as the development of the faculties of faith, etc., is successful by avoiding persons who are without faith, etc.,🔽so too the avoidance of wrong practice is successful by avoiding persons who are of wrong practice. Hence he says, “Having abandoned the three kinds of persons.”

original: puggale pahāyā”ti. Catutthapuggalassāti imasmiṃ catukke vuttacatutthapuggalassa hitapaṭipattiyaṃyeva
analyzed: puggale pahāya ati catuttha puggalassa ati imasmin catukke vutta catuttha puggalassa hita paṭipattiyaṃ yeva
translated: “The fourth kind of person”: he shows that he practices only the way of welfare of the fourth kind of person mentioned in the fourfold classification.

original: paṭipādemi pavattemīti dassento. Santāti samaṃ vināsaṃ nirodhaṃ pattāti ayamettha
analyzed: paṭipādemi pavattemi iti dassento santā ati samam vināsam nirodham pattā ati ayam ettha
translated: “The same end”: they reach the same end, the same cessation.

original: atthoti āha “niruddhā santāti vuttā”ti. Puna santāti bhāvanāvasena kilesapariḷāhavigamato
analyzed: attho ti āha niruddhā santā ati vuttā ati puna santā ati bhāvanā vasena kilesa pariḷāha vigamato
translated: “Peace” again is said: “They are said to be peaceful because they have gone to the destruction of the defilements’ fever by means of development.

original: santāti ayamettha atthoti āha “nibbutā”ti. Santāti ānetvā yojanā. Santo haveti ettha
analyzed: santā iti ayam ettha attho ti āha nibbutā ati santā iti ānetvā yojanā santaḥ havā iti ettha
translated: This is the meaning here.” “They are said to be extinguished” is said. The construing is “Peace” is said.

original: samabhāvakarena sādhubhāvassa visesapaccayabhūtena paṇḍiccena samannāgatā ariyā “santo”ti
analyzed: sama bhāva karena sādhu bhāvassa visesa paccaya bhūtena paṇḍiccena samannāgatāḥ ariyāḥ santo ti
translated: “They are good, having peace” : the Noble Ones are said to be “peaceful” because they are endowed with the wisdom that is a special condition for the state of being good by means of the state of equanimity.

original: vuttāti āha – “santo have…pe… paṇḍitā”ti.
analyzed: vuttā iti āha paṇḍitā ati
translated: “They are good, having peace, having wisdom, having the state of being good” is said.

original: Āhito ahaṃmāno etthāti attā attabhāvo, idha pana yo paro na hoti, so attā, taṃ attānaṃ.🔽Paranti attato aññaṃ. Chātaṃ vuccati taṇhā jighacchāhetutāya. Anto tāpanakilesānanti
analyzed: āhitaḥ ahaṃmānaḥ ettha ati attā atta bhāvaḥ idha pana yaḥ paraḥ na hoti saḥ attā tam attānam  param ti attataḥ aññam chātam vuccati taṇhā jighacchā hetu tāya antar tāpana kilesānam ti
translated: “Self” is a selfhood, a self-state. But here what is not other is a self, and that self is “one’s own.”🔽“Another” is different from oneself. Craving is called “hunger” because it is the cause of the hunger of craving.🔽“The defilements that burn within” are the defilements that burn and torment the self in one’s own continuity.

original: attano santāne attapariḷāhajananasantappanakilesānaṃ. Cittaṃ ārādhetīti cittaṃ pasādeti,
analyzed: attano santāne atta pariḷāha janana santappana kilesānam cittam ārādheti iti cittam pasādeti
translated: “He satisfies the mind” : he delights the mind. The meaning is that he gladdens it.

original: sampahaṃsetīti attho. Yasmā pana tathābhūto cittaṃ sampādento ajjhāsayaṃ gaṇhanto
analyzed: sampahaṃseti iti atthaḥ yasmai pana tathābhūtaḥ cittam sampādentaḥ ajjhāsayam gaṇhantaḥ
translated: But because he is of that kind, he satisfies the mind, and he is called “one who takes up the position of” .

original: nāma hoti, tasmā vuttaṃ “cittaṃ sampādetī”tiādi.
analyzed: nāma hoti tasmai vuttam cittam sampādeti itiādi
translated: That is why it is said “He satisfies the mind” and so on.

original: 5. Dukkhaṃ paṭikkūlaṃ jegucchaṃ etassāti dukkhapaṭikkūlo taṃ dukkhapaṭikkūlaṃ. Visesanavisesitabbatā🔽hi kāmacārā. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana dukkhassa visesitabbataṃ sandhāya bāhiratthasamāsaṃ🔽anādiyitvā “dukkhassa paṭikkūla”nti attho vutto. Yena hi bhāgena purisassa dukkhaṃ
analyzed: dukkham paṭikkūlam jeguccham etassa ati dukkha paṭikkūlaḥ tat dukkha paṭikkūlam visesana visesitabba tā  hi kāmacārāḥ aṭṭhakathāyam pana dukkhassa visesitabba tam sandhāya bāhirattha samāsam  an ādiyitvā dukkhassa paṭikkūlanti atthaḥ vuttaḥ yena hi bhāgena purisassa dukkham
translated: “It is the repulsive in the form of pain” : the repulsive is what is called the repulsive .🔽For the compound is a bahubbīhi,🔽not a tatpurisa, in the sense of “the repulsive of pain.”🔽For the meaning is “that which is repulsive in the form of pain,” and it is so called because it is repulsive to a man in the sense of being undesirable.

original: paṭikkūlaṃ, tena dukkhassa purisopīti. Tenāha – “paccanīkasaṇṭhita”nti.
analyzed: paṭikkūlam tena dukkhassa purisaḥ api iti tena āha paccanīka saṇṭhitanti
translated: “It is the repulsive in the form of pain” is said in the commentary with reference to the fact that pain is what should be distinguished.🔽“By four reasons” : by the four reasons beginning with skill in the elements.

original: 6. Catūhi kāraṇehīti dhātukusalatādīhi catūhi kāraṇehi. Kammaṃ karotīti yogakammaṃ
analyzed: catūhi kāraṇehi iti dhātu kusala tā ādīhi catūhi kāraṇehi kammam karoti iti yoga kammam
translated: “He does the work of yoking” : he does the work of meditation.

original: karoti. Yasmā sambuddhā paresaṃ maggaphalādhigamāya ussāhajātā, tattha nirantaraṃ
analyzed: karoti yasmai sambuddhā paresam magga phala adhigamāya ussāha jātā tattha nirantaram
translated: For the Enlightened Ones are eager to arouse in others the attainment of the paths and fruits. They are constantly and continuously

original: yuttappayuttā eva honti, te paṭicca tesaṃ antarāyo na hotiyevāti āha “na pana buddhe
analyzed: yutta ppayuttāḥ eva honti te paṭicca tesam antarāyaḥ na āha na pana buddhe
translated: engaged in that. There is no obstacle to that on their part. Therefore it is said, “But not on the part of the Enlightened Ones.”

original: paṭiccā”ti. Kiriyaparihāniyā desakassa tasseva vā puggalassa tajjapayogābhāvato.
analyzed: paṭicca ati kiriya parihāniyā desakassa tassa iva vā puggalassa
translated: For the failure of an action is due either to the absence of the proper place or to the absence of the proper person or to the absence of the proper effort.

original: “Desakassa vā”ti idaṃ sāvakānaṃ vasena daṭṭhabbaṃ. Mahatā atthenāti ettha attha-saddo🔽ānisaṃsapariyāyoti āha “dvīhi ānisaṃsehī”ti. Pasādaṃ paṭilabhati “arahanto”tiādinā🔽saṅghasuppaṭipattiyā sutattā. Abhinavo nayo udapādi santatasīlatādivasena anattantapatādivasena,🔽sopi taṃ sutvā dāsādīsu savisesaṃ lajjī dayāpanno hitānukampī hutvā sekkhapaṭipadaṃ🔽sīlaṃ sādhento anukkamena satipaṭṭhānabhāvanaṃ paribrūheti. Tenāha bhagavā “mahatā🔽atthena saṃyutto”ti.
analyzed: desakassa vā ti idam sāvakānam vasena daṭṭhabbam mahatā atthena ati ettha attha saddaḥ  ānisaṃsa pariyāyā iti āha dvīhi ānisaṃsehi iti pasādam paṭilabhati arahanto tiādinā  saṅgha su paṭipattiyā su tattā abhinavaḥ nayaḥ udapādi santata sīla tā ādi vasena anattantapa tā ādi vasena  saḥ api tam sutvā dāsa ādīsu sa visesam lajjī dayā āpannaḥ hita anukampī hutvā sekkha paṭipadam  sīlam sādhentaḥ anukkamena sati paṭṭhāna bhāvanam paribrūha iti tena āha bhagavā mahatā  atthena saṃyuttā ti
translated: “Or for the country” should be understood as for the disciples. “For a great benefit”: the word attha

original: 8. Paresaṃ hananaghātanādinā rodāpanato luddo, tathā vighātakabhāvena kāyacittānaṃ vidāraṇato dāruṇo, viruddhavādatāya kakkhaḷo, bandhanāgāre niyutto bandhanāgāriko.
analyzed: paresam hanana ghātana ādinā roda āpanataḥ luddaḥ tathā vighātaka bhāvena kāya cittānam vidāraṇataḥ dāruṇaḥ viruddha vāda tāya kakkhaḷaḥ bandhanāgāre niyuttaḥ bandhanāgāriko
translated: is a synonym for ānisaṃsa, a benefit, a good result, a profit, a blessing, a reward, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward, a profit, a benefit, a good result, a blessing, a fruit, a consequence, a result, a reward

original: 9. Khattiyābhisekenāti khattiyānaṃ kattabbaabhisekena. Santhāgāranti santhāravasena🔽kataṃ agāraṃ yaññāvāṭaṃ. Sappitelenāti sappimayena telena, yamakasnehena hi tadā🔽kāyaṃ abbhañjati. Vacchabhāvaṃ taritvā ṭhito vacchataro. Parikkhepakaraṇatthāyāti
analyzed: khattiya abhisekena ati khattiyānam kattabba abhisekena santhāgāram ti santhāra vasena  katam agāram yaññāvāṭam sappi telena ati sappi mayena telena yamaka snehena hi tadā  kāyam abbhañjati vaccha bhāvam taritvā ṭhitaḥ vacchataro parikkhepa karaṇa tthāya ati
translated: 9. By the consecration of a Khattiya: by the consecration that should be performed for Khattiyas. A meeting-hall: a house made for the purpose of a meeting. With ghee and oil: with ghee as oil. For at that time they anointed the body with a double-strength embrocation. Having crossed the state of a calf, he stood as a bull. For the purpose of delimiting:

original: vanamālāhi saddhiṃ dabbhehi vediyā parikkhepanatthāya. Yaññabhūmiyanti avasesayaññaṭṭhāne.
analyzed: vanamālāhi saddhim dabbhehi vediyā parikkhepana tthāya yañña bhūmiyanti avasesa yañña ṭṭhāne
translated: 9. With the consecration of the Khattiyas: with the consecration to be performed for the Khattiyas. The sacrificial enclosure: a house built for the purpose of the sacrificial enclosure. With ghee and oil: with ghee and oil. For at that time the body was anointed with double-strength oil. Having crossed the state of a calf, he stands as a bull. For the purpose of enclosing: for the purpose of enclosing the altar with the reeds together with the garlands of the forest. The sacrificial ground: in the place of the remaining sacrifice.

original: Yaṃ panettha atthato avibhattaṃ taṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: yam pana ittha atthataḥ a vibhattam tam su viññeyyam eva
translated: But what here is not explained in meaning is quite clear.

original: Kandarakasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
translated: The explanation of the Kandarakasutta, which shows the condensed meaning, is finished.

original: 2. Aṭṭhakanāgarasuttavaṇṇanā🔽17. Avidūreti iminā pāḷiyaṃ “vesāliya”nti idaṃ samīpe bhummavacananti dasseti. Sārappattakulagaṇanāyāti
analyzed: aṭṭhaka nāgara sutta vaṇṇanā  avidūra iti iminā pāḷiyam vesāliyam ti idam samīpe bhumma vacanam ti dasseti sāra ppatta kula gaṇanāya ati
translated: The explanation of the Aṭṭhakanāgarasutta

original: mahāsāramahappattakulagaṇanāya. Dasame ṭhāneti aññe aññeti dasagaṇanaṭṭhāne. Aṭṭhakanagare
analyzed: mahāsāra mahappatta kula gaṇanāya dasame ṭhāne iti aññe aññe iti dasa gaṇana ṭṭhāne aṭṭhaka nagare
translated: Not far: by this he shows that in the text “Vesāliya” is a locative of proximity. By the reckoning of the families that had attained greatness: by the reckoning of the families that had attained great substance. In the place of the tenth: in the place of the reckoning of the ten. In the eight cities

original: jāto bhavo aṭṭhakanāgaro. Kukkuṭārāmoti pāṭaliputte kukkuṭārāmo, na kosambiyaṃ.🔽18. Pakatatthaniddeso ta-saddoti tassa “bhagavatā”tiādīhi padehi samānādhikaraṇabhāvena🔽vuttassa yena abhisambuddhabhāvena bhagavā pakato adhigato supākaṭo ca, taṃ abhisambuddhabhāvaṃ
analyzed: jātaḥ bhavaḥ aṭṭhaka nāgaro kukkuṭa ārāmo ti pāṭaliputte kukkuṭa ārāmaḥ na kosambiyam  ta saddaḥ ti tassa bhagavatā ati ādīhi padehi samāna adhikaraṇa bhāvena  vuttassa yena abhisambuddha bhāvena bhagavā pakataḥ adhigataḥ su pākaṭaḥ ca tam abhisambuddha bhāvam
translated: He was born as the Naga king Aṭṭhaka. The Kukkuṭa Monastery: in Pāṭaliputta, not in Kosambī.🔽The description of the state of being fully enlightened: the word “that” is used in the sense of the state of being fully enlightened, which is the same as the state of being fully enlightened by which the Blessed One is fully enlightened and well enlightened, together with the way of practice that should be followed.

original: saddhiṃ āgamanīyapaṭipadāya atthabhāvena dassento “yo so…pe… abhisambuddho”ti āha.
analyzed: saddhim āgamanīya paṭipadāya attha bhāvena dassentaḥ yaḥ sope abhisambuddhaḥ ti āha
translated: He said, “That which is fully enlightened by the Blessed One” in order to show that.

original: Satipi ñāṇadassana-saddānaṃ idha paññāvevacanabhāve tena tena visesena tesaṃ visayavisese🔽pavattidassanatthaṃ asādhāraṇañāṇavisesavasena vijjāttayavasena vijjāabhiññānāvaraṇañāṇavasena
analyzed: sati pi ñāṇa dassana saddānam idha paññā vevacana bhāve tena tena visesena tesam visaya visese  pavatti dassana attham asādhāraṇa ñāṇa visesa vasena vijjā ttaya vasena vijjā abhiññāna āvaraṇa ñāṇa vasena
translated: Although the words “knowledge” and “seeing” are here synonyms for understanding, in order to show that they occur with a particular distinction in a particular distinction of object,🔽he said “knowledge of omniscience” in the sense of a particular knowledge not held in common, “the three knowledges” in the sense of the three kinds of direct-knowledge, “knowledge of the destruction of the cankers” in the sense of the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers,

original: sabbaññutañāṇamaṃsacakkhuvasena paṭivedhadesanāñāṇavasena ca tadatthaṃ yojetvā dassento
analyzed: sabbaññuta ñāṇa maṃsa cakkhu vasena paṭivedha desanā ñāṇa vasena ca tad attham yojetvā dassento
translated: and “the knowledge of teaching penetration” in the sense of the eye of the flesh of omniscience.

original: “tesaṃ tesa”ntiādimāha. Tattha āsayānusayaṃ jānatā āsayānusayañāṇena sabbaṃ ñeyyadhammaṃ
analyzed: tesam tesam ti ādim āha tattha āsayā anusayam jānatā āsayā anusaya ñāṇena sabbam ñeyya dhammam
translated: He says “who knows” and so on. Herein, knowing the underlying tendency of the various kinds of dispositions is by means of the knowledge of the underlying tendency .🔽Seeing all knowable dhammas is by means of the knowledge of omniscience that is unobstructed about all dhammas.

original: passatā sabbaññutānāvaraṇañāṇehi. Pubbenivāsādīhīti pubbenivāsāsavakkhayañāṇehi.
analyzed: passatā sabbaññu tā anāvaraṇa ñāṇehi pubbenivāsa ādīhi iti pubbenivāsa āsava kkhaya ñāṇehi
translated: By means of the knowledge of recollection of past lives and of the destruction of the taints is by means of the knowledge of the recollection of past lives and of the destruction of the taints.

original: Paṭivedhapaññāyāti ariyamaggapaññāya. Desanāpaññāya passatāti desetabbadhammānaṃ
analyzed: paṭivedha paññāya ati ariya magga paññāya desanā paññāya passatā ti desetabba dhammānam
translated: By means of the knowledge of penetration is by means of the knowledge of the noble path.

original: desetabbappakāraṃ bodhaneyyapuggalānañca āsayānusayacaritādhimuttiādibhedaṃ dhammadesanāpaññāya
analyzed: desetabba ppakāram āsaya anusaya carita adhimutti ādi bhedam dhamma desanā paññāya
translated: By means of the knowledge of teaching is by means of the knowledge of teaching the Dhamma that should be taught, and the dispositions, underlying tendencies, conduct, and propensities, and so on, of the people to be taught.🔽By means of the knowledge of seeing is by means of the knowledge of seeing as it really is.

original: yāthāvato passatā. Arīnanti kilesārīnaṃ, pañcavidhamārānaṃ vā, sāsanassa vā paccatthikānaṃ
analyzed: yāthāvataḥ passatā arīnanti kilesa arīnam pañcavidha mārānam vā sāsanassa vā paccatthikānam
translated: The enemies is the defilement enemies or the five enemies , or the sectarians who are enemies of the Dispensation.

original: aññatitthiyānaṃ tesaṃ pana hananaṃ pāṭihāriyehi abhibhavanaṃ appaṭibhānatākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: añña titthiyānam tesam pana hananam pāṭihāriyehi abhibhavanam appaṭibhāna tā karaṇam
translated: The slaying of them is the overcoming of them by means of the supernormal powers, or the rendering of them incapable of reply,

original: ajjhupekkhanameva vā, kesivinayasuttañcettha nidassanaṃ.
analyzed: ajjhupekkhanam eva vā kesivinaya suttam ca ittha nidassanam
translated: or the mere overlooking of them. The Kesava Sutta may be cited here as an example.

original: Tathā ṭhānāṭṭhānādivibhāgaṃ jānatā yathākammūpagasatte passatā, savāsanānaṃ āsavānaṃ
analyzed: tathā ṭhāna aṭṭhāna ādi vibhāgam jānatā yathā kammūpaga satte passatā sava āsanānam āsavānam
translated: Similarly, by means of the knowledge of seeing is by means of the knowledge of seeing the distinction between right and wrong, and so on, and the beings who are reborn according to their kamma. By means of the knowledge of seeing is by means of the knowledge of seeing the destruction of the taints together with their residues.

original: khīṇattā arahatā, abhiññeyyādibhede dhamme abhiññeyyādito aviparītāvabodhato sammāsambuddhena.
analyzed: khīṇattā arahatā abhiññeyya ādi bhede dhamme abhiññeyya āditaḥ a viparīta avabodhato sammāsambuddhena
translated: He is the Enlightened One because he has awakened to the three kinds of knowledge, namely, the knowledge of the past and future by the knowledge of the three periods of time, the knowledge of the path and not-path by the knowledge of omniscience, and the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers by the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.🔽Or alternatively, he is the knower because his knowledge is unobstructed in the three times.

original: Atha vā tīsu kālesu appaṭihatañāṇatāya jānatā, kāyakammādivasena tiṇṇaṃ kammānaṃ🔽ñāṇānuparivattito nisammakāritāya passatā, davādīnaṃ abhāvasādhikāya pahānasampadāya
analyzed: atha vā tīsu kālesu appaṭihata ñāṇa tāya jānatā kāya kamma ādi vasena tiṇṇam kammānam  ñāṇa anuparivattitaḥ nisamma kāritāya passatā dava ādīnam abhāva sādhikāya pahāna sampadāya
translated: He is the seer because his knowledge follows after the three kinds of action, namely, bodily, verbal, and mental, and because he acts with full awareness.🔽He is the destroyer of the cankers because he has perfected the abandoning of the cankers by the attainment of the exhaustion of the cankers’ roots.

original: arahatā, chandādīnaṃ ahānihetubhūtāya akkhayapaṭibhānasādhikāya sabbaññutāya sammāsambuddhenāti
analyzed: arahatā chanda ādīnam ahāni hetu bhūtāya akkhaya paṭibhāna sādhikāya sabbaññu tāya sammāsambuddhena ati
translated: He is the Enlightened One because he has perfected omniscience by the attainment of inexhaustible eloquence, which is the cause of the non-diminution of zeal, etc.

original: evaṃ dasabalaaṭṭhārasaāveṇikabuddhadhammavasenapi yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: evam dasa bala aṭṭhārasa āveṇika buddha dhamma vasena api yojanā kātabbā
translated: Thus the interpretation should be made by way of the ten powers and the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha.

original: 19. Abhisaṅkhatanti attano paccayehi abhisammukhabhāvena samecca sambhūyya kataṃ,
analyzed: abhisaṅkhatanti attanaḥ paccayehi abhisammukha bhāvena sametca sambhūyya katam
translated: “Conditioned” : made by its own conditions, by being brought together and assembled in the presence of itself.

original: svassa katabhāvo uppādanena veditabbo, na uppannassa paṭisaṅkharaṇenāti āha “uppādita”nti.
analyzed: svassa kata bhāvaḥ uppādanena veditabbaḥ na uppannassa paṭisaṅkharaṇena ati āha uppāditam ti
translated: Its state of being made should be understood by its production, not by its re-fashioning of what already exists. Therefore it is said: “produced.”

original: Te cassa paccayā cetanāpadhānāti dassetuṃ pāḷiyaṃ “abhisaṅkhataṃ abhisañcetayita”nti
analyzed: te ca ssa paccayā cetanā apadhānā ati dassetum pāḷiyam abhisaṅkhatam abhisañcetayitanti
translated: In order to show that its conditions are the chief among the mental factors, the text says: “conditioned, well-considered.”

original: vuttanti “cetayitaṃ pakappita”nti atthamāha. Abhisaṅkhataṃ abhisañcetayitanti ca
analyzed: vuttam ti cetayitam pakappitam ti attham āha abhisaṅkhatam abhisañcetayitam iti ca
translated: “Said” means “thought out and planned.” “ Formed and put together”

original: jhānassa pātubhāvadassanamukhena viddhaṃsanabhāvaṃ ulliṅgeti yañhi ahutvā sambhavati,
analyzed: jhānassa pātubhāva dassana mukhena viddhaṃsana bhāvam ulliṅgeti yat hi a hutvā sambhavati
translated: means “formed and put together by the kamma-process.” He intimates the state of being broken up by the method of showing the manifestation of jhāna, for what is not and what is come to an end.

original: taṃ hutvā paṭiveti. Tenāha pāḷiyaṃ ‘abhisaṅkhata’ntiādi. Samathavipassanādhamme ṭhitoti🔽samathadhamme ṭhitattā samāhito vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā aniccānupassanādīhi niccasaññādayo
analyzed: tam hutvā paṭiveti tena āha pāḷiyam abhisaṅkhata ntiādi samatha vipassanā dhamme ṭhitaḥ ti  samatha dhamme ṭhita ttā samāhitaḥ vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā anicca anupassana ādīhi nicca saññā ādayo
translated: Therefore it is said in the text: “formed and put together.” “ Standing in the Dhamma of serenity and insight”

original: pajahanto anukkamena taṃ anulomañāṇaṃ pāpetā hutvā vipassanādhamme ṭhito. Samathavipassanāsaṅkhātesu
analyzed: pajahantaḥ anukkamena tam anuloma ñāṇam hutvā vipassanā dhamme ṭhitaḥ samatha vipassanā saṅkhātesu
translated: means that he is standing in the Dhamma of serenity because he is concentrated, and he is standing in the Dhamma of insight because he has reached the conformity knowledge by gradually abandoning the perception of permanence, etc., by insight beginning with the contemplation of impermanence, etc.

original: dhammesu rañjanaṭṭhena rāgo, nandanaṭṭhena nandīti. Tattha sukhumā apekkhā vuttā,
analyzed: dhammesu rañjana ṭṭhena rāgaḥ nandana ṭṭhena nandī iti tattha sukhumā apekkhā vuttā
translated: In the Dhamma of serenity and insight, which are called “serenity” and “insight,” there is passion in the sense of delighting, and there is delight in the sense of rejoicing.🔽Here subtle expectation is called “fondness.”

original: yā “nikantī”ti vuccati.
analyzed: yā nikantī iti vuccati
translated: This is what is meant by “fondness.”

original: Evaṃ santeti evaṃ yathārutavasena ca imassa suttapadassa atthe gahetabbe sati. Samathavipassanāsu
analyzed: evam santā iti evam yathāruta vasena ca imassa sutta padassa atthe gahetabbe sati samatha vipassanāsu
translated: “If this is so”: if the meaning of this sutta passage is to be taken literally.

original: chandarāgo kattabboti anāgāmiphalaṃ nibbattetvā tadatthāya samathavipassanāpi anibbattetvā🔽kevalaṃ tattha chandarāgo kattabbo bhavissati. Kasmā? Tesu samathavipassanāsaṅkhātesu
analyzed: chanda rāgaḥ kattabbaḥ ti anāgāmi phalam nibbattetvā tad atthāya samatha vipassanā api a nibbattetvā  kevalam tattha chanda rāgaḥ kattabbaḥ bhavissati kasmā tesu samatha vipassanā saṅkhātesu
translated: Having produced the fruit of non-return, he should not produce the serenity and insight that are the means to that end.

original: dhammesu chandarāgamattena anāgāminā laddhabbassa aladdhānāgāmiphalena laddhabbattā
analyzed: dhammesu chanda rāga mattena anāgāminā laddhabbassa aladdha anāgāmi phalena laddhabba ttā
translated: He should have only desire and lust for it. Why? Because what is to be obtained by the non-returner through mere desire and lust for those states called serenity and insight is obtained by one who has not obtained the fruit of non-return.

original: tathā sati tena anāgāmiphalampi laddhabbameva nāma hoti. Tenāha – “anāgāmiphalaṃ
analyzed: tathā sati tena anāgāmi phalam pi laddhabbam eva nāma hoti tena āha anāgāmi phalam
translated: And so the fruit of non-return is also to be obtained by him. That is why it is said: “The fruit of non-return will be penetrated.”

original: paṭividdhaṃ bhavissatī”ti. Sabhāvato rasitabbattā aviparīto attho eva attharaso.
analyzed: paṭividdham bhavissati iti sabhāvataḥ rasitabba ttā aviparītaḥ atthaḥ eva attha rasaḥ
translated: The meaning that is not upside-down is the meaning of the essence because it is to be savoured as the individual essence.

original: Aññāpi kāci sugatiyoti vinipātike sandhāyāha. Aññāpi kāci duggatiyoti asurakāyamāha.🔽Samathadhurameva dhuraṃ samathayānikassa vasena desanāya āgatattā. Mahāmālukyovāde
analyzed: aññā api kāci sugatiyā iti vinipātike sandhāya āha aññā api kāci duggatiyā iti asura kāyam āha  samatha dhuram eva dhuram samatha yānikassa vasena desanāyaḥ mahāmālukya uvāde
translated: “Any other good destination” is said with reference to the hells. “Any other bad destination” is said with reference to the animal world.🔽Because the teaching comes under the heading of serenity in the case of one whose vehicle is serenity.

original: “vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāra”nti pādakajjhānaṃ katvā “so yadeva
analyzed: vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāranti pādakajjhānam katvā saḥ yat eva
translated: In the Mahāmāluṅkyavāda Sutta the basic jhāna is given first with the words, “Quite secluded from sense desires, secluded from unprofitable things” , and then the path with the words, “He enters upon and dwells in the first jhāna” .

original: tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgata”ntiādinā vipassanaṃ vitthāretvā “so tattha ṭhito
analyzed: tattha hoti rūpa gatam vedanā gata nti ādinā vipassanam vitthāretvā saḥ tattha ṭhitaḥ
translated: And because it is said: “Standing upon that,🔽he reaches the destruction of the cankers” ,

original: āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpuṇātī”ti āgatattā “mahāmālukyovāde vipassanāva dhura”nti āha.
analyzed: āsavānam khayam pāpuṇāti iti āgata ttā mahāmālukyovāde vipassanā ava dhuranti āha
translated: it is said that insight is the burden in the Mahāmāluṅkyavāda .🔽In the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna Sutta, the burden is borne by insight of the kind that is threefold in its purpose and universal in its scope.

original: Mahāsatipaṭṭhānasutte sabbatthakameva tikkhatarāya vipassanāya āgatattā vuttaṃ “vipassanuttaraṃ
analyzed: mahāsatipaṭṭhāna sutte sabbatthakam eva tikkhatarāya vipassanāya āgatattā vuttam vipassanuttaram
translated: That is why it is said that it is “declared to be insight’s burden” .

original: kathita”nti. Kāyagatāsatisutte ānāpānajjhānādivasena savisesaṃ samathavipassanāya
analyzed: kathitam ti kāya gata asati sutte āna apāna jhāna ādi vasena sa visesam samatha vipassanāya
translated: In the Kāyagatāsati Sutta, it is borne by serenity and insight with their special qualities, which are respectively the signless and the perception of foulness.

original: āgatattā vuttaṃ “samathuttaraṃ kathita”nti.
analyzed: āgata ttā vuttam samathuttaram kathitam iti
translated: That is why it is said that it is “declared to be serenity’s burden” .

original: Appaṃ yācitena bahuṃ dentena uḷārapurisena viya ekaṃ dhammaṃ pucchitena “ayampi ekadhammo”ti
analyzed: appam yācitena bahum dentena uḷāra purisena viya ekam dhammam pucchitena ayam pi eka dhammaḥ ti
translated: Just as a very generous man gives much when asked for little, so too, when asked about one thing, he answered “This one thing”

original: kathitattā ekādasapi dhammā pucchāvasena ekadhammo nāma jāto paccekaṃ vākyaparisamāpanañāyena.
analyzed: kathita ttā ekādasa api dhammā pucchā vasena eka dhammo nāma jātaḥ paccekam vākya parisamāpana ñāyena
translated: and so made eleven things into one thing by way of the question, or else he completed the sentence by the method of taking each term separately.

original: Ekavīsati pabbāni tehi bodhiyamānāya paṭipadāya ekarūpattā paṭipadāvasena ekadhammo
analyzed: ekavīsati pabbāni tehi bodhiyamānāya paṭipadāya eka rūpa ttā paṭipadā vasena eka dhammaḥ
translated: The practice is one thing because the twenty-one hundred powers of enlightenment that are being developed by that practice have a single nature.

original: nāma jātoti. Idha imasmiṃ aṭṭhakanāgarasutte. Nevasaññānāsaññāyatanadhammānaṃ saṅkhārāvasesasukhumabhāvappattatāya
analyzed: nāma jātaḥ ti idha imasmin aṭṭhaka nāgara sutte nevasaññā nāsañña āyatana dhammānam saṅkhāra avasesa sukhuma bhāva ppatta tāya
translated: Because the mental data of the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception have reached the state of subtle residual formations,🔽the teaching is not given here by way of the fourth immaterial state.

original: tattha sāvakānaṃ dukkaranti na catutthāruppavasenettha desanā āgatāti catunnaṃ brahmavihārānaṃ,
analyzed: tattha sāvakānam na catuttha āruppa vasena ittha desanā āgatā ati catunnam brahmavihārānam
translated: So there are eleven by way of the four divine abidings and the first three immaterial states.

original: heṭṭhimānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ āruppānañca vasena ekādasa. Pucchāvasenāti “atthi nu kho, bhante
analyzed: heṭṭhimānam tiṇṇam āruppānam ca vasena ekādasa pucchā vasena ati atthi nu kho bhante
translated: By way of the question: “Is there, venerable sir,

original: ānanda, tena…pe… sammāsambuddhena ekadhammo akkhāto”ti evaṃ pavattapucchāvasena.
analyzed: ānanda tenape sammāsambuddhena eka dhammo akkhāto ti evam pavatta pucchā vasena
translated: a single idea taught by the Blessed One … a Fully Enlightened One?”

original: Amatuppattiyatthenāti amatabhāvassa uppattihetutāya, sabbānipi kammaṭṭhānāni ekarasampi🔽amatādhigamapaṭipattiyāti attho, evamettha aggaphalabhūmi anāgāmiphalabhūmīti dveva
analyzed: amata uppattiyā atthena ati amata bhāvassa uppatti hetutāya sabbāni api kammaṭṭhānāni ekarasam pi  amata adhigama paṭipattiyā ti attho evam ettha agga phala bhūmi anāgāmi phala bhūmi iti dvā iva
translated: As a cause for the arising of the deathless: as a cause for the arising of the state of deathlessness.🔽All meditation subjects have the same taste in that they are the way to attain the deathless.🔽So the meaning is: the plane of the supreme fruit and the plane of the fruit of non-returner are the two planes that are stated in their individual forms.

original: bhūmiyo sarūpato āgatā, nānantariyatāya pana heṭṭhimāpi dve bhūmiyo atthato āgatā evāti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: bhūmiyaḥ sarūpataḥ āgatāḥ nānantariyatāya pana heṭṭhimā api dve bhūmiyaḥ atthataḥ āgatāḥ eva ati daṭṭhabbā
translated: But the two lower planes should be regarded as stated in their individual forms too by way of their being next to each other.

original: 21. Pañca satāni aggho etassāti pañcasataṃ. Sesaṃ uttānameva.
analyzed: pañca satāni etassa ati pañca satam sesam uttānam eva
translated: 500 is its price: pañcasataṃ. The rest is clear.

original: Aṭṭhakanāgarasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: aṭṭhaka nāgara sutta vaṇṇanāya līnattha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the brief account in the Discourse on the Eight-Factored Man is finished.

original: 3. Sekhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sekha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discourse on the Initiate

original: 22. Santhāgāranti atthānusāsanāgāraṃ. Tenāha – “uyyogakālādīsū”tiādi. Ādi-saddena
analyzed: santhāgāram ti attha anusāsana āgāram tena āha uyyoga kāla ādīsu itiādi ādi saddena
translated: A meeting-hall: a hall for the purpose of giving advice. Hence he says “at the time of the recitation, etc.” The word “etc.”

original: maṅgalamahādīnaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Santhambhantīti vissamanti, parissamaṃ vinodentīti🔽attho. Sahāti sannivesavasena ekajjhaṃ. Saha atthānusāsanaṃ agāranti etasmiṃ atthe
analyzed: maṅgala mahā ādīnam saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo santhambhanti iti vissamanti parissamam vinodenti iti  atthaḥ saha iti sannivesa vasena ekajjham saha attha anusāsanam etasmin atthe
translated: should be regarded as including the Great Benediction. They rest: they relax; the meaning is that they remove fatigue.🔽Together: in a single place by way of a gathering. Together with the advice: it should be regarded as said that the -tha- of attha was made the -ntha- of santhā,

original: ttha-kārassa ntha-kāraṃ katvā santhāgāranti vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Santharantīti sammantanavasena tiṭṭhanti.🔽Tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ āgatameva bhavissatīti buddhavacanassa āgamanasīsena ariyaphaladhammānampi🔽āgamanaṃ vuttameva, tiyāmarattiṃ tattha vasantānaṃ phalasamāpattivaḷañjanaṃ hotīti.
analyzed: tthakārassa nthakāram katvā vuttanti daṭṭhabbam santharanti iti sammantana vasena tiṭṭhanti 🔽tepiṭakam buddha vacanam āgatam eva bhavissati iti buddha vacanassa āgamana sīsena ariya phala dhammānam pi 🔽āgamanam vuttam eva tiyāma rattim tattha vasantānam phala samāpatti vaḷañjanam hoti iti
translated: because of the advice in this meaning. They rest: they stand by way of agreement.

original: Tasmiñca bhikkhusaṅghe kalyāṇaputhujjanā vipassanaṃ ussukkāpentā hontīti ce? Ariyamaggadhammānaṃ
analyzed: tasmin ca bhikkhu saṅghe kalyāṇa puthujjanāḥ vipassanam ussukkāpentāḥ honti iti ce ariya magga dhammānam
translated: And if it be said that in that Sangha of bhikkhus there are good ordinary men who are intent on insight,

original: tattha āgamanaṃ hotiyeva.🔽Allagomayenāti acchena allagomayarasena. Opuñchāpetvāti vilimpitvā. Catujjātiyagandhehīti
analyzed: tattha āgamanam  alla gomayena ati acchena alla gomaya rasena vilimpitvā catur jātiya gandhehi iti
translated: then the arrival of the states of the noble path is inevitable.

original: tagarakuṅkumayavanapupphatamālapattāni pisitvā katagandhehi nānāvaṇṇeti nīlādivasena🔽nānāvaṇṇe, na bhittivisesavasena. Bhittivisesavasena pana nānāsaṇṭhānarūpameva. Mahāpiṭṭhikakojavaketi🔽hatthipiṭṭhīsu attharitabbatāya mahāpiṭṭhikāti laddhasamaññe kojaveti vadanti. Kuttake🔽pana sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ hatthattharaṇā hatthirūpavicittā. Assattharakasīhattharakādayopi
analyzed: tagara kuṅkuma yavana puppha tamāla pattāni pisitvā kata gandhehi nānā vaṇṇā iti nīla ādi vasena  nānā vaṇṇe na bhitti visesa vasena bhitti visesa vasena pana nānā saṇṭhāna rūpam eva mahāpiṭṭhika kojavaka iti  hatthi piṭṭhīsu attharitabba tāya mahāpiṭṭhikā ati laddha samaññe kojavā iti vadanti kuttake  pana sandhāya itam vuttam hatthattharaṇāḥ hatthi rūpa vicittāḥ assattharaka sīhattharaka ādayaḥ api
translated: With fresh cow-dung: with fresh cow-dung juice that is not yet dry. After smearing: after anointing. With the four-kinds-of-perfumed-water: with perfumes made by pounding together agarwood, yellow sandalwood, black aloes, and jasmine buds. With various colours: with various colours such as blue, etc.,🔽not with various shapes, for the various shapes are the various shapes of the various kinds of flowers. The great-slab-elephant-tusk-boards: they call them “great slabs” because they are spread on the back of the hand. They are “elephant tusks” because they are like elephant tusks. But this is said with reference to the ivory

original: assasīharūpādivicittā eva attharakā, cittattharakaṃ nānārūpehi ceva nānāvidhamālākammādīhi🔽ca vicittaṃ attharakaṃ.
analyzed: assa sīha rūpa ādi vicittāḥ eva attharakā cittattharakam nānā rūpehi ca iva nānāvidha mālā kamma ādīhi 🔽ca vicittam attharakam
translated: work. The horse-boards and the lion-boards are also boards decorated with the various shapes of horses and lions, etc. The various-coloured-boards are boards decorated with various shapes and with various kinds of ornamental work such as garlands, etc.

original: Upadhānanti apassayanaṃ upadahitvāti apassayayoggabhāvena ṭhapetvā gandhehi katamālā
analyzed: upadhānam ti apassayanam upadahitvā ati apassaya yoggabhāvena ṭhapetvā gandhehi kata mālā
translated: “Garlands” are garlands made of scents.

original: gandhadāmaṃ, tamālapattādīhi kataṃ pattadāmaṃ. Ādi-saddena hiṅgulatakkolajātiphalajātipupphādīhi
analyzed: gandha dāmam tamāla patta ādīhi katam patta dāmam ādi saddena hiṅgula takkola jāti phala jāti puppha ādīhi
translated: “Scented garlands” are garlands made of tālavaṇṭa, etc.🔽“Beds” are couches made in the shape of beds.

original: katadāmaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Pallaṅkākārena katapīṭhaṃ pallaṅkapīṭhaṃ, tīsu passesu, ekapasse
analyzed: kata dāmam saṅgaṇhāti pallaṅka ākārena kata pīṭham pallaṅka pīṭham tīsu passesu eka passe
translated: “Seats” are couches made in the three-quarter or full-length form.

original: eva vā saupassayaṃ apassayapīṭhaṃ, anapassayaṃ muṇḍapīṭhaṃ yojanāvaṭṭeti yojanaparikkhepe.
analyzed: eva vā sa aupassayam apassaya pīṭham an apassayam muṇḍa pīṭham yojana avaṭṭeti yojana parikkhepe
translated: “Beds and seats” are beds and seats that are not used.🔽“Surroundings” are the surroundings of a monastery.

original: Saṃvidhāyāti antaravāsakassa koṇapadesañca itarapadesañca samaṃ katvā vidhāya. Tenāha
analyzed: saṃvidhāya ati antara vāsakassa koṇa padesam ca itara padesam ca samam katvā vidhāya tena āha
translated: “Arranging” means arranging by making the corners and other parts of the inner cloth even.

original: – “kattariyā padumaṃ kantanto viyā”ti timaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādentoti ettha ca yasmā buddhānaṃ
analyzed: kattariyā padumam kantantaḥ viyāti ettha ca yasmai
translated: “Like a lotus in a painting” means covering the navel.

original: rūpasampadā viya ākappasampadāpi paramukkaṃsagatā, tasmā tadā bhagavā evaṃ sobhatīti
analyzed: rūpa sampadā viya ākappa sampadā api param ukkaṃsa gatā tasmai tadā bhagavā evam sobhati iti
translated: Herein, because the Blessed One’s perfection of form is the highest, so too is his perfection of deportment. Therefore the Blessed One shines with beauty.

original: dassento “suvaṇṇapāmaṅgenā”tiādimāha, tattha asamena buddhavesenātiādinā tadā bhagavā🔽buddhānubhāvassa niguhaṇe kāraṇābhāvato tattha sannipatitadevamanussanāgayakkhagandhabbādīnaṃ
analyzed: dassentaḥ suvaṇṇa pāmaṅgena atiādim āha tattha asamena buddha vesena ati ādinā tadā bhagavā  buddha anubhāvassa niguhaṇe kāraṇa abhāvataḥ tattha sannipatita deva manussa nāga yakkha gandhabba ādīnam
translated: and showing this, he says “with the golden palm-leaf ornament” , etc. Herein, with the incomparable Buddha-glory: the Blessed One,🔽because there was no reason for concealing the Buddha-power,

original: pasādajananatthaṃ attano sabhāvapakatikiriyāyeva kapilavatthuṃ pāvisīti dasseti.
analyzed: pasāda janana attham attano sabhāva pakati kiriyāya iva kapilavatthum pāvisi iti dasseti
translated: showed that he entered Kapilavatthu with his own natural behaviour, in order to generate confidence in the gods, men, nagas, yakkhas, gandhabbas, etc., who had assembled there.

original: Buddhānaṃ kāyappabhā nāma pakatiyā asītihatthamattameva padesaṃ pharatīti āha – “asītihatthaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: buddhānam kāyappabhā nāma pakatiyāḥ asīti hattha mattam eva padesam pharati iti āha asīti hattha ṭṭhānam
translated: The bodily radiance of Buddhas spreads naturally only a distance of eighty hands, so he said “he took up a position eighty hands away” .

original: aggahesī”ti nīlapītalohitodātamañjiṭṭhapabhassarānaṃ vasena chabbaṇṇā buddharasmiyo.
analyzed: aggahesī iti vasena chabbaṇṇāḥ buddha rasmiyaḥ
translated: The Buddha’s rays are of six colours, namely, blue, yellow, red, white, pink, and clear.

original: Sabbapāliphulloti mūlato paṭṭhāya yāva aggā phullo vikasito. Paṭipāṭiyā ṭhapitānantiādi
analyzed: sabba pāli phullo ti mūlataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva aggā phullaḥ vikasito paṭipāṭiyā ṭhapita ananti ādi
translated: Fully blossomed from the roots upwards: blossomed, expanded, from the roots upwards to the tips. Arranged in order:

original: parikappūpamā. Yathā taṃ…pe… alaṅkataṃ añño virocati, evaṃ virocittha, samatiṃsāya
analyzed: parikappu upamā yathā taṃpe alaṅkatam aññaḥ virocati evam virocittha samatiṃsāya
translated: the simile of the comparison. Just as the other one shines forth, so they shone forth,🔽with the thirty perfections. It is said that they shone forth because they were created by the perfections.

original: pāramitāhi abhisaṅkhatattā evaṃ virocitthāti vuttaṃ hoti. Pañcavīsatiyā nadīnanti
analyzed: pāramitāhi evam virocittha iti vuttam hoti pañcavīsatiyā nadīnam ti
translated: With the twenty-five rivers:

original: gaṅgādīnaṃ candabhāgāpariyosānānaṃ pañcavīsatiyā mahānadīnaṃ. Sambhijjāti sambhedaṃ
analyzed: gaṅgā ādīnam canda bhāga a pariyosānānam pañcavīsatiyā mahā nadīnam sambhijjāti sambhedam
translated: the twenty-five great rivers beginning with the Ganges.

original: missībhāvaṃ patvā mukhadvāreti samuddaṃ paviṭṭhaṭṭhāne.
analyzed: missībhāvam patvā mukha dvāra iti samuddam paviṭṭha ṭṭhāne
translated: “They enter the ocean” means that they enter the ocean at the place where they empty into it.🔽“The eyes of gods, men, nāgas, supaṇṇas, gandhabbas, and yakkhas” is said by way of conjecture.

original: Devamanussanāgasupaṇṇagandhabbayakkhādīnaṃ akkhīnīti cetaṃ parikappanavasena vuttaṃ. Sahassenāti padasahassena, bhāṇavārappamāṇena ganthenāti attho.
analyzed: deva manussa nāga supaṇṇa gandhabba yakkha ādīnam akkhīni iti ca itam parikappana vasena vuttam sahassena ati pada sahassena bhāṇa vāra ppamāṇena ganthena ati attho
translated: “With a thousand” means with a thousand words, with a text of the length of a recitation.

original: Kampayanto vasundharanti attano guṇavisesehi pathavīkampaṃ uppādento, evaṃbhūtopi
analyzed: kampayantaḥ attanaḥ guṇa visesehi pathavī kampam uppādentaḥ evaṃbhūtaḥ api
translated: “Shaking the earth” means causing an earthquake by the excellence of his own qualities.

original: aheṭhayanto pāṇāni. Sabbadakkhiṇattā buddhānaṃ dakkhiṇaṃ paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ uddharanto.
analyzed: a heṭhayantaḥ pāṇāni sabbadakkhiṇattā buddhānam dakkhiṇam paṭhamam pādam uddharantaḥ
translated: “Without harming living beings” means without harming living beings, raising his right foot first, because the Buddhas are right-handers.🔽“He touches the earth evenly” means that because his feet are well-placed, he touches the earth evenly.

original: Samaṃ samphusate bhūmiṃ suppatiṭṭhitapādatāya. Yadipi bhūmiṃ samaṃ phusati, rajasānupalippati
analyzed: samam samphusate bhūmim suppatiṭṭhita pāda tāya yadi api bhūmim samam phusati rajasā an upalippati
translated: Even though he touches the earth evenly, dust does not stick to him

original: sukhumattā chaviyā. Ninnaṭṭhānaṃ unnamatītiādi buddhānaṃ suppatiṭṭhitapādasaṅkhātassa
analyzed: sukhuma tā chaviyāḥ ninna ṭṭhānam unnamati itiādi buddhānam su patiṭṭhita pāda saṅkhātassa
translated: because of the fineness of his skin. “The low places rise up and the high places become level” and so on are said because the feet of the Buddhas are well-placed.

original: mahāpurisalakkhaṇapaṭilābhassa nissandaphalaṃ. Nātidūre uddharatīti atidūre ṭhapetuṃ
analyzed: mahāpurisa lakkhaṇa paṭilābhassa nissanda phalam na atidūre uddharati iti atidūre ṭhapetum
translated: The acquisition of the Great Man’s Marks is the fruit of the outflow . He does not take it too far away is he does not take it and put it too far away.

original: na uddharati. Naccāsanne ca nikkhipanti accāsanne ca ṭhāne anikkhipanto niyyāti.
analyzed: na uddharati na acca āsanne ca nikkhipanti acca āsanne ca ṭhāne a nikkhipantaḥ niyyāti
translated: He does not put it down too near, and he does not go with it too near a place where it might be put down.

original: Hāsayanto sadevake loke tosayanto. Catūhi pādehi caratīti catucārī.
analyzed: hāsayantaḥ sa devake loke tosayantaḥ catūhi pādehi carati iti catu cārī
translated: He goes, making the world of gods and men laugh and rejoice. He goes with four feet is he goes with four modes of deportment.

original: Buddhānubhāvassa pakāsanavasena gatattā vaṇṇakālo nāma kiresa. Sarīravaṇṇe vā guṇavaṇṇe
analyzed: buddha anubhāvassa pakāsana vasena gata ttā vaṇṇa kālaḥ nāma kiresa sarīra vaṇṇe vā guṇa vaṇṇe
translated: This is called the time for praise because of the manifestation of the Buddha’s power. Whether the physical beauty or the special qualities are being discussed,

original: vā kathiyamāne dukkathitanti na vattabbaṃ. Kasmā? Aparimāṇavaṇṇā hi buddhā bhagavanto,
analyzed: vā kathiyamāne dukkathitam ti na vattabbam kasmā aparimāṇa vaṇṇāḥ hi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: it is not to be said that they are being badly spoken of. Why? Because the Blessed Buddhas are of immeasurable beauty.

original: buddhaguṇasaṃvaṇṇanā jānantassa yathādhammasaṃvaṇṇanaṃyeva anupavisatīti.
analyzed: buddha guṇa saṃvaṇṇanāḥ jānantassa yathā dhamma saṃvaṇṇanam yā iva anupavisati iti
translated: When the Buddha’s special qualities are being discussed, it is just a discussion of the Dhamma according to the truth.

original: Dukūlacumbaṭakenāti ganthitvā gahitadukūlavatthena, nāgavikkantacaraṇoti hatthināgasadisapadanikkhepo.
analyzed: dukūla cumbaṭakena ati ganthitvā gahita dukūla vatthena nāga vikkanta caraṇaḥ ti hatthi nāga sadisa pada nikkhepo
translated: With a cloth wrapped around it is with a cloth wrapped around it and tied. He goes with the tread of a lion is he goes with the tread of a great elephant.

original: Satapuññalakkhaṇoti anekasatapuññanimmitamahāpurisalakkhaṇo maṇiverocano yathāti
analyzed: sata puñña lakkhaṇoti aneka sata puñña nimmita mahā purisa lakkhaṇaḥ maṇiverocanaḥ yathā ati
translated: With the three hundred marks is with the three hundred special qualities of a great man produced by a hundred merits. The jewel-like light is the light of a jewel.

original: ativiya virocamāno maṇi viya verocano nāma eko maṇivisesoti keci mahāsālovāti mahanto🔽sālarukkho viya, koviḷārādimahārukkho viya vā padumo kokanado yathāti kokanadasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: ativiya virocamānaḥ maṇi viya verocanaḥ nāma ekaḥ maṇi visesaḥ iti keci mahantaḥ  sāla rukkhaḥ viya koviḷāra ādi mahā rukkhaḥ viya vā padumaḥ kokanadaḥ yathā iti kokanada saṅkhātam
translated: and it shines with a surpassing radiance. It is a special kind of gem called the sun-gem, say some.🔽It is like a great sāla tree,🔽like a great tree such as a koviḷāra, etc., or like a great lotus called a kokanada,

original: mahāpadumaṃ viya, vikasamānapadumaṃ viya vā.
analyzed: mahā padumam viya vikasamāna padumam viya vā
translated: like a full-blown lotus.

original: Ākāsagaṅgaṃ otārento viyātiādi tassā pakiṇṇakakathāya aññesaṃ dukkarabhāvadassanañceva🔽suṇantānaṃ accantasukhāvahabhāvadassanañca pathavījaṃ ākaḍḍhento viyāti nāḷiyantaṃ
analyzed: ākāsagaṅgaṃ otārentaḥ viya atiādi tassā pakiṇṇaka kathāya aññesam dukkara bhāva dassanam ca eva  suṇantānam accanta sukha āvaha bhāva dassanam ca pathavī jam ākaḍḍhentaḥ viyāti nāḷiyantam
translated: “As if dragging up the river of the sky” and so on is said in order to show that it is difficult for others to do and🔽in order to show that it is a source of great happiness for those who do it.🔽“As if dragging up the earth’s root” is said in order to show that it is difficult to do.

original: yojetvā mahāpathaviyā heṭṭhimatale pappaṭakojaṃ uddhaṃmukhaṃ katvā ākaḍḍhento viya
analyzed: yojetvā mahā pathaviyāḥ heṭṭhima tale pappaṭaka ojam uddhaṃmukham katvā ākaḍḍhentaḥ viya
translated: As if hitching a plough to a plough pole and dragging up the earth’s root, which is the lower surface of the earth, turned upside down.

original: yojanikanti yojanappamāṇaṃ madhubhaṇḍanti madhupaṭalaṃ.
analyzed: yojanikam ti yojana ppamāṇam madhubhaṇḍam ti madhu paṭalam
translated: “A league in size” means a league in extent. “A honey-comb” means a mass of honey.

original: Mahantanti uḷāraṃ. Sabbadānaṃ dinnameva hotīti sabbameva paccayajātaṃ āvāsadāyakena
analyzed: mahantam ti uḷāram sabba dānam dinnam eva hoti iti sabbam eva paccaya jātam āvāsa dāyakena
translated: “Great” means abundant. “All gifts are given” means that all the requisites are given by the one who gives the dwelling.

original: dinnameva hoti. Tathāhi dve tayo gāme piṇḍāya caritvā kiñci aladdhā āgatassapi chāyūdakasampannaṃ
analyzed: dinnam eva hoti tathā hi dve tayo gāme piṇḍāya caritvā kiñci a laddhā āgatassa api chāyu udaka sampannam
translated: and it is given. For even one who has gone for alms in two or three villages and has got nothing, or who has got only a little, can go to a monastery that has a tank and

original: ārāmaṃ pavisitvā nhāyitvā paṭissaye muhuttaṃ nipajjitvā uṭṭhāya nisinnassa kāye balaṃ
analyzed: ārāmam pavisitvā nhāyitvā paṭissaye muhuttam nipajjitvā uṭṭhāya nisinnassa kāye balaṃ
translated: and it is given. For even if he has gone for alms in two or three villages and has got nothing, still when he comes to the monastery and bathes in the shade and drinks water and lies down in the cool place for a moment and then gets up and sits, strength comes to his body as if it had been fetched and put there.

original: āharitvā pakkhittaṃ viya hoti. Bahi vicarantassa ca kāye vaṇṇadhātu vātātapehi kilamati,🔽paṭissayaṃ pavisitvā dvāraṃ pidhāya muhuttaṃ nisinnassa visabhāgasantati vūpasammati,
analyzed: āharitvā pakkhittam viya hoti bahi vicarantassa ca kāye vaṇṇa dhātu vāta ātapehi kilamati  paṭissayam pavisitvā dvāram pidhāya muhuttam nisinnassa visa bhāga santati
translated: And while he is wandering outside, the bodily appearance fades in the wind and sun;

original: sabhāgasantati patiṭṭhāti, vaṇṇadhātu āharitvā pakkhittā viya hoti, bahi vicarantassa
analyzed: sa bhāga santati patiṭṭhāti vaṇṇa dhātu āharitvā pakkhittā viya hoti bahi vicarantassa
translated: but when he goes into the shelter and shuts the door and sits down for a moment, the dissimilar continuity subsides and a similar continuity becomes established, and the bodily appearance comes back as if it had been fetched and put there.

original: ca pāde kaṇṭako vijjhati, khāṇu paharati, sarīsapādiparissayo ceva corabhayañca uppajjati,
analyzed: ca pāde kaṇṭakaḥ vijjhati khāṇu paharati sarīsa pādi parissayo ca iva cora bhayam ca uppajjati
translated: And while he is wandering outside, a thorn pricks his foot, a stump strikes him, and there is the danger of snakes, etc., and of robbers;

original: paṭissayaṃ pavisitvā dvāraṃ pidhāya nipannassa pana sabbe parissayā na honti, ajjhayantassa
analyzed: paṭissayam pavisitvā dvāram pidhāya nipannassa pana sabbe parissayāḥ na honti ajjhayantassa
translated: but when he goes into the shelter and shuts the door and lies down, there is no danger from any quarter.

original: dhammapītisukhaṃ, kammaṭṭhānaṃ manasikarontassa upasamasukhaṃ uppajjati bahiddhā🔽vikkhepābhāvato, bahi vicarantassa ca kāye sedā muccanti, akkhīni phandanti, senāsanaṃ
analyzed: dhamma pīti sukham kammaṭṭhānam manasikarontassa upasama sukham uppajjati bahiddhā  vikkhepa abhāvataḥ bahi vicarantassa ca kāye sedāḥ muccanti akkhīni phandanti senāsanam
