translated: He is devoured by the greedy one, that is, his body of states is devoured by the greedy one, that is, by the greedy person, by the one who is greedy for gains, honors, robes, etc., by the one who makes a living by wrong livelihood.🔽He is devoured by the greedy one, that is, his body of states is devoured by the greedy one, that is, by the greedy person, by the one who is greedy for gains, honors, robes, etc., by the one who makes a living by wrong livelihood.🔽He is devoured by the greedy one, that is, his body of states is devoured by the greedy one, that is, by the greedy person, by the one who is greedy for gains, honors, robes, etc., by the one who makes a living by wrong livelihood.

original: nekkhamme cittampi na uppādeti, evaṃ āvaṭṭetvā byasanāpādanena kāmaguṇānaṃ āvaṭṭasadisatā🔽daṭṭhabbā. Tenāha “yathā hī”tiādi.🔽165. Rāgānuddhaṃsitenāti rāgena anuddhaṃsitena. Caṇḍamacchaṃ āgammāti susukādicaṇḍamacchaṃ🔽āgamma. Mātugāmaṃ āgammāti mātugāmo hi yonisomanasikārarahitaṃ adhīrapurisaṃ itthikuttabhūtehi
analyzed: nekkhamme cittam pi na uppādeti evam āvaṭṭetvā byasana āpādanena kāma guṇānaṃ āvaṭṭa sadisa tā  daṭṭhabbā tena āha yathā hi itiādi  rāga an uddhaṃsitena ati rāgena an uddhaṃsitena caṇḍam accham āgamma ati susuka ādi caṇḍam accham  āgamma mātugāmam āgamma ati mātugāmaḥ hi yoni soma nasikāra rahitam adhīra purisam itthi kutta bhūtehi
translated: He is devoured by the greedy one, that is, his body of states is devoured by the greedy one, that is, by the greedy person, by the one who is greedy for gains, honors, robes, etc., by the one who makes a living by wrong livelihood.🔽He is devoured by the greedy one, that is, his body of states is devoured by the greedy one, that is, by the greedy person, by the one who is greedy for gains, honors, robes, etc., by the one who makes a living by wrong livelihood.🔽He is devoured by the greedy one, that is, his body of states is devoured by the greedy one, that is, by the greedy person, by the one who is greedy for gains, honors, robes, etc., by the one who makes a living by wrong livelihood.

original: attano hāvabhāvavilāsehi abhibhuyya gahetvā dhīrajātiyampi attano rūpādīhi palobhanavasena
analyzed: attanaḥ hāva bhāva vilāsehi gahetvā dhīra jātiyam pi attanaḥ rūpa ādīhi palobhana vasena
translated: He is devoured by the greedy one, that is, his body of states is devoured by the greedy one, that is, by the greedy person, by the one who is greedy for gains, honors, robes, etc., by the one who makes a living by wrong livelihood.

original: anavasesaṃ attano upakāradhamme sīlādike sampādetuṃ asamatthaṃ karonto anayabyasanaṃ
analyzed: anavasesam attanaḥ upakāra dhamme sīla ādike sampādetum asamattham karontaḥ anaya byasanam
translated: He makes him incapable of accomplishing the virtues of head-hairs, etc., which are helpful to himself without remainder.

original: pāpeti. Tenāha – “mātugāmaṃ āgamma uppannakāmarāgo vibbhamatī”ti.
analyzed: pāpā iti tena āha mātu gāmam uppanna kāma rāgaḥ vibbhamati iti
translated: He brings him to ruin and destruction by making him incapable of accomplishing the virtues, etc., which are the means of benefiting himself. Hence it is said: “Lust for women arises in him, and he breaks out into a sweat” .

original: Bhayaṃ nāma yattha bhāyitabbavatthu, tattha otarantasseva hoti, na anotarantassa,
analyzed: bhayam nāma yattha bhāyitabba vatthu tattha otarantassa iva hoti na an utarantassa
translated: Fear is something that arises only in one who enters a place where there is something to be afraid of, not in one who does not enter.

original: taṃ otaritvā bhayaṃ vinodetvā tattha kiccaṃ sādhetabbaṃ, itarathā catthasiddhi na
analyzed: tam otaritvā bhayam vinodetvā tattha kiccam sādhetabbam itarathā na
translated: Having entered and dispelled the fear, one should accomplish one’s purpose there; otherwise one’s purpose will not be accomplished.

original: hotīti imamatthaṃ upamopamitabbasarūpavasena dassetuṃ “yathā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: hoti iti imam attham upamā upamitabba sarūpa vasena dassetum yathā atiādi vuttam tattha
translated: In order to illustrate this meaning by means of a simile and its application, the following is said: “Just as a man in need of water” , etc. Herein,

original: udakaṃ nissāya ānisaṃso pipāsavinayanaṃ sarīrasuddhi pariḷāhūpasamo kāyautuggāhāpananti🔽evamādi. Sāsanaṃ nissāya ānisaṃso pana saṅkhepato vaṭṭadukkhūpasamo, vitthārato pana
analyzed: udakam nissāya ānisaṃsaḥ pipāsa vinayanam sarīra suddhi pariḷāha upasamaḥ  evamādi sāsanam nissāya ānisaṃso pana saṅkhepataḥ vaṭṭa dukkha upasamaḥ vitthārato pana
translated: the benefits based on water are the quenching of thirst, the cleansing of the body, the allaying of fever, the removal of dust, etc.

original: sīlānisaṃsādivasena anekavidho, so visuddhimagge vuttanayena veditabbo. Vuttappakāro
analyzed: sīla anisaṃsa ādi vasena anekavidhaḥ saḥ visuddhi magge vutta nayena veditabbaḥ vutta ppakāraḥ
translated: The benefits based on the Dispensation are, in brief, the allaying of the suffering of the round of rebirths, and in detail they are of the various kinds beginning with the benefits of virtue . They should be understood in the way stated in the Path of Purity .

original: ānisaṃso hoti tāni bhayāni abhibhuyya pavattassāti adhippāyo. Imāni abhāyitvāti imāni
analyzed: ānisaṃsaḥ hoti tāni bhayāni abhibhuyya pavattassa ati adhippāyaḥ imāni abhāyitvā ati imāni
translated: The intention is that there is a benefit in the occurrence of these fears being overcome.🔽Without fear of these: without fear of these fears of anger, resentment, etc.

original: kodhūpāyāsādibhayāni abhibhuyya pavattitvā abhāyitvā. Kodhūpāyāsādayo hi bhāyati
analyzed: kodhūpa āyāsa ādi bhayāni abhibhuyya kodhūpa āyāsa ādayaḥ hi bhāyati
translated: For anger, resentment, etc., are called “fears” because one is afraid of them.

original: etasmāti bhayanti vuttā. Theroti mahādhammarakkhitatthero. Kāmaṃ pahānābhisamayakālo🔽eva sacchikiriyābhisamayo, sammādiṭṭhiyā pana saṃkilesavodānadhammesu kiccaṃ asaṃkiṇṇaṃ
analyzed: etasmā iti vuttā thero ti mahādhammarakkhita thero kāmam pahāna abhisamaya kālo  eva sacchikiriyā abhisamayaḥ sammādiṭṭhiyā pana saṃkilesa vodāna dhammesu kiccam asaṃkiṇṇam
translated: The Elder: the Elder Mahādhammarakkhita.🔽The time of penetration of abandoning is indeed the time of penetration of realization, but in order to show that the function of right view in regard to the states of defilement and purification is unadulterated,

original: katvā dassetuṃ samānakālikampi asamānakālikaṃ viya vuttaṃ “taṇhāsotaṃ chinditvā nibbānapāraṃ
analyzed: katvā dassetum samāna kālikam pi asamāna kālikam viya vuttam taṇhā sotam chinditvā nibbāna pāram
translated: it is stated as if it were not simultaneous, although it is.🔽Having cut off the stream of craving, he is unable to see the other shore of Nibbāna.

original: daṭṭhuṃ na sakkotī”ti. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: daṭṭhum na sakkoti iti sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: Cātumasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the word “sluggish” in the Cātumāsutta is finished.

original: 8. Naḷakapānasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: naḷaka pāna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Naḷakapāna Sutta

original: 166. Yattha bodhisattapamukho vānaro naḷakena pānīyaṃ pivi, sā pokkharaṇī, tassāmanto
analyzed: yattha bodhisatta pamukhaḥ vānaraḥ naḷakena pānīyam sā pokkharaṇī
translated: The lotus pond where the monkey chief, the Bodhisatta, drank water through a hollow reed stalk,

original: bhūmippadeso, tattha niviṭṭhagāmo ca “naḷakapāna”nteva paññāyittha, idha pana gāmo
analyzed: bhūmi ppadeso tattha niviṭṭha gāmo ca naḷaka pāna ntā iva paññāyittha idha pana gāmo
translated: The place was known as “Nalakapāna.” But here the village

original: adhippetoti āha “naḷakapāneti evaṃnāmake gāme”ti. Idāni tamatthaṃ āgamanato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: adhippeto ti āha naḷaka pāne ti evaṃnāmake gāme iti idāni tam attham āgamanataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: is meant. Therefore it is said, “in the village called Nalakapāna.” Now, in order to show the meaning of that,

original: dassetuṃ “pubbe kirā”ti āraddhaṃ. Paññavāti itikattabbatāya paññāya paññavā.
analyzed: dassetum pubbe kirāti āraddham paññavā ati itikattabba tāya paññāya paññavā
translated: beginning with “formerly,” etc. Paññavā means endowed with wisdom, because of the need for that.

original: Thūladīghabahulabhāvena mahatīhi dāṭhikāhi samannāgatattā mahādāṭhiko. “Udakarakkhaso
analyzed: thūla dīgha bahula bhāvena mahatīhi dāṭhikāhi samannāgata ttā mahā dāṭhikaḥ udaka rakkhaso
translated: Mahādāṭhika means having great teeth, because of having great teeth through being fat, long, and numerous. “I am a water demon

original: aha”nti vatvā vānarānaṃ kañci amuñcitvā “sabbe tumhe mama hatthagatā”ti dassento
analyzed: aham ti vatvā kañci a muñcitvā sabbe tumhe mama hattha gatā ati dassento
translated: having said that, without releasing any of the monkeys, showing that “all of you are in my power,”

original: “tumhe pana sabbe khādissāmī”ti āha. Dhami…pe… piviṃsūti bodhisattena gahitanaḷo
analyzed: tumhe pana sabbe khādissāmi iti āha dhamipe piviṃsu iti bodhisattena gahita naḷaḥ
translated: he said, “but I will eat all of you.” Dhami…pe… piviṃsūti the bamboo

original: anavaseso abbhantare sabbasandhīnaṃ nibbādhena ekacchiddo ahosi. Neva maṃ tvaṃ vadhissasīti
analyzed: anavasesaḥ abbhantare sabba sandhīnam nibbādhena eka chiddaḥ ahosi na iva mam tvam vadhissasi iti
translated: taken by the Bodhisatta became a single piece through the obstruction of all the joints inside without exception. You will not kill me

original: udakarakkhasa tvaṃ vadhitukāmopi mama purisathāmena na vadhissasi.
analyzed: udakarakkhasa tvam vadhitu kāmaḥ api mama purisathāmena na vadhissasi
translated: even though you, water demon, desire to kill me, you will not kill me through my human strength.

original: Evaṃ pana vatvā mahāsatto “ayaṃ pāpo ettha pānīyaṃ pivante aññepi satte mā bādhayitthā”ti
analyzed: evam pana vatvā mahāsatto ayam pāpaḥ ettha pānīyam pivante aññe pi satte mā bādhayittha ati
translated: Having said this, the Great Being, out of compassion for the other beings who might drink the water there, thought:

original: karuṇāyamāno “ettha jāyantā naḷā sabbe apabbabandhā ekacchiddāva hontū”ti adhiṭṭhāya
analyzed: karuṇāyamānaḥ ettha jāyantā naḷā sabbe a pabbabandhāḥ eka chiddāḥ ava hontu iti adhiṭṭhāya
translated: “May all the reeds that grow here be without knots, and may they be perforated in one place.”

original: gato. Tenāha “tato paṭṭhāyā”tiādi.
analyzed: gataḥ tena āha tatas paṭṭhāya atiādi
translated: After resolving thus, he went away. Therefore it is said: “From that time on.”

original: 167. Anuruddhappamukhā bhikkhū bhagavatā “kacci tumhe anuruddhā”ti pucchitāti thero “taggha mayaṃ, bhante”ti āha.
analyzed: anuruddha ppamukhāḥ bhikkhū bhagavatā kacci tumhe anuruddhā ati pucchitā ati theraḥ taggha mayam bhante iti āha
translated: The monks headed by Anuruddha were asked by the Exalted One: “Anuruddha, I hope you are getting along?” The Elder replied: “Indeed, we are, venerable sir.”

original: Sace pabbajati, jīvitaṃ labhissati, no aññathāti raññā pabbajjāya abhinītāti rājābhinītā.
analyzed: sace pabbajati jīvitam labhissati no aññathā ati raññā pabbajjāya abhinītā ati rāja abhinītā
translated: If he goes forth, he will live; otherwise not.” Thus he was urged to go forth by the king.

original: Corābhinītāti etthāpi eseva nayo. Corānaṃ mūlaṃ chindanto “kaṇṭakasodhanaṃ karissāmī”ti.
analyzed: cora abhinītā ati ettha api esa iva nayo mūlam chindantaḥ kaṇṭaka sodhanam karissāmi iti
translated: In the case of the thieves, the meaning is the same. He thought: “I will clear away the brambles in order to cut off the root of the thieves.”

original: Ājīvikāyāti ājīvena jīvitavuttiyā. Imesu pana anuruddhattherādīsu.🔽Vivekanti pubbakālikakiriyappadhānaṃ “abyāpajjaṃ upeta”ntiādīsu viyāti āha – “viviccā”ti,
analyzed: ājīvikāya iti ājīvena jīvita vuttiyā imesu pana anuruddhatthera ādīsu 🔽vivekam ti pubba kālika kiriya ppadhānam abyāpajjam upeta nti ādīsu viya iti āha vivicca iti
translated: “For the sake of livelihood” means for the sake of living by means of livelihood.🔽“Seclusion” is the practice of the preliminary stage. It is like the seclusion mentioned in the passage: “He should approach a secluded place.”

original: viviccitvā vivitto hutvā vinā hutvāti attho. Pabbajitakiccanti pabbajitassa sāruppakiccaṃ.
analyzed: viviccitvā vivittaḥ hutvā vinā hutvā ati attho pabbajita kiccanti pabbajitassa sāruppa kiccam
translated: ‘Having gone forth’ means having gone forth, having become a monk, having become a recluse. ‘The business of a recluse’ is the business appropriate to a recluse.

original: Samaṇakiccanti samaṇabhāvakaraṇakiccaṃ. Yadaggena hi pabbajitakiccaṃ kātuṃ na sakkoti
analyzed: samaṇa kiccanti samaṇa bhāva karaṇa kiccam yat aggena hi pabbajita kiccam kātum na sakkoti
translated: ‘The business of an ascetic’ is the business that makes an ascetic. For if one cannot do the business of a recluse with one thing,

original: tadaggena samaṇabhāvakarampi kiccaṃ kātuṃ na sakkoti. Tenāha “so yevā”tiādi.
analyzed: tad aggena samaṇa bhāva karam pi kiccam kātum na sakkoti tena āha saḥ yeva iti ādi
translated: one cannot do the business that makes an ascetic with that either. That is why he said ‘that very’ and so on.

original: 168. Appaṭisandhike tāva byākaronto pavattīsu ṭhānaṃ atītoti katvā upapattīsu byākaroti nāma tattha paṭisandhiyā abhāvakittanato. Mahantatuṭṭhinoti vipulapamodā.🔽169. Imassāti “assā”ti padassa atthavacanaṃ. Imassa ṭhitassa āyasmato sāmaṃ diṭṭho🔽vā hoti anussavasuto vāti yojanā. Samādhipakkhikā dhammā dhammāti adhippetā, samādhi
analyzed: appaṭisandhike tāva byākaronto pavattīsu ṭhānam atītaḥ ti katvā upapattīsu byākaroti nāma tattha paṭisandhiyā abhāva kittanataḥ vipula pamodā  imassa ati assa ati padassa attha vacanam imassa ṭhitassa āyasmataḥ sāmam diṭṭho  vā hoti anussava sutaḥ vā ti yojanā samādhi pakkhikā dhammā dhammā ati adhippetā samādhi
translated: As to the ‘unlocalizable’: he interprets it in terms of the kinds of becoming because he has passed beyond the plane of the rounds of becoming. ‘Greatly gladdened’ means greatly joyful.

original: pana evaṃvihārīti ettha vihārasaddena gahito. Evaṃvimuttāti ettha pana vimuttisaddena
analyzed: pana evaṃvihārī iti ettha vihāra saddena gahitaḥ evam vimuttā ati ettha pana vimutti saddena
translated: ‘This’: this is the meaning of the word ‘his.’ ‘Seen by him in person’ means seen by himself. ‘Or heard of by report’ means heard of by hearsay. ‘The states that are on his side’ are the states that are on the side of concentration. ‘Concentration’ is included by the word ‘dwelling’ in the clause ‘dwelling in this way.’ ‘Liberation’ is included by the word ‘liberation’ in the clause ‘liberated in this way.’

original: phalavimutti gahitā. Caratopīti samathavipassanācārena caratopi viharantassapi. Upāsakaupāsikāṭhānesu
analyzed: phala vimutti gahitā carataḥ api iti samatha vipassanā ācārena carataḥ api viharantassa api upāsaka upāsikā ṭhānesu
translated: Even while walking: even while walking by the practice of serenity and insight, even while living.

original: labbhamānampi arahattaṃ appakabhāvato pāḷiyaṃ anuddhaṭanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: labbhamānam pi arahattam appaka bhāvato pāḷiyam anuddhaṭanti daṭṭhabbam sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: It should be regarded as not mentioned in the text because it is rare in the parts of the scriptures dealing with laymen and laywomen. The rest is easy to understand.

original: Naḷakapānasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: naḷaka pāna sutta vaṇṇanāya līnattha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the word “sluggish” is finished.

original: 9. Goliyānisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: goliyāni sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Goliya-ani sutta🔽is finished.

original: 173. Padasamācāroti taṃtaṃpaccayabhedadassanāya vigatattā pakārehi daliddasamācāro
analyzed: pada samācāro ti taṃ taṃ paccaya bheda dassanāya vigata ttā pakārehi dalidda samācāro
translated: The word padasaṃcāro is a word formed by the method of the “broken compound” (padasambandha).🔽The meaning is “one whose conduct is weak.”

original: sithilasamācāroti attho. Yasmā pana tādiso samācāro thiro daḷho nāma na hoti, tasmā🔽vuttaṃ “dubbalasamācāro”ti. “Sākhasamācāro”ti vā pāṭho, tattha tattha lagganaṭṭhena
analyzed: sithila samācāro ti attho yasmā pana tādisaḥ samācāro thiraḥ daḷhaḥ nāma na hoti tasmā  vuttam dubbala samācāro ti sākha samācāro ti vā pāṭhaḥ tattha tattha laggana ṭṭhena
translated: But since such conduct is not firm and strong,🔽it is said to be “weak conduct.”🔽Or the reading is “sākhasaṃcāro,” in which case the meaning is “one whose character is like a branch,”🔽in the sense of clinging here and there. Hence it is said to be “gross conduct.”

original: sākhāsadisasīloti attho. Tenāha “oḷārikācāro”ti. Paccayesu sāpekkhoti paccayesu sāpekkhatāya
analyzed: sākhā sadisa sīlaḥ ti attho tena āha oḷārika ācāraḥ ti paccayesu sāpekkhaḥ ti paccayesu sāpekkha tāya
translated: He is “dependent on conditions” because he is dependent on conditions.🔽For it is by this that his gross conduct should be understood.

original: eva hissa oḷārikācāratā veditabbā. Garunā kismiñci vutte gāravavasena patissavanaṃ
analyzed: eva hi ssa oḷārika ācāra tā veditabbā garunā kismiñci vutte gārava vasena patissavanam
translated: He is “respectful” in the sense of paying respect and listening respectfully to whatever is said.

original: patisso, patissavacanabhūtaṃ taṃsabhāgañca yaṃ kiñci gāravanti attho. Saha patissenāti🔽sappatissena, sappatissavena ovādasampaṭicchanena. Patissīyatīti vā patisso, garukātabbo,🔽tena saha patissenāti sabbaṃ pubbe viya. Tenāha “sajeṭṭhakenā”ti. Serivihāro nāma🔽attappadhānavāso. Tenāha “niraṅkusavihārenā”ti.
analyzed: patissaḥ patissavacana bhūtam taṃsa bhāgañca yam kiñci gāravanti saha patissena ati  sappatissena sappatissavena ovāda sampaṭicchanena patissīyati iti vā patissaḥ garukātabbo  tena saha patissena ati sabbam pubbe viya tena āha sa jeṭṭhakena ati serivihāraḥ nāma  tena āha niraṅkusa vihārena ati
translated: and the consent is the consent itself and what is of the same class as that, and any respect. With consent:🔽with consent, with the consent of the consent to the advice. Or alternatively, patissavena means that he should be consented to, he should be respected,🔽with that, with consent. Therefore he said “with the elder brother.” The dwelling of a gentleman is🔽a dwelling for the self-development of virtue. Therefore he said “with the dwelling of one who is not bound by the bridle.”🔽🔽

original: Anupakhajjāti anupakaḍḍhitvā. Garuṭṭhāniyānaṃ antaraṃ anāpucchā anupavisitvāti imamatthaṃ dassetuṃ “tattha yo”tiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Ābhisamācārikanti abhisamācāre bhavaṃ. Kiṃ pana tanti āha “vattapaṭipattimattampī”ti.🔽Nātikālasseva saṅghassa purato pavisitabbaṃ, na pacchā paṭikkamitabbanti adhippāyena🔽atikāle ca gāmappaveso atidivā paṭikkamanañca nivāritaṃ, taṃ dassetuṃ “na atipāto”tiādi
analyzed: an upakhajja ati an upakaḍḍhitvā garuṭṭhā niyānam antaram an āpucchā an upavisitvā iti imam attham dassetum tattha yaḥ ti ādi vuttam 🔽ābhisamācārikam ti abhisamācāre bhavam kim pana tat ti āha vatta paṭipattimattam pi iti 🔽na atikālassa iva saṅghassa puratas pavisitabbam na pacchā paṭikkamitabbam ti adhippāyena 🔽ati kāle ca gāma paveso atidivā paṭikkamanam ca nivāritam tam dassetum na atipātā tiādi
translated: ‘With consent’ means with the consent of the Sangha, with the consent of the group, with the consent of the individual. ‘With the one who has consented’ means with the one who has consented, with the one who has given consent, with the one who has agreed to the advice. ‘With the one who consents’ means with the one who should be respected. ‘With the one who has consented’ means means with the one who should be respected. ‘With the one who has consented’ means with the one who has consented. ‘With the

original: vuttaṃ. Uddhaccapakatikoti vibbhantacitto. Avacāpalyenāti daḷhavātāpahatapallavasadisena lolabhāvena.
analyzed: vuttam uddhacca pakatikaḥ ti vibbhanta cittaḥ avacāpalyena ati daḷha vāta apahata pallava sadisena lola bhāvena
translated: “It is said” : it is said in the texts. “One of restless temperament” : one whose mind is distracted. “By fickleness” : by fickleness like a leaf tossed about by the wind.

original: Paññavatāti iminā bhikkhusāruppesu itikattabbesu upāyapaññā adhippetā, na sutamayapaññā.
analyzed: paññavatā ti iminā bhikkhu sāruppesu itikattabbesu upāya paññā adhippetā na suta maya paññā
translated: “Wise” : by this word, the wisdom of means in the duties to be done with regard to the bhikkhus is intended, not the wisdom of learning.

original: Abhidhamme abhivinaye yogoti iminā bhāvanāpaññāuttarimanussadhamme yogo pakāsito.
analyzed: abhidhamme abhivinaye yogo ti iminā bhāvanā paññā uttari manussa dhamme yogo pakāsito
translated: “Application to the higher Dhamma and Discipline” : by this, application to the wisdom of development and to the higher states of men is shown.

original: Yogoti ca paricayo uggaṇhavasena.🔽Āruppāti iminā catassopi arūpasamāpattiyo gahitā, tā pana catūhi rūpasamāpattīhi
analyzed: ca paricayaḥ uggaṇha vasena  āruppā ti iminā catassaḥ api arūpa samāpattiyaḥ gahitā tāḥ pana catūhi rūpa samāpattīhi
translated: “Application” : acquaintance by way of learning.

original: vinā na sampajjantīti āha – “āruppāti ettāvatā aṭṭhapi samāpattiyo vuttā hontī”ti.🔽Kasiṇeti dasavidhe kasiṇe. Ekaṃ parikammakammaṭṭhānanti yaṃ kiñci ekabhāvanā parikammadīpanaṃ
analyzed: vinā na sampajjanti iti āha āruppa ati ettāvatā aṭṭha api samāpattiyaḥ vuttāḥ honti iti  kasiṇa iti dasavidhe kasiṇe ekam parikamma kammaṭṭhānam ti yam kiñci eka bhāvanā parikamma dīpanam
translated: “The immaterial” : by this, the four immaterial attainments are included. But they are not accomplished without the four material form attainments. Therefore it is said: “By the immaterial, the eight attainments are included.”🔽“The kasiṇa” : the ten kasiṇas. “One subject of meditation” : any one of the meditation subjects for development.

original: khandhakammaṭṭhānaṃ. Tenāha “paguṇaṃ katvā”ti. Kasiṇaparikammaṃ pana taggahaṇeneva
analyzed: khandha kammaṭṭhānam tena āha paguṇam katvā iti kasiṇa parikammam pana tad gahaṇena iva
translated: “Having made it familiar” : having made it familiar by way of the preliminary work. But the preliminary work of the kasiṇa is included by the word “kasiṇa.”

original: gahitaṃ hoti, lokiyā uttarimanussadhammā heṭṭhā gahitāti āha “uttarimanussadhammeti🔽iminā sabbepi lokuttaradhamme dassetī”ti. Neyyapuggalassa vasenāti jānitvā vitthāretvā🔽ñātabbapuggalassa vasenāti.
analyzed: gahitam hoti lokiyāḥ uttari manussa dhammāḥ heṭṭhā gahitā ati āha uttari manussa dhamma iti  iminā sabbe api lokuttara dhamme dasseti iti neyya puggalassa vasena ati jānitvā vitthāretvā  ñātabba puggalassa vasena ati
translated: and the mundane supramundane states are included by the mundane states.🔽“Supramundane states” : by this he shows all the supramundane states.🔽“The person to be guided” : the person who should be taught after having known .🔽“The person to be known” :

original: Goliyānisuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
translated: “Mundane supramundane states” are mundane states and supramundane states. “Mundane” means “having the world as its province” . “Supramundane” means “having the supramundane as its province” . “Supramundane” means “having the noble as its province” . “Mundane” means “having the ignoble as its province” . “Supramundane” means “having the noble as its province” . “By the person to be guided” means by the person who should be taught after being understood. “By the person to be known” means by the person who should be taught after being understood. The explanation of the meaning of the brief account in the Goliya-ani sutta is finished.

original: 10. Kīṭāgirisuttavaṇṇanā🔽174. Pañca ānisaṃseti appābādhatādike pañca guṇe. Tattha akkhirogakucchirogādīnaṃ🔽abhāvo appābādhatā. Sarīre tesaṃ kuppanadukkhassa abhāvo appātaṅkaṃ. Sarīrassa uṭṭhānasukhatā
analyzed: pañca ānisaṃse iti appa ābādha tā ādike pañca guṇe  abhāvaḥ appa ābādha tā sarīre tesam kuppana dukkhassa abhāvaḥ appa ātaṅkam sarīrassa uṭṭhāna sukha tā
translated: . The Kīṭāgiri sutta

original: lahuṭṭhānaṃ. Balaṃ nāma kāyabalaṃ. Phāsuvihāro iriyāpathasukhatā. Anupakkhandānīti🔽duccajanavasena sattānaṃ anupaviṭṭhāni. Sañjānissathāti ettha iti-saddo ādiattho,
analyzed: lahu ṭṭhānam balam nāma kāya balam phāsu vihāraḥ iriyāpatha sukha tā anupakkhandāni iti  duccajana vasena sattānam anupaviṭṭhāni sañjānissatha ati ettha iti saddaḥ ādi atthaḥ
translated: “Five benefits”: the five qualities beginning with little illness. Herein, little illness is the absence of eye disease, stomach disease, etc. Little trouble is the absence of the suffering of their occurrence in the body. Ease of support is the pleasantness of the posture of the body. Strength is bodily strength. Pleasant abiding is the pleasantness of the postures. Not crowded is not crowded with bad people. You will recognize: here the word iti has the meaning of a particle of this kind.

original: tasmā iti evaṃ ānisaṃsanti attho.
analyzed: tasmai iti evam attho
translated: Therefore the meaning is: “in this way, benefits.”🔽. The Kīṭāgiri sutta

original: 175. Āvāse niyuttāti āvāsikā tassa anativattanato. Tenāha “nibaddhavāsino”ti, niyatavāsinoti
analyzed: āvāse niyuttā ati āvāsikā tassa an ativattanataḥ tena āha nibaddha vāsinaḥ iti niyata vāsinaḥ iti
translated: “Appointed to a residence” : they are residents because they do not go beyond that residence. Hence he says “regular residents,” the meaning being “fixed residents.”

original: attho. Tannibandhāti nibandhaṃ vuccati byāpāro, tattha bandhā pasutā ussukāti tannibandhā.
analyzed: atthaḥ tad nibandhā ati nibandham vuccati byāpāraḥ tattha bandhā pasutā ussukā ati tad nibandhā
translated: “That which is the cause” : the cause is called “the cause of that” . Those who are bound to that are “those who are bound to that.”

original: Kathaṃ te tattha nibandhāti āha “akataṃ senāsana”ntiādi. Uppajjanakena kālena pattabbaṃ
analyzed: katham te tattha nibandhā ti āha akatam senāsana nti ādi uppajjanakena kālena pattabbam
translated: How are they bound to that? He says “the lodging is not yet made,” etc.

original: kālikaṃ so pana kālo anāgato eva hotīti āha “anāgate kāle pattabba”nti.
analyzed: kālikam saḥ pana kālaḥ anāgataḥ eva hoti iti āha anāgate kāle pattabbanti
translated: The time that is to be reached is the time that is to be reached in the future.

original: 178. Ettakā vedanā sevitabbāti aṭṭhārasapi nekkhammanissitā vedanā sevitabbā, gehassitā na sevitbbā.
analyzed: ettakā vedanā sevitabbā ti aṭṭhārasa api nekkhamma nissitā vedanā sevitabbā geha ssitā na sevitbbā
translated: The feeling that is to be cultivated is the eighteen kinds of feeling based on renunciation that are to be cultivated, and the eighteen kinds of feeling based on the household life that are not to be cultivated.🔽That is done because the sixteen kinds of duties are finished.

original: 181. Taṃ kataṃ soḷasavidhassapi kiccassa niṭṭhitattā. Anulomikānīti utusukhabhāvena🔽anurūpāni. Tenāha “kammaṭṭhānasappāyānī”ti. Samānaṃ kurumānāti omattataṃ adhimattatañca
analyzed: tam katam soḷasavidhassa api kiccassa niṭṭhita ttā anulomikāni iti utu sukha bhāvena  anurūpāni tena āha kammaṭṭhāna sappāyāni iti samānam omattatam adhimattatam ca
translated: “Conducive” : suitable through being pleasant to the elements.🔽Hence he says “conducive to the meditation subject.”

original: pahāya samakiccataṃ sampādentā.🔽182. Te dve hontīti te ādito vuttā dve.
analyzed: pahāya sama kiccatam sampādentā 🔽te dve honti iti te āditas vuttā dve
translated: “Doing the same” : abandoning the idea of inferiority and the idea of superiority, they accomplish equality of service.

original: Ubhato ubhayathā ubhohi bhāgehi vimuttoti ubhatobhāgavimutto ekadesasarūpekasesanayena.
analyzed: ubhatas ubhayathā ubhohi bhāgehi vimuttaḥ ti ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ eka desa sarūpa ika sesa nayena
translated: He is liberated in both ways in both instances, by both kinds of non-clinging.🔽For this is said in the Abhidhamma Commentary: “Liberated in both ways in both instances, thus he is a both-ways-liberated one” .

original: Tathā hi vuttaṃ abhidhammaṭṭhakathāyaṃ “dvīhi bhāgehi dve vāre vimuttoti ubhatobhāgavimutto”ti.🔽Tattha keci tāva therā – “samāpattiyā vikkhambhanavimokkhena, maggena samucchedavimokkhena
analyzed: tathā hi vuttam abhidhamma ṭṭhakathā ayam dvīhi bhāgehi dve vāre vimuttaḥ ti ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ ti  tattha keci tāva therā samāpattiyāḥ vikkhambhana vimokkhena maggena samuccheda vimokkhena
translated: Herein, some elders say that he is liberated in both ways because he is liberated by the suppression of defilements through attainment and by the abolition of their underlying tendencies through the path.🔽Others say that he is a both-ways-liberated one because he is liberated from the material form of the fine-material sphere and then is liberated from the immaterial states by entering upon the fourth jhāna.🔽They say that he is “one who is liberated from the description” because he is liberated from the description of the fine-material and immaterial states.

original: vimuttoti ubhatobhāgavimutto”ti vadanti. Aññe therā – “ayaṃ ubhatobhāgavimutto rūpato
analyzed: vimutto ti ubhatobhāga vimutto ti vadanti aññe therāḥ ayam ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ rūpataḥ
translated: And they quote this sutta in support: “Just as a flame shaken by the wind reels and reels again,🔽So in the world the fool reels, but the wise man reels no more” .🔽And they quote this sutta too: “Just as a flame, bhikkhus, shaken by the wind, reels and reels again, so in the world, bhikkhus, the fool reels, he reels again, he reels over and over again.

original: muccitvā nāmaṃ nissāya ṭhito puna tato muccanato nāmanissitako”ti vatvā tassa ca sādhakaṃ –
analyzed: muccitvā nāmam nissāya ṭhito puna tatas muccanataḥ nāmanissitakaḥ ti vatvā tassa ca sādhakam
translated: But the wise man does not reel, he reels no more, he reels not again, he reels not over and over again” .🔽And they quote this too: “Just as a flame, Upasīva, shaken by the wind,

original: “Acci yathā vātavegena khittā, (upasivāti bhagavā,)
analyzed: acci yathā vāta vegena khittā bhagavā
translated: Reels and reels again, so in the world the fool,🔽Reels, reels again, reels over and over again.🔽But the wise man, freed from the description,

original: Atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ;
analyzed: attham paleti naḥ upeti saṅkham
translated: Reels not, reels no more, reels not over and over again” .🔽And they quote this too: “Just as a flame, Upasīva, shaken by the wind,🔽Reels and reels again, so in the world the fool,🔽Reels, reels again, reels over and over again.

original: Evaṃ muni nāmakāyā vimutto,
analyzed: evam muni nāma kāyāḥ vimuttaḥ
translated: But the wise man, freed from the description,

original: Atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkha”nti. –🔽Imaṃ suttapadaṃ vatvā “nāmakāyato ca rūpakāyato ca suvimuttattā ubhatobhāgavimutto”ti
analyzed: attham paleti naḥ upeti 🔽imam sutta padam vatvā nāma kāyataḥ ca rūpa kāyataḥ ca su vimutta ttā ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ ti
translated: Reels not, reels no more, reels not over and over again” .

original: vadanti. Sutte hi ākiñcaññāyatanalābhino upasivabrāhmaṇassa bhagavatā nāmakāyā vimuttoti🔽ubhatobhāgavimuttoti akkhātoti. Apare pana “samāpattiyā vikkhambhanavimokkhena ekavāraṃ
analyzed: vadanti sutte hi ākiñcaññāyatana lābhinaḥ upasiva brāhmaṇassa bhagavatā nāma kāyā vimutto ti  ubhatobhāga vimutto ti akkhāto ti apare pana samāpattiyāḥ vikkhambhana vimokkhena eka vāram
translated: They say: for in the sutta the Blessed One described the brahmin Upāsī, who had attained the base consisting of nothingness, as “liberated in both ways” ,🔽saying “He is liberated in both ways, bhikkhus, the bhikkhu who is an Arahant, whose taints are destroyed, who has lived the life, done what was to be done, laid down the burden, reached his own goal, utterly destroyed the fetters of existence, and is completely liberated through final knowledge” .

original: vimutto, maggena samucchedavimokkhena ekavāraṃ vimuttoti evaṃ ubhatobhāgavimutto”ti🔽vadanti. Ettha paṭhamavāde dvīhi bhāgehi vimuttoti ubhatobhāgavimutto. Dutiyavāde
analyzed: vimuttaḥ maggena samuccheda vimokkhena eka vāram vimuttaḥ ti evam ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ ti  vadanti ettha paṭhama vāde dvīhi bhāgehi vimuttaḥ ti ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ dutiya vāde
translated: Others say that he is liberated in both ways because he is liberated in one way by the liberation of the suppression of defilements by means of attainment and in one way by the liberation of the severance of defilements by means of the path.🔽Herein, in the first case he is liberated in both ways because he is liberated by means of the two kinds of liberation. In the second case he is liberated in both ways because he is liberated from both kinds.

original: ubhatobhāgato vimuttoti ubhatobhāgavimutto. Tatiyavāde pana dvīhi bhāgehi dve vāre🔽vimuttoti ayametesaṃ viseso. Kilesehi vimutto kilesā vā vikkhambhanasamucchedehi
analyzed: ubhatobhāgataḥ vimuttaḥ ti ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ tatiya vāde pana dvīhi bhāgehi dve vāre  vimuttaḥ ti ayam etesam visesaḥ kilesehi vimuttaḥ kilesāḥ vā vikkhambhana samucchedehi
translated: In the third case the difference is that he is liberated in both ways because he is liberated in two ways by means of the two kinds of liberation.🔽The meaning should be regarded in this way: he is liberated from defilements, or he is liberated from the two kinds of embodiment by means of the two kinds of liberation, namely, that of suppression and that of severance.🔽Hence it was said above “He is liberated in both ways because of the two kinds of liberation” .

original: kāyadvayato vimuttā assāti ayamattho daṭṭhabbo. Tenāha “dvīhi bhāgehī”tiādi.
analyzed: kāya dvayataḥ vimuttā assa ati ayam attho daṭṭhabbo tena āha dvīhi bhāgehi itiādi
translated: He: the one liberated in both ways.

original: Soti ubhatobhāgavimutto. Kāmañcettha rūpāvacaracatutthajjhānampi arūpāvacarajjhānaṃ
analyzed: kāmam ca itthā rūpāvacara catuttha jhānam pi arūpāvacara jhānam
translated: The fourth jhāna of the fine-material sphere and the immaterial jhānas

original: viya duvaṅgikaṃ āneñjappattanti vuccati. Taṃ pana padaṭṭhānaṃ katvā arahattaṃ patto
analyzed: viya duvaṅgikam āneñjappattanti vuccati tam pana padaṭṭhānam katvā arahattam patto
translated: and it is called “attained to imperturbability” since it is twofold. But one who has reached Arahantship by making that the proximate cause

original: ubhatobhāgavimutto nāma na hoti rūpakāyato avimuttattā. Tañhi kilesakāyatova vimuttaṃ,
analyzed: ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ nāma na hoti rūpa kāyataḥ a vimutta ttā tat hi kilesa kāyataḥ va vimuttam
translated: is not called “liberated in both ways” because he is not liberated from the material body. For that is liberated only from the mental body,

original: na rūpakāyato, tasmā tato vuṭṭhāya arahattaṃ patto ubhatobhāgavimutto na hotīti āha
analyzed: na rūpa kāyataḥ tasmā tatas vuṭṭhāya arahattam patto ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ na hoti iti āha
translated: not from the material body. That is why it is said that he who emerges from that and reaches Arahantship is not liberated in both ways.🔽“The eight liberations are given in the Mahānidāna Sutta thus: ‘One possessing material form sees material forms’ , etc.,

original: – “catunnaṃ arūpa…pe… pañcavidho hotī”ti. “Rūpī rūpāni passatī”tiādike nirodhasamāpattiante🔽aṭṭha vimokkhe vatvā – “yato ca kho, ānanda, bhikkhu ime aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā
analyzed: catunnam arūpape pañcavidhaḥ hoti iti rūpī rūpāni passati itiādike nirodha samāpatti ante  aṭṭha vimokkhe vatvā yato ca kho ānanda bhikkhu ime aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā
translated: ending with ‘one who, before attaining the cessation of perception and feeling, has made that attainment his resort’ .

original: viharati, paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti, ayaṃ vuccati, ānanda, bhikkhu
analyzed: viharati paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti ayam vuccati ānanda bhikkhu
translated: And though it is said there in the Mahānidāna Sutta: ‘But, Ānanda, when a bhikkhu has had these eight liberations in his direct experience … and his taints are destroyed by his seeing with wisdom, this bhikkhu is called one liberated in both ways’ ,

original: ubhatobhāgavimutto”ti yadipi mahānidāne vuttaṃ, taṃ pana ubhatobhāgavimuttaseṭṭhavasena
analyzed: ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ ti yadi api mahānidāne vuttam tam pana ubhatobhāga vimutta seṭṭha vasena
translated: still that is said with reference to the best kind of ‘liberated in both ways.’

original: vuttanti idha sabbaubhatobhāgavimuttasaṅgahaṇatthaṃ “pañcavidho hotī”ti vatvā “pāḷi
analyzed: vuttam ti idha pañcavidhaḥ hoti iti vatvā
translated: So in order to include all kinds of ‘liberated in both ways’ here, it is said that ‘he is of five kinds.’

original: panettha…pe… abhidhamme aṭṭhavimokkhalābhino vasena āgatā”ti āha. Idhāpi hi kīṭāgirisutte
analyzed: pana itthape abhidhamme aṭṭha vimokkha lābhinaḥ vasena āgatā ati āha idha api hi kīṭāgirisutte
translated: Here too, in the Kītāgiri Sutta,🔽“Here, bhikkhus, a certain person … is both-ways liberated” .

original: “idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo…pe… ubhatobhāgavimutto”ti arūpasamāpattivasena cattāro🔽ubhatobhāgavimuttā, seṭṭho ca vutto vuttalakkhaṇūpapattito. Yathāvuttesu hi pañcasu
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ puggala ope ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ ti arūpa samāpatti vasena cattāraḥ  ubhatobhāga vimuttā seṭṭho ca vuttaḥ vutta lakkhaṇa upapattitaḥ yathā vuttesu hi pañcasu
translated: The four kinds of both-ways liberated are stated according to the attainment of the immaterial states.🔽And the best is stated according to the attainment of the eight emancipations.

original: purimā cattāro nirodhaṃ na samāpajjantīti pariyāyena ubhatobhāgavimuttā nāma. Aṭṭhasamāpattilābhī🔽anāgāmī taṃ samāpajjitvā tato vuṭṭhāya vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pattoti nippariyāyena
analyzed: purimā cattāraḥ nirodham na samāpajjanti iti pariyāyena ubhatobhāgavimuttā nāma aṭṭha samāpatti lābhī  anāgāmī tam samāpajjitvā tatas vuṭṭhāya vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam patto ti nippariyāyena
translated: For the first four of the five kinds of both-ways liberated are called “both-ways liberated” in a figurative sense because they do not attain cessation.

original: ubhatobhāgavimuttaseṭṭho nāma.
analyzed: ubhatobhāgavimuttaseṭṭhaḥ nāma
translated: But the non-returner who attains the eight attainments and attains cessation after emerging from it, and who then develops insight and reaches Arahantship, is called “best both-ways liberated” in the primary sense.

original: Katamo ca puggalotiādīsu katamoti pucchāvacanaṃ, puggaloti asādhāraṇato pucchitabbavacanaṃ.
analyzed: katamo ca puggalo tiādīsu katamo ti pucchā vacanam puggalo ti asādhāraṇato pucchitabba vacanam
translated: In the passage beginning, “What kind of person? ” the word “what” is a question word, and the word “person” is the word to be questioned about, which is done in a non-specific sense.

original: Idhāti imasmiṃ sāsane. Ekaccoti eko. Aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharatīti aṭṭha
analyzed: idha ati imasmim sāsane ekacco ti ekaḥ aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati iti aṭṭha
translated: Here in this Dispensation. One: a certain one. Has attained the eight emancipations and dwells in them: has attained the eight emancipations and dwells in them in the way appropriate to each.

original: samāpattiyo sahajātanāmakāyena paṭilabhitvā viharati. Paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā🔽hontīti vipassanāpaññāya saṅkhāragataṃ, maggapaññāya cattāri saccāni passitvā cattāropi
analyzed: samāpattiyaḥ sahajāta nāmakāyena paṭilabhitvā viharati paññāya ca ssa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā  honti iti vipassanā paññāya saṅkhāra gatam magga paññāya cattāri saccāni passitvā cattāro api
translated: And his taints are destroyed by seeing with understanding.

original: āsavā parikkhīṇā hontīti evamattho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti iti evamatthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: The meaning should be regarded thus: “The taints are destroyed by seeing with understanding the mental formations in the case of insight, and by seeing the four truths in the case of the path.”

original: Paññāvimuttoti visesato paññāya eva vimutto, na tassā patiṭṭhānabhūtena aṭṭhavimokkhasaṅkhātena
analyzed: paññā vimutto ti visesataḥ paññāya eva vimuttaḥ na tassā patiṭṭhāna bhūtena aṭṭha vimokkha saṅkhātena
translated: “Liberated in understanding”: he is liberated especially by understanding, not by the surmounting of the eight liberations called “steadying of understanding” .

original: sātisayena samādhināti paññāvimutto. Yo ariyo anadhigataaṭṭhavimokkhena sabbaso āsavehi🔽vimutto, tassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Adhigatepi hi rūpajjhānavimokkhe na so sātisayasamādhinissitoti
analyzed: sa atisayena samādhinā ati paññā vimuttaḥ yaḥ ariyaḥ anadhigata aṭṭha vimokkhena sabbaso āsavehi  vimuttaḥ tassa etam adhivacanam adhigate pi hi rūpa jjhāna vimokkhe na saḥ sa atisaya samādhi nissitaḥ ti
translated: So he is “liberated in understanding.” This is a term for one who, though he has not attained the eight liberations, is nevertheless liberated from all the defilements by means of understanding.🔽For even though he has attained the jhāna liberations, he is not “liberated in both ways” by virtue of that, since that is not surmounting of the defilements.

original: na tassa vasena ubhatobhāgavimutto hotīti vuttovāyamattho. Arūpajjhānesu pana ekasmimpi
analyzed: na tassa vasena ubhatobhāga vimutto hoti iti vuttā uva ayam attho arūpa jhānesu pana ekasmim pi
translated: But when he has attained even one of the immaterial jhānas he is called “liberated in both ways” .

original: sati ubhatobhāgavimuttoyeva nāma hoti. Tena hi aṭṭhavimokkhekadesena taṃnāmadānasamatthena
analyzed: sati ubhatobhāga vimuttā yā iva nāma hoti tena hi aṭṭha vimokkha ekadesena tad nāma dāna samatthena
translated: For then he is able to be called by the name of one who possesses a portion of the eight liberations.

original: aṭṭhavimokkhalābhītveva vuccati. Samudāye hi pavatto vohāro avayavepi dissati yathā
analyzed: aṭṭha vimokkha lābhī itvā iva vuccati samudāye hi pavattaḥ vohāraḥ avayave pi dissati yathā
translated: and it is said that he has attained the eight emancipations. For usage is seen in the case of a collection to apply to the individual members,

original: “sattisayo”ti. Pāḷīti abhidhammapāḷi. Etthāti etissaṃ paññāvimuttikathāyaṃ. Aṭṭhavimokkhapaṭikkhepavasenevāti
analyzed: satti sayaḥ ti pāḷi iti abhidhamma pāḷi ettha ati etissam paññā vimutti kathā ayam aṭṭha vimokkha paṭikkhepa vasena iva āti
translated: as in the case of the expression “the army is shouting” . The text is the Abhidhamma text. Herein means in this discussion of the kind of deliverance that is by understanding. By the word “only” he shows that the denial is made only by way of the eight emancipations.

original: avadhāraṇena idhāpi paṭikkhepavaseneva āgatabhāvaṃ dasseti. Tenāha “kāyena phusitvā viharatī”ti.
analyzed: avadhāraṇena idha api paṭikkhepa vasena iva āgata bhāvam dasseti tena āha kāyena phusitvā viharati iti
translated: Hence he says, “he abides having contacted with the body and making it his basis” .

original: Phuṭṭhantaṃ sacchikarotīti phuṭṭhānaṃ anto phuṭṭhanto, phuṭṭhānaṃ arūpajjhānānaṃ🔽anantaro kāloti adhippāyo. Accantasaṃyoge cetaṃ upayogavacanaṃ, phuṭṭhānantarakālameva🔽sacchikaroti sacchikātabbopāyenāti vuttaṃ hoti. Bhāvanapuṃsakaṃ vā etaṃ “ekamantaṃ
analyzed: phuṭṭhantam sacchikaroti iti phuṭṭhānam antaḥ phuṭṭhantaḥ phuṭṭhānam arūpa jhānānam  anantaraḥ kālo ti adhippāyaḥ upayoga vacanam phuṭṭha anantara kālam eva  sacchikaroti sacchikātabba upāyena iti vuttam hoti bhāva napuṃsakam vā etam ekam antam
translated: He makes the contact that is the last of the contacts : the meaning is that he makes the last moment of the immaterial jhānas that are the contacts.🔽For this is a locative of time referring to the moment immediately after the immaterial jhānas. And this is a locative of instrument in the sense of an ultimate means, for what is meant is that he makes the last moment of the contact by means of the means for realizing the supramundane. Or alternatively, this is a locative of source, like such locatives as “having sat down on one side” .

original: nisīdī”tiādīsu viya. Yo hi arūpajjhānena rūpakāyato nāmakāyekadesato ca vikkhambhanavimokkhena
analyzed: nisīdi iti ādīsu viya yaḥ hi arūpa jhānena rūpa kāyataḥ nāma kāya ekadesato ca vikkhambhana vimokkhena
translated: For the locative of source is used in the sense of the locative of means, as in the passage, “Having made the deathless element his goal, having made the deathless element his refuge” .

original: vimutto, tena nirodhasaṅkhāto vimokkho ālocito pakāsito viya hoti, na pana kāyena
analyzed: vimuttaḥ tena nirodha saṅkhātaḥ vimokkhaḥ ālocitaḥ pakāsitaḥ viya hoti na pana kāyena
translated: And the liberation called cessation is as if looked over and illuminated by him, but it is not realized by his body.

original: sacchikato, nirodhaṃ pana ārammaṇaṃ katvā ekaccesu āsavesu khepitesu tena so sacchikato🔽hoti, tasmā so sacchikātabbaṃ nirodhaṃ yathāālocitaṃ nāmakāyena sacchikarotīti “kāyasakkhī”ti🔽vuccati, na tu “vimutto”ti ekaccānaṃ āsavānaṃ aparikkhīṇattā. Tenāha – “jhānaphassaṃ
analyzed: sacchikataḥ nirodham pana ārammaṇam katvā ekaccesu āsavesu khepitesu tena so sacchikataḥ  hoti tasmā saḥ sacchikātabbam nirodham yathā ālocitam nāmakāyena sacchikaroti iti kāyasakkhī iti  vuccati na tu vimuttaḥ ti ekaccānam āsavānam a parikkhīṇa ttā tena āha jhāna phassam
translated: But when he has made cessation his object and has suppressed some of the defilements, then it is realized by him.🔽So he realizes with his body, as it has been looked over, the cessation that should be realized. Hence he is called “one who realizes the highest through bodily-witnessing” . But he is not called “liberated” because not all his defilements are exhausted. Hence it was said: “He first contacts the jhāna- resultant, and afterwards he realizes Nibbāna, cessation” .

original: paṭhamaṃ phusati, pacchā nirodhaṃ nibbānaṃ sacchikarotī”ti. Ayaṃ catunnaṃ arūpasamāpattīnaṃ
analyzed: paṭhamam phusati pacchā nirodham nibbānam sacchikaroti iti ayam catunnam arūpa samāpattīnam
translated: This is the first kind of bodily-witness.

original: ekekato vuṭṭhāya saṅkhāre sammasitvā kāyasakkhibhāvaṃ pattānaṃ catunnaṃ, nirodhā
analyzed: ekekatas vuṭṭhāya saṅkhāre sammasitvā kāya sakkhi bhāvam pattānam catunnam nirodhā
translated: And there are four more kinds, namely, those who, after emerging from each of the four immaterial states, have reached the state of bodily-witness by comprehending formations, and

original: vuṭṭhāya aggamaggappattaanāgāmino ca vasena ubhatobhāgavimutto viya pañcavidho nāma
analyzed: vuṭṭhāya agga magga ppatta anāgāmino ca vasena ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ viya pañcavidhaḥ nāma
translated: those who, after emerging from cessation, have reached the state of one “liberated in both ways” by attaining the supramundane path.

original: hoti. Tena vuttaṃ abhidhammaṭīkāyaṃ “kāyasakkhimhipi eseva nayo”ti.
analyzed: hoti tena vuttam abhidhammaṭīkāyam esa iva nayaḥ ti
translated: So there are five kinds in all. Hence it was said in the Abhidhamma Commentary: “The same method applies in the case of the bodily-witness.”

original: Diṭṭhantaṃ pattoti dassanasaṅkhātassa sotāpattimaggañāṇassa anantaraṃ pattoti vuttaṃ🔽hoti. “Diṭṭhattā patto”tipi pāṭho. Etena catusaccadassanasaṅkhātāya diṭṭhiyā nirodhassa
analyzed: diṭṭhantam pattoti dassana saṅkhātassa sotāpatti magga ñāṇassa anantaram pattoti vuttam  hoti diṭṭha ttā patto tipi pāṭhaḥ etena catur acca dassana saṅkhātāya diṭṭhiyā nirodhassa
translated: ‘He has attained to what is seen’ means that he has attained immediately after the knowledge of the path of stream-entry called ‘seeing.’

original: pattataṃ dīpeti. Tenāha “dukkhā saṅkhārā, sukho nirodhoti ñātaṃ hotī”ti. Tattha paññāyāti🔽maggapaññāya. Paṭhamaphalaṭṭhato yāva aggamaggaṭṭhā, tāva diṭṭhippatto. Tenāha “sopi
analyzed: dīpeti tena āha dukkhā saṅkhārā sukhaḥ nirodho ti ñātam hoti iti tattha paññāyāti  magga paññāya paṭhama phala ṭṭhataḥ yāva aggamagga ṭṭhā tāva diṭṭhippatto tena āha saḥ api
translated: There is also the reading ‘diṭṭhattā patto,’ which means that he has attained cessation by means of the view called ‘seeing the four truths.’ Hence it is said: ‘It is known that formations are suffering and cessation is bliss.’

original: kāyasakkhi viya chabbidho hotī”ti. Yathā pana paññāvimutto pañcavidho vutto, evaṃ🔽ayampi sukkhavipassako, catūhi rūpajjhānehi vuṭṭhāya diṭṭhippattabhāvappattā cattāro
analyzed: kāya sakkhi viya chabbidhaḥ hoti iti yathā pana paññā vimuttaḥ pañcavidhaḥ vuttaḥ evam  ayam pi sukkha vipassako catūhi rūpa jhānehi vuṭṭhāya diṭṭhi ppatta bhāva ppattā cattāro
translated: ‘By means of understanding’: by means of the understanding of the path. From the time he reaches the first fruit up to the time he reaches the path of arahatship, he is a ‘view-attainer.’ Hence it is said: ‘He too is of six kinds like the bodily witness.’

original: cāti pañcavidho hotīti veditabbo. Saddhāvimuttepi eseva nayo. Idaṃ dukkhanti ettakaṃ
analyzed: ca ati pañcavidhaḥ hoti iti veditabbo saddhā vimutte pi esa iva nayaḥ idam dukkham ti ettakam
translated: But just as the one liberated by faith is said to be of five kinds, so too this dry-insight worker, after emerging from the four jhānas, becomes a view-attainer and is of four kinds,🔽making five altogether.

original: dukkhaṃ, na ito uddhaṃ dukkhanti. Yathābhūtaṃ pajānātīti ṭhapetvā taṇhaṃ upādānakkhandhapañcakaṃ
analyzed: dukkham naḥ itas uddham dukkhanti yathābhūtam pajānāti iti ṭhapetvā taṇham upādāna khandha pañcakam
translated: ‘This is suffering’—he understands as it really is the five aggregates as objects of clinging, excluding craving.

original: dukkhasaccanti yāthāvato pajānāti. Yasmā pana taṇhā dukkhaṃ janeti nibbatteti, tato🔽taṃ dukkhaṃ samudeti, tasmā naṃ “ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo”ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti yasmā
analyzed: dukkha saccanti yāthāvataḥ pajānāti yasmā pana taṇhā dukkham janeti nibbatteti tatas  tam dukkham samudeti tasmai naṃ ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti yasmai
translated: He understands as it really is: ‘This is the noble truth of suffering.’ But craving generates suffering, produces it,

original: pana idaṃ dukkhaṃ samudayo ca nibbānaṃ patvā nirujjhati appavattiṃ gacchati, tasmā
analyzed: pana idam dukkham samudayaḥ ca nibbānam patvā nirujjhati appavattim gacchati tasmā
translated: Therefore he understands as it really is: ‘This is the origin of suffering.’ But when this suffering has reached cessation, it ceases, it does not occur,

original: “ayaṃ dukkhanirodho”ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti. Ariyo pana aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo taṃ dukkhanirodhaṃ
analyzed: ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ariyaḥ pana aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo tam dukkha nirodham
translated: Therefore he understands as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering.’ But the noble eightfold path leads to the cessation of suffering,

original: gacchati, tena “ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminipaṭipadā”ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti. Ettāvatā🔽nānakkhaṇe saccavavatthānaṃ dassitaṃ. Idāni taṃ ekakkhaṇe dassetuṃ “tathāgatappaveditā”tiādi
analyzed: gacchati tena ayam dukkha nirodha gāmini paṭipadā ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ettāvatā  nānā khaṇe sacca vavatthānam dassitam idāni tam eka kkhaṇe dassetum tathāgata ppaveditā atiādi
translated: Therefore he understands as it really is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’ To this extent

original: vuttaṃ, tassattho āgamissati.
analyzed: vuttam tassa atthaḥ āgamissati
translated: the defining of the truths has been shown in different moments. Now, in order to show that in one moment, it is said, ‘The Dhamma taught by the Tathāgata’ and so on. The meaning of that will come.

original: Saddhāya vimuttoti etena sabbathā avimuttassapi saddhāmattena vimuttabhāvo dīpito
analyzed: saddhāya vimuttaḥ ti etena sabbathā avimuttassa api saddhā mattena vimutta bhāvaḥ dīpito
translated: ‘Liberated in faith’: by this it is shown that one who is not completely liberated is liberated by the mere state of faith.

original: hoti. Saddhāvimuttoti vā saddhāya adhimuttoti attho. Vuttanayenevāti “sotāpattiphala”ntiādinā
analyzed: hoti saddhā vimutto ti vā saddhāya adhimutto ti attho vutta nayena iva ati sotāpatti phala nti ādinā
translated: “In the way already stated” means in the way stated in the passage beginning, “The fruit of stream-entry” .

original: vuttanayena. Saddahantassāti “ekaṃsato ayaṃ paṭipadā kilesakkhayaṃ āvahati sammāsambuddhena🔽bhāsitattā”ti evaṃ saddahantassa. Yasmā panassa aniccānupassanādīhi niccasaññāpahānavasena🔽bhāvanāya pubbenāparaṃ visesaṃ passato tattha tattha paccakkhatāpi atthi, tasmā vuttaṃ🔽“saddahantassa viyā”ti. Sesapadadvayaṃ tasseva vevacanaṃ. Ettha ca pubbabhāgamaggabhāvanāti
analyzed: vutta nayena saddahantassa ati ekaṃsataḥ ayam paṭipadā kilesa khayam āvahati sammāsambuddhena  bhāsita ttā ti evam saddahantassa yasmā pana assa anicca anupassana ādīhi nicca saññā apahāna vasena  bhāvanāya pubbena aparam visesam passato tattha tattha paccakkhatā api atthi tasmā vuttam  saddahantassa viya ati sesa pada dvayam tassa iva vevacanam ettha ca pubba bhāga magga bhāvanā ti
translated: “One who has confidence” : one who has confidence thus, “This way leads to the cessation of suffering, because it was taught by the Exalted One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One” .🔽But since he sees a difference in his development from the earlier time in the abandoning of the perception of permanence, etc., by means of the contemplation of impermanence, etc., he has also direct knowledge of that difference. Therefore it is said, “as if he had confidence” . The other two terms are synonyms for the same thing.

original: vacanena āgamanīyapaṭipadānānattena saddhāvimuttadiṭṭhippattānaṃ paññānānattaṃ hotīti
analyzed: vacanena āgamanīya paṭipadā nānattena saddhā vimutta diṭṭhi ppattānam paññā nānattam hoti iti
translated: And here the words “development of the path in the prior stage” show that there is a difference in wisdom between those liberated by faith and those who have attained to view, since the path is different in the case of each.

original: dassitaṃ. Abhidhammaṭṭhakathāyampi “nesaṃ kilesappahāne nānattaṃ natthi, paññāya
analyzed: dassitam abhidhamma ṭṭhakathāyam pi na isam kilesa ppahāne nānattam natthi paññāya
translated: In the Abhidhamma Commentary too it is said: “There is no difference in the abandoning of defilements in these two. The difference is in the wisdom.

original: nānattaṃ atthiyevā”ti vatvā – “āgamanīyanānatteneva saddhāvimutto diṭṭhippattaṃ na
analyzed: nānattam atthiyā iva ati vatvā āgamanīya nānattena iva saddhā vimuttaḥ diṭṭhi ppattam na
translated: “There is a difference, indeed.”🔽“It is only by the difference in the time of coming that the faith-liberated one is not a body-witness.

original: pāpuṇātīti sanniṭṭhānaṃ kata”nti vuttaṃ.🔽Paññāsaṅkhātaṃ dhammaṃ adhimattatāya pubbaṅgamaṃ hutvā pavattaṃ anussaratīti dhammānusārī.
analyzed: pāpuṇāti iti sanniṭṭhānam katan ti vuttam  paññā saṅkhātam dhammam adhimatta tāya pubbaṅgamam hutvā pavattam anussarati iti dhamma anusārī
translated: There is a difference, ” and then he concluded that “the faith-liberated one does not reach the one attained to view because of the difference in the mode of arrival. ”🔽He recollects the Dhamma which is called wisdom and which is the forerunner in the arising of the path.

original: Tenāha “dhammo”tiādi. Saddhaṃ anussarati saddhāpubbaṅgamaṃ maggaṃ bhāvetīti imamatthaṃ
analyzed: tena āha dhamma uti ādi saddham anussarati saddhā pubbaṅgamam maggam bhāveti iti imam attham
translated: Therefore he said “Dhamma” and so on. He recollects faith and develops the path which is preceded by faith. This is the meaning.

original: “eseva nayo”ti atidisati. Paññaṃ vāhetīti paññāvāhī, paññaṃ sātisayaṃ pavattetīti
analyzed: esā iva nayo ti atidisati paññam vāheti iti paññāvāhī paññam sa atisayam pavatteti iti
translated: He shows this by the words “The same method applies.” He is a carrier of wisdom, a bearer of wisdom, because he causes wisdom to flow,🔽because he makes wisdom flow in abundance.🔽The meaning is this. He develops the noble path which is preceded by wisdom.

original: attho. Tenāha “paññāpubbaṅgamaṃ ariyamaggaṃ bhāvetī”ti. Saddhāvāhinti ettha vuttanayena
analyzed: atthaḥ tena āha paññā pubbaṅgamam ariya maggam bhāveti iti saddhā vāhin ti ettha vutta nayena
translated: The meaning should be understood in the way stated in the case of “carrier of faith.”🔽The discussion of the one liberated in both ways, etc.

original: attho veditabbo. Ubhatobhāgavimuttādikathāti ubhatobhāgavimuttādīsu āgamanato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: atthaḥ veditabbaḥ ubhatobhāga vimutta ādi kathā ati ubhatobhāga vimutta ādīsu āgamanataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: The discussion beginning with the one liberated in both ways.

original: vattabbakathā. Etesanti yathāvuttānaṃ ubhatobhāgavimuttādīnaṃ. Idhāti imasmiṃ kīṭāgirisutte.
analyzed: vattabba kathā etesanti yathāvuttānam ubhatobhāga vimutta ādīnam idha iti imasmim kīṭāgirisutte
translated: These: the one liberated in both ways, etc., as stated. Here: in this Kītāgiri Sutta.

original: Nanu ca aṭṭhasamāpattilābhivasena ubhatobhāgavimutto kāyasakkhīādayo ca abhidhamme
analyzed: nanu ca aṭṭha samāpatti lābhi vasena ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ kāya sakkhī ādayo ca abhidhamme
translated: Are not the body witness, etc., mentioned in the Abhidhamma as being of the kinds of both-ways-liberated, etc., obtained by the attainment of the eight attainments?

original: āgatā, kathamidha arūpajjhānalābhīvaseneva uddhaṭāti codanaṃ sandhāyāha “yasmā”tiādi.
analyzed: āgatā katham idha codanam sandhāya āha yasmā iti ādi
translated: Are not the body-witness and the rest mentioned in the Abhidhamma as being of two kinds, namely, those who attain the eight attainments and those who are both-ways released? How then is it said here that they are only those who attain the formless attainments? The answer to this is “Because the Blessed One … in the Ariyavamsa Sutta” .

original: Phusitvā patvā. Paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā hontīti na āsavā paññāya passīyanti,
analyzed: phusitvā patvā paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti iti na āsavā paññāya passīyanti
translated: Having touched, having reached. And his taints are destroyed by seeing with understanding. Taints are not seen with understanding.🔽But they are destroyed by seeing with understanding. Therefore it is said: “destroyed by seeing with understanding.”

original: dassanakāraṇā paññāya parikkhīṇā “disvā paññāya parikkhīṇā”ti vuttā. Dassanāyattaparikkhayattā🔽eva hi dassanaṃ āsavānaṃ khayassa purimakiriyā hotīti. Tathāgatena paveditāti bodhimaṇḍe
analyzed: dassana kāraṇā paññāya parikkhīṇā disvā paññāya parikkhīṇā iti vuttā dassana āyatta parikkhaya ttā  eva hi dassanam āsavānam khayassa purima kiriyā hoti iti tathāgatena paveditā ati bodhimaṇḍe
translated: For it is only because of seeing that they are destroyed.

original: nisīditvā tathāgatena paṭividdhā viditā pacchā paresaṃ pākaṭīkatā. “Catusaccadhammā”ti
analyzed: nisīditvā tathāgatena paṭividdhā viditā pacchā paresam pākaṭīkatā catu sacca dhammā ati
translated: Proclaimed by the Tathāgata: discovered by the Tathāgata sitting in the Way-place of Awakening and later made clear to others.🔽The four noble truths: the virtue, etc., are included in that, so it is said: “Here virtue is taught” and so on.

original: vatvā tadantogadhattā sīlādīnaṃ “imasmiṃ ṭhāne sīlaṃ kathita”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Atthenāti
analyzed: vatvā sīla ādīnam imasmin ṭhāne sīlam kathita ntiādi vuttaṃ atthena ati
translated: In the meaning:

original: avippaṭisārādipayojanena tasmiṃ tasmiṃ pītiādikena atthena. Kāraṇenāti sappurisūpanissayādinā🔽kāraṇena tasmiṃ tasmiṃ samādhiādipadaṭṭhānatāya sīlādi kāraṇe. Ciṇṇacaritattāti saddhāciṇṇabhāvena🔽sambodhāvahabhāve. Tattha tattha vicaritā visesena caritā, tesu tena paññā suṭṭhu
analyzed: a vippaṭisāra ādi payojanena tasmim tasmim pīti ādikena atthena kāraṇena ati sappurisa upanissaya ādinā  kāraṇena tasmin tasmin samādhi ādi padaṭṭhāna tāya sīla ādi kāraṇe saddhā a ciṇṇa bhāvena  sambodhā vaha bhāve tattha tattha vicaritā visesena caritā tesu tena paññā suṭṭhu
translated: and so on, with the meaning of each in the sense of gladness, and so on. As a reason: as a reason for each in the sense of the basis for concentration, and so on, with the reason of virtue, and so on. As a practice: as a practice in the sense of the practice of faith,

original: carāpitāti attho. Patiṭṭhitā hoti maggena āgatattā. Mattāya parittappamāṇena. Olokanaṃ
analyzed: attho patiṭṭhitā hoti maggena āgata ttā mattāya paritta ppamāṇena olokanam
translated: and so on, in the sense of the state of leading to full enlightenment. As a course: as a course in the sense of a course in each case, as a course in those, with wisdom well coursed in that, is the meaning. As a foundation: as a foundation in the sense of the path’s being reached. As a measure: as a measure in the sense of a small amount. As a looking-on:

original: khamanti, paññāya gahetabbataṃ upenti.🔽Tayoti kāyasakkhidiṭṭhippattasaddhāvimuttā. Yathāṭhitova pāḷiattho, na tattha kiñci🔽niddhāretvā vattabbaṃ atthīti suttantapariyāyena avuttaṃ vadati. Tassa maggassāti
analyzed: khamanti paññāya gahetabbatam upenti  tayo ti kāya sakkhi diṭṭhi ppatta saddhā vimuttāḥ yathā aṭhitaḥ iva pāḷi atthaḥ na tattha kiñci  niddhāretvā vattabbam atthi iti suttanta pariyāyena avuttam vadati tassa maggassa ati
translated: as a looking-on in the sense of being able to be grasped by understanding.

original: sotāpattimaggassa yaṃ kātabbaṃ, tassa adhigatattā. Upari pana tiṇṇaṃ maggānaṃ atthāya
analyzed: sotāpatti maggassa yam kātabbam tassa adhigata ttā upari pana tiṇṇam maggānaṃ atthāya
translated: Three: those with faith and those with understanding who have reached the bodily witness stage. The meaning of the text is as it stands. There is nothing to be extracted from it, so he speaks without using a sutta phrase. As to the path: because what has to be done for the stream-entry path has been done by his reaching it. But for the sake of the three higher paths

original: sevamānā anulomasenāsanaṃ, bhajamānā kalyāṇamitte, samannānayamānā indriyāni anupubbena
analyzed: sevamānā anuloma senāsanam bhajamānā kalyāṇa mitte samannānayamānā indriyāni anupubbena
translated: Practicing in the right order, the right way of living,🔽Serving good friends, bringing the faculties to maturity, in due course

original: bhāvanāmaggappaṭipāṭiyā arahattaṃ pāpuṇissanti maggassa anekacittakkhaṇikatāyāti
analyzed: bhāvanā magga paṭipāṭiyā arahattam pāpuṇissanti maggassa aneka citta khaṇika tāya ati
translated: and they will reach Arahantship by the gradual path, since the path is of many consciousnesses.

original: ayamettha suttapadese pāḷiyā attho.
analyzed: ayam ettha sutta padese pāḷiyāḥ attho
translated: This is the meaning of the text in the sutta.

original: Imameva pāḷiṃ gahetvāti “katamo ca puggalo saddhānusārī”ti maggaṭṭhe puggale vatvā
analyzed: imam eva pāḷim gahetvā ati katamo ca puggalo saddhā anusārī iti maggaṭṭhe puggale vatvā
translated: Taking that very text: after describing the person who is a follower by faith as “What kind of person is a follower by faith? ”

original: “imassa kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave”tiādinā tesaṃ vasena anulomasenāsanasevanādīnaṃ vuttattā
analyzed: imassa kho aham bhikkhave ti ādinā tesam vasena anuloma senāsana sevana ādīnam vutta ttā
translated: and then saying “This person, bhikkhus” and so on, he describes the gradual training in the way of resorting to the right kind of lodging, etc.,

original: imameva yathāvuttaṃ pāḷipadesaṃ gahetvā “lokuttaradhammo bahucittakkhaṇiko”ti vadati.
analyzed: imam eva yathāvuttam pāḷi padesam gahetvā lokuttara dhammo bahu citta kkhaṇikaḥ ti vadati
translated: he says that the supramundane state is of many consciousnesses, taking that very passage as he has described it.

original: So vattabboti so vitaṇḍavādī evaṃ vattabbo. Yadi maggaṭṭhapuggale vatvā anulomikasenāsanasevanādi🔽pāḷiyaṃ vuttanti maggasamaṅgino eva hutvā te tathā paṭipajjanti, evaṃ sante senāsanapaṭisaṃyuttarūpādivipassanaggahaṇasmiṃ
analyzed: saḥ vattabbaḥ ti saḥ vitaṇḍa vādī evam vattabbaḥ yadi magga ṭṭha puggale vatvā anulomika senāsana sevana ādi 🔽pāḷiyam vuttanti magga samaṅginaḥ eva hutvā te tathā paṭipajjanti evam sante senāsana paṭisaṃyutta rūpa ādi vipassana ggahaṇasmiṃ
translated: He should be told: that disputant should be told as follows.

original: tava matena maggasamaṅgino eva āpajjeyyuṃ, na cetaṃ evaṃ hoti, tasmā suttaṃ me laddhanti
analyzed: tava matena magga samaṅginaḥ eva āpajjeyyum na ca itam evam hoti tasmā suttam me laddhanti
translated: “If you think that only those possessed of the path would commit the offence, then you have not understood the Thread.”

original: yaṃ kiñci mā kathehīti vāretabbo. Tenāha “yadi aññena cittenā”tiādi. Tattha evaṃ🔽santeti nānācitteneva senāsanapaṭisevanādike sati. Tattha pāḷiyaṃ yadi lokuttaradhammasamaṅgino🔽eva pañcaviññāṇasamaṅgikālepi lokuttarasamaṅgitaṃ sace sampaṭicchasi, satthārā saddhiṃ
analyzed: yam kiñci mā kathehi iti vāretabbaḥ tena āha yadi aññena cittena atiādi tattha evam  santā iti nānā cittena iva senāsana paṭisevana ādike sati tattha yadi lokuttara dhamma samaṅginaḥ  eva pañca viññāṇa samaṅgi kāle pi lokuttara samaṅgi tam sace sampaṭicchasi satthārā saddhim
translated: “Don’t say that” he should be told. “If it were so, then”

original: paṭivirujjhasi suttavirodhadīpanato. Tenāha “satthārā hī”tiādi. Dhammavicāraṇā nāma
analyzed: paṭivirujjhasi sutta virodha dīpanato tena āha satthārā hi itiādi dhamma vicāraṇā nāma
translated: “if it were so, then” there would be the contradiction of the text in the case of the use of a resting place, etc., with a different cognizance. Herein, if you admit that one possessed of the supramundane idea is possessed of the supramundane idea even at the time when he is possessed of the five consciousnesses, then you contradict the Master.

original: tuyhaṃ avisayo, tasmā yāguṃ pivāhīti uyyojetabbo.🔽183. Ādikenevāti paṭhameneva. Anupubbasikkhāti anupubbeneva pavattasikkhāya. Tenāha
analyzed: tuyham avisayaḥ tasmai yāgum pivāhi iti  ādikena iva āti paṭhamena iva anupubba sikkhā ati anupubbena iva pavatta sikkhāya tena āha
translated: “For the Master” and so on. “The investigation of ideas” is not your province, so drink the gruel.

original: “karaṇatthe paccattavacana”nti. Saddhā jātā etassāti saddhājāto, agyāhitātipakkhepena
analyzed: karaṇa atthe paccatta vacananti saddhā jātā etassa ati saddhājātaḥ a gyāhita atipakkhepena
translated: “With the first” : with the first only. “The training in regular succession” : the training that occurs in regular succession only. Hence he said “The reflexive pronoun is in the sense of instrument” . “One who has faith arisen in him” is a “faith-follower” .

original: jāta-saddassa pacchāvacanaṃ. Evametanti adhimuccanaṃ okappaniyasaddhā. Santike nisīdati
analyzed: jāta saddassa pacchāvacanam evam etat ti adhimuccanam okappaniya saddhā santike nisīdati
translated: and the word ‘after’ is a subsequent expression for the word ‘born’. The word ‘thus’ is the faith of approval in the act of approving. He sits down near to him

original: upaṭṭhānavasena. Sādhukaṃ katvā dhāretīti yathāsutaṃ dhammaṃ vācuggatakaraṇavasena🔽taṃ paguṇaṃ katvā sāravasena dhāreti. Chando jāyatīti dhammesu nijjhānakkhamesu ime🔽dhamme bhāvanāpaññāya paccakkhato ussāmīti kattukamyatākusalacchando jāyati. Ussahatīti
analyzed: upaṭṭhāna vasena sādhukam katvā dhāreti iti yathāsutam dhammam vācuggata karaṇa vasena  tam paguṇam katvā sāra vasena dhāreti chandaḥ jāyati iti dhammesu nijjhāna khamesu ime  dhamme bhāvanā paññāya paccakkhataḥ ussāmī iti kattu kamya tā kusala chandaḥ jāyati ussahati iti
translated: by way of attendance. He bears in mind well means that he bears in mind the Dhamma as he has heard it by making it into words,🔽and he bears it in mind as essence by making it familiar. Desire arises means that in regard to the ideas that are the object of his insight,🔽the unprofitable desire to act arises in him, thinking: ‘I shall experience these ideas by direct-cognizing with insight-understanding’. He makes an effort means that

original: chando uppādamatte aṭṭhatvā tato bhāvanārambhavasena ussahati. Tulayatiti sammasanavasena🔽saṅkhāre. Tīraṇavipassanāya tulayantoti tīraṇapariññāya jānitvā upari pahānapariññāya🔽vasena paritulayanto paṭijānanto. Maggapadhānaṃ padahatīti maggalakkhaṇaṃ padhānikaṃ
analyzed: chandaḥ uppāda matte tatas bhāvanā ārambha vasena ussahati tulayati ti sammasana vasena  saṅkhāre tīraṇa vipassanāya tulayanto ti tīraṇa pariññāya jānitvā upari pahāna pariññāya  vasena paritulayantaḥ paṭijānantaḥ magga padhānam padahati iti magga lakkhaṇam padhānikam
translated: after the mere arising of desire, he makes an effort by undertaking the development. He investigates means that he investigates formations by way of discerning.🔽He understands by means of the insight of seeing means that, having understood by means of the full-understanding as abandoning, he comprehends by way of the full-understanding as investigation. He makes the effort for the path means that he makes the effort for the path that is the characteristic of the path.

original: maggaṃ padahati. Pesitacittoti nibbānaṃ pati pesitacitto. Nāmakāyenāti maggappaṭipāṭiyā
analyzed: maggam padahati pesita cittaḥ ti nibbānam pati pesita cittaḥ nāmakāyena ati magga paṭipāṭiyā
translated: He is one whose mind is bent on means that he is one whose mind is bent on extinction. By the name-group means that he is one who has reached the path by the order of the path.

original: taṃtaṃmaggasampayuttanāmakāyena. Na pana kiñci āhāti dūratāya samānaṃ na kiñci vacanaṃ
analyzed: taṃ taṃ magga sampayutta nāmakāyena na pana kiñci āha ati dūratāya samānam na kiñci vacanam
translated: by the name-group associated with that particular path. But he did not say anything at all.

original: bhagavā āha te daḷhataraṃ niggaṇhituṃ.
analyzed: bhagavān āha te daḷhataram niggaṇhitum
translated: The Blessed One said this in order to restrain them even more.

original: 184. Paṇena vohārena byākaraṇaṃ paṇaviyā, paṇaviyā abhāvena opaṇaviyā, na upetīti
analyzed: paṇena vohārena byākaraṇam paṇaviyā paṇaviyā abhāvena opaṇaviyā na upeti iti
translated: The reply is “paṇavī” . The word “opaṇavī” is not appropriate because it does not have the prefix “upa.”

original: na yujjati. Tanti idaṃ idha adhippetaṃ paṇo paṇaviyaṃ dassetuṃ. Tayidaṃ sabbaṃ bhagavā
analyzed: na yujjati idam idha adhippetam paṇo paṇaviyam dassetum tayidam sabbam bhagavā
translated: The word “paṇavī” is intended here in order to show that it has the prefix “paṇ.” The Blessed One said this

original: “mayaṃ kho, āvuso, sāyañceva bhuñjāmā”ti assajipunabbasukehi vuttaṃ sikkhāya avattanabhāvadīpanavacanaṃ sandhāya vadati.🔽Ukkhipitvāti sīsena gahetvā viya samādāya. Anudhammoti anurūpo sabhāvo, sāvakabhāvassa🔽anucchavikā paṭipatti. Rohanīyanti viruḷhibhāvaṃ. Siniyhati ettha, etena vāti sineho,
analyzed: mayam kho āvuso sāyam ca iva bhuñjāma ati assa jipu nabbasukehi vuttam sikkhāya avattana bhāva dīpana vacanam sandhāya vadati  ukkhipitvā iti sīsena gahetvā viya samādāya anudhammaḥ ti anurūpaḥ sabhāvaḥ sāvaka bhāvassa  anucchavikā paṭipatti viruḷhi bhāvam siniyhati ettha etena vāti sinehaḥ
translated: in reference to the statement made by Assaji and Punabbasuka: “We eat in the evening, friend.”🔽“Having lifted up” means having taken up as if by the head. “In accordance with the Dhamma” means in accordance with the nature of the disciple,🔽the practice that is suitable for the state of discipleship. “Conducive to growth” means conducive to development. “Affection” is the cause for the word “affectionate.”

original: kāraṇaṃ. Taṃ ettha atthīti sinehavantaṃ, pādakanti attho. Taco ekaṃ aṅganti taco
analyzed: kāraṇam tam ettha atthi iti sinehavantam pādakanti taco ekam aṅganti taco
translated: The meaning is: “having affection,” “having a base.” “The body” is one part of the fourfold body.

original: vīrapakkhabhāve ekamaṅgaṃ. Padhānaṃ anuyuñjantassa hi tace palujjamānepi taṃnimittaṃ
analyzed: vīra pakkha bhāve ekam aṅgam padhānam anuyuñjantassa hi tace palujjamāne pi tad nimittam
translated: is one factor in the hero’s state of being. For one who is devoted to striving, when that is decaying, the sign of that

original: avosānaṃ anāpajjanakasseva vīriyassa ekaṃ aṅgaṃ ekaṃ kāraṇaṃ. Evaṃ sesesu vattabbaṃ.
analyzed: avosānam an āpajjanakassa iva vīriyassa ekam aṅgam ekam kāraṇam evam sesesu vattabbam
translated: One factor in the hero’s state. For when one is devoted to striving, even if that is decaying, it is only for one who does not allow the sign of that to reach cessation that striving has one factor, one cause. The rest should be treated in the same way.

original: Tenāha – “arahattaṃ appatvā na vuṭṭhahissāmīti evaṃ paṭipajjatī”ti. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: tena āha arahattam ap patvā na vuṭṭhahissāmi iti evam paṭipajjati iti sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: Hence it is said: ‘He practices so that he will not emerge without reaching Arahantship’ . The rest is easy to understand.

original: Kīṭāgirisuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the word ‘sluggish’ in the Kīṭāgiri Sutta is ended.

original: Niṭṭhitā ca bhikkhuvaggavaṇṇanā.🔽3. Paribbājakavaggo
analyzed: niṭṭhitā ca bhikkhu vagga vaṇṇanā  paribbājaka vaggaḥ
translated: And the commentary on the Bhikkhu Vagga is ended.🔽The Wanderer’s Group

original: 1. Tevijjavacchasuttavaṇṇanā🔽185. Tatthāti ekapuṇḍarīkasaññite paribbājakārāme. Anāgatapubbo lokiyasamudāhāravasena🔽“cirassaṃ kho, bhante”tiādinā vuccati, ayaṃ panettha āgatapubbataṃ upādāya tathā
analyzed: tevijjavaccha sutta vaṇṇanā  tattha ati eka puṇḍarīka saññite paribbājaka ārāme anāgata pubbaḥ lokiya samudāhāra vasena  cirassam kho bhante ti ādinā vuccati ayam pana ittha āgata pubbatam upādāya tathā
translated: The Tevijjavaccha Sutta

original: vutto. Bhagavā hi kesañci vimuttijananatthaṃ, kesañci indriyaparipākatthaṃ, kesañci
analyzed: vuttaḥ bhagavā hi kesañci vimutti janana attham kesañci indriya paripāka attham kesañci
translated: ‘There’ is in the Wanderers’ Rest Hut, which is called ‘One Lotus’. ‘Long since, venerable sir’ is said in the form of a worldly utterance. But this is said in this way by taking the fact that it has been said before. For the Blessed One said it in order to generate deliverance in some, in order to mature the faculties in some, and in order to make some understand.

original: visesādhigamatthaṃ kadāci titthiyārāmaṃ upagacchati. Ananuññāya ṭhatvāti ananujānitabbe
analyzed: visesa adhigama attham kadāci titthiya ārāmam upagacchati an anuññāya ṭhatvā ati an anujānitabbe
translated: sometimes he goes to a heretic’s monastery for the purpose of acquiring special knowledge. ‘Without permission’: without being allowed to.

original: ṭhatvā. Anujānitabbaṃ siyā anaññātassa ñeyyassa abhāvato. Yāvatakañhi ñeyyaṃ, tāvatakaṃ
analyzed: ṭhatvā anujānitabbam siyā an aññātassa ñeyyassa abhāvataḥ yāvatakam hi ñeyyam tāvatakam
translated: It may be asked: ‘Why is it that there is no knowledge that is not to be known?’🔽For as far as there is knowledge, that is as far as there is the knowable;

original: bhagavato ñāṇaṃ, yāvatakañca bhagavato ñāṇaṃ tāvatakaṃ ñeyyaṃ. Tenevāha – “na tassa
analyzed: bhagavataḥ ñāṇam yāvatakam ca bhagavataḥ ñāṇam tāvatakam ñeyyam tena iva āha na tassa
translated: and as far as there is the knowable, that is as far as there is knowledge. Hence it is said:🔽‘There is nothing not seen by him,

original: adiṭṭhamidhatthi kiñci, atho aviññātamajānitabba”ntiādi. Sabbaññutaññāṇena hi bhagavā
analyzed: a diṭṭham idha atthi kiñci atho a viññātam a jānitabba ntiādi sabbaññuta ññāṇena hi bhagavā
translated: Nor is there anything not known that can be known by one who knows’ .

original: āvajjetvā pajānāti. Vuttañhetaṃ “āvajjanapaṭibaddhaṃ buddhassa bhagavato ñāṇa”nti.
analyzed: āvajjetvā pajānāti vuttam ha etam āvajjana paṭibaddham buddhassa bhagavataḥ ñāṇan ti
translated: For the Blessed One knows by adverting with the knowledge of omniscience. It is said: ‘The knowledge of the Blessed One is bound up with adverting’ .

original: Yadi evaṃ “caraṃ samāhito nāgo, tiṭṭhaṃ nāgo samāhito”ti idaṃ suttapadaṃ kathanti?🔽Vikkhepābhāvadīpanapadametaṃ, na anāvajjanenapi ñāṇānaṃ pavattiparidīpanaṃ. Yaṃ panettha
analyzed: yadi evam caran samāhitaḥ nāgo tiṭṭhan nāgo samāhito ti idam sutta padam kathanti  vikkhepa abhāva dīpana padam etam na an āvajjanena api ñāṇānam pavatti paridīpanam yam pana ittha
translated: If that is so, how is it to be said that the following passage is a sutta? ‘The elephant in rut when walking is concentrated, the elephant in rut when standing is concentrated’ ?

original: vattabbaṃ, taṃ heṭṭhā vitthārato vuttameva.
analyzed: vattabbam tat heṭṭhā vitthārataḥ vuttam eva
translated: This passage shows that there is no distraction; it does not show that there is no adverting and that knowledge occurs without adverting. But what has to be said here has already been said in detail below .

original: 186. Yāvadevāti idaṃ yathāruci pavatti viya aparāparuppattipi icchitabbāti tadabhāvaṃ🔽dassento āha – “sakiṃ khīṇānaṃ āsavānaṃ puna khepetabbābhāvā”ti. Paccuppannajānanaguṇanti
analyzed: yāvat eva iti idam yathāruci icchitabbā ati tad abhāvam  dassentaḥ āha sakim khīṇānam āsavānam puna khepetabba abhāvā ti paccuppanna jānana guṇan ti
translated: “As far as” : this is said in order to show that there is no further arising of defilements, as if there were a process of arising according to one’s wish.

original: idaṃ dibbacakkhuñāṇassa paribhaṇḍañāṇaṃ anāgataṃsañāṇaṃ anādiyitvā vuttaṃ, tassa
analyzed: idam dibba cakkhu ñāṇassa paribhaṇḍa ñāṇam anāgataṃsa ñāṇam an ādiyitvā vuttam tassa
translated: “The quality of knowing the present” : this is said without taking into account the knowledge of the divine eye and the knowledge of the future.

original: pana vasena anāgataṃsañāṇaguṇaṃ dassetīti vattabbaṃ siyā.
analyzed: pana vasena anāgataṃsa ñāṇa guṇam dasseti iti vattabbam siyā
translated: But it should be said that it shows the quality of the knowledge of the future.

original: Gihiparikkhāresūti vatthābharaṇādidhanadhaññādigihiparikkhāresu. Gihiliṅgaṃ pana
analyzed: gihi parikkhāresu iti vattha ābharaṇa ādi dhana dhañña ādi gihi parikkhāresu gihi liṅgam pana
translated: “In the requisites of the house-holder” : in the requisites of the house-holder such as clothes, ornaments, wealth, grain, etc.

original: appamāṇaṃ, tasmā gihibandhanaṃ chinditvā dukkhassantakarā hontiyeva. Sati pana dukkhassantakiriyāya
analyzed: appamāṇam tasmai gihibandhanam chinditvā dukkha ssanta karāḥ sati pana
translated: But the characteristics of the house-holder are immeasurable. Therefore, having cut off the bondage of the house-holder, they become the enders of suffering.🔽But if there is the ending of suffering, they do not remain in the characteristics of the house-holder. Showing this, he said “Even those who” , etc.

original: gihiliṅge te na tiṭṭhantiyevāti dassento “yepī”tiādimāha. Sukkhāpetvā samucchinditvā.
analyzed: gihi liṅge te na tiṭṭhanti yeva ati dassentaḥ ye pi itiādim āha sukkhāpetvā samucchinditvā
translated: Having dried up, having cut off.

original: Arahattaṃ pattadivaseyeva pabbajanaṃ vā parinibbānaṃ vāti ayaṃ nayo na sabbasādhāraṇoti
analyzed: arahattam patta divaseya iva pabbajanam vā parinibbānam vā ati ayam nayaḥ na sabba sādhāraṇaḥ ti
