original: 288. Paccayasāmaggihetukattā dhammappattiyā padesato pariññāvatthukāpi ariyā upaṭṭhite🔽cittavighātapaccaye yadetaṃ nātisāvajjaṃ, tadevaṃ gaṇhantīti ayamettha dhammatāti
analyzed: paccaya sāmaggi hetuka ttā dhammappattiyā padesataḥ pariññā vatthukā api ariyāḥ upaṭṭhite  citta vighāta paccaye yat etam na ati sāvajjam tat evam gaṇhanti iti ayam ettha dhamma tā ati
translated: Because of the combination of requisites, the noble ones, who are the basis for the knowledge of the measure of the earth,🔽when the conditions for mental anguish have arisen, take only that which is not very blameworthy. This is the nature of things here.

original: āha – “alābhaṃ ārabbha cittaññathatta”ntiādi. Soti kikī kāsirājā. Brāhmaṇabhattoti
analyzed: āha alābham ārabbha saḥ iti kikī kāsi rājā brāhmaṇabhattā iti
translated: Therefore it is said: “The alteration of mind about gain” and so on. He means King Kiki of Kasi. Worshipped by brahmins means

original: brāhmaṇesu bhatto. Deveti brāhmaṇe sandhāyāha. Bhūmidevāti tesaṃ samaññā, tadā brāhmaṇagaruko
analyzed: brāhmaṇesu bhatto deva iti brāhmaṇe sandhāya āha bhūmideva ati tesam samaññā tadā brāhmaṇa garukaḥ
translated: worshipped by brahmins. Gods means he speaks referring to the brahmins. Earth gods means their designation. At that time, brahmins were respected.

original: loko. Tadā hi kassapopi bhagavā brāhmaṇakule nibbatti. Dhītu avaṇṇaṃ vatvāti, “mahārāja,
analyzed: tadā hi kassapaḥ api bhagavā brāhmaṇa kule nibbatti mahā rāja
translated: After speaking dispraise of his daughter: “Great king,

original: tava dhītā brāhmaṇasamayaṃ pahāya muṇḍapāsaṇḍikasamayaṃ gaṇhī”tiādinā rājaputtiyā
analyzed: tava dhītā brāhmaṇa samayam pahāya muṇḍa pāsaṇḍika samayam rāja puttiyā
translated: your daughter has abandoned the brahmin tradition and taken up the tradition of the shaven-headed sectarians.”🔽After speaking thus about the faults of the king’s daughter, they took a boon.

original: aguṇaṃ vatvā. Varaṃ gaṇhiṃsu ñātakā. Rajjaṃ niyyātesi “mā me vacanaṃ musā ahosi,
analyzed: aguṇam vatvā varam gaṇhiṃsu ñātakāḥ rajjam niyyātesi mā me vacanam musā ahosi
translated: He gave the kingdom to them, saying, “Let my words not be false.

original: aṭṭhame divase niggaṇhissāmī”ti.
analyzed: aṭṭhame divase niggaṇhissāmi iti
translated: I will suppress them on the eighth day.”

original: Pāvanaasmanayanavasena sammā pāvīkatattā parisuddhataṇḍulāni. Pāḷiyaṃ taṇḍulapaṭibhastānīti taṇḍulakhaṇḍāni. Muggapaṭibhastakaḷāyapaṭibhastesupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: sammā pāvīkatattā parisuddha taṇḍulāni pāḷiyam taṇḍula paṭibhastāni iti taṇḍula khaṇḍāni mugga paṭibhasta kaḷāya paṭibhastesu pi esā iva nayo
translated: Because they are well-purified by the process of washing, they are pure rice. In the text, they are called “rice-grains” . The same method applies to the “lentil-grains” and “kidney-bean-grains” .

original: 289. Ko nu khoti bhummatthe paccattavacananti āha – “kuhiṃ nu kho”ti pāripūriṃ yojīyanti
analyzed: kaḥ nu khalu iti bhumma atthe paccatta vacananti āha kuhim nu khalu iti pāripūrim yojīyanti
translated: “Who is it?” is a first-person singular form in the sense of “where is it?” “Where is it?” is supplied to complete the sense.

original: byañjanabhojanāni etthāti pariyogo, tato pariyogā. Tenāha “sūpabhājanato”ti. Saññaṃ
analyzed: byañjana bhojanāni ettha iti pariyogo tatas pariyogā tena āha sūpa bhājanato ti saññam
translated: The “end” is the end of the bowl, because it is the place where the rice and curry are collected. Therefore it is said, “from the end of the soup-bowl.”

original: datvāti vuttaṃ sabbaṃ ācikkhitvā tumhākaṃ atthāya sampādetvā nikkhitto upaṭṭhākoti
analyzed: datvā iti vuttam sabbam ācikkhitvā tumhākam atthāya sampādetvā nikkhittaḥ upaṭṭhāko ti
translated: After giving the perception: after telling him everything, after saying, “A servant has been appointed for your sake and set aside,”

original: bhagavato ārocethāti saññaṃ datvā. Ativissatthoti ativiya vissattho. Pañcavaṇṇāti
analyzed: bhagavataḥ ārocetha iti saññam datvā ativissattho ti ativiya vissatthaḥ pañca vaṇṇā ati
translated: and he gave the sign to inform the Lord. He was over-confident: he was over-confident. Five colours:

original: khuddikādivasena pañcappakārā.
analyzed: khuddikā ādi vasena pañca ppakārā
translated: five-coloured by way of the five kinds of colour, blue, yellow, etc.🔽Why is the word nissakkha used in the singular? What is the meaning?

original: 290. Kinti nissakke paccattavacanaṃ, kasmāti attho? Dhammikoti iminā āgamanasuddhiṃ
analyzed: kim ti nissakke paccatta vacanam kasmā iti atthaḥ dhammikaḥ ti iminā āgamana suddhim
translated: Dhammika: he shows that his coming was pure.

original: dasseti. Bhikkhūnaṃ patte bhattasadisoti iminā upāsakena satthu pariccattabhāvaṃ🔽tattha satthuno ca aparisaṅkataṃ dasseti. Sikkhāpadavelā nāma natthīti dhammassāmibhāvato
analyzed: dasseti bhikkhūnam patte bhatta sadisaḥ ti iminā upāsakena satthu pariccatta bhāvam  tattha satthuno ca aparisaṅkatam dasseti sikkhāpada velā nāma natthi iti dhamma ssāmi bhāvato
translated: Bhikkhus’ bowl-food: he shows that the lay devotee had given to the Master and that the Master had no suspicion.

original: sikkhāpadamariyādā nāma natthi paṇṇattivajje, pakativajje pana setughāto eva.🔽291. Chadanaṭṭhāne yadākāsaṃ, tadeva tassa gehassa chadananti ākāsacchadanaṃ. Pakatiyā
analyzed: sikkhāpada mariyādā nāma natthi paṇṇatti vajje pakati vajje pana setu ghātaḥ eva  chadana ṭṭhāne yat ākāsam tat eva tassa gehassa chadanam ti ākāsa chadanam pakatiyā
translated: There is no time for training rules: because he is the Lord of the Dhamma, there is no time for training rules, that is, for prohibitions in the Monastic Code; but there is a breach of continuity in the case of prohibitions in ordinary usage.🔽The space in the place of concealment is the same as the roof of the house, thus it is a roof of space.🔽The normal ventilation: the ventilation in the covered place was the same as that in the open place,

original: utupharaṇamevāti chādite yādisaṃ utu, chadane uttiṇabhāvepi tamhi gehe tādisameva
analyzed: chādite chādite chadane tādisam eva
translated: even though the thatch was removed.

original: utupharaṇaṃ ahosi. Tesaṃyevāti tesaṃ ghaṭikārassa mātāpitūnaṃ eva.
analyzed: utu pharaṇam ahosi tesam yeva ati tesam ghaṭikārassa mātā pitūnam eva
translated: To them: to the potter’s parents.

original: 292. “Catasso muṭṭhiyo eko kuḍuvo, cattāro kuḍuvā eko pattho, cattāro patthā eko
analyzed: catasso muṭṭhiyaḥ ekaḥ kuḍuvaḥ cattāro kuḍuvāḥ ekaḥ pattho cattāro patthāḥ ekaḥ
translated: “Four handfuls make one kuḍuva. Four kuḍuvas make one pattha. Four patthas make one

original: āḷhako, cattāro āḷhakā ekaṃ doṇaṃ, cattāri doṇāni ekā mānikā, catasso mānikā ekā🔽khārī, vīsati khārikā eko vāhoti tadeva ekasakaṭa”nti suttanipātaṭṭhakathādīsu vuttaṃ,
analyzed: āḷhakaḥ cattāro āḷhakāḥ ekam doṇam cattāri doṇāni ekā mānikā catasso mānikāḥ ekā  khārī vīsati khārikāḥ ekaḥ vāho ti tat eva eka sakaṭanti sutta nipāta ṭṭhakathā ādīsu vuttam
translated: āḷhaka. Four āḷhakas make one doṇa. Four doṇas make one mānika. Four mānikas make one🔽khāri. Twenty khāris make one vāha. That is the same as one cart-load.” So it is said in the Suttanipāta Commentary, etc.

original: idha pana “dve sakaṭāni eko vāho”ti vuttaṃ. Telaphāṇitādinti ādi-saddena sappiādiṃ
analyzed: idha pana dve sakaṭāni ekaḥ vāho ti vuttam tela phāṇita ādin ti ādi saddena sappi ādiṃ
translated: But here it is said that two cart-loads make one vāha. “Oil, molasses, etc.” The word “etc.”

original: maricādikaṭukabhaṇḍañca saṅgaṇhāti. Nāhaṃ raññā diṭṭhapubbo, kuto paripphassoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: marica ādi kaṭuka bhaṇḍañca saṅgaṇhāti na aham raññā diṭṭha pubbaḥ kutas paripphassaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: includes ghee, etc., and pungent spices such as black pepper. The meaning is: “I have never been seen by the king, let alone known.”

original: Naccitvāti naccaṃ datvā.
analyzed: naccitvā ati naccam da tvā
translated: “Having danced”: having given a dance performance.

original: Ghaṭikārasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the Ghaṭīkāra Sutta is finished.

original: 2. Raṭṭhapālasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: raṭṭhapāla sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Ratthapala Sutta

original: 293. Thūlameva thullaṃ, thullā vipulā mahantā koṭṭhā jātā imassāti thullakoṭṭhikanti
analyzed: thūlam eva thullam thullāḥ vipulāḥ mahantā koṭṭhāḥ jātāḥ imassa ati thulla koṭṭhikam ti
translated: Thulla means large. Thullakoṭṭhika means a village that has become large, extensive, and great,

original: odanapūpapahūtavasena laddhanāmo nigamo. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana thullakoṭṭhanti attho
analyzed: odana pūpa pahūta vasena laddha nāmaḥ nigamaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam pana thulla koṭṭhanti attho
translated: having obtained its name from the abundance of rice cakes. But in the Commentary the meaning of thullakoṭṭhika is explained as follows:

original: vutto. Tena pāḷiyaṃ ika-saddena padavaḍḍhanaṃ katanti dasseti.🔽294. Raṭṭhapāloti idaṃ tassa kulaputtassa nāmaṃ. Paveṇivasena āgatakulavaṃsānugatanti
analyzed: vuttaḥ tena pāḷiyam i ka saddena pada vaḍḍhanam kata nti dasseti  raṭṭhapālo ti idam tassa kula puttassa nāmam paveṇi vasena āgata kula vaṃsa anugatan ti
translated: “Thus” shows that the word “also” in the text is to be expanded in each case.🔽“Rāṭhapāla” is the name of the clansman. “In accordance with the family tradition handed down from his ancestors” means

original: samudāgamato paṭṭhāya dassetuṃ “kasmā raṭṭhapālo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Sandhāretunti vināsanato
analyzed: samudāgamataḥ paṭṭhāya dassetum kasmā raṭṭha pālo tiādi vuttam sandhāretum ti vināsanato
translated: in accordance with the family tradition handed down from his ancestors who came from the same village. “Why was he called Rāṭhapāla?” is said to show how he was so called from the time of his conception.🔽“To support” means to maintain in the same condition as before, without letting him be destroyed.

original: pubbe yādisaṃ, tatheva sammadeva dhāretuṃ samattho. Saddhāti kammaphalasaddhāya sampannā.
analyzed: pubbe yādisam tathā iva sammat eva dhāretum samatthaḥ saddhā ati kamma phala saddhāya sampannā
translated: “Faith” means endowed with faith in the results of kamma.

original: Sāmaṇeraṃ disvāti sikkhākāmatāya etadagge ṭhapiyamānaṃ disvā.
analyzed: sāmaṇeram disvā ati sikkhā kāma tāya etad agge ṭhapiyamānam disvā
translated: “Having seen the novice” means having seen him placed at the head of those who desire the training.

original: Saha raññāti sarājikaṃ, raññā saddhiṃ rājaparisaṃ. Cātuvaṇṇanti brāhmaṇādicatuvaṇṇasamudāyaṃ.
analyzed: saha raññāti sa rājikam raññā saddhim rāja parisam brāhmaṇa ādi catuvaṇṇa samudāyam
translated: “Together with the king” means together with the king’s retinue, with the king. “The four castes” means the four castes consisting of brahmins, etc.

original: Posetunti vaddhetuṃ dānādīhi saṅgahavatthūhi saṅgaṇhituṃ. Yaṃ kulaṃ. Pahossatīti sakkhissati.
analyzed: posetum ti vaddhetum dāna ādīhi saṅgaha vatthūhi saṅgaṇhitum yam kulam pahossati iti sakkhissati
translated: “To support” means to nourish, to gather in by the means of gathering in such as giving. “Which family” means which family. “Will be able” means will be able to.

original: Tena tena me upaparikkhatoti “kāmā nāmete aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā, aṭṭhikaṅkalūpamā”ti
analyzed: tena tena me upaparikkhato ti kāmāḥ nāma ete aniccāḥ dukkhāḥ vipariṇāma dhammāḥ aṭṭhi kaṅkalu upamā ati
translated: “By investigating in this way and that” means “Sensual desires are impermanent, suffering, and subject to change. They are like a skeleton.”

original: ca ādinā yena yena ākārena kāmesu ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṃkilesaṃ, tabbipariyāyato nekkhamme
analyzed: ca ādinā yena yena ākārena kāmesu ādīnavam okāram saṃkilesam tad vipariyāyataḥ nekkhamme
translated: and so on, in whatever way the Blessed One has shown the danger, the destruction, the defilement, in sense pleasures, in the opposite way he has shown the benefit, the blessing, the virtue, in renunciation.

original: ānisaṃsaṃ guṇaṃ pakāsentaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, tena tena pakārena
analyzed: ānisaṃsam guṇam pakāsentam bhagavatā dhammam desitam ājānāmi tena tena pakārena
translated: I understand the Dhamma taught by the Blessed One in this way:🔽When I examine and reflect on this matter, it occurs to me thus:

original: upaparikkhato vīmaṃsantassa mayhaṃ evaṃ hoti evaṃ upaṭṭhāti. Sikkhattayabrahmacariyanti
analyzed: upaparikkhataḥ vīmaṃsantassa mayham evam hoti evam upaṭṭhāti sikkhattaya brahmacariyam ti
translated: The holy life is the supreme development,🔽the supreme development is the holy life.

original: adhisīlādisikkhattayasaṅgahaṃ seṭṭhacariyaṃ. Akhaṇḍādibhāvāpādanena akhaṇḍaṃ lakkhaṇavacanañhetaṃ.🔽Kañcipi sikkhekadesaṃ asesetvā ekanteneva paripūretabbatāya ekantaparipuṇṇaṃ. Cittuppādamattampi
analyzed: adhi sīla ādi sikkhattaya saṅgaham sa iṭṭha cariyam akhaṇḍa ādi bhāva āpādanena akhaṇḍam lakkhaṇa vacanam ha etam  kañcipi sikkha ekadesam a sesetvā ekantena iva paripūretabba tāya ekanta paripuṇṇam cittuppāda mattam pi
translated: It is unbroken, since it is not broken by any of the various kinds of breach. This is a description of its characteristic.🔽It is fulfilled in every way, since it can be fulfilled only by fulfilling every aspect of the training without exception.

original: saṃkilesamalaṃ anuppādetvā accantameva visuddhaṃ katvā pariharitabbatāya ekantaparisuddhaṃ.
analyzed: saṃkilesa malam an uppādetvā accantam eva visuddham katvā pariharitabba tāya ekanta parisuddham
translated: It is utterly purified, since it can be maintained only by maintaining it as utterly purified, without allowing it to be defiled even by the slightest stain.

original: Tato eva saṅkhaṃ viya likhitanti saṅkhalikhitaṃ. Tenāha “likhitasaṅkhasadisa”nti.
analyzed: tatas eva saṅkham saṅkha likhitam tena āha
translated: It is engraved like a design on a gem, thus it is engraved like a design on a gem. Hence it was said: “Like a design engraved on a gem” .

original: Dāṭhikāpi massuggahaṇeneva gahetvā “massu”tveva vuttaṃ, uttarādharamassunti attho.
analyzed: dāṭhikā api massu ggahaṇena iva gahetvā massu tvā iva vuttam uttara adhara massunti attho
translated: The word “yellow” is said by way of the dyeing with turmeric.

original: Kasāyena rattāni kāsāyāni. Ananuññātaṃ puttaṃ na pabbājeti “mātāpitūnaṃ lokiyamahājanassa
analyzed: kasāyena rattāni kāsāyāni an anuññātam puttam na pabbājeti mātā pitūnam lokiya mahājanassa
translated: He does not allow the ordination of a son without the permission of his parents, thinking: “Let there be no disturbance of mind in the world of the parents.”

original: cittaññathattaṃ mā hotū”ti. Tathā hi suddhodanamahārājassa tathā varo dinno.
analyzed: cittaññathattam mā hotu iti tathā hi suddhodana mahā rājassa tathā varaḥ dinno
translated: For thus a boon was granted to the Great King Suddhodana.

original: 295. Piyāyitabbato piyoti āha “pītijanako”ti. Manassa appāyanato manāpoti āha “manavaḍḍhanako”ti.🔽Sukhedhito taruṇadārakakāle. Tato parañca sappikhīrādisādurasamanuññabhojanādiāhārasampattiyā🔽sukhaparibhato. Atha vā daḷhabhattikadhātijanādiparijanasampattiyā ceva paricchadasampattiyā
analyzed: piyāyitabbataḥ piyaḥ ti āha pīti janakaḥ iti manassa appāyanataḥ manāpaḥ iti āha mana vaḍḍhanakaḥ ti  sukhedhitaḥ taruṇa dāraka kāle tatas parañca sappi khīra ādi sādurasa manuñña bhojana ādi āhāra sampattiyā  atha vā daḷha bhattika dhāti jana ādi parijana sampattiyā ca iva paricchada sampattiyā
translated: He is called “the one who generates joy” because he is to be delighted in. He is called “the one who increases the mind” because he is to be pleased with.🔽He is to be delighted in because he is the cause of happiness in the time of youth. After that, he is to be delighted in because of the abundance of food, such as milk, ghee, etc., which is permitted.🔽Or else, he is to be delighted in because of the abundance of nurses, such as the wet-nurse Mahāpajāpatī, etc., and because of the abundance of clothing, etc., and because of the abundance of the requisites of the most excellent and sublime happiness.

original: ca uḷārapaṇītasukhapaccayūpahārehi ca sukhedhito, akiccheneva dukkhappaccayavinodanena
analyzed: ca uḷāra paṇīta sukha paccaya upahārehi ca sukha edhitaḥ a kicchena iva dukkha ppaccaya vinodanena
translated: He is to be delighted in because of the removal of the conditions of suffering without difficulty.

original: sukhaparibhato. Ajjhattikaṅgasampattiyā vā sukhedhito, bāhiraṅgasampattiyā sukhaparibhato.
analyzed: sukha paribhataḥ ajjhattika aṅga sampattiyā vā sukha edhitaḥ bāhiraṅga sampattiyā sukha paribhataḥ
translated: or he is well provided with happiness. Or he is well provided with happiness because of the excellence of the internal factors, and he is well provided with the requisites of happiness because of the excellence of the external factors.

original: Kassacīti upayogatthe sāmivacanaṃ, kiñcīti vuttaṃ hoti, ayameva vā pāṭho. Tathā hi
analyzed: kassaci iti upayoga atthe sāmi vacanam kiñci iti vuttam hoti ayam eva vā pāṭhaḥ tathā hi
translated: Kassaci means “of someone,” in the sense of “enjoyer.” Kiñci is said; or this is the reading. For thus

original: “appamattakampi kalabhāgaṃ dukkhassa na jānāsī”ti attho vutto. Evaṃ santeti nanu
analyzed: appamattakam pi kalabhāgam dukkhassa na jānāsi iti atthaḥ vuttaḥ evam santa iti nanu
translated: the meaning is stated: “You do not know even a fraction of suffering.” If that is so, then

original: mayaṃ raṭṭhapāla maraṇādīsu kenaci upāyena appatīkārena maraṇenapi tayā akāmakāpi
analyzed: mayam raṭṭhapāla maraṇa ādīsu kenaci upāyena appatīkārena maraṇena api tayā akāmakā api
translated: we, Ratthapala, by some means or other, even by death that is not desired by you,

original: vinā bhavissāma, evaṃ sati. Yenāti yena kāraṇena. Kiṃ panāti ettha kinti kāraṇatthe
analyzed: vinā bhavissāma evam sati yena ati yena kāraṇena kim pana ati ettha kim ti kāraṇatthe
translated: we will be separated. If that is so, then. Yenatthi means “for what reason.” But what is it? Here kin means “reason.”

original: paccattavacananti dassento āha “kena pana kāraṇenā”ti.🔽296. Paricārehīti parito tattha tattha yathāsakaṃ visayesu cārehi. Tenāha “ito cito
analyzed: paccatta vacanam ti dassentaḥ āha kena pana kāraṇena ati  paricārehi iti paritas tattha tattha yathāsakam visayesu cārehi tena āha itas citas
translated: It shows the reflexive pronoun. He said: “But for what reason?”🔽Paricārehīti means “wander about here and there in your respective spheres.” Therefore he said: “Bring from here and there.”

original: ca upanehī”ti. Paricārehīti vā sukhūpakaraṇehi attānaṃ paricārehi, attano paricaraṇaṃ
analyzed: ca upanehi iti paricārehi iti vā sukhu upakaraṇehi attānam paricārehi attano paricaraṇam
translated: Or paricārehīti means “serve yourself with requisites of happiness.” Attano paricaraṇaṃ

original: kārehi. Tathābhūto ca yasmā laḷanto kīḷanto nāma hoti, tasmā “laḷā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kārehi tathābhūto ca yasmā laḷantaḥ kīḷantaḥ nāma hoti tasmā laḷātiādi vuttam
translated: and he is called “one who is sporting, enjoying himself, and amusing himself” because he is sporting, enjoying himself, and amusing himself in that way.

original: Niccadānaṃ dānaṃ nāma, uposathadivasādīsu dātabbaṃ atirekadānaṃ padānaṃ nāma. Paveṇīrakkhaṇavasena
analyzed: nicca dānam dānam nāma uposatha divasa ādīsu dātabbam atireka dānam padānam nāma paveṇī rakkhaṇa vasena
translated: “Continuous giving” is giving that is given on Uposatha days, etc.; “special giving” is giving that is given in addition to that.

original: vā dīyamānaṃ dānaṃ nāma, attanāva paṭṭhapetvā dīyamānaṃ padānaṃ nāma. Pacurajanasādhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: vā dīyamānam dānam nāma paṭṭhapetvā dīyamānam padānam nāma pacura jana sādhāraṇam
translated: Or “continuous giving” is giving that is given by way of protecting the continuity; “special giving” is giving that is given by way of initiating oneself.

original: vā nātiuḷāraṃ dānaṃ nāma, anaññasādhāraṇaṃ atiuḷāraṃ padānaṃ nāma. Uddassetabbāti
analyzed: vā na ati uḷāram dānam nāma anañña sādhāraṇam ati uḷāram padānam nāma uddassetabbā ati
translated: “Giving” is giving that is shared by ordinary people; “special giving” is giving that is not shared by others and is very great.

original: uddhaṃ dassetabbā. Kuto uddhaṃ te dassetabbā? Pabbajitato uddhaṃ attānaṃ mātāpitaro
analyzed: uddham dassetabbā kutas uddham te dassetabbā pabbajitataḥ uddham attānam mātā pitaro
translated: “Should be shown” means should be shown above. Why should they be shown above? He should show himself above the one gone forth, and his mother and father

original: dassetabbā, tenāha “yathā”tiādi.
analyzed: dassetabbā tena āha yathā itiādi
translated: above that. Therefore it is said, “As it is said” and so on.

original: 299. Balaṃ gahetvāti ettha balaggahaṇaṃ nāma kāyabalassa uppādanamevāti āha “kāyabalaṃ
analyzed: balam gahetvā iti ettha bala ggahaṇam nāma kāya balassa uppādanam eva ati āha kāya balaṃ
translated: “Having taken hold of strength”: here, “taking hold of strength” is the arousing of bodily strength. Therefore it is said, “having generated bodily strength.”

original: janetvā”ti. Evaṃ viharantoti yathā pāḷiyaṃ vuttaṃ evaṃ eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto viharanto.
analyzed: janetvā iti evam viharantaḥ iti yathā pāḷiyam vuttam evam ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ appamattaḥ viharantaḥ
translated: “One who is living thus”: one who is living alone, secluded, ardent, and resolute, as it is said in the text.

original: Tasmāti yasmā neyyo, na ugghaṭitaññū, na ca vipañcitaññū, tasmā. Cirena pabbajito🔽dvādasame vasse arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Yaṃ pana vuttaṃ pāḷiyaṃ “na cirassevā”ti, taṃ saṭṭhi
analyzed: tasmā iti yasmā neyyaḥ na ugghaṭita ññū na ca vipañcita ññū tasmā cirena pabbajitaḥ  dvādasame vasse arahattam pāpuṇi yam pana vuttam pāḷiyam na cirassa iva ati tam saṭṭhi
translated: Therefore: since he was not a person of quick understanding, nor one of reflective understanding, but one to be taught, he went forth late.

original: vassāni tato adhikampi vipassanāparivāsaṃ vasante upādāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vassāni tatas adhikam pi vipassanā parivāsam vasante upādāya vuttam
translated: He reached Arahantship in the twelfth year. But what is said in the text, “not long after,” is said with reference to the six years he spent in the life of a wanderer before he went forth.

original: Sattadvārakoṭṭhakassāti sattagabbhantaradvārakoṭṭhakasīsena gabbhantarāni vadati.🔽Paharāpetīti vayovuḍḍhānurūpaṃ kappāpanādinā alaṅkārāpeti. Antojātatāya ñātisadisī
analyzed: satta dvāra koṭṭhakassa ati satta gabbhantara dvāra koṭṭhaka sīsena gabbhantarāni vadati  paharāpeti iti vayaḥ vuḍḍha anurūpam kappāpana ādinā alaṅkārāpeti antar jāta tāya ñāti sadisī
translated: Seven doors and seven windows: he speaks of the seven doors and seven windows in the womb.🔽He had her adorned: he had her adorned with ornaments such as were suitable to her age.🔽A slave who is like a relative: a slave who is like a relative because she was born in the house.

original: dāsī ñātidāsī. Pūtibhāveneva lakkhitabbo doso vā abhidoso, sova ābhidosiko, abhidosaṃ
analyzed: dāsī ñāti dāsī pūti bhāvena iva lakkhitabbaḥ dosaḥ vā abhidosaḥ saḥ uva ābhidosikaḥ abhidosam
translated: A blemish that is a stain: a blemish that is a stain because it is marked by putridity. He is a stain-bematcher because he has a stain.

original: vā paccūsakālaṃ gato patto atikkantoti ābhidosiko. Tenāha “ekarattātikkantassā”tiādi.
analyzed: vā paccūsa kālam gataḥ pattaḥ atikkantaḥ iti ābhidosiko tena āha eka ratta atikkantassa atiādi
translated: Or he is a stain-bematcher because he has gone beyond, reached, exceeded the time for the morning meal.🔽He is not fit to be used: he is not fit to be used because he has become putrid.

original: Aparibhogāraho pūtibhūtabhāvena. Ariyavohārenāti ariyasamudācārena. Ariyā hi mātugāmaṃ
analyzed: pūti bhūta bhāvena ariya vohārena ati ariya samudācārena ariyāḥ hi mātugāmam
translated: By the noble speech: by the noble conduct. For the noble ones

original: bhaginivādena samudācaranti. Nissaṭṭhapariggahanti pariccattālayaṃ. Vattuṃ vaṭṭatīti
analyzed: bhagini vādena samudācaranti nissaṭṭha pariggahanti pariccatta ālayam vattum vaṭṭati iti
translated: They address her as “sister.” “Given up as a possession”: given up as a possession. “It is proper to speak to her”:

original: nirapekkhabhāvato vuttaṃ, idha pana visesato aparibhogārahattāva vatthuno. Nimīyati
analyzed: nirapekkha bhāvataḥ vuttam idha pana visesataḥ a paribhoga araha ttā ava vatthuno nimīyati
translated: this is said because she is free from dependence. But here, in particular, it is because the robe-material is not fit to be used. “It is a sign”: it is a sign because it is seen.

original: saññāyatīti nimittaṃ, tathāsallakkhito ākāroti āha “ākāraṃ aggahesī”ti.
analyzed: saññāyati iti nimittam ākāro ti āha ākāram aggahesi iti
translated: “He took note of the appearance”: he took note of the appearance in that way.

original: 300. Gharaṃ pavisitvāti gehasāminiyā nisīditabbaṭṭhānabhūtaṃ antogehaṃ pavisitvā.
analyzed: gharam pavisitvā ati geha sāminiyā nisīditabba ṭṭhāna bhūtam antogeham pavisitvā
translated: “Having entered the house”: having entered the inner part of the house, which is the place where the lady of the house sits.

original: Ālapaneti dāsijanassa ālapane. Bahi nikkhamantāti yathāvuttaantogehato bahi nikkhamantiyo.
analyzed: ālapane iti dāsi janassa ālapane bahi nikkhamantā ti yathāvutta antogehataḥ bahi nikkhamantiyo
translated: “When she spoke”: when she spoke to the servants. “When she was going out”: when she was going out from the inner part of the house as described.

original: Gharesu sālā hontīti gharesu ekamante bhojanasālā honti pākāraparikkhittā susaṃvihitadvārabandhā
analyzed: gharesu sālāḥ honti iti gharesu ekamante bhojana sālāḥ honti pākāra parikkhittā su saṃvihita dvārabandhā
translated: “In the houses there were halls”: in the houses there were halls in one place for eating, surrounded by walls, with well-fitted doors and bolts,

original: susammaṭṭhavālikaṅgaṇā.
analyzed: su sammaṭṭha vāli kaṅgaṇā
translated: with well-swept sand-covered floors.

original: Anokappanaṃ asaddahanaṃ. Amarisanaṃ asahanaṃ. Anāgatavacanaṃ anāgatasaddappayogo,
analyzed: anokappanam a saddahanam a marisanam a sahanam anāgata vacanam anāgata sadda ppayogaḥ
translated: “Not looking at”: not believing. “Not enduring”: not tolerating. “Not speaking”: not using words that are future.

original: attho pana vattamānakālikova. Tenāha “paccakkhampī”ti. Ariyiddhiyanti “paṭikūle apaṭikūlasaññī
analyzed: atthaḥ pana vattamāna kālikaḥ uva tena āha paccakkhampi iti paṭikūle a paṭikūla saññī
translated: but the meaning is as if it were the present time. Hence he said ‘even though they were refused ’.

original: viharatī”ti evaṃ vuttaariyiddhiyaṃ.
analyzed: viharati iti evam
translated: ‘ Noble effort ’: the noble effort stated thus ‘ he abides contemplating what is not pleasant as not pleasant ’ .

original: Pūtikummāso chaḍḍanīyadhammo tassa gehato laddhopi na dātabbayuttako dāsijanena dinnoti
analyzed: pūti kummāsaḥ chaḍḍanīya dhammo tassa gehataḥ laddhaḥ api na dātabba yuttakaḥ dāsi janena dinnaḥ ti
translated: ‘ A rotten pumpkin ’: even though it was obtained from his house, it was not suitable to be given because it was to be thrown away. It was given by the slave-people.🔽Hence he said ‘ we did not get a gift as a gift ’.

original: āha “deyyadhammavasena neva dānaṃ alatthamhā”ti. “Imehi muṇḍakehī”tiādinā nitthunanavacanena
analyzed: āha deyya dhamma vasena na iva dānam alatthamha ati imehi muṇḍakehi iti ādinā nitthunana vacanena
translated: ‘ With the words “ What is the use of these shaveling fellows … ” ’: by this contemptuous statement

original: paccakkhānaṃ atthato laddhameva, tassa pana ujukaphāsusamācāravasena aladdhattā vuttaṃ
analyzed: paccakkhānam atthataḥ laddham eva tassa pana ujuka phāsu samācāra vasena aladdha ttā vuttam
translated: the refusal was in fact obtained, but because it was not obtained by the straight-forward method of asking for alms, it was said

original: “na paccakkhāna”nti. Tenāha – “paṭisanthāravasena paccakkhānampi na alatthamhā”ti.🔽“Neva dāna”ntiādi paccāsīsāya akkhantiyā ca vuttaṃ viya pacurajano maññeyyāti tannivattanatthaṃ
analyzed: na paccakkhānam ti tena āha paṭisanthāra vasena paccakkhānam pi na alatthamha iti  na iva dāna nti ādi paccāsīsāya akkhantiyā ca vuttam viya pacurajanaḥ maññeyya ati tad nivattana attham
translated: ‘ we did not get a refusal ’. Hence he said ‘ we did not get a refusal even as a refusal ’.🔽‘ We did not get a gift as a gift ’, etc., was said in order to prevent the ordinary man from thinking that the refusal was obtained by the method of asking for alms and by the method of counter-invitation.

original: adhippāyamassa vivarituṃ “kasmā panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Suttikāpaṭicchannanti sippikāchadāhi channaṃ.
analyzed: adhippāyam assa vivaritum kasmā pana atiādi vuttam suttikā paṭicchannam ti sippikā chadāhi channam
translated: ‘ But why did they not get a gift as a gift? ’ was said in order to reveal the intention.

original: Ukkaṭṭhaekāsanikatāyāti idaṃ bhūtakathanamattaṃ therassa tathābhāvadīpanato. Mudukassapi
analyzed: ukkaṭṭha eka āsanika tāya ti idam bhūta kathana mattam therassa tathā bhāva dīpanataḥ mudukaḥ api
translated: The phrase “he was strict in the observance of the one-session rule” is merely a statement of fact, intended to show that the Elder was of that nature.

original: hi ekāsanikassa yāya nisajjāya kiñcimattaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuttaṃ, vattasīsenapi tato vuṭṭhitassa🔽puna bhuñjituṃ na vaṭṭati. Tenāha tipiṭakacūḷābhayatthero “āsanaṃ vā rakkheyya bhojanaṃ
analyzed: hi eka āsanikassa yāya nisajjāya kiñcimattam bhojanam bhuttam vatta sīsena api tatas vuṭṭhitassa  puna bhuñjitum na vaṭṭati tena āha tipiṭakacūḷābhaya theraḥ āsanam vā rakkheyya bhojanaṃ
translated: For even a mild one-session eater, after rising from the seat on which he has eaten a little food, even with the intention of taking more, is not allowed to eat again.🔽Therefore the Elder Tipiṭaka Cūḷa Abhaya said: “He should either keep to the seat or keep to the food.”

original: vā”ti. Ukkaṭṭhasapadānacārikoti purato pacchato ca āhaṭabhikkhampi aggahetvā bahidvāre
analyzed: vāti ukkaṭṭha sa padāna cārikā ti puratas pacchatas ca āhaṭa bhikkham pi aggahetvā bahidvāre
translated: The phrase “he was strict in the observance of the alms-food rule” shows that he did not accept food brought forward or brought back, but stood at the door and received it into his bowl.

original: ṭhatvā pattavissajjanameva karoti. Eteneva therassa ukkaṭṭhapiṇḍapātikabhāvo dīpito.
analyzed: ṭhatvā patta vissajjanam eva karoti etena iva therassa ukkaṭṭha piṇḍapātika bhāvaḥ dīpitaḥ
translated: This shows that the Elder was strict in the observance of the alms-food rule.🔽Therefore it is said: “He did not accept alms for the morrow.”

original: Tenāha – “svātanāya bhikkhaṃ nāma nādhivāsetī”ti. Atha kasmā adhivāsesīti āha “mātu🔽anuggahenā”tiādi. Paṇḍitā hi mātāpitūnaṃ ācariyupajjhāyānaṃ vā kātabbaṃ anuggahaṃ
analyzed: tena āha svātanāya bhikkham nāma na adhivāseti iti atha kasmai adhivāsesi iti āha mātu  anuggahena atiādi paṇḍitāḥ hi mātā pitūnam ācariya upajjhāyānam vā kātabbam anuggaham
translated: But why did he accept it on this occasion?🔽The answer is: “Out of consideration for his mother.”

original: ajjhupekkhitvā dhutaṅgasuddhikā na bhavanti.
analyzed: ajjhupekkhitvā dhutaṅga suddhikāḥ na bhavanti
translated: For the wise do not become pure in the ascetic practices by neglecting to do a service for their mother or father or for their teachers and preceptors.

original: 301. Payuttanti vaddhivasena payojitaṃ, taddhitalopaṃ katvā vuttanti veditabbaṃ yathā
analyzed: payuttam ti vaddhi vasena payojitam taddhita lopam katvā vuttam iti veditabbam yathā
translated: “Applied” : what is meant is that it is used in the sense of “increase” . It should be understood that the words are used with elision of the middle term.

original: aññatthāpi “pitāmahaṃ dhanaṃ laddhā, sukhaṃ jīvati sañcayo”ti. Jeṭṭhakitthiyoti padhānitthiyo.🔽Itoti imasmiṃ kule anubhavitabbavibhavasampattito. Aññatoti imassa dinnattā aññasmiṃ
analyzed: aññattha api pitāmaham dhanam laddhā sukham jīvati sañcayā uti jeṭṭhakitthiyā uti padhānitthiyo  itas ti imasmim kule anubhavitabba vibhava sampattitaḥ aññatas ti imassa dinna ttā aññasmim
translated: “Used” : “used” should be understood as “used” by way of increase, as it is said in the Dhammapada: “The father, having obtained wealth, lives happily, and Sañjaya” .🔽“Chief woman” : the chief woman.

original: kule anubhavitabbasampattito.
analyzed: kule anubhavitabba sampattitaḥ
translated: “From here” : from the prosperity and success that should be experienced in this family. “From elsewhere” : from the prosperity and success that should be experienced in another family because of the giving of this .

original: 302. Cittavicittanti kappanāya ceva araharūpena alaṅkārādinā ca cittitañceva vicittitañca.
analyzed: kappanāya ca iva araha rūpena alaṅkāra ādinā ca cittitam ca iva vicittitam ca
translated: “Variously decorated” : decorated and variously decorated with ornaments, etc., and with the form of one who is worthy of worship.

original: Vaṇakāyanti vaṇabhūtaṃ kāyaṃ. Samantato ussitanti heṭṭhimakāyavasena heṭṭhā upari
analyzed: vaṇakāyanti vaṇa bhūtam kāyam samantataḥ ussitanti heṭṭhima kāya vasena heṭṭhā upari
translated: “The body of sores” : the body that is a sore. “All around it is oozing” : it is dependent on the lower part of the body below and on the upper part of the body above.

original: ca sannissitaṃ. Niccāturanti abhiṇhappaṭipīḷitaṃ, sadā dukkhitaṃ vā. Bahusaṅkappanti
analyzed: ca sannissitam nicca āturanti abhiṇha paṭipīḍitam sadā dukkhitam vā bahu saṅkappanti
translated: “Always festering” : always afflicted, or always suffering. “Full of many thoughts” :

original: rāgavatthubhāvena abhijanehi hāvabhāvavilāsavasena, āmisavasena ca soṇasiṅgālādīhi
analyzed: rāga vatthu bhāvena abhijanehi hāva bhāva vilāsa vasena āmisa vasena ca soṇa siṅgāla ādīhi
translated: because of the objects of lust, because of the play of the various kinds of existence, and because of material things, it is like a jackal, a fox, etc.

original: bahūhi saṅkappetabbaṃ. Ṭhitīti avaṭṭhānaṃ avipariṇāmo natthi. Tenāha – “bhijjanadhammatāva
analyzed: bahūhi saṅkappetabbam ṭhiti iti avaṭṭhānam avipariṇāmaḥ na atthi tena āha bhijjana dhamma tā va
translated: and it is to be thought of in many ways. ‘ Steadiness ’ is non-turning-away, non-changing. Hence it is said ‘ It is the state of being what has to be penetrated ’ .🔽🔽

original: niyatā”ti, parissavabhāvāpatti ceva vināsapatti ca ekantikāti attho.
analyzed: niyatā ati parissava bhāva āpatti ca iva vināsa patti ca ekantikā ati attho
translated: and it is to be conjectured in many ways. ‘Stability’: there is no stability, no non-change. Hence he said ‘the state of being broken up is certain’ . The meaning is that the state of being worn away and the state of being destroyed are absolute.

original: Cittakatampīti gandhādīhi cittakatampi. Rūpanti sarīraṃ.🔽Alattakakatāti piṇḍialattakena suvaṇṇakatā. Tenāha “alattakena rañjitā”ti. Cuṇṇakamakkhitanti
analyzed: citta katampi iti gandha ādīhi sarīram  alattakakatā ati piṇḍi alattakena suvaṇṇa katā tena āha alattakena rañjitā iti cuṇṇaka makkhitanti
translated: ‘Even what is made by mind’: even what is made by mind with perfumes, etc. ‘Form’: the body.🔽‘Painted with lac’: painted with lac in the form of a round dot. Hence he said ‘dyed with lac’. ‘Anointed with powder’: the face made up with cosmetics such as gorocana, etc.,

original: dosanīharaṇehi tāpadahanādīhi katābhisaṅkhāramukhaṃ gorocanādīhi obhāsanakacuṇṇehi🔽makkhitaṃ, tenāha “sāsapakakkenā”tiādi.
analyzed: dosa nīharaṇehi tāpa dahana ādīhi kata abhisaṅkhāra mukham gorocanā ādīhi obhāsanaka cuṇṇehi  makkhitam tena āha sāsapa kakkena atiādi
translated: after the removal of blemishes by means of heat, rubbing, etc., is anointed with powder. Hence he said ‘with a powder-puff’ , etc.

original: Rasodakenāti saralaniyyāsarasamissena udakena. Āvattanaparivatte katvāti āvattanaparivattanavasena
analyzed: rasa udakena ati sarala niyyāsa rasa missena udakena āvattana parivatte katvā ati āvattana parivattana vasena
translated: ‘With water flavoured with juice’: with water mixed with the juice of sugar-cane, etc. ‘Having turned it round and round’: having turned it round and round by means of turning it round and round.

original: nate katvā. Aṭṭhapadakaracanāyāti bhittikūṭaddhacandādivibhāgāya aṭṭhapadakaracanāya.
analyzed: nate katvā aṭṭhapadaka racanāya ati bhitti kūṭa ddha canda ādi vibhāgāya aṭṭhapadaka racanāya
translated: ‘For the making of an eight-sector design’: for the making of an eight-sector design by means of the division into wall, peak, half-moon, etc.

original: Viravamāneti “ayaṃ palāyati, gaṇha gaṇhā”ti viravamāne. Hiraññasuvaṇṇaorodheti vattabbaṃ.
analyzed: viravamāne iti ayam palāyati gaṇha gaṇhāti viravamāne hirañña suvaṇṇa orodha iti vattabbam
translated: Viravamanīti “he’s running away, catch him, catch him” saying this. Hiraññasuvaṇṇaorodheti vattabbaṃ.

original: 303. Ussitāya ussitāyāti kulavibhavabāhusaccapaññāsampattiyā uggatāya uggatāya. Abhilakkhito uḷārabhāvena.
analyzed: ussitāya ussitāya ati kula vibhava bāhu sacca paññā sampattiyā uggatāya uggatāya abhilakkhitaḥ uḷāra bhāvena
translated: Ussitāya ussitāyāti kulavibhavabāhusaccapaññāsampattiyā uggatāya uggatāya. Abhilakkhito uḷārabhāvena.

original: 304. Parijuññānīti parihānāni. Ye byādhinā abhibhūtā sattā jiṇṇakappā vayohānisattā
analyzed: parijuññāni iti parihānāni ye byādhinā sattā jiṇṇa kappāḥ vayaḥ hāni sattā
translated: Parijuññānīti parihānāni. Ye byādhinā abhibhūtā sattā jiṇṇakappā vayohānisattā

original: viya honti, tato nivattento “jarājiṇṇo”ti āha. Vayovuḍḍho, na sīlādivuḍḍho. Mahattaṃ
analyzed: viya honti tatas nivattentaḥ jarā jiṇṇo ti āha vayaḥ vuḍḍhaḥ na sīla ādi vuḍḍhaḥ mahattam
translated: viya honti, tato nivattento “jarājiṇṇo”ti āha. Vayovuḍḍho, na sīlādivuḍḍho. Mahattaṃ

original: lāti gaṇhātīti mahallako, jātiyā mahallako, na vibhavādināti jātimahallako. Dvattirājaparivattasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: lāti gaṇhāti iti mahallakaḥ jātiyā mahallakaḥ na vibhava ādinā ati jāti mahallakaḥ dvatti rāja parivatta saṅkhātam
translated: lāti gaṇhātīti mahallako, jātiyā mahallako, na vibhavādināti jātimahallako. Dvattirājaparivattasaṅkhātaṃ

original: addhānaṃ kālaṃ gato vītivattoti addhagato. Tathā ca paṭhamavayaṃ majjhimavayañca
analyzed: kālam gataḥ vītivatto ti addhagato tathā ca paṭhama vayam majjhima vayam ca
translated: addhānaṃ kālaṃ gato vītivattoti addhagato. Tathā ca paṭhamavayaṃ majjhimavayañca🔽atīto hotīti āha “addhānaṃ atikkanto”ti. Jiṇṇādipadehi paṭhamavayamajjhimavayassa

original: atīto hotīti āha “addhānaṃ atikkanto”ti. Jiṇṇādipadehi paṭhamavayamajjhimavayassa
analyzed: atītaḥ hoti iti āha addhānam atikkantaḥ iti jiṇṇa ādi padehi paṭhama vayam ajjhima vayassa
translated: Translation: ‘Crying out’ means crying out ‘He’s running away, catch him, catch him!’ ‘Gold and silver and precious stones’ should be mentioned.🔽‘Eminent’ means high, high through the excellence of birth, wealth, etc. ‘Distinguished’ means distinguished by the excellence of great qualities.🔽‘Decrepitude’ is the state of being decrepit. ‘Age’ is the state of being aged. ‘Old age’ is the state of being old. ‘Brokenness’ is the state of being broken. ‘Wrinkles’ is the state of being wrinkled. ‘Grey hairs’ is the state of being grey-haired. ‘Baldness’ is the state of being bald. ‘Sagging skin’ is the state of having sagging skin. ‘Fading eyesight’ is the state of having fading eyesight. ‘Failing hearing’ is the state of having failing hearing. ‘Swollen limbs’ is the state of having swollen limbs. ‘Corpulence’ is the state of being corpulent. ‘Weakness’ is the state of being weak. ‘Trembling’ is the state of trembling. ‘Shaking’ is the state of shaking.

original: bodhitattā anuppattatāvisiṭṭho vaya-saddo osānavayavisayoti āha “pacchimavayaṃ anuppatto”ti.
analyzed: bodhita ttā anuppatta tā visiṭṭhaḥ vaya saddo osāna vaya visayo ti āha pacchima vayam anuppatto ti
translated: The word ‘end’ is distinguished by the state of being attained, and so he said ‘he has attained the end’.

original: “Appiccho, appaḍaṃsamakasavātātapasarīsapasamphasso”ti evamādīsu viya appa-saddo
analyzed: appicchaḥ evamādīsu viya appasaddaḥ
translated: As in the case of ‘little desire, little difficulty, little affliction, little wind, cold and rain to contend with’, the word ‘little’

original: abhāvatthoti adhippāyenāha “appābādhoti arogo, appātaṅkoti niddukkho”ti. Appattho
analyzed: abhāva attho ti adhippāyena āha appa ābādhaḥ ti arogaḥ appa ātaṅko ti niddukkhaḥ ti appattho
translated: is intended to mean ‘non-existence’, and so he said ‘little illness’ means ‘healthy’, ‘little affliction’ means ‘free from suffering’. Or the word ‘little’

original: vā idha, tatthāpi appa-saddo daṭṭhabbo. Evañhi “yo hi, gahapati, imaṃ pūtikāyaṃ pariharanto🔽muhuttampi ārogyaṃ paṭijāneyya kimaññatra bālyā”ti suttapadaṃ samatthitaṃ hoti. Vipaccanaṃ
analyzed: vā idha tattha api appasaddaḥ daṭṭhabbo evam hi yaḥ hi gahapati imam pūti kāyam pariharantaḥ  muhuttam pi ārogyam paṭijāneyya kim aññatra bālyā ati sutta padam samatthitam hoti vipaccanam
translated: should be seen here as ‘little food’, for thus the words of the sutta are justified: ‘Householder, he who, while carrying around this putrid body,

original: vipāko, so eva vepāko. Samo vepāko etissā atthīti samavepākinī, tāya. Teneva samavepākinibhāvena
analyzed: vipāko saḥ eva vepākaḥ samaḥ vepākaḥ etissā atthi iti samavepākinī tāya tena iva samavepākini bhāvena
translated: would claim health even for a moment, what is that other than foolishness?’ Ripening is ripening itself. It has the same ripening, thus it is of the same ripening. By that, by the state of having the same ripening,

original: sabbampi sammadeva gaṇhāti dhāretīti gahaṇī. Gahaṇisampattiyā hi yathābhuttaāhāro
analyzed: sabbam pi sammad eva gaṇhāti dhāreti iti gahaṇī gahaṇi sampattiyā hi yathā bhutta āhāraḥ
translated: it is all taken correctly, thus it is ‘to be taken’. For when there is success in taking, food eaten

original: sammadeva jīranto sarīre tiṭṭhati, no aññathā bhuttabhutto āhāro jīrati gahaṇiyā
analyzed: sammat eva jīranto sarīre tiṭṭhati no aññathā bhutta bhuttaḥ āhāro jīrati gahaṇiyā
translated: remains in the body correctly digested, not otherwise. Food eaten is digested by the state of being ‘to be taken’,

original: tikkhabhāvena. Tatheva tiṭṭhatīti bhuttākāreneva tiṭṭhati gahaṇiyā mandabhāvato.
analyzed: tikkha bhāvena tathā iva tiṭṭhati iti bhutta ākārena iva tiṭṭhati gahaṇiyāḥ manda bhāvato
translated: by its keenness. It remains as it was eaten: it remains in the form in which it was eaten, because the gullet is not discriminating.

original: Bhattacchando uppajjateva bhuttaāhārassa sammā pariṇāmaṃ gatattā. Tenevāti samavepākinibhāveneva.
analyzed: bhatta chandaḥ uppajjateva bhutta āhārassa sammā pariṇāmam gata ttā tena iva ati samavepākini bhāvena iva
translated: The desire to eat arises because the food eaten has been properly digested.🔽The enjoyments of the requisites are not all exhausted at once, all at once, but

original: Pattānaṃ bhogānaṃ parikkhiyamānaṃ na sahasā ekajjhaṃyeva parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, atha🔽kho anukkamena, tathā ñātayopīti āha “anupubbenā”ti. Chātakabhayādināti ādi-saddena
analyzed: pattānam bhogānam parikkhiyamānam na sahasā ekajjhaṃyā iva parikkhayam gacchanti atha  kho anukkamena tathā ñātayaḥ api iti āha anupubbena āti chātaka bhaya ādinā ādi saddena
translated: rather they are exhausted gradually, in the same way.🔽The fear of snakes, etc., is included by the word “etc.”🔽The word “etc.” includes the fear of sickness, etc.

original: byādhibhayādiṃ saṅgaṇhāti.🔽305. Uddesasīsena niddeso gahitoti āha “dhammaniddesā uddiṭṭhā”ti. Yasmā vā ye dhammā🔽uddisitabbaṭṭhena “uddesā”ti vuccanti. Teva dhammā niddisitabbaṭṭhena niddesāti “dhammaniddesā
analyzed: byādhi bhaya ādim saṅgaṇhāti  uddesa sīsena niddesaḥ gahito ti āha dhamma niddesā uddiṭṭhā ti yasmai vā ye dhammā  uddisitabba ṭṭhena uddesā ati vuccanti te va dhammā niddisitabba ṭṭhena niddesā ati dhamma niddesā
translated: The explanation is taken as the heading for the recitation.🔽The explanation of the Dhamma has been recited.🔽Or alternatively, the words “The explanation of the Dhamma has been recited” can be taken to mean that the things called “recitations” because they are to be recited, are also called “explanations” because they are to be explained.

original: uddiṭṭhā”ti attho vutto. Atha vā ye dhammā aniccatādivibhāvanavasena uddhaṃ uddhaṃ
analyzed: uddiṭṭhā ti attho vuttaḥ atha vā ye dhammā anicca tā ādi vibhāvana vasena uddham uddham
translated: Or alternatively, the words “The explanation of the Dhamma has been recited” can be taken to mean that the things called “recitations” because they are to be recited, are also called “explanations” because they are to be explained.

original: desessanti, te dhammā tatheva nissesato desessantīti evaṃ uddesaniddesapadānaṃ anatthantaratā
analyzed: desessanti te dhammā tathā iva nissesataḥ desessanti iti evam uddesa niddesa padānam anatthantara tā
translated: and they will teach them in the same way as they were taught, so that the words of the teaching and the words of the explanation are not different in meaning.

original: veditabbā. Tatthāti jarāmaraṇasantike. Addhuvoti niddhuvo na thiro, aniccoti attho.
analyzed: veditabbā tattha ati jarā maraṇa santike addhuvaḥ niddhuvaḥ na thiraḥ aniccaḥ ti attho
translated: Herein, “soon” means not slow, not lasting, not permanent.

original: Tenāha “dhuvaṭṭhānavirahito”ti, ajātābhūtāsaṅkhatadhuvabhāvakāraṇavivittoti attho.
analyzed: tena āha dhuva ṭṭhāna virahitaḥ ti ajāta abhūta asaṅkhata dhuva bhāva kāraṇa vivittaḥ iti attho
translated: Hence it is said, “devoid of lastingness,” the meaning is, devoid of the cause of being unborn, unoriginated, unformed, and permanent.

original: Upanīyyatīti vā jarāmaraṇena loko sammā nīyati, tasmā addhuvoti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo.🔽Tāyitunti jātiādibyasanato rakkhituṃ samatthena issarena attanā virahitoti. “Imaṃ
analyzed: upanīyyati iti vā jarā maraṇena lokaḥ sammā nīyati tasmai evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo  tāyitum ti jāti ādi byasanataḥ rakkhitum samatthena issarena attanā virahitaḥ ti imam
translated: Or alternatively, the world is led on by death and old age, and so it is “soon,” and the meaning should be regarded thus.

original: lokaṃ ito vaṭṭadukkhato mocessāmi, jarābyādhimaraṇānaṃ taṃ adhibhavituṃ na dassāmī”ti
analyzed: lokam itas vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ mocessāmi jarā byādhi maraṇānam tam adhibhavitum na dassāmi iti
translated: “Without a protector” means without a self that is a lord able to protect from the dangers of birth, etc., “I shall deliver this world from this round of suffering, I shall not allow it to be overcome by old age, disease, and death,”

original: evaṃ abhisaratīti abhissaraṇaṃ, lokassa sukhassa dātā hitassa vidhātā koci issaro,
analyzed: evam abhisarati iti abhissaraṇam lokassa sukhassa dātā hitassa vidhātā koci issaraḥ
translated: and so on. “Without a refuge” means that there is no lord who is the giver of the world’s happiness, the ordainer of its welfare.

original: tadabhāvato āha “anabhissaroti asaraṇo”ti. Nissako mamāyitabbavatthuabhāvato, tenāha
analyzed: tad abhāvataḥ āha an abhissaro ti asaraṇo ti nissakaḥ tena āha
translated: Since there is none, he says, “without a refuge,” meaning “without a refuge to which one might go for protection.” “Without a shelter” means that there is no self that is a shelter, a place of rest, a protection, a refuge, a final resort.

original: “sakabhaṇḍavirahito”tiādi. Taṇhāya vase jāto taṇhāya vijitoti katvā “taṇhāya dāso”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: saka bhaṇḍa virahitaḥ tiādi taṇhāya vase jātaḥ taṇhāya vijito ti katvā taṇhāya dāso ti vuttam
translated: “Without his own property” and so on. He is born to the sway of craving, conquered by craving, thus he is called “a slave to craving.”

original: 306. Hatthivisayattā hatthisannissitattā vā hatthisippaṃ “hatthī”ti gahitanti āha
analyzed: hatthi visaya ttā hatthi sannissita ttā vā hatthi sippam hatthī iti gahitan ti āha
translated: The elephant craft is called “elephant” because it is the province of the hand or because it is dependent on the hand.

original: – “hatthisminti hatthisippe”ti, sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Sātisayaṃ ūrubalaṃ etassa
analyzed: hatthi smin ti hatthi sippa iti sesa padesu pi esa iva nayaḥ sa atisayam ūru balam etassa
translated: Thus he says: “In the elephant, i.e., in the elephant craft.” The same method applies to the other terms.🔽He has extraordinary thigh power, thus he is called “thigh-powerful.”

original: atthīti ūrubalīti āha – “ūrubalasampanno”ti, tamevatthaṃ pākaṭaṃ katvā dassetuṃ “yassa
analyzed: atthi iti ūru bali iti āha ūru bala sampannaḥ iti tam eva attham pākaṭam katvā dassetum yassa
translated: He says: “endowed with thigh power.” In order to show that very meaning, he says: “For he…”

original: hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Abhinnaṃ parasenaṃ bhindato bhinnaṃ sakasenaṃ sandhārayato upatthambhayato.
analyzed: hi itiādi vuttam abhinnam para senam bhindataḥ bhinnam saka senam sandhārayataḥ upatthambhayataḥ
translated: He is “thigh-powerful” because he breaks up the army of the enemy and because he supports and strengthens his own army that is broken up.

original: Bāhubalīti etthāpi “yassa hi phalakañca āvudhañca gahetvā”tiādinā attho vattabbo,
analyzed: bāhu balī iti ettha api yassa hi phalakam ca āvudham ca gahetvā ati ādinā atthaḥ vattabbo
translated: In the case of “arm-powerful,” the meaning should be stated thus: “For he, having taken up a shield and a weapon…” and so on.

original: idha pana parahatthagataṃ rajjaṃ āharituṃ bāhubalanti yojanā. Yathā hi “ūrubalī”ti
analyzed: idha pana para hattha gatam rajjam āharitum yojanā yathā hi ūru bali iti
translated: But here the interpretation is: “arm-powerful” means the power of the arm in bringing back a kingdom that is in the hands of others.🔽For just as in the case of “thigh-powerful” the meaning is stated without mentioning the arm,

original: etthāpi bāhubalaṃ anāmasitvā attho, evaṃ “bāhubalī”ti ettha ūrubalaṃ anāmasitvā attho
analyzed: ettha api bāhu balam an āmasitvā evam bāhu balī iti ettha ūru balam an āmasitvā
translated: so in the case of “arm-powerful” the meaning is stated without mentioning the thigh.

original: veditabbo, āhito ahaṃmāno etthāti attā, attabhāvo. Alaṃ samattho attā etassāti alamatthoti
analyzed: veditabbaḥ āhitaḥ ahaṃmānaḥ ettha ati attā attabhāvaḥ alam samatthaḥ attā etassa ati alamatthaḥ iti
translated: It should be known that the self is the selfhood that is the source of the conceit “I am.” The meaning of “alam” is “capable.”

original: āha “samatthaattabhāvo”ti.🔽Pariyodhāyāti vā parito ārakkhaṃ odahitvā. “Saṃvijjante kho, bho raṭṭhapāla, imasmiṃ
analyzed: āha  pariyodhāya ati vā paritas ārakkham odahitvā saṃvijjante kho bho raṭṭhapāle imasmin
translated: The selfhood that is capable is the selfhood that is capable of being the self.

original: rājakule hatthikāyāpi…pe… vattissantī”ti idampi so rājā upari dhammuddesassa kāraṇaṃ āharanto āha.🔽Vuttasseva anu pacchā gāyanavasena kathanaṃ anugīti. Tā pana gāthā dhammuddesānaṃ
analyzed: rāja kule vattissanti iti idam pi saḥ rājā upari dhammuddesassa kāraṇam āharantaḥ āha  vuttassa iva anu pacchā gāyana vasena kathanaṃ tā pana gāthā dhamma uddesānam
translated: Or “pariyodhāya” means “having placed protection around.” “In this royal court, sir, there are troops of elephants, horses, chariots, and foot soldiers, and they are on duty.” This is the reason the king gave for the recitation of the Dhamma above.🔽The recitation of the verses after the discourse has been spoken is the anugīti. But these verses are called anugīti because they are collected in the proper way, without regard to the order in which the Dhamma was taught.

original: desanānupubbiṃ anādiyitvāpi yathārahaṃ saṅgaṇhanavasena anugītāti āha “catunnaṃ dhammuddesānaṃ anugīti”nti.
analyzed: desanā anupubbim an ādiyitvā api yathāraham saṅgaṇhana vasena anugītā iti āha catunnam dhamma uddesānam anugītin ti
translated: “The recitation of the verses of the four Dhamma-recitations.”

original: 307. Ekanti ekajātiyaṃ. Vatthukāmakilesakāmā visayabhedena bhinditvā tathā vuttāti daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: ekam ti eka jātiyam vatthu kāma kilesa kāmā visaya bhedena bhinditvā tathā vuttā iti daṭṭhabbo
translated: “Eka” means “in one birth.” “Vatthu” and “kāma” should be understood as said by way of the distinction of sense-desire as object.

original: Sāgarantenāti sāgarapariyantena.
analyzed: sāgara antena ati sāgara pariyantena
translated: “Sāgaranta” means “having an ocean as its end.”

original: Aho vatāti socane nipāto, “aho vata pāpaṃ kataṃ mayā”tiādīsu viya. Amarātiādīsu āhūti kathenti. Mataṃ uddissa “amha”nti vattabbe sokavasena “amara”nti vuccati.
analyzed: aho vata iti socane nipātaḥ aho vata pāpam katam mayā atiādīsu viya amara atiādīsu āhū ti kathenti matam uddissa amhanti vattabbe soka vasena amaranti vuccati
translated: Aho vata = aho vata. The particle vata is used in the sense of lamentation, as in the passage: “Aho vata pāpaṃ kataṃ mayā” . In the passage under discussion, āhu = āhu. The word amara is used in the sense of “we” in the sense of lamentation.

original: Vosānanti niṭṭhaṃ, pariyosānanti attho. Sāvāti paññā eva. Dhanatoti sabbadhanato. Uttamatarā seṭṭhā, tenevāha “paññājīviṃ jīvitamāhu seṭṭha”nti.
analyzed: vosānam nti niṭṭham pariyosānam ti attho sā avāti paññā eva dhanataḥ ti sabba dhanataḥ uttamatarā seṭṭhā tena iva āha paññā jīvim jīvitam āhu seṭṭhanti
translated: Vosānanti = niṭṭhaṃ, pariyosānanti attho. Sāvā = paññā eva. Dhanato = sabbadhanato. Uttamatarā = seṭṭhā. Therefore, it is said: “Paññājīviṃ jīvitamāhu seṭṭha” .

original: Tesu pāpaṃ karontesu sattesu, niddhāraṇe cetaṃ bhummavacanaṃ. Paramparāyāti attabhāvaparamparāya.
analyzed: tesu pāpam karontesu sattesu niddhāraṇe ca itam bhumma vacanam paramparāya ati atta bhāva paramparāya
translated: Tesu pāpaṃ karontesu sattesu, niddhāraṇe cetaṃ bhummavacanaṃ. Paramparāyāti attabhāvaparamparāya.

original: Saṃsāraṃ āpajjitvāti bhavādīsu saṃsārassa āpajjanahetuṃ āpajjanto paralokaṃ upeti,
analyzed: saṃsāram āpajjitvā iti bhava ādīsu saṃsārassa āpajjana hetum āpajjantaḥ para lokam upeti
translated: Saṃsāraṃ āpajjitvā = bhavādīsu saṃsārassa āpajjanahetuṃ āpajjanto paralokaṃ upeti,

original: paralokaṃ upentova bahuvidhadukkhasaṅkhātaṃ gabbhañca upeti. Tādisassāti tathārūpassa
analyzed: para lokam upentaḥ iva bahuvidha dukkha saṅkhātam gabbham ca upeti tādisassa ati tathārūpassa
translated: paralokaṃ upentova bahuvidhadukkhasaṅkhātaṃ gabbhañca upeti. Tādisassāti tathārūpassa

original: gabbhavāsadukkhādīnaṃ adhiṭṭhānabhūtassa appapaññassa añño appapañño ca abhisaddahanto
analyzed: gabbha vāsa dukkha ādīnam adhiṭṭhāna bhūtassa appapaññassa aññaḥ appapaññaḥ ca abhisaddahanto
translated: gabbhavāsadukkhādīnaṃ adhiṭṭhānabhūtassa appapaññassa añño appapañño ca abhisaddahanto

original: hitasukhāvahanti pattiyāyanto.
analyzed: hita sukha āvahanti
translated: hitasukhāvahanti pattiyāyanto.

original: “Pāpadhammo”ti vuttattā tādisassa paraloko nāma duggati evāti āha “paramhi apāyaloke”ti.
analyzed: pāpa dhammaḥ ti vuttattā tādisassa para lokaḥ nāma duggati eva ati āha paramhi apāya loka iti
translated: “In the next world of woe” : because of the words “of evil nature” , the next world of such a person is only a bad destination.

original: Vividharūpenāti rūpasaddādivasena tatthapi paṇītatarādivasena bahuvidharūpena.🔽Sāmaññamevāti samaṇabhāvo eva seyyo. Ettha ca ādito dvīhi gāthāhi catuttho dhammuddeso
analyzed: vividha rūpena ati rūpa sadda ādi vasena paṇītatara ādi vasena bahuvidha rūpena  sāmaññam eva ati samaṇa bhāvaḥ eva seyyaḥ ettha ca āditaḥ dvīhi gāthāhi catutthaḥ dhamma uddeso
translated: “In many a form” : in many a kind, such as visible forms, sounds, etc., and also in the many kinds of excellence, etc., found there.

original: anugīto. Catutthagāthāya tatiyo. Pañcamagāthāya dutiyo. Chaṭṭhagāthāya dutiyatatiyā.🔽Sattamagāthāya paṭhamo dhammuddeso anugīto, aṭṭhamādīhi pavattinivattīsu kāmesu nekkhamme
analyzed: anugīto catuttha gāthāya tatiyo pañcama gāthāya dutiyo chaṭṭha gāthāya dutiya tatiyā  sattama gāthāya paṭhamaḥ dhamma uddesaḥ anugītaḥ aṭṭhama ādīhi pavatti nivattīsu kāmesu nekkhamme
translated: “The state of a recluse is better” : the state of a recluse alone is better. And here, in the first two stanzas, the fourth exhortation is sung. In the fourth stanza, the third. In the fifth stanza, the second. In the sixth stanza, the second and third.

original: ca yathārahaṃ ādīnavānisaṃsaṃ vibhāvetvā attano pabbajjakāraṇaṃ paramato dassento🔽yathāvuttadhammuddesaṃ nigameti, tena vuttaṃ “tā pana gāthā dhammuddesānaṃ desanānupubbiṃ
analyzed: ca yathāraham ādīnava anisaṃsam vibhāvetvā attanaḥ pabbajja kāraṇam paramatas dassento  yathā vutta dhamma uddesam nigameti tena vuttam tāḥ pana gāthāḥ dhamma uddesānam desanā anupubbim
translated: In the seventh stanza, the first exhortation is sung. In the eighth and following stanzas, the danger and the advantage in sensual pleasures and in renunciation are respectively shown as appropriate, and he shows his own reason for going forth as superior to that of others.

original: anādiyitvāpi yathārahaṃ saṅgaṇhanavasena anugītā”ti. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: an ādiyitvā api yathāraham saṅgaṇhana vasena anugītā iti sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: He concludes the exhortation stated above. Therefore it is said: “But those stanzas, without regard to the order of the exhortations, are sung as a collection in the appropriate place.” The rest is easy to understand.

original: Raṭṭhapālasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: raṭṭhapāla sutta vaṇṇanāya līnattha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the brief account in the Ratthapala Sutta is ended.

original: 3. Maghadevasuttavaṇṇanā🔽308. Pubbe maghadevo nāma rājāti atītakāle imasmiṃyeva kappe anekavassasahassāyukesu
analyzed: pubbe maghadevaḥ nāma rājā ati atīta kāle imasmiṃ yeva kappe aneka vassa sahassa āyukesu
translated: The Maghadeva Sutta🔽In the past, in this same fortunate aeon, when human life was as much as ten thousand years in length,

original: manussesu paṭipāṭiyā uppannānaṃ caturāsītisahassānaṃ cakkavattirājūnaṃ ādipuriso🔽maghadevoti evaṃnāmo rājā.🔽Dhammoti rājadhammoti lokikā vadanti. Mahābodhinidhānapāramitāsaṅkhāto pana dhammo
analyzed: manussesu paṭipāṭiyā uppannānam caturāsīti sahassānam cakkavatti rājūnam ādi purisaḥ  evaṃnāmaḥ rājā  dhammaḥ ti rājadhammaḥ iti lokikāḥ vadanti mahā bodhi nidhāna pāramitā saṅkhātaḥ pana dhammaḥ
translated: there was a king named Maghadeva, who was the first of eighty-four thousand wheel-turning monarchs.🔽The word dhamma here, say the worldlings, is the king’s law. But the dhamma is the perfection of the great enlightenment.

original: atthīti dhammiko. Dhammenāti ñāyena. Tadā brahmavihārādibhāvanādhammassa rañño anadhigatattā
analyzed: atthi iti dhammikaḥ dhammena ati ñāyena tadā brahmavihāra ādi bhāvanā dhammassa raññaḥ an adhigata ttā
translated: The king was righteous because he had the dhamma. By the dhamma means by the right way. Since the king had not yet attained the dhamma of the development of the divine abidings, etc.,

original: tassapi vā anabhijjhādīhi samānayogakkhamattā vuttaṃ “dasakusalakammapathe ṭhito”ti.
analyzed: tassa api vā anabhijjhā ādīhi samāna yogakkhama ttā vuttam dasa kusala kamma pathe ṭhito ti
translated: or since he was equal in conduct to those who had attained it, it is said that he “abided by the ten courses of wholesome kamma.”

original: Dhammanti dhammato anapetaṃ. Tathā hi ca so pakkhapātābhāvato “samo”ti vuccatīti
analyzed: dhammanti dhammataḥ an apetam tathā hi ca so pakkhapāta abhāvato samaḥ ti vuccati iti
translated: By the dhamma means not deviating from the dhamma. For he is called “equal” because he is free from partiality.

original: āha “samaṃ caratī”ti. Pakatiniyāmenevāti paveṇiyā āgataniyāmeneva. Yasmā nigamajanapadesu
analyzed: āha samam carati iti pakati niyāmena iva ati paveṇiyāḥ āgata niyāmena iva yasmai nigama janapadesu
translated: Thus it is said that he “behaved equally.” By the regular method means by the method that had come down in the succession of teachers. Since in the villages and towns

original: yebhuyyena gahapatīnaṃ saṅgaho, tasmā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “gahapatikāna”ntveva vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yebhuyyena gahapatīnam saṅgahaḥ tasmai aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam
translated: and it is mostly the householders who are the supporters of the Dispensation. That is why it is said in the commentary, “of the householders.”

original: Pāḷiyaṃ pana aññameva nāgaracārittaṃ, aññaṃ negamajanapadacārittanti te visuṃ gahitā
analyzed: pāḷiyam pana aññam eva nāgara cārittam aññam negama janapada cārittanti te visum gahitā
translated: But in the text itself the behavior of the city-dwellers and the behavior of the country-dwellers are given separately,

original: “negamesu ceva janapadesu cā”ti. Paccuggamananiggamanavasena uposathassa paṭiharaṇaṃ
analyzed: negamesu ca iva janapadesu ca ati paccuggamana niggamana vasena uposathassa paṭiharaṇam
translated: “in the cities and the countryside.” The observance day is “observed” by going out and coming in.

original: pāṭihāriyo, so eva pāṭihāriko, pakkho. Ime divasāti ime cattāro divasā.
analyzed: pāṭihāriyaḥ saḥ eva pāṭihārikaḥ pakkhaḥ ime divasā ati ime cattāro divasā
translated: The “going out” is the observance day itself. The “coming in” is the next day. The observance day is “observed” by going out and coming in on these two days.

original: 309. Devoti maccu abhibhavanaṭṭhena. Yathā hi devo pakatisatte abhibhavati, evaṃ
analyzed: deva iti abhibhavana ṭṭhena yathā hi devaḥ pakati satte abhibhavati evam
translated: “Death” is so called because it overpowers living beings. Just as a god overpowers ordinary beings,

original: maccu satte abhibhavati. “Ahaṃ asukaṃ maddituṃ āgamissāmi, tvaṃ tassa kese gahetvā
analyzed: maccu satte abhibhavati aham asukam madditum āgamissāmi tvam tassa kese gahetvā
translated: so death overpowers living beings. “I will come to kill so-and-so. You must seize his hair

original: mā vissajjehī”ti maccudevassa āṇākarā dūtā viyāti dūtāti vuccanti. Alaṅkatapaṭiyattāyāti
analyzed: mā vissajjehi iti maccudevassa āṇākarāḥ dūtāḥ viyāti dūtā ati vuccanti alaṅkata paṭiyattāya ati
translated: and not let him go,” just as the king’s messengers carry out the king’s orders, so too death is called a messenger because it carries out the orders of the god of death.

original: idaṃ attano dibbānubhāvaṃ āvikatvā ṭhitāyāti dassetuṃ vuttaṃ. Devatābyākaraṇasadisameva
analyzed: idam attanaḥ dibba anubhāvam āvikatvā ṭhitāya iti dassetum vuttam devatā byākaraṇa sadisam eva
translated: “Adorned and decorated”: this is said in order to show that the devatās stand there revealing their own divine power.

original: hoti na cireneva maraṇasambhavato. Visuddhidevānanti khīṇāsavabrahmānaṃ. Te hi carimabhave
analyzed: na cirena iva maraṇa sambhavataḥ khīṇāsava brahmānam te hi carima bhave
translated: because death is bound to occur before long. ‘Pure deities’ are deities free from the cankers. For they show the Bodhisattvas who are in their last existence

original: bodhisattānaṃ jiṇṇādike dassenti.
analyzed: bodhisattānam jiṇṇa ādike dassenti
translated: their old age, etc., and they show them the sick man, etc., too.

original: Dukhitañca byādhitanti byādhibhāvena sañjātadukkhanti attho. Antimabhavikabodhisattānaṃ
analyzed: dukhitam ca byādhitam ti byādhi bhāvena sañjāta dukkham ti attho antimabhavika bodhisattānam
translated: ‘Sick’ means ‘suffering from the suffering of sickness’ .

original: visuddhidevehi upaṭṭhāpitabhāvaṃ upādāya tadaññesaṃ tehi anupaṭṭhāpitānampi paṇḍitānaṃ🔽tathā voharitabbatā pariyāyasiddhāti āha “iminā pariyāyenā”ti.
analyzed: visuddhidevehi upaṭṭhāpita bhāvam upādāya tad aññesam tehi an upaṭṭhāpitānam pi paṇḍitānam  tathā voharitabba tā pariyāya siddhā iti āha iminā pariyāyena ati
translated: Because the Bodhisattvas in their last existence are attended by the pure deities, and because it is proper to speak of other wise men in the same way even though they are not so attended,🔽the expression ‘sick with suffering’ is used by way of a simile.

original: Disampatīti vibhattialopena niddeso, disāsīsena desā vuttāti desānaṃ adhipatirājāti🔽attho. Uttamaṅge sirasi ruhantīti uttamaṅgaruhā, kesā. Te panettha yasmā palitattā
analyzed: disampatī iti vibhatti a lopena niddesaḥ disā sīsena desāḥ vuttā ati desānam adhipati rājā ati  uttamaṅge sirasi ruhanti iti uttamaṅgaruhā kesā te pana ittha yasmā palita ttā
translated: ‘Kings of the regions’ : the locative case-ending is omitted in ‘disampatī’ . What is meant is that they are kings of the regions because they rule over the regions.🔽‘Growing on the head’ : the hair grows on the head. But here they are called ‘age-makers’ because they are the last to go in the case of all ages,

original: avisesato sabbapacchimavayasandassakā honti, tasmā “vayoharā”ti vuttā.
analyzed: avisesato sabba pacchima vaya sandassakāḥ honti tasmā vayoharā ti vuttā
translated: because they go white without distinction of age.

original: Purisayugo yasmā tasmiṃ vaṃse sañjātapurisaṭṭhitiyā paricchinno, tasmā āha “vaṃsasambhave
analyzed: purisa yugaḥ tasmin vaṃse sañjāta purisa ṭṭhitiyā paricchinnaḥ tasmai āha vaṃsa sambhave
translated: ‘A pair of men’ : what is meant is that the pair of men is limited by the state of being a man in that family.

original: purise”ti. Rājagehato āhaṭabhikkhāya yāpentoti iminā kumārakapabbajjāya upagatabhāvaṃ dasseti.🔽Parihariyamānovāti aññena aññena parihariyamāno viya velāya velāya tena mahatā parijanena
analyzed: purisa iti rāja gehataḥ āhaṭa bhikkhāya yāpento ti iminā kumāraka pabbajjāya upagata bhāvam dasseti  parihariyamānaḥ uvāti aññena aññena parihariyamānaḥ viya velāya velāya tena mahatā parijanena
translated: “to a man.” By this he shows that he went forth as a novice.🔽“Was nourished”: the meaning is that he played the child’s part, being looked after by that great retinue, as if he were being looked after by one after another.

original: upaṭṭhiyamāno kumārakīḷaṃ kīḷīti attho. Keci pana “parihariyamāno evā”ti avadhāraṇavasena
analyzed: upaṭṭhiyamānaḥ kumāra kīḷam kīḷīti attho keci pana eva ati avadhāraṇa vasena
translated: But some, taking the word eva in the sense of “only,”

original: atthaṃ vadanti, tathā sati caturāsītivassasahassāni thaññapāyī taruṇadārako ahosīti
analyzed: attham vadanti tathā sati catur āsīti vassa sahassāni thaññapāyī taruṇa dārako ahosi iti
translated: say that the meaning is that he was nourished only at the breast for eighty-four thousand years.

original: āpajjatīti tadayuttaṃ. Kumārakālaṃ vatvā tadanantaraṃ oparajjavacanato viruddhañcetaṃ.🔽(Pañcamaṅgalavacanena unnaṅgalamaṅgalaukkantanamaṅgalakammahāyamaṅgaladussamaṅgalāni
analyzed: āpajjati iti tat ayuttam kumāra kālam vatvā tad anantaram oparajja vacanataḥ  pañcamaṅgala vacanena unnaṅgala maṅgala aukkantana maṅgala kamma hāyamaṅgala dussamaṅgalāni
translated: But that is inappropriate, for it would follow that he was a tender infant for that length of time. And this contradicts the statement of his succession to the kingship immediately after his childhood.

original: samupagatāni eva ahesunti daṭṭhabbaṃ).
analyzed: samupagatāni eva ahesunti daṭṭhabbam
translated: (The five auspicious events should be regarded as having taken place in the following order: the auspicious dream, the auspicious birth, the auspicious bathing, the auspicious lying on the royal couch, and the auspicious going forth.)🔽Sons and grandsons are called “sons and grandsons”

original: 311. Savaṃsavasena āgatā puttanattuādayo puttā ca paputtā ca etissāti puttapaputtakā
analyzed: āgatā putta nattu ādayaḥ puttā ca paputtā ca etissa ati putta paputtakā
translated: because they have come into being by the power of the seed.

original: paramparā. Nihatanti nihitaṃ ṭhapitaṃ, pavattitanti attho. Nihatanti vā satataṃ patiṭṭhitabhāvena🔽vaḷañjitanti attho. Tenāha “kalyāṇavatta”nti. Atirekatarā dve guṇāti mahāsattassa
analyzed: paramparā nihatanti nihitam ṭhapitam pavattitanti atthaḥ nihatanti vā satatam patiṭṭhita bhāvena  vaḷañjitanti attho tena āha mahāsattassa
translated: “Succession”: “Nihata” is “nihita” , “placed”, the meaning is “occurred”. Or else, “nihata” has the meaning of “vaḷañjita” , “made manifest”, by the state of being constantly established.🔽Therefore it is said: “good conduct”.

original: maghadevakālato atirekatarā dve guṇā itararājūhi pana atirekatarā anekasatasahassappabhedā eva guṇā ahesunti.
analyzed: maghadeva kālataḥ atirekatarāḥ dve guṇāḥ itara rājūhi pana atirekatarāḥ aneka sata sahassa ppabhedāḥ eva guṇāḥ ahesunti
translated: “Two qualities more than the rest”: the two qualities of the Great Being were more than the rest, but the qualities of the other kings were more than the rest in the many hundreds of thousands of their divisions.

original: 312. Tettiṃsa sahapuññakārino ettha nibbattāti taṃsahacaritaṭṭhānaṃ tettiṃsaṃ, tadeva
analyzed: tettiṃsa saha puñña kārino ettha nibbattā ati tad saha carita ṭṭhānam tettiṃsam tat eva
translated: “Thirty-three” : the place where they lived together was the thirty-three,🔽that is, the Thirty-three . They are called “Thirty-three” because they dwell there.

original: tāvatiṃsaṃ, taṃnivāso etesanti tāvatiṃsā. Nivāsabhāvo ca tesaṃ tattha nibbattanapubbakoti
analyzed: tāvatiṃsam etesan ti tāvatiṃsāḥ nivāsa bhāvaḥ ca tesam tattha nibbattana pubbakaḥ ti
translated: And their dwelling there is prior to their rebirth there.🔽Therefore it is said: “the Thirty-three gods” , meaning the gods reborn in the Thirty-three gods’ realm.

original: āha – “devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānanti tāvatiṃsabhavane nibbattadevāna”nti. Raññoti nimimahārājassa.
analyzed: āha devānam tāvatiṃsānam ti tāvatiṃsa bhavane rañño ti nimi mahārājassa
translated: “The king” : the chief king Nimmānarati.

original: Ovāde ṭhatvāti “sīlaṃ arakkhanto mama santikaṃ mā āgacchatū”ti niggaṇhanavasenapi,
analyzed: ovāde ṭhatvā ati sīlam arakkhantaḥ mama santikam mā āgacchatu iti niggaṇhana vasena api
translated: “Standing in the advice”: by way of the restraint “one who does not guard morality should not come into my presence”.

original: “ekantato mama vijite vasantena sīlaṃ rakkhitabba”nti evaṃ pavattitaovādavasenapi ovāde ṭhatvā.
analyzed: ekantataḥ mama vijite vasantena sīlam rakkhitabban ti evam ovāde ṭhatvā
translated: “I must keep the precepts in your realm” — thus he spoke the exhortation.

original: Atha nanti mahājutikaṃ mahāvipphāraṃ mahānubhāvaṃ nimirājānaṃ. “Sakkohamasmi devindo,
analyzed: atha nanti mahājutikam mahā vipphāram mahā anubhāvam nimi rājānam sakkoham asmi devindo
translated: “Then” — thus he spoke to King Nimi, who was endowed with great splendor, great influence, and great power. “I am Sakka, the lord of the gods,

original: tava santikamāgato”ti attano sakkabhāvaṃ pavedetvā “kaṅkhaṃ te paṭivinodessāmī”ti
analyzed: tava santikam āgataḥ ti attanaḥ sakka bhāvam pavedetvā kaṅkham te paṭivinodessāmi iti
translated: who has come to you” — thus he announced his own status as Sakka. “I will remove your doubt” —

original: āha. Tenāha “sabbabhūtānamissarā”tiādi.🔽Sīlaṃ upādāya omakatāya “ki”nti hīḷento vadati. Guṇavisiṭṭhatāyāti lābhayasādīnañceva
analyzed: āha tena āha  sīlam upādāya omaka tāya kinti hīḷentaḥ vadati
translated: thus he said. Therefore he said “the lord of all beings” and so forth.🔽He spoke, despising the precepts, as if they were insignificant. “Because of his excellence in virtue” — because of his supreme virtue, which is the cause of gain, honor, etc.,

original: piyamanāpatādīnañca āsavakkhayapariyosānānaṃ nimittabhāvena uttamaguṇatāya. Tadā🔽sakko anuruddhatthero, so attano purimajātiyaṃ paccakkhasiddhaṃva dānato sīlaṃ mahantaṃ
analyzed: piya manāpata ādīnam ca āsava kkhaya pariyosānānam nimitta bhāvena uttama guṇa tāya tadā  sakkaḥ anuruddha tthero so attano purima jātiyam paccakkha siddham iva dānato sīlam mahantam
translated: and of the destruction of the taints, etc. At that time,🔽Sakka was the Elder Anuruddha, who, recalling his own previous birth,

original: vibhāvento “ahañhī”tiādimāha. Tattha attanā vasiyamānaṃ kāmāvacaradevalokaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: vibhāventaḥ ahañhi iti ādim āha tattha attanā vasiyamānam kāma avacara deva lokam sandhāya
translated: was extolling the virtue of giving, which was evident to himself, as being great. Therefore he said “I am he” and so forth. Therein, referring to the sense-sphere heavenly world, which was under his control,

original: “pettivisayato”ti vuttaṃ. Tassa hi kappasatasahassaṃ vivaṭṭajjhāsayassa pūritapāramissa
analyzed: petti visayataḥ ti vuttam tassa hi kappa sata sahassam vivaṭṭa jhāsayassa pūrita pāramissa
translated: “From the realm of petas” is said. For him, a hundred thousand eons of the opened-up mind, having fulfilled the pāramīs,

original: devaloko petaloko viya upaṭṭhāsi. Tenevāha “accharāgaṇasaṅghuṭṭhaṃ, pisācagaṇasevita”nti.
analyzed: deva loko peta loko viya upaṭṭhāsi tena iva āha accharā gaṇa saṅghuṭṭham pisāca gaṇa sevitan ti
translated: the deva world appeared like the peta world. Therefore he said: “Filled with heaps of sugar, frequented by hordes of pisācas.”

original: Khattiyeti khattiyajātiyaṃ. Visujjhatīti brahmalokūpapattiṃ sandhāya vadati kāmasaṃkilesavisujjhanato. Kāyāti ca brahmakāyamāha.
analyzed: khattiya iti khattiya jātiyam visujjhati iti brahma loka upapattim sandhāya vadati ca brahmakāyam āha
translated: Khattiya: in the khattiya caste. Visujjhati: he speaks with reference to rebirth in the brahma world, because of purification from the defilement of sense desire. Kāya: he refers to the brahma-world.

original: Imassa mama adiṭṭhapubbarūpaṃ disvā “ahudeva bhaya”nti cintetvā āha “avikampamāno”ti.
analyzed: imassa mama adiṭṭha pubba rūpam disvā bhayanti cintetvā āha avikampamānaḥ iti
translated: Having seen this form which I have never seen before, thinking “it is only fear,” he said: “without trembling.”

original: Bhāyanto hi cittassa aññathattena kāyassa ca chambhitattena vikampati nāma. Tenāha
analyzed: bhāyantaḥ hi cittassa aññathattena kāyassa ca chambhita ttena vikampati nāma tena āha
translated: For one who is afraid, by the change of mind and by the trembling of the body, it is called trembling. Therefore he said:

original: “abhāyamāno”ti. Sukhaṃ kathetuṃ hotīti puññaphalaṃ kathetuṃ sukhaṃ hoti.
analyzed: abhāyamānā iti sukham kathetum hoti iti puñña phalam kathetum sukham hoti
translated: “without being afraid.” Sukhaṃ kathetuṃ hotīti: it is easy to speak about the fruit of merit.

original: 313. Manaṃ āgamma yuttāyeva hontīti mātalissa sakkasseva cittaṃ jānitvā yuttā viya
analyzed: manam āgamma yuttāya iva honti iti mātalissa sakkassa iva cittam jānitvā yuttāḥ viya
translated: Manaṃ āgamma yuttāyeva hontīti: having known only the mind of Mātali, the charioteer, they are as if yoked.

original: honti, rathe yuttaājānīyakiccaṃ karonti devaputtā. Evaṃ tādise kāle tathā paṭipajjanti,
analyzed: honti rathe yutta ājānīya kiccam karonti deva puttāḥ evam tādise kāle tathā paṭipajjanti
translated: and the gods performed the function of the thoroughbred horses.

original: yathā erāvaṇo devaputto hatthikiccaṃ. Naddhito paṭṭhāyāti rathapañjarapariyantena
analyzed: yathā erāvaṇaḥ deva putto hatthi kiccam paṭṭhāyāti ratha pañjara pariyantena
translated: They proceeded in such a way that the god Eravana performed the function of the elephant.🔽From the yoke-strap: the yoke-strap is the place where the axle is fastened, starting from there.

original: akkhassa sambandhaṭṭhānaṃ naddhī, tato paṭṭhāya. Akkho bajjhati etthāti akkhabaddho,🔽akkhena rathassa baddhaṭṭhānaṃ. Yathā devalokato yāva candamaṇḍalassa gamanavīthi,
analyzed: akkhassa sambandha ṭṭhānam naddhī tatas paṭṭhāya akkhaḥ bajjhati ettha ati akkhabaddho  akkhena rathassa baddha ṭṭhānam yathā deva lokataḥ yāva canda maṇḍalassa gamana vīthi
translated: The axle is fastened here, thus it is the axle-fastening;

original: tāva attano ānubhāvena heṭṭhāmukhameva rathaṃ pesesi, evaṃ candamaṇḍalassa gamanavīthito🔽yāva rañño pāsādo, tāva tatheva pesesi. Dve magge dassetvāti patodalaṭṭhiyā ākāsaṃ
analyzed: tāva attanaḥ ānubhāvena heṭṭhā mukham eva ratham pesesi evam canda maṇḍalassa gamana vīthitaḥ  yāva rañño pāsādaḥ tāva tathā iva pesesi dve magge dassetvā ati patoda laṭṭhiyā ākāsam
translated: it is the place where the axle is fastened to the chariot. Just as the chariot was sent by him with its face downwards by his own power from the world of the gods as far as the path of the moon,🔽so too he sent it from the path of the moon as far as the king’s palace.🔽Having shown two paths: having shown by his own power two paths, as if scratching the sky with the whip-handle,

original: vilikhanto viya attano ānubhāvena nirayagāmī devalokagāmī cāti dve magge dassetvā.
analyzed: vilikhantaḥ viya attanaḥ ānubhāvena niraya gāmī deva loka gāmī ca ati dve magge dassetvā
translated: one leading to hell and the other to the world of the gods.

original: Katamenātiādi desanāmattaṃ, yathā tena rathena gacchantassa nirayo devaloko ca pākaṭā
analyzed: katamena ati ādi desanā mattam yathā tena rathena gacchantassa nirayaḥ deva loko ca pākaṭā
translated: By which? etc., is mere teaching, for the hell and the world of the gods became evident to him as he proceeded in the chariot.

original: honti, tathā karaṇaṃ adhippetaṃ.
analyzed: honti tathā karaṇam adhippetam
translated: and the meaning intended is that he should do so in both ways.🔽With the reason stated, the Great Being said, “Mātali, drive me there in both ways.”

original: Vuttakāraṇameva sandhāyāha mahāsatto “ubhayeneva maṃ mātali nehī”ti. Dugganti duggamaṃ.
analyzed: vutta kāraṇam eva sandhāya āha mahāsattaḥ ubhayena iva mam mātali nehi iti dugganti duggamam
translated: “Dugganti duggamaṃ” means “the difficult is difficult to cross.”

original: Vettaraṇinti evaṃnāmakaṃ nirayaṃ. Kuthitanti pakkuthitaṃ nipakkatelasadisajālaṃ.
analyzed: evaṃnāmakam nirayam kuthitanti pakkuthitam nipakka tela sadisa jālam
translated: “Vettaraṇi” is the name of a hell. “Kuthita” is boiling, having a net like that of boiled oil.

original: Khārasaṃyuttanti khārodakasadisaṃ.
analyzed: khāra saṃyuttanti khāra udaka sadisam
translated: “Khārasaṃyutta” is like water with rice.

original: Rathaṃ nivattetvāti nirayābhimukhato nivattetvā. Bīraṇīdevadhītāyāti “bīraṇī”ti evaṃnāmikāya
analyzed: ratham nivattetvā ati niraya abhimukhataḥ nivattetvā bīraṇī deva dhītāya ati bīraṇī iti evaṃnāmikāya
translated: “Rathaṃ nivattetvā” means turning the chariot away from the hell. “Bīraṇīdevadhītāya” means to the devaputta named “Bīraṇī.”

original: accharāya. Soṇadinnadevaputtassāti “soṇadinno”ti evaṃnāmakassa devaputtassa. Gaṇadevaputtānanti
analyzed: accharāya soṇadinna deva puttassa ati soṇadinnaḥ ti evaṃnāmakassa deva puttassa gaṇa deva puttānam ti
translated: “Soṇadinnadevaputtassa” means to the devaputta named “Soṇadinna.” “Gaṇadevaputtānaṃ”

original: gaṇavasena puññaṃ katvā gaṇavaseneva nibbattadevaputtānaṃ.
analyzed: gaṇa vasena puññam katvā gaṇa vasena iva nibbatta deva puttānam
translated: means the devaputtas who were reborn by making merit in groups.

original: Pattakāleti upakaṭṭhāya velāya. Atithinti paccekasambuddhaṃ. Kassapassa bhagavato
analyzed: patta kāleti upakaṭṭhāya velāya atithim ti paccekasambuddham kassapassa bhagavataḥ
translated: “Pattakāle” means at the right time. “Atithi” means a paccekabuddha. “Kassapassa bhagavato”

original: sāsane ekaṃ khīṇāsavattherantipi vadanti. Mātāva puttaṃ sakimābhinandīti yathā pavāsato
analyzed: sāsane ekam vadanti mātā ava puttam yathā pavāsataḥ
