translated: it is said that he was a thera who had destroyed the taints in the Dispensation of the Blessed One Kassapa. “Mātāva puttaṃ sakimābhinandī” means just as a mother rejoices in her son.

original: āgataṃ puttaṃ mātā sakiṃ ekavāraṃ āgatakāle abhinandati, tathā niccakāle abhinandi
analyzed: āgatam puttam mātā sakim eka vāram āgata kāle abhinandati tathā nicca kāle
translated: The mother, when her son comes, rejoices once, at the time of his coming, so he rejoiced at the time of his coming.

original: sakkaccaṃ parivisi. Saṃyamā saṃvibhāgāti sīlasaṃyamā saṃvibhāgasīlā. Jātaketi nimijātake.
analyzed: sakkaccam parivisi saṃyamā saṃvibhāgā ati sīla saṃyamā saṃvibhāga sīlā jātakā iti nimi jātake
translated: He served with care. Restraint and sharing: restraint and sharing of virtue. In the Jataka: in the Nimijataka.

original: Cittakūṭanti devanagarassa dakkhiṇadisāya dvārakoṭṭhakaṃ. Sakko cittaṃ sandhāretuṃ🔽asakkontoti mahāsatte pavattaṃ devatānaṃ sakkārasammānaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ attano
analyzed: cittakūṭanti devanagarassa dakkhiṇa disāya dvāra koṭṭhakam sakko cittam sandhāretuṃ  a sakkontaḥ ti mahāsatte pavattam devatānam sakkāra sammānam paṭicca uppannam attano
translated: Cittakūṭa: a gate-tower in the south direction of the city of the gods. Sakka was unable to restrain his mind.🔽Unable to conceal the envious mind that arose in him🔽through the honour and respect shown to the Great Being, and unable to keep it within,

original: usūyacittaṃ bahi anāvikatvā abbhantareyeva ca naṃ ṭhapetuṃ asakkonto. Aññesaṃ puññena
analyzed: usūya cittam bahi an āvikatvā abbhantareya iva ca nam ṭhapetum a sakkontaḥ aññesam puññena
translated: he was overcome by the merit of others.

original: vasāhīti sakkassa mahāsattaṃ rosetukāmatāya ārādhanaṃ nidasseti. Purāṇasakko dīghāyuko,
analyzed: vasāhi iti sakkassa mahāsattam rosetu kāma tāya ārādhanam nidasseti purāṇa sakkaḥ dīgha āyukaḥ
translated: He was able to surpass Sakka: this shows the worship of Sakka who was desirous of surpassing the Great Being. The ancient Sakka was long-lived,

original: taṃ upādāya jarājiṇṇaṃ viya katvā “jarasakko”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tam upādāya jarā jiṇṇam viya katvā jarasakko ti vuttam
translated: and in comparison with him, he was called “the old Sakka” as if he were old and decrepit.🔽The rest of it: the rest of his own lineage, the conduct of the ancient kings in his family, he followed.

original: 315. Sesaṃ sabbanti pabbajjupagamanā sesaṃ attano vaṃse porāṇarājūnaṃ rājacārittaṃ.
analyzed: sesam pabbajja upagamanā sesam attanaḥ vaṃse rāja cārittam
translated: The rest of the ancient kings’ conduct in their own line, which is the rest of the going forth and the acceptance of the state of a bhikkhu.

original: Pākatikanti puna sabhāvattameva gato ahosi, apabbajitabhāvavacanenevassa brahmavihārabhāvanādīnaṃ
analyzed: pākatikam ti puna sabhā vattam eva gataḥ ahosi a pabbajita bhāva vacanena iva assa brahmavihāra bhāvanā ādīnam
translated: He became a layman again, as it were; for the words “he gave up the training” imply the abandonment of the development of the divine abidings, etc.,

original: pabbajjāguṇānaṃ abhāvo dīpito hoti.
analyzed: pabbajjā guṇānaṃ abhāvaḥ dīpitaḥ hoti
translated: He became a layman again: he reverted to his former state. The expression “he became a layman again” shows that he had no more the qualities of a monk, such as the development of the divine abidings, etc.

original: 316. Vīriyaṃ akaronto samucchindati, na tāva samucchinnaṃ, kalyāṇamittasaṃsaggādipaccayasamavāye
analyzed: vīriyam a karontaḥ samucchindati na tāva samucchinnam kalyāṇa mitta saṃsagga ādi paccaya samavāye
translated: He cuts it off by not making an effort. It is not cut off as long as the conditions for association with good friends, etc., are present,

original: sati sīlavataṃ kalyāṇavattaṃ pavattetuṃ sakkoti. Dussīlena samucchinnaṃ nāma hoti
analyzed: sati sīlavatam kalyāṇavattam pavattetum sakkoti dussīlena samucchinnam nāma hoti
translated: for then the virtuous man can continue to practice good conduct. It is called cut off by the unvirtuous man,

original: tassa tattha nirāsabhāvena paṭipattiyā eva asambhavato. Satta sekhā pavattenti kalyāṇavattassa
analyzed: tassa tattha nirāsa bhāvena paṭipattiyāḥ eva asambhavataḥ satta sekhā pavattenti kalyāṇa vattassa
translated: for it is impossible for him to practice it because he is rejected from it. The seven kinds of good conduct are practiced by the trainee,

original: apariniṭṭhitakiccattā. Khīṇāsavena pavattitaṃ nāma pariniṭṭhitakiccattā. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: a pariniṭṭhita kicca ttā khīṇāsavena pavattitam nāma pariniṭṭhita kicca ttā sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: for his work is not yet finished. That practiced by the one free from cankers is called finished, for his work is finished. The rest is easily understood.

original: Maghadevasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.🔽4. Madhurasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the brief account in the Maghadeva Sutta is finished.🔽The Madhura Sutta is in the Uttaraka Madhura, in the Guntha Grove, in the Black-rock Cave.

original: 317. Madhurāyanti uttaramadhurāyaṃ. Gundāvaneti kāḷasippalivane. Atimuttakavaneti
analyzed: madhurāyanti uttara madhurāyam gundā vanā iti kāḷa sippali vane atimuttaka vanā iti
translated: In the Atimuttaka Grove.

original: ca vadanti. Catūsu vaṇṇesu brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇo. Paṇḍaroti parisuddho. Kāḷakoti
analyzed: ca vadanti catūsu vaṇṇesu brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ vaṇṇaḥ paṇḍaro ti parisuddhaḥ kāḷako ti
translated: and they say: “In the four castes only the brahmin caste is the best caste. The white is pure. The black is impure.

original: aparisuddho. Jātigottādipaññāpanaṭṭhānesūti jātigottādivasena suddhacintāyaṃ brāhmaṇā🔽eva suddhajātikā, na itareti adhippāyo. Saṃsārato vā suddhacintāyaṃ brāhmaṇāva sujjhanti🔽vedavihitassa suddhavidhino aññesaṃ avisayattāti adhippāyo. Taṃ panetaṃ tesaṃ virujjhati
analyzed: aparisuddhaḥ jāti gotta ādi paññāpana ṭṭhānesu iti jāti gotta ādi vasena suddha cintā ayam brāhmaṇā  eva suddha jātikāḥ na itare iti adhippāyaḥ saṃsārataḥ vā suddha cintā ayam brāhmaṇāḥ ava sujjhanti  veda vihitassa suddha vidhinaḥ aññesam avisaya ttā ati adhippāyaḥ tam pana etam tesam virujjhati
translated: In the matter of the proclamation of birth, lineage, etc.,” the intention is that only brahmins are of pure birth, not others, by reason of their pure thinking in terms of birth, lineage, etc.🔽Or the intention is that only brahmins are purified by pure thinking in the sense of the round of rebirths, because the purification by the pure rite laid down in the Vedas is not within the province of others.

original: khattiyavessānampi mantajjhenassa anuññātattā, mantajjhenavidhinā ca saṃsārasuddhiyābhāvato.
analyzed: khattiya vessānam pi mantajjhenassa anuññāta ttā mantajjhena vidhinā ca saṃsāra suddhiyā abhāvato
translated: But this is contradicted by the fact that the Buddha has allowed the rite for the son of a brahmin by a khattiya woman, and because there is no purification of the round of rebirths by the rite for the son of a brahmin by a brahmin woman.

original: Puttā nāma anorasāpi honti, na tathā imeti āha “orasā”ti. Ure saṃvaḍḍhitaputtopi
analyzed: puttāḥ nāma anorasāḥ api honti na tathā ime iti āha orasā ti ure saṃvaḍḍhita puttaḥ pi
translated: Sons are not necessarily of the mother’s heart’s desire, but these are, thus they are called “of the heart’s desire” . A son who is brought up on the breast is called “of the breast” .

original: “orasa”nti vuccati. Ime pana mukhato niggato hutvā ure saṃvaḍḍhāti dassetuṃ “orasā
analyzed: orasanti vuccati ime pana mukhataḥ niggataḥ hutvā ure saṃvaḍḍha ati dassetuṃ orasā
translated: But these are born from the mouth and brought up on the breast, thus to show this it is said, “of the breast, born from the mouth” .

original: mukhato jātā”ti vuttaṃ. Tato eva brahmato jātāti brahmajā, brahmasambhūtāpi “brahmajā”ti
analyzed: mukhataḥ jātā iti vuttam tatas eva brahmataḥ jātā ati brahma jā brahma sambhūtā api brahma jāti
translated: And because of that they are born from Brahmā, thus they are “born of Brahmā” , and they are “born of Brahmā” because they are produced by Brahmā.

original: vuccanti, na tathā ime. Ime pana paccakkhato brahmunā nimmitāti brahmanimmitā, tato
analyzed: vuccanti na tathā ime ime pana paccakkhatas brahmunā nimmitā ati brahma nimmitā tatas
translated: but not so these. But these are called “created by Brahmā” because they were created by Brahmā face to face.

original: eva brahmato laddhabbavijjādidāyajjadāyādāti brahmadāyādāti sabbametaṃ brāhmaṇānaṃ
analyzed: eva brahmataḥ brahma dāyādāti sabbam etam
translated: Because of that they are “heirs of Brahmā” in the sense of being the recipients of the knowledge, etc., that can be obtained from Brahmā.

original: katthanāpalāpasadisaṃ viññūnaṃ appamāṇaṃ avimaddakkhamaṃ vācāvatthumattaṃ brahmakuttasseva
analyzed: katthana apalāpa sadisam viññūnam appamāṇam a vimadda kkhamam vācāvatthumattam brahmakuttassa iva
translated: All this is like the talk and prattle of the brahmans, immeasurable for the wise, and an object of speech that is hard to believe, because there is no such thing as a “Brahma-wheel.”

original: abhāvato. Yaṃ panettha vattabbaṃ, taṃ visuddhimaggavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttameva. Tenāha “ghosoyevā”tiādi.
analyzed: abhāvataḥ yam pana ittha vattabbam tam visuddhi magga vaṇṇanāyam vuttam eva tena āha
translated: But what should be said here has already been said in the commentary on the Visuddhimagga. Therefore it is said, “It is only a sound.”

original: Vohāramattamevetanti etaṃ “brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇo”tiādi vacanamattameva, na tassa
analyzed: vohāra mattam eva itanti etam brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ vaṇṇo ti ādi vacana mattam eva na tassa
translated: “It is only a matter of usage”: it is only a matter of the mere words “Only the brahmans are the highest caste,” etc.

original: attho tehi adhippetappakāro atthi.
analyzed: atthaḥ tehi adhippeta ppakāraḥ atthi
translated: There is no such meaning as they ascribe to it.

original: 318. Samijjheyyāti diṭṭhidīpanavasena attano ajjhāsayo nipphajjeyya. Tenāha “manoratho
analyzed: samijjheyya iti diṭṭhi dīpana vasena attanaḥ ajjhāsayaḥ nipphajjeyya tena āha manorathaḥ
translated: “Would be fulfilled”: his own wish would be fulfilled by the appearance of his view. Therefore it is said, “His wish would be fulfilled.”

original: pūreyyā”ti. Khattiyopīti parakhattiyopi. Assāti samiddhadhanādiṃ pattassa. Tenāha
analyzed: pūreyya iti khattiyaḥ api iti para khattiyaḥ api assa ati samiddha dhana ādim pattassa tena āha
translated: “Even a noble”: even a noble of another clan. “Would be a brahmin”: would be one who has attained abundant wealth, etc. Therefore it is said,

original: – “issariyasampattassā”ti nesanti etesaṃ catunnaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ ettha pubbuṭṭhāyibhāvādinā
analyzed: issariya sampattassa ati etesam catunnam vaṇṇānam ettha pubbuṭṭhāyi bhāva ādinā
translated: “By the attainment of lordship” : they are called “lords” because of their pre-eminence in the four castes.

original: itarehi upacaritabbatāya na kiñci nānākaraṇanti yojanā.
analyzed: itarehi upacaritabba tāya na kiñci yojanā
translated: “By the attainment of lordship” : the meaning is that there is no difference in the way in which the four castes are to be served by the others through the duties of the chief and so on.

original: 322. Ahaṃ cīvarādīhi upaṭṭhāko, tumhākaṃ icchitacchitakkhaṇe vadeyyātha yenatthoti
analyzed: aham cīvara ādīhi upaṭṭhāko tumhākam icchita chita kkhaṇe vadeyyātha yena atthi ti
translated: “I will be your attendant with robes, etc., and you can tell me what you want from time to time.”

original: yojanā. Corādiupaddavanisedhanena rakkhāgutti, dānādinimittaupaddavanisedhanena āvaraṇagutti.
analyzed: yojanā cora ādi upaddava nisedhanena rakkhā gutti dāna ādi nimitta upaddava nisedhanena āvaraṇa gutti
translated: Protection is the warding off of dangers from thieves, etc., and shelter is the warding off of dangers from giving, etc.

original: Paccuppannānatthanisedhanena vā rakkhāgutti, āgāmianatthanisedhanena āvaraṇagutti.🔽Ettha ca khattiyādīsu yo yo issaro, tassa itarena anuvattetabbabhāve, kusalākusalakaraṇena
analyzed: paccuppanna anattha nisedhanena vā rakkhā gutti āgāmi anattha nisedhanena āvaraṇa gutti  ettha ca khattiya ādīsu yaḥ yaḥ issaraḥ tassa itarena anuvattetabba bhāve kusala akusala karaṇena
translated: Or protection is the warding off of present dangers, and shelter is the warding off of future dangers.

original: nesaṃ vasena laddhabbaabhisamparāye, pabbajitehi laddhabbasāmīcikiriyāya ca aṇumattopi
analyzed: vasena laddhabba abhisamparāye pabbajitehi laddhabba sāmīcikiriyāya ca aṇumattaḥ api
translated: And here, in the case of the nobles, etc., there is not the slightest difference in the way in which each should be served by the other, in the way in which they should be reborn by doing good and bad deeds,

original: viseso natthi, tasmā so visesābhāvo pāḷiyaṃ tattha tattha vāre “evaṃ sante”tiādinā
analyzed: visesaḥ natthi tasmā saḥ visesa abhāvo tattha tattha vāre evam santā iti ādinā
translated: and in the way in which they should be served by those gone forth. Therefore, the absence of difference is shown in the text here and there by the words “If that is so,” etc.

original: vibhāvito. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: vibhāvito sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: The rest is quite clear.

original: Madhurasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
translated: The Commentary on the Madhura Sutta is finished.

original: 5. Bodhirājakumārasuttavaṇṇanā🔽324. Olokanakapadumanti līlāaravindaṃ. Tasmāti kokanadasaṇṭhānattā kokanadoti saṅkhaṃ labhi.
analyzed: bodhirājakumāra sutta vaṇṇanā  līlā aravindam saṅkham
translated: The lotus of the world’s eye opened,🔽The shell got its name because it has the shape of a kokanada flower.🔽The last plank is called the last because it is the last to be laid. For the top of the steps is

original: 325. Yāva pacchima…pe… phalakaṃ vuttaṃ tassa sabbapacchā santhatattā. Uparimaphalagatañhi
analyzed: yāva pacchima pe phalakam vuttam tassa sabba pacchā uparima phala gatam hi
translated: the top of the last plank.

original: sopānamatthakaṃ. Olokanatthaṃyevāti na kevalaṃ bhagavato āgamanaññeva olokanatthaṃ,
analyzed: sopāna matthakam olokana attham yeva āti na kevalam bhagavataḥ olokana attham
translated: For the purpose of looking: not only for the purpose of looking for the Blessed One’s arrival,

original: atha kho attano patthanāya santharāpitāya celapaṭikāya akkamanassapi.🔽Sakuṇapotaketi kādambaṭiṭṭibhaputtake. Aññova bhaveyyāti tasmiṃ attabhāve mātugāmato
analyzed: atha kho attanaḥ patthanāya santharāpitāya cela paṭikāya  sakuṇa potaka iti kādamba ṭiṭṭibha puttake aññaḥ uva bhaveyya iti tasmin atta bhāve mātu gāmataḥ
translated: but also for the purpose of looking while walking on the cloth spread out for his own purpose.🔽The young birds: the young of the kadamba and the tittibha.🔽Another would be: another woman would be his wife in that existence.

original: añño idāni bhariyābhūto mātugāmo bhaveyya. Puttaṃ labheyyāti attano kammavasena puttaṃ,
analyzed: aññaḥ idāni bhariyā bhūtaḥ mātu gāmaḥ bhaveyya puttam labheyya ati attano kamma vasena puttam
translated: Would get a son: would get a son by her own kamma,🔽not by his. Both: both of these two.

original: no tassa. Ubhohīti imehi eva ubhohi. Imehi kāraṇehīti tassa rājakumārassa buddhaṃ
analyzed: no tassa ubhohi iti imehi eva ubhohi imehi kāraṇehi iti tassa rāja kumārassa buddham
translated: For these reasons: for the reasons of the prince’s seeing the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha.

original: paṭicca micchāgahaṇaṃ, titthiyānaṃ ujjhāyanaṃ, anāgate manussānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ uddissa🔽vippaṭisāroti imehi tīhi kāraṇehi. Paññattanti santhataṃ celapaṭikaṃ. Maṅgalaṃ icchantīti maṅgalikā.
analyzed: paṭicca micchā gahaṇam titthiyānam ujjhāyanam anāgate manussānam bhikkhūnam uddissa  vippaṭisāro ti imehi tīhi kāraṇehi paññattanti santhatam celapaṭikam maṅgalam icchanti iti maṅgalikā
translated: and the wrong grasping of the sectarians, and the future resentment of men towards the monks.🔽The ‘arrangement’ is the cloth and the blanket. ‘Wishing for good fortune’ means being desirous of good fortune.🔽The ‘third reason’ refers to the non-arising of resentment towards the monks.

original: 326. Tatiyaṃ kāraṇanti iminā bhikkhūsu vippaṭisārānuppādanamāha. Yaṃ kiñci paribhuñjana-sukhaṃ
analyzed: tatiyam kāraṇam ti iminā bhikkhūsu vippaṭisāra anuppādanam āha yam kiñci paribhuñjana sukham
translated: The pleasure and satisfaction of using the cloth is the ‘enjoyment of sensual pleasure.’

original: kāmasukhallikānuyogoti adhippāyena kāmasukhallikānuyogasaññī hutvā…pe… maññamāno evamāha.
analyzed: kāma sukhallikā anuyogaḥ iti adhippāyena kāma sukhallikā anuyoga saññī hutvā āpe maññamānaḥ evam āha
translated: With the intention of ‘enjoyment of sensual pleasure,’ he thinks, ‘I am enjoying sensual pleasure.’

original: 327. Atha naṃ bhagavā tato micchābhinivesato vivecetukāmo “so kho aha”ntiādinā attano🔽dukkaracariyaṃ dassetuṃ ārabhi. Mahāsaccake vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ “so kho aha”ntiādipāṭhassa
analyzed: atha nam bhagavā tatas micchā abhinivesataḥ vivecetu kāmo saḥ kho ahanti ādinā  dukkara cariyam dassetum ārabhi mahāsaccake vutta nayena iva veditabbam saḥ kho aham ti ādi pāṭhassa
translated: Then the Exalted One, wishing to remove his wrong attachment, began to show his own difficult conduct with the words, “I, monks.”🔽This should be understood in the same way as in the Mahāsaccaka Sutta,🔽because the passage beginning with “I, monks” has come down in the same way as it appears there.

original: tattha āgataniyāmeneva āgatattā. Pāsarāsisutte vuttanayenāti etthāpi eseva nayo.
analyzed: tattha āgata niyāmena iva āgata ttā pāsarāsi sutte vutta nayena ati ettha api esā iva nayo
translated: The same method applies here also in the case of the passage in the Pāsarāsi Sutta.

original: 343. Aṅkusaṃ gaṇhanti etena tassa gahaṇe cheko hotīti aṅkusagahaṇasippaṃ. Meghautunti🔽meghaṃ paṭicca uppannasītautuṃ. Pabbatautunti pabbataṃ paṭicca uṇhautuṃ. Ubhayavasena
analyzed: aṅkusam gaṇhanti etena tassa gahaṇe chekaḥ hoti iti aṅkusa gahaṇa sippam  megham paṭicca uppanna sītautum pabbatautum ti pabbatam paṭicca uṇhautum ubhaya vasena
translated: The art of handling the goad is the skill in handling the goad by which one is clever at taking hold of it. The cold season is the season that arises contingent upon the cold. The hot season is the season that arises contingent upon the heat. The rainy season is the season that arises contingent upon the rains. The wind is the air element. The sun is the fire element.

original: ca tassa tathā sītuṇhaututo eno āgatoti ta-kārassa da-kāraṃ katvā udenoti nāmaṃ akāsi.
analyzed: ca tassa tathā eno āgato iti takārassa dakāram katvā udeno iti nāmam akāsi
translated: The art of handling the goad is the skill in handling the goad by which one is clever at catching hold of it. The cold season is the cold season that arises contingent upon the clouds. The hot season is the hot season that arises contingent upon the mountains. And because the cold and the heat came to him in both seasons, he made a name for himself by changing the ta of his name to da, thus “Udena.”🔽The ascetic, knowing the king’s death by means of his penetrating knowledge,

original: Tāpaso ogāḷhañāṇavasena rañño matabhāvaṃ ñatvā. Ādito paṭṭhāyāti kosambinagare parantaparañño🔽aggamahesibhāvato paṭṭhāya. Pubbeti sīlavantakāle. Hatthiganthanti hatthīnaṃ attano
analyzed: tāpasaḥ ogāḷha ñāṇa vasena raññaḥ mata bhāvam ñatvā āditaḥ paṭṭhāya ati kosambi nagare parantaparañño  agga mahesi bhāvataḥ paṭṭhāya pubba iti sīlavanta kāle hatthi ganthanti hatthīnam attanaḥ
translated: from the beginning, that is, from the time when he was the chief queen’s son of the border king in the city of Kosambī,

original: vase vattāpanasatthaṃ. Tenevassa taṃ sikkhāpeti, kiccañca ijjhati.
analyzed: vase vattāpana sattham tena iva assa tam sikkhāpeti kiccam ca ijjhati
translated: in the past, in the time of the Elder Sīlava, the elephant taming, that is, the means of bringing the elephants under his control. By that he trains it, and his purpose is accomplished.

original: 344. Padahanabhāvoti bhāvanānuyogo. Padhāne vā niyutto padhāniyo, padhāniyassa bhikkhuno,
analyzed: padahana bhāvaḥ ti bhāvanā anuyogaḥ padhāne vā niyuttaḥ padhāniyaḥ padhāniyassa bhikkhuno
translated: The state of being devoted is the devotion to development. Or he is devoted because he is devoted to devotion. For a bhikkhu who is devoted,

original: tasseva padhāniyabhāvassa aṅgāni kāraṇāni padhāniyaṅgāni. Saddhā etassa atthīti saddho.
analyzed: tassa iva padhāniya bhāvassa aṅgāni kāraṇāni padhāniyaṅgāni saddhā etassa atthi iti saddhaḥ
translated: the factors of devotion are the causes of that very devotion of his. He who has faith is faithful.

original: Kiñcāpi paccekabodhisattānampi abhinīhārato paṭṭhāya āgatā āgamanasaddhā eva, mahābodhisattānaṃ
analyzed: kiñca api pacceka bodhisattānam pi abhinīhārato paṭṭhāya āgatāḥ āgamana saddhāḥ eva mahā bodhisattānam
translated: And although the faith that has come to the Paccekabuddhas and the Great Buddhas from the time of their aspiration is faith that has come ,

original: pana saddhā garutarāti sā eva gahitā. Acalabhāvena okappanaṃ “sammāsambuddho bhagavā,
analyzed: pana saddhā garutarāti sā eva gahitā acala bhāvena okappanam sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā
translated: nevertheless the latter is called “come” because it is more weighty.🔽The “adherence” by the “immovable” stage is the “adherence” by the “immovable” stage of the faith that has come, which is the “adherence” by the “immovable” stage of the faith that has come.

original: svākhyāto dhammo, suppaṭipanno saṅgho”ti kenaci akampiyabhāvena ratanattayaguṇe ogāhitvā
analyzed: su ākhyātaḥ dhammo suppaṭipanno saṅghaḥ ti kenaci a kampiya bhāvena rata nattaya guṇe ogāhitvā
translated: The “acceptance” by the “acceptance” stage is the “acceptance” by the “acceptance” stage of the faith that has come, which is the “acceptance” by the “acceptance” stage of the faith that has come.🔽The “appearance of confidence” is the appearance of confidence in the Three Jewels.

original: kappanaṃ. Pasāduppatti ratanattaye pasīdanameva. Bodhinti catumaggañāṇanti vuttaṃ
analyzed: kappanam pasāda uppatti ratana ttaye pasīdanam eva bodhi nti catu magga ñāṇan ti vuttam
translated: “Enlightenment” is the four paths.

original: taṃnimittattā sabbaññutaññāṇassa, bodhīti vā sammāsambodhi. Sabbaññutaññāṇapadaṭṭhānañhi
analyzed: taṃnimitta ttā sabbaññu taññāṇassa bodhi iti vā sammāsambodhi sabbaññu taññāṇa padaṭṭhānam hi
translated: It is so called because it is the cause of the knowledge of omniscience. Or alternatively, “enlightenment” is perfect enlightenment.

original: maggañāṇaṃ, maggañāṇapadaṭṭhānañca sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ “sammāsambodhī”ti vuccati. Nicchitasubuddhatāya
analyzed: magga ñāṇam magga ñāṇa padaṭṭhānam ca sabbaññu taññāṇam sammāsambodhī iti vuccati nicchita su buddha tāya
translated: For the path is the proximate cause of the knowledge of omniscience, and the knowledge of omniscience is the proximate cause of the path. That is why the path is called “perfect enlightenment.”

original: dhammassa sudhammatā saṅghassa suppaṭipatti vinicchitā eva hotīti āha “desanāsīsameva
analyzed: dhammassa su dhamma tā saṅghassa su paṭipatti vinicchitā eva hoti iti āha desanā sīsam eva
translated: The “goodness of the Dhamma” and the “good practice of the Saṅgha” are established by the establishment of the Buddha.

original: ceta”ntiādi. Tassa padhānaṃ vīriyaṃ ijjhati ratanattayasaddhāya “imāya paṭipadāya
analyzed: cetanti ādi tassa padhānam vīriyam ijjhati ratanattaya saddhāya imāya paṭipadāya
translated: “And the rest of the night” .

original: jarāmaraṇato muccissāmī”ti padhānānuyoge avaṃmukhasambhavato.
analyzed: jarā maraṇataḥ muccissāmi iti padhāna anuyoge avaṃmukha sambhavato
translated: His striving succeeds because of his faith in the Three Jewels, since he is intent on striving with the thought, “By this way I shall be released from aging and death.”🔽“Free from affliction” and the rest are as already stated.

original: Appābādhotiādi heṭṭhā vuttameva. Aguṇaṃ pakāsetā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitā sammāpaṭipattiyā
analyzed: appa ābādhaḥ tiādi heṭṭhā vuttam eva aguṇam pakāsetā āyatim saṃvaram āpajjitā sammā paṭipattiyā
translated: He reveals his faults and undertakes restraint in the future in order to purify himself by right practice.

original: visodhanatthaṃ. Udayañca atthañca gantunti “avijjāsamudayā”tiādinā pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ
analyzed: visodhana attham udayam ca attham ca gantunti avijjā samudaya ati ādinā pañcannam upādānakkhandhānaṃ
translated: “The rise and fall” of the five aggregates of clinging is known by way of the rise and fall of ignorance, etc.🔽Therefore it is said, “By this” , etc.

original: udayañca vayañca jānituṃ. Tenāha “etenā”tiādi. Parisuddhāya upakkilesavinimuttāya.
analyzed: udayam ca vayam ca jānitum tena āha etena ati ādi parisuddhāya upakkilesa vinimuttāya
translated: “To be purified” means to be free from defilements.

original: Nibbijjhitunti tadaṅgavasena pajahituṃ samucchedappahānassa paccayo bhavituṃ. Yaṃ🔽dukkhaṃ khīyatīti kilesesu appahīnesu tena tadupanissayakammaṃ paṭicca yaṃ dukkhaṃ
analyzed: nibbijjhitum ti tad aṅga vasena pajahitum samuccheda ppahānassa paccayaḥ bhavitum yam  dukkham khīyati iti kilesesu appahīnesu tena tad upanissaya kammam paṭicca yam dukkham
translated: “To be disgusted with” means to abandon by the method of abandoning through substitution of opposites, in order to become a condition for the abandonment by cutting off.

original: uppajjeyya, taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.🔽345. Sesadivaseti sattadivasato paṭṭhāya yāva dve rattindivā.
analyzed: uppajjeyya tam sandhāya vuttam 🔽sesa divasa iti satta divasato paṭṭhāya yāva dve
translated: “The suffering that is exhausted” is the suffering that would arise by way of the kamma that is a condition for that, if the defilements were not abandoned.

original: 346. Kucchisannissito gabbho nissayavohārena “kucchī”ti vuccati, so etissā atthīti
analyzed: kucchi sannissitaḥ gabbhaḥ nissaya vohārena kucchī iti vuccati saḥ etissā atthi iti
translated: The womb is called “belly” in the sense of support, since the embryo is supported by it.🔽She is “with child” because she has that.

original: kucchimatī. Tenāha “āpannasattā”ti. Ārakkho panassa paccupaṭṭhito hotīti mātarā gahitasaraṇaṃ
analyzed: kucchimatī tena āha āpannasattā ti ārakkhaḥ pana assa paccupaṭṭhitaḥ hoti iti mātarā gahita saraṇam
translated: Hence it is said, “She is pregnant.” “The protection is set up for it” means that the mother’s refuge is taken as the child’s refuge.

original: gabbhavuṭṭhitassa tassa saraṇagamanaṃ pavedayitassa kusalaṃ saraṇaṃ nāma, mātu katarakkho
analyzed: gabbha vuṭṭhitassa tassa saraṇa gamanam pavedayitassa kusalam saraṇam nāma mātu kata rakkhaḥ
translated: When the child is born, the mother announces the child’s refuge. The child’s wholesome refuge is the mother’s refuge.🔽The protection is set up for the child.

original: puttassapi paccupaṭṭhitoti. Mahallakakāleti vacanatthaṃ jānanakāle. Sārentīti yathādiṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: puttassa api paccupaṭṭhitaḥ ti mahallaka kāle iti vacana attham jānana kāle sārenti iti yathādiṭṭham
translated: “When they know the meaning of the words ‘greatly extended’” means when they know the meaning of the words “greatly extended.”

original: yathābalaṃ ratanattayaguṇapatiṭṭhāpanavasena assa sārenti. Sallakkhetvāti vuttamatthaṃ
analyzed: yathābalam rata nattaya guṇa patiṭṭhāpana vasena assa sārenti sallakkhetvā iti vuttam attham
translated: “They extend it” means they establish it in the qualities of the Triple Gem according to their understanding and ability.🔽“Having considered” means having remembered the meaning stated.

original: upadhāretvā. Saraṇaṃ gahitaṃ nāma hoti ratanattayassa saraṇabhāvasallakkhaṇapubbakatanninnacittabhāvatova.
analyzed: upadhāretvā saraṇam gahitam nāma hoti rata nattayassa saraṇa bhāva sat lakkhaṇa pubbaka tad ninna citta bhāvataḥ uva
translated: The refuge is taken when the Triple Gem is considered as the refuge, and the mind is inclined to it.

original: Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: Bodhirājakumārasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: bodhirājakumāra sutta vaṇṇanāya līnattha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the brief statement in the story of Prince Bodhi is finished.

original: 6. Aṅgulimālasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aṅgulimāla sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Story of Angulimala

original: 347. Aṅgulīnaṃ mālaṃ dhāretīti iminā anvatthā tassa samaññāti dasseti. Tatrāti tasmiṃ
analyzed: aṅgulīnam mālam dhāreti iti iminā anvatthā tassa samaññā ati dasseti tatra ati tasmin
translated: By the words “he wore a garland of fingers” he shows that he was known by that name. “There” means in that

original: ācariyavacanena aṅgulimālassa dhāraṇe. Karīsasahassakhette ekasālisīsaṃ viya apaññāyamānasakakicco🔽hotīti adhippāyo. Takkasīlaṃ pesayiṃsu “tādisassa ācariyassa santike sippuggahasammāpayogena
analyzed: ācariya vacanena aṅguli mālassa dhāraṇe karīsa sahassa khette eka sāli sīsam viya a paññāyamāna saka kicco  hoti iti adhippāyaḥ takka sīlam pesayiṃsu tādisassa ācariyassa santike sippuggaha sammāpayogena
translated: matter of wearing the garland of fingers as a teacher’s instruction. The intention is that he was of no use to anyone, like a single grain of rice in a field of a thousand threshing floors.

original: diṭṭhadhammike samparāyike ca atthe jānanto bhāriyaṃ na kareyyā”ti. Bāhirakā ahesuṃ
analyzed: diṭṭhadhammike samparāyike ca atthe jānantaḥ bhāriyam na kareyya iti bāhirakāḥ ahesuṃ
translated: They sent Takkasila to him, saying: “Knowing the worldly and supramundane benefits by the proper application of learning in the presence of such a teacher, one would not do what is heavy.” They were outsiders

original: ahiṃsakassa vattasampattiyā ācariyassa cittasabhāvato nibbattanatibhāvena. Sineheneva
analyzed: ahiṃsakassa vatta sampattiyā ācariyassa citta sabhāvataḥ nibbatta nati bhāvena sinehena iva
translated: because of the teacher’s perfection in conduct as a harmless man, and because of the non-existence of the state of being born from his mind. They spoke as if with affection

original: vadanteti sinehena viya vadante.
analyzed: vadantā iti sinehena viya vadante
translated: because of their affection.

original: Gaṇanampi na uggaṇhātīti gaṇanavidhimpi na sallakkheti. Tattha kāraṇamāha “pakatiyā”tiādinā.
analyzed: gaṇanam pi na uggaṇhāti iti gaṇana vidhim pi na sallakkheti tattha kāraṇam āha pakatiyā iti ādinā
translated: “He did not learn even the counting” means he did not consider even the method of counting. There he gives the reason with “naturally” and so on.

original: Ṭhapitaṭṭhāneti rukkhagacchantarādike ṭhapitaṭṭhāne sakuntasiṅgālānaṃ vasena aṅguliyo
analyzed: ṭhapita ṭhāna iti rukkha gacchantara ādike ṭhapita ṭhāne sa kunta siṅgālānam vasena aṅguliyaḥ
translated: “The place where he left them” means the place where he left the fingers, such as in the middle of a tree or a road, because of the presence of birds and jackals.

original: vinassanti. Bhaggavoti kosalarañño purohitaṃ gottena vadati. Coro avissāsanīyo sāhasikabhāvato.
analyzed: vinassanti bhaggavo ti kosala raññaḥ purohitam gottena vadati coraḥ a vissāsanīyaḥ sāhasika bhāvato
translated: will perish. ‘The brahmin’: he refers to the king’s chaplain by his clan name. ‘The thief should not be trusted’ because of his violence.

original: Purāṇasanthatā sākhā avissāsanīyā vicchikādīnaṃ pavesanayogyattā. Rājā avissāsanīyo
analyzed: purāṇa santhatā sākhā a vissāsanīyā vicchika ādīnam pavesana yogya tā rājā a vissāsanīyaḥ
translated: ‘The old tree’s branches’: they should not be trusted because they are suitable for entry by scorpions, etc. ‘The king should not be trusted’

original: issariyamadena dhanalobhena ca kadāci jīvite saṅkābhāvato. Itthī avissāsanīyā lolasīlacittabhāvato.
analyzed: issariya madena dhana lobhena ca kadāci jīvite saṅkā bhāvataḥ itthī a vissāsanīyā lola sīla citta bhāvataḥ
translated: because of the danger to life at times when he is intoxicated with sovereignty and greedy for wealth. ‘The woman should not be trusted’ because of her fickle nature and her fickle mind.

original: Anuddharaṇīyo bhavissati saṃsārapaṅkato.
analyzed: an uddharaṇīyaḥ bhavissati saṃsāra paṅkataḥ
translated: ‘He will not be rescued’ from the mire of the round of rebirths.

original: 348. Saṅkaritvāti “mayaṃ ekajjhaṃ sannipatitvā coraṃ māretvā vā palāpetvā gamissāmā”ti
analyzed: saṅkaritvā ati mayam ekajjham sannipatitvā coram māretvā vā palāpetvā gamissāma ati
translated: ‘Having combined’: having made a combination, thinking, ‘We will kill the thief or drive him away after we have gathered together in one place.’

original: saṅkaraṃ katvā. Iddhābhisaṅkhāranti abhisaṅkharaṇaṃ adhiṭṭhānaṃ. Abhisaṅkhāsīti adhiṭṭhahi.
analyzed: saṅkaram katvā abhisaṅkharaṇam adhiṭṭhānam abhisaṅkhāsi iti adhiṭṭhahi
translated: ‘Resolution’: determination, resolve. ‘He resolved’: he determined.

original: Saṃharitvāti saṃkhipitvā. Orabhāgeti corassa orabhāge.
analyzed: saṃharitvā iti saṃkhipitvā ora bhāge iti ca urassaḥ ora bhāge
translated: ‘Having collected’: having gathered together. ‘In the front’: in the front of the thief.

original: 349. Daṇḍoti paharaṇahatthacchedanādiko daṇḍanasaṅkhāto daṇḍo. Pavattayitabboti ānetabbo.
analyzed: daṇḍo ti paharaṇa hattha chedana ādikaḥ daṇḍana saṅkhātaḥ daṇḍo pavattayitabbo ti ānetabbo
translated: ‘Punishment’: the punishment called ‘cutting off the hand’ that is inflicted as a penalty. ‘Should be carried out’: should be brought about.

original: Apanetvāti attano santānato samucchedavasena pahāya. Paṭisaṅkhāyāti paṭisaṅkhānena.
analyzed: apanetvā iti attano santānataḥ samuccheda vasena pahāya paṭisaṅkhāya ati paṭisaṅkhānena
translated: ‘Having abandoned’: having given up, having cut off from his own continuity. ‘Having reflected’: by means of reflection.

original: Avihiṃsāyāti karuṇāya. Sāraṇīyadhammesūti chasupi sāraṇīyadhammesu, ṭhito aṭṭhitānaṃ
analyzed: avihiṃsāya ati karuṇāya sāraṇīya dhammesu ti chasu pi sāraṇīya dhammesu ṭhitaḥ a ṭhitānam
translated: ‘Non-violence’: by means of compassion. ‘In the things that lead to endearment’: in the six things that lead to endearment. ‘Standing’: those who are not standing

original: pāpadhammānaṃ bodhimūle eva samucchinnattā. Yathā atīte aparimitaṃ kālaṃ sandhāvitaṃ,
analyzed: pāpa dhammānam bodhi mūle eva yathā atīte aparimitam kālam sandhāvitam
translated: at the foot of the Bodhi Tree have already cut off evil things. ‘As he has wandered’: as he has wandered for an immeasurable time in the past,

original: evaṃ imāya paṭipattiyā anāgatepi sandhāvissatīti dassento “idānī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: evam imāya paṭipattiyā anāgate pi sandhāvissati iti dassentaḥ idāni iti ādim āha
translated: so he will wander in the future by means of this practice. Showing this, the Exalted One says ‘Now.’

original: Itvevāti iti eva, iti-saddo nidassanattho. Tenāha “evaṃ vatvā yevā”ti. Akirīti ākiri, pañcapi āvudhāni vikiri. Tena vuttaṃ “khipi chaḍḍesī”ti.🔽350. Ettovāti ato eva āgatamaggeneva sāvatthiṃ gatā. Adhivāsessatīti “coraṃ paṭisedhetuṃ
analyzed: itu eva ati iti eva iti saddaḥ nidassana atthaḥ tena āha evam vatvā yā iva ati akiri iti ākiri tena vuttam khipi chaḍḍesi iti  ettas vā ati atas eva āgata maggena iva sāvatthim gatā adhivāsessati iti coram paṭisedhetum
translated: ‘Just so’: just this, just this. The word iti has the sense of indication. Therefore he says ‘having spoken thus, just so.’ ‘He hurled’: he hurled, he scattered the five weapons. Therefore it is said ‘he threw, he cast away.’

original: gamissāmī”ti vutte tuṇhī bhavissati. Dāruṇakammena uppannanāmanti “aṅgulimālo”ti🔽imaṃ nāmaṃ sandhāya vadati.
analyzed: gamissāmi iti vutte tuṇhī bhavissati dāruṇa kammena uppanna nāmanti aṅgulimālo ti 🔽imam nāmam sandhāya vadati
translated: ‘From here’: from here, from the path he came by. ‘To Savatthi’: they went to Savatthi. ‘He will consent’: if it is said ‘I will go to stop the thief,’ he will remain silent. ‘The name that arose from a terrible deed’: he speaks with reference to the name ‘Aṅgulimāla.’

original: 351. Hatthī araññahatthī honti manussānaṃ tattha gantuṃ asakkuṇeyyattā, evaṃ assāpi.
analyzed: hatthī arañña hatthī honti manussānam tattha gantum a sakkuṇeyya ttā evam assa api
translated: Elephants are wild elephants because people cannot go there. So too with horses.

original: Kūṭasahassānaṃ bhijjanakāraṇaṃ hoti therassa āgamanabhayena ghaṭe chaḍḍetvā palāyanena.🔽Gabbhamūḷhāyāti byākulagabbhāya. Pabbajjābalenāti vuttaṃ, satthu desanānubhāvenāti
analyzed: kūṭa sahassānam bhijjana kāraṇam hoti therassa āgamana bhayena ghaṭe chaḍḍetvā palāyanena  gabbha mūḷhāya ati byākula gabbhāya pabbajjā balena ati vuttam satthu desanā anubhāvena ati
translated: It is the cause of the breaking up of a thousand stakes because of the running away of the herdsmen after throwing down their stakes through fear of the elder’s arrival.🔽“Pregnant and barren” : the meaning is, “pregnant and with an undeveloped embryo.” “The power of the going forth” : this is said because of the power of the Teacher’s teaching.

original: pana vattabbaṃ. So hi tassāpi kāraṇanti. Ariyā nāma jāti pabbajjā ariyabhāvatthāya jātīti katvā.
analyzed: pana vattabbam so hi tassa api kāraṇan ti ariyā nāma jāti pabbajjā ariya bhāva tthāya jāti iti katvā
translated: For that was the cause of her going forth. “Noble” : the meaning is, “born in the Noble One’s family, born for the purpose of attaining the Noble One’s state.”

original: Mahāparittaṃ nāmetanti mahānubhāvaṃ parittaṃ nāmetaṃ. Tathā hi naṃ thero sabbabhāvena
analyzed: mahāparittam nāma etat ti mahā anubhāvam parittam nāma etat tathā hi nam theraḥ sabba bhāvena
translated: “The Great Protection” : this is a protection of great efficacy. For the elder made it entirely

original: ariyāya jāto saccādhiṭṭhānena akāsi. Tenāha “saccakiriyakataṭṭhāne”ti. Gabbhamūḷhanti
analyzed: ariyāya jātaḥ sacca adhiṭṭhānena akāsi tena āha sacca kiriya kata ṭṭhāna iti gabbha mūḷhanti
translated: noble by means of the foundation of truth, which is noble. Therefore he said, “In the place where the truth-act was performed.” “Pregnant and barren” :

original: mūḷhagabbhaṃ. Gabbho hi paripakko sampajjamāno vijāyanakāle kammajavātehi sañcāletvā🔽parivattito uddhaṃpādo adhosīso hutvā yonimukhābhimukho hoti, evaṃ so kassaci alaggo
analyzed: mūḷha gabbham gabbhaḥ hi paripakkaḥ sampajjamānaḥ vijāyana kāle kamma ja vātehi sañcāletvā 🔽parivattitaḥ uddhaṃpādaḥ adhosīsaḥ hutvā yonimukha abhimukhaḥ hoti evam so kassaci a laggo
translated: barren with an undeveloped embryo. For when the embryo is ripe and about to be delivered, it is moved by the winds of kamma and,🔽being turned over and over, it comes to face the door of the womb with its head pointing downward. But in this case it did not do so.

original: sotthinā bahi nikkhamati, vipajjamāno pana viparivattanavasena yonimaggaṃ pidahitvā🔽tiriyaṃ nipajjati, tathā yassā yonimaggo pidahati, sā tattha kammajavātehi aparāparaṃ🔽parivattamānā byākulā mūḷhagabbhāti vuccati, taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “gabbhamūḷha”nti.🔽Saccakiriyā nāma buddhāsayaṃ attano sīlaṃ paccavekkhitvā katā, tasmā saccakiriyā
analyzed: sotthinā bahi nikkhamati vipajjamānaḥ pana viparivattana vasena yonimaggam pidahitvā  tiriyam nipajjati tathā yassā yoni maggo pidahati sā tattha kamma ja vātehi apara aparam  parivattamānā byākulā mūḷhagabbhā iti vuccati tam sandhāya vuttam gabbha mūḷham ti  saccakiriyā nāma buddha asayam attano sīlam paccavekkhitvā katā tasmai saccakiriyā
translated: and comes out safely, but when it is turning round to come out, it may block the womb-door by turning sideways,🔽and then it lies there. So too, if the womb-door is blocked, it is said to be “confused in the womb,” and it is said of it that “it lies there confused and bewildered in the womb, being turned round and round by the winds of kamma that arise from time to time.”🔽“Act of truth”: this is when one who has the Buddha for his object reviews his own virtue and then does it. So it is said:

original: vejjakammaṃ na hotīti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Therassapi cātiādinā upasaṅkamitabbakāraṇaṃ vadati.🔽Ime dve hetū paṭicca bhagavā theraṃ saccakiriyaṃ kāresi. Jātinti mūlajātiṃ.🔽352. Pariyādāya āhacca bhinnena sīsena. Sabhāgadiṭṭhadhammavedanīyakammanti niraye🔽nibbattanasakakammasabhāgabhūtaṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyakammaṃ. Sabhāgatā ca samānavatthukatā
analyzed: vejja kammam na hoti iti daṭṭhabbam therassa api ca ati ādinā upasaṅkamitabba kāraṇam vadati 🔽ime dve hetū paṭicca bhagavā theram saccakiriyam kāresi mūla jātim 🔽pariyādāya āhacca bhinnena sīsena sa bhāga diṭṭha dhamma vedanīya kammanti niraye 🔽nibbattana saka kamma sabhāga bhūtam diṭṭhadhamma vedanīya kammam sabhāga tā ca samāna vatthuka tā
translated: If he comes out safely, he is called “one who has come out well.” But if he is deformed, he is called “one who has come out deformed.” If he is dead, he is called “one who has come out dead.” If he is dead and putrid, he is called “one who has come out putrid.” If he is dead and putrid and his mother dies because of it, he is called “one who has come out and killed his mother.” If he is dead and putrid and his mother dies because of it, and his father dies because of it, he is called “one who has come out and killed his mother and father.” If he is dead and putrid and his mother dies because of it, and his mother’s twin sister becomes pregnant and gives birth to him, he is called “one who has come out and killed his mother’s twin sister’s child.” If he is dead and putrid and his mother dies because of it, and his mother’s twin sister becomes pregnant and gives birth to him, and his mother’s twin sister dies because of it, he is called “one who has come out and killed his mother’s twin sister and her child.” If he is dead and putrid and his mother dies because of it, and his mother’s twin sister becomes pregnant and gives birth to him, and his mother’s twin sister dies because of it, and his mother’s twin sister’s child dies because of it, he is called “one who has come out and killed his mother’s twin sister, her child, and her child’s child.” If he is dead and putrid and his mother dies because of it, and his mother’s twin sister becomes pregnant and gives birth to him, and his mother’s twin sister dies because of it, and his mother’s twin sister’s child dies because of it, and his mother’s twin sister’s child’s child dies because of it, he is called “one who has come out and killed his mother’s twin sister, her child, her child’s child, and her child’s child’s child.” If he is dead and putrid and his mother dies because of it, and his mother’s twin sister becomes pregnant and gives birth to him, and his mother’s twin sister dies because of it, and his mother’s twin sister’s child dies because of it, and his mother’s twin

original: samānārammaṇatāekavīthipariyāpannatādivasena sabbathā sarikkhatā, sadisampi ca nāma
analyzed: samāna ārammaṇa tā eka vīthi pariyāpanna tā ādi vasena sabbathā sa rikkha tā sadisam pi ca nāma
translated: The similarity is in all respects, that is to say, in having a common object, in being included in a single cognitive series, and so on. And what is called “similar”

original: tadevāharīyati yathā “tasseva kammassa vipāko”ti ca “sā eva tittirī tāneva osadhānī”ti
analyzed: tat eva āharīyati yathā tassa iva kammassa ca sā eva tittirī tān eva osadhāni iti
translated: is just that, as in the passage “The ripening of that same kamma” , and in the passage “That same partridge, those same herbs” .

original: ca. Idāni tameva sabhāgataṃ dassetuṃ “kammaṃ hī”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Kariyamānamevāti🔽paccayasamavāyena paṭipāṭiyā nibbattiyamānameva. Tayo koṭṭhāse pūreti, diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaaparāpariyāyavedanīyaupapajjavedanīyasaṅkhāte
analyzed: ca idāni tam eva sabhā gatam dassetum kammam hi itiādi āraddham kariyamānam eva ati  paccaya samavāyena paṭipāṭiyā nibbattiyamānam eva tayo koṭṭhāse pūreti diṭṭhadhamma vedanīya apara apariyāya vedanīya upapajja vedanīya saṅkhāte
translated: Now, in order to show that very similarity, the following is begun: “For kamma, when being done” .🔽When being done: when being produced in succession by the concurrence of conditions.🔽It fills three compartments: it fills the three portions called “to be experienced here and now,” “to be experienced in the next existence,” and “to be experienced in some future existence.”

original: tayo bhāge pūreti, tesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ bhāgānaṃ vasena pavattati.🔽Diṭṭhadhammo vuccati paccakkhabhūto paccuppanno attabhāvo, tattha veditabbaphalaṃ
analyzed: tayaḥ bhāge pūreti tesam tiṇṇam bhāgānam vasena pavattati  diṭṭhadhammo vuccati paccakkha bhūto paccuppannaḥ attabhāvo tattha veditabba phalam
translated: It occurs by means of those three portions.🔽The present state of being is called the present visible world. The fruit to be experienced there is

original: kammaṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ. Paccuppannabhavato anantaraṃ veditabbaphalaṃ kammaṃ
analyzed: kammam diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyam paccuppanna bhavataḥ anantaram veditabba phalam kammam
translated: kamma to be experienced here and now. Kamma to be experienced in the next existence is that the fruit of which is to be experienced in the next existence following the present one.

original: upapajjavedanīyaṃ. Diṭṭhadhammānantarabhavato aññasmiṃ attabhāvapariyāye attabhāvaparivatte
analyzed: upapajja vedanīyam diṭṭha dhamma anantara bhavataḥ aññasmin atta bhāva pariyāye atta bhāva parivatte
translated: and kamma that is to be experienced in the next rebirth.🔽Kamma that is to be experienced in some future life is kamma that is to be experienced in a future existence other than the next, in a different continuity of aggregates, in a different rebirth-linking.

original: veditabbaphalaṃ kammaṃ aparāpariyāyavedanīyaṃ. Paṭipakkhehi anabhibhūtatāya, paccayavisesena🔽paṭiladdhavisesatāya ca balavabhāvappattā tādisassa pubbābhisaṅkhārassa vasena sātisayā
analyzed: veditabba phalam kammam apara apariyāya vedanīyam paṭipakkhehi anabhibhūta tāya paccaya visesena  paṭiladdha visesa tāya ca balava bhāva ppattā tādisassa pubba abhisaṅkhārassa vasena sa atisayā
translated: Kamma that is to be experienced in accordance with the sequence of lives is kamma that is to be experienced in a future existence other than the next, in a different continuity of aggregates, in a different rebirth-linking, but in a sequence of lives that is not confused.

original: hutvā pavattā paṭhamajavanacetanā tasmiṃyeva attabhāve phaladāyinī diṭṭhadhammavedanīyā🔽nāma. Sā hi vuttākārena balavati javanasantāne guṇavisesayuttesu upakārānupakāravasappavattiyā
analyzed: hutvā pavattā paṭhama javana cetanā tasmin yeva atta bhāve phala dāyinī diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyā  nāma sā hi vuttā ākārena balavati javana santāne guṇa visesa yuttesu upakāra anupakāra vasa ppavattiyā
translated: Kamma that is to be experienced in this very life is the first javana volition that occurs in excess in the javana process of such a previous formation, which gives its fruit in that same continuity of aggregates.🔽For that is strong in the way already stated, and it is not kamma that is to be experienced in a future existence, in a future rebirth, or in a future continuity of aggregates, because it is incapable of giving fruit in the way already stated.🔽It is not kamma that is to be experienced in accordance with the sequence of lives, because it is incapable of giving fruit in a confused sequence of lives.🔽It is not kamma that is to be experienced in the next rebirth, because it is incapable of giving fruit in the next rebirth.

original: āsevanālābhena appavipākatāya ca itaradvayaṃ viya pavattasantānuparamāpekkhaṃ okāsalābhāpekkhañca
analyzed: āsevana alābhena appa vipāka tāya ca itara dvayam viya pavatta santa anuparama apekkham okāsa lābha apekkham ca
translated: It is not kamma that is to be experienced in some future life, because it is incapable of giving fruit in a future existence other than the next, in a different continuity of aggregates, in a different rebirth-linking.🔽It is not kamma that is to be experienced in accordance with the sequence of lives, because it is incapable of giving fruit in a confused sequence of lives.

original: kammaṃ na hotīti idheva pupphamattaṃ viya pavattivipākamattaṃ phalaṃ deti.
analyzed: kammam na hoti iti idha iva puppha mattam viya pavatti vipāka mattam phalam deti
translated: It is not kamma that is to be experienced in the next rebirth, because it is incapable of giving fruit in the next rebirth.🔽It is not kamma that is to be experienced in some future life, because it is incapable of giving fruit in a future existence other than the next, in a different continuity of aggregates, in a different rebirth-linking.🔽It is not kamma that is to be experienced in accordance with the sequence of lives, because it is incapable of giving fruit in a confused sequence of lives.🔽It is not kamma that is to be experienced in the next rebirth, because it is incapable of giving fruit in the next rebirth.🔽It is not kamma that is to be experienced in some future life, because it is incapable of giving fruit in a future existence

original: Tathā asakkontanti kammassa phaladānaṃ nāma upadhipayogādipaccayantarasamavāyeneva🔽hotīti tadabhāvato tasmiṃyeva attabhāve vipākaṃ dātuṃ asakkontaṃ. Ahosikammanti kammaṃyeva🔽ahosi, na tassa vipāko ahosi, atthi bhavissati vāti evaṃ vattabbaṃ kammaṃ. Atthasādhikāti
analyzed: tathā asakkontanti kammassa phala dānam nāma upadhi payoga ādi paccaya ntara samavāyena iva  hoti iti tad abhāvataḥ tasmin yeva atta bhāve vipākam dātum a sakkontam kammaṃyeva  ahosi na tassa vipākaḥ ahosi atthi bhavissati vā ti evam vattabbam kammam attha sādhikā ti
translated: And unable to do so: the giving of the fruit of the action is only by the concurrence of other conditions, such as the presence of the aggregates, etc.,

original: dānādipāṇātipātādiatthassa nipphādikā. Kā pana sāti āha “sattamajavanacetanā”ti.🔽Sā hi sanniṭṭhāpakacetanā vuttanayena paṭiladdhavisesā purimajavanacetanāhi laddhāsevanā🔽ca samānā anantare attabhāve vipākadāyinī upapajjavedanīyakammaṃ nāma. Tenāha “anantare🔽attabhāve vipākaṃ detī”ti. Sati saṃsārappavattiyāti iminā asati saṃsārappavattiyā
analyzed: dāna ādi pāṇātipāta ādi atthassa nipphādikā kā pana sā ati āha sattama javana cetanā iti  sā hi sanniṭṭhāpaka cetanā vutta nayena paṭiladdha visesā purima javana cetanāhi laddha āsevanā  ca samānā anantare atta bhāve vipāka dāyinī upapajjavedanīya kammam nāma tena āha anantare  atta bhāve vipākam deti iti sati saṃsāra ppavattiyā ati iminā asati saṃsāra ppavattiyā
translated: and so it is unable to give its ripening in that same individual existence because those conditions are absent. The action was: the action only was, but its ripening was not; the action should be spoken of thus: “It was, it will be.” It is productive of welfare: it is productive of the welfare consisting in giving, etc., and of the non-welfare consisting in killing living beings, etc. But what is that? He said: “The seventh impulsion- volition.”🔽For that is the decisive-support volition. And it is the kind of action called “kamma that is to be experienced after rebirth” since it gives its ripening in the next individual existence, having acquired distinction in the way already stated and having acquired repetition by the preceding impulsion-volitions. Hence he said: “It gives its ripening in the next individual existence.”

original: ahosikammapakkhe tiṭṭhati vipaccanokāsassa abhāvatoti.
analyzed: ahosikamma pakkhe tiṭṭhati vipaccanokāsassa abhāvato ti
translated: As long as there is the occurrence of the round: by this he shows that it remains on the side of the action that was, because there is no opportunity for its ripening as long as there is the occurrence of the round, which is the condition for the giving of the ripening.

original: Samugghāṭitāni vipaccanokāsassa anuppattidhammatāpādanena. Diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ🔽atthi vipākārahābhāvassa anibbattitattā vipaccanokāsassa anupacchinnattā. Katūpacitañhi
analyzed: samugghāṭitāni vipacca nokāsassa an uppatti dhamma tā āpādanena diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyam  atthi vipāka araha abhāvassa a nibbattita ttā vipacca nokāsassa an upacchinna ttā kata upacitam hi
translated: They are “unbarred” by making it impossible for the opportunity to arise for the ripening of the kamma.🔽The kamma that is to be experienced in this very life exists as long as the opportunity for its ripening has not been cut off.

original: kammaṃ sati vipaccanokāse yāva na phalaṃ deti, tāva attheva nāma vipākārahabhāvato.🔽“Yassa kho”ti idaṃ aniyamākāravacanaṃ bhagavatā kammasarikkhatāvasena sādhāraṇato
analyzed: kammam sati vipacca nokāse yāva na phalam deti tāva attha iva nāma vipāka araha bhāvato  yassa kho ti idam aniyama ākāra vacanam bhagavatā kamma sarikkha tā vasena sādhāraṇato
translated: For kamma that has been stored up exists as long as it has not given its fruit, and it is called “existing” because it is capable of giving fruit.🔽“If anyone” is said by the Blessed One in the sense of a general statement, in order to show that the kamma is similar to the kamma-result.

original: vuttanti āha “yādisassa kho”ti.
analyzed: vuttanti āha yādisassa kho ti
translated: “If anyone” is said in the sense of a particular statement, in order to show that the kamma-result is similar to the kamma.

original: Pamādakilesavimuttoti pamādahetukehi sabbehi kilesehi vimutto.
analyzed: pamāda kilesa vimuttaḥ ti pamāda hetukehi sabbehi kilesehi vimuttaḥ
translated: “Freed from the defilement of negligence” means freed from all the defilements that have negligence as their root.

original: Pāpassa pidhānaṃ nāma avipākadhammatāpādananti āha “appaṭisandhikaṃ karīyatī”ti.
analyzed: pāpassa pidhānam nāma a vipāka dhamma tā āpādananti āha appaṭisandhikam karīyati iti
translated: “The bar is lifted” means that the kamma is made incapable of ripening.

original: Buddhasāsaneti sikkhāttayasaṅgahe buddhassa bhagavato sāsane. Yuttappayutto viharatīti
analyzed: buddha sāsane iti sikkhā ttaya saṅgahe buddhassa bhagavato sāsane yutta ppayuttaḥ viharati iti
translated: “In the Dispensation of the Buddha” means in the Dispensation of the Blessed One, which is included in the Three Trainings.

original: akattabbassa akaraṇavasena, kattabbassa ca paripūraṇavasena pavattati.
analyzed: a kattabbassa a karaṇa vasena kattabbassa ca paripūraṇa vasena pavattati
translated: “He lives in conformity with the practice” means that he lives by the practice of not doing what should not be done and by the practice of fulfilling what should be done.

original: Dissanti kujjhantīti disā, paṭipakkhāti āha “sapattā”ti. Tappasaṃsapakāranti mettānisaṃsakittanākāraṃ.🔽Kālenāti āmeḍitalopena niddesoti āha “khaṇe khaṇe”ti. Anukarontūti yesaṃ kalyāṇamittānaṃ
analyzed: dissanti kujjhanti iti disā paṭipakkhā ti āha sa pattā ati tad pasaṃsa pakāram ti mettā nisaṃsa kittana ākāram  kālena ati āma īḍita lopena niddeso ti āha khaṇe khaṇe iti anukarontu iti yesam kalyāṇa mittānam
translated: “They are seen to be angry” : the directions are so called because of the presence of enemies in the directions opposite to the cardinal directions. “The praise of ascetics” : the praise of the benefits of loving-kindness.

original: santike suṇanti, yathāsutaṃ dhammaṃ tesaṃ anukarontu diṭṭhānugatikaraṇaṃ āpajjantu,
analyzed: santike suṇanti yathāsutam dhammam tesam anukarontu diṭṭha anugati karaṇam āpajjantu
translated: “In time” : the word kālena is a demonstrative pronoun referring to the present moment. “May they follow” : may they follow the good friends in whose presence they hear the Dhamma. May they practice in accordance with what they have heard.

original: attano veripuggalānampi bhagavato santike dhammassavanaṃ sammāpaṭipattiñca paccāsīsati.
analyzed: attanaḥ veri puggalānam pi bhagavato santike dhammassavanam sammāpaṭipattiñca paccāsīsati
translated: He wishes that even his enemies may listen to the Dhamma and practice rightly in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: Tasanti gatiṃ patthayantīti tasā bhavantarādīsu saṃsaraṇabhāvato. Tenāha “tasā vuccanti sataṇhā”ti.
analyzed: tasanti gatim patthayanti iti tasāḥ bhavantara ādīsu saṃsaraṇa bhāvato tena āha tasāḥ vuccanti sa taṇhā ti
translated: “Those who are tormented” : they are called “tormented” because of their state of wandering in the round of rebirths in the various realms of existence. Thus he says: “Those who are tormented are called those who have craving.”

original: Netabbaṭṭhānaṃ udakaṃ nayantīti nettikā. Bandhitvāti daḷhaṃ bandhitvā. Telakañjikenāti telamissitena kañjikena.
analyzed: netabba ṭṭhānam udakam nayanti iti nettikāḥ bandhitvā ati daḷham bandhitvā tela kañjikena ati tela missitena kañjikena
translated: “Water-carriers” : they carry water to the place where it is to be used. “Bound” : bound tightly. “With sour gruel mixed with oil” : with sour gruel mixed with oil.

original: Yādisova aniṭṭhe, tādisova iṭṭheti iṭṭhāniṭṭhe nibbikārena tādī. Yesaṃ pana kāmāmisādīnaṃ
analyzed: yādiso uva aniṭṭhe tādiso uva iṭṭhe iti iṭṭha aniṭṭhe nibbikārena yesam pana kāma āmisa ādīnam
translated: “The same with regard to the desirable and the undesirable” : they are the same with regard to the desirable and the undesirable without partiality. But those who are attached to sense pleasures, etc.

original: vantattā rāgādīnaṃ cattattā kāmoghādīnaṃ tiṇṇattā tādibhāvo bhaveyya, tesaṃ bhagavatā
analyzed: vantattā rāga ādīnam cattattā kā mogha ādīnam tiṇṇattā tādi bhāvaḥ bhaveyya tesam bhagavatā
translated: He would be such because of his having vomited, his having cut off, his having crossed over, lust, etc., the cankers of sensual pleasure, etc.🔽The Exalted One has vomited them all, cut them off, crossed over them,

original: sabbaso vantā cattā tiṇṇā, tasmā bhagavā vantāvīti tādī, cattāvīti tādī, tiṇṇāvīti🔽tādī, yehi anaññasādhāraṇehi sīlādiguṇehi samannāgatattā bhagavā tādibhāvena ukkaṃsapāramippatto
analyzed: sabbasas vantā cattā tiṇṇā tasmai bhagavā vantāvī iti tādī cattāvī iti tādī tiṇṇāvī iti  tādī yehi anañña sādhāraṇehi sīla ādi guṇehi samannāgata ttā bhagavā ta ādi bhāvena ukkaṃsa pārami ppatto
translated: therefore he is such because of his having vomited, because of his having cut off, because of his having crossed over.🔽He is such because of his having attained the perfection of excellence by virtue of his being endowed with such virtues as virtue, etc., which are not shared by others.

original: taṃniddeso, tehi guṇehi yāthāvato niddisitabbatopi tādī. Yathā yantarajjuyā yantaṃ
analyzed: taṃ niddesaḥ tehi guṇehi yāthāvataḥ tādī yathā yanta rajjuyā yantam
translated: He is such because of his being able to be pointed out by those virtues.

original: nīyati, evaṃ yāya taṇhāya bhavo nīyati, sā “bhavanetti bhavarajjū”ti vuttā. Tenāha
analyzed: nīyati evam yāya taṇhāya bhavaḥ nīyati sā bhavanā itti bhava rajjū iti vuttā tena āha
translated: Just as a machine is guided by a rope, so is existence guided by craving. Therefore craving is called “the guide to existence, the rope of existence.”🔽Therefore he said, “By that” and so on.

original: “tāya hī”tiādi, kammāni kusalādīni vipaccayanti apaccayanti etāyāti kammavipāko.
analyzed: tāya hi itiādi kammāni kusala ādīni vipaccayanti apaccayanti etāya ati kamma vipāko
translated: The ripening of kamma, good, etc., is called “the ripening of kamma” because it ripens, i.e., produces its fruit, by that .🔽The state of non-ripening is the volition of the noble path. Therefore he said, “by the volition of the path.”

original: Apaccayabhāvo nāma ariyamaggacetanāyāti āha “maggacetanāyā”ti. Yāva na kilesā pahīyanti,
analyzed: apaccaya bhāvaḥ nāma ariya magga cetanāya ati āha magga cetanāya ati yāva na kilesā pahīyanti
translated: As long as the defilements are not abandoned,

original: tāva ime sattā saiṇā eva aserivihārabhāvatoti āha “aṇaṇo nikkileso jāto”ti.
analyzed: tāva ime sattā saiṇāḥ eva aseri vihāra bhāvataḥ ti āha aṇaṇaḥ nikkilesaḥ jātaḥ iti
translated: beings are still in debt, because they have not yet lived the life free from debt. Therefore he said, “he has become debtless, free from defilement.”

original: Theyyaparibhogo nāma sāmiparibhogābhāvato. Bhagavatāpi hi attano sāsane sīlavato
analyzed: theyya paribhogaḥ nāma sāmi paribhoga abhāvataḥ bhagavatā api hi attano sāsane
translated: “Use as theft” is so called because there is no use by the owner. For the requisites are allowed by the Blessed One to one who is virtuous

original: paccayā anuññātā, na dussīlassa, dāyakānaṃ sīlavatoyeva pariccāgo, na dussīlassa🔽attano kārānaṃ mahapphalabhāvassa paccāsīsanato. Iti satthārā ananuññātattā dāyakehi
analyzed: paccayāḥ anuññātāḥ na dussīlassa dāyakānam sīlavato yeva pariccāgaḥ na dussīlassa  attano kārānam mahapphala bhāvassa paccāsīsanato iti satthārā an anuññāta ttā dāyakehi
translated: in his dispensation, not to one who is not virtuous. And the giving of the donors is only to one who is virtuous, not to one who is not virtuous,

original: ca apariccattattā “dussīlassa paribhogo theyyaparibhogo nāmā”ti vuttaṃ. Iṇavasena
analyzed: ca a pariccatta ttā dussīlassa paribhogaḥ theyya paribhogaḥ nāma ati vuttam iṇa vasena
translated: because it is the donors who are grateful for the great fruit of their own action. So it is said that “the use of one who is not virtuous is called use as theft” because it is not allowed by the Blessed One and because it is not given by donors.

original: paribhogo iṇaparibhogo. Paṭiggāhakato dakkhiṇāvisuddhiyā abhāvato iṇaṃ gahetvā paribhogo
analyzed: paribhogaḥ iṇa paribhogaḥ paṭiggāhakataḥ dakkhiṇā visuddhiyāḥ abhāvataḥ iṇam gahetvā paribhogaḥ
translated: “Use as debt” is so called because it is used like a debt. The meaning is that it is used like a debt owing because there is no purification of offering on the part of the receiver.

original: viyāti attho. Yasmā sekkhā bhagavato orasaputtā, tasmā te pitusantakānaṃ paccayānaṃ🔽dāyādā hutvā te paccaye paribhuñjantīti tesaṃ paribhogo dāyajjaparibhogo nāma. Kiṃ
analyzed: viya ati atthaḥ yasmā sekkhā bhagavataḥ orasa puttā tasmā te pitu santakānam  dāyādāḥ hutvā te paccaye paribhuñjanti iti tesam paribhogaḥ dāyajja paribhogaḥ nāma kim
translated: Since the trainers are the Blessed One’s own sons, they are heirs to the requisites that are the Blessed One’s own property. So their use is called “use as an inheritance.”🔽But do they use the Blessed One’s requisites or those given by householders?

original: pana te bhagavato paccaye paribhuñjanti, udāhu gihīhi dinnanti? Gihīhi dinnāpi te
analyzed: pana te bhagavato paccaye paribhuñjanti udāhu gihīhi dinnanti gihīhi dinnā api te
translated: They use those given by householders.

original: bhagavatā anuññātattā bhagavato santakā honti ananuññātesu sabbena sabbaṃ paribhogābhāvato
analyzed: bhagavatā anuññāta ttāḥ bhagavataḥ santakāḥ honti an anuññātesu sabbena sabbam paribhoga abhāvato
translated: They are the Blessed One’s because he has allowed them. There is no enjoyment of what he has not allowed.

original: anuññātesuyeva paribhogasambhavato. Dhammadāyādasuttañcettha sādhakaṃ.
analyzed: anuññātesu yā iva paribhoga sambhavataḥ dhammadāyādasuttam ca ittha sādhakam
translated: But there is enjoyment of what he has allowed. The Dhammadāyāda Sutta is the proof here.

original: Avītarāgānaṃ taṇhāparavasatāya paccayaparibhoge sāmibhāvo natthi, tadabhāvena vītarāgānaṃ🔽tattha sāmibhāvo yathāruci paribhogasambhavato. Tathā hi te paṭikūlampi appaṭikūlākārena,
analyzed: avīta rāgānam taṇhā paravasa tāya paccaya paribhoge sāmibhāvaḥ natthi tad abhāvena vīta rāgānam  tattha sāmi bhāvaḥ yathāruci paribhoga sambhavato tathā hi te appaṭikūlam api appaṭikūla ākārena
translated: Those who are not free from lust have no ownership of requisites because they are subject to craving. But those who are free from lust🔽have ownership of them because they can enjoy them as they wish. For they enjoy requisites in a way free from dislike,

original: appaṭikūlampi paṭikūlākārena tadubhayaṃ vivajjetvā upekkhākārena ca paccaye paribhuñjanti,
analyzed: a paṭikūlam pi paṭikūla ākārena tat ubhayam vivajjetvā upekkhā ākārena ca paccaye paribhuñjanti
translated: in a way free from liking, and in a way free from both, respectively.

original: dāyakānañca manorathaṃ paripūrenti. Sesamettha yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ visuddhimagge,
analyzed: dāyakānam ca manoratham paripūrenti sesam ettha yat vattabbam tat visuddhi magge
translated: And they fulfil the donors’ expectation. What else should be said here has been said in the Visuddhimagga

original: taṃsaṃvaṇṇanāsu ca vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ. Kilesaiṇānaṃ abhāvaṃ sandhāya “aṇaṇo”ti
analyzed: tad saṃvaṇṇanāsu ca vutta nayena iva veditabbam kilesa eṇānam abhāvam sandhāya aṇaṇo ti
translated: and in the commentary on the Āṭānāṭiya Sutta. He is “indebted” in the sense of being without debt, that is to say, in the sense of being without defilements,

original: vuttaṃ, na paccavekkhitaparibhogamattaṃ. Tenāha āyasmā ca bākulo – “sattāhameva kho
analyzed: vuttam na paccavekkhita paribhoga mattam tena āha āyasmā ca bākulaḥ satta aham eva kho
translated: not in the sense of having enjoyed requisites after reflecting on them. Hence the venerable Bakkula said:🔽“For seven days I enjoyed requisites after reflecting on them.

original: ahaṃ, āvuso, saraṇo raṭṭhapiṇḍaṃ bhuñji”nti.🔽Vatthukāmakilesakāmehi taṇhāya pavattiākāraṃ paṭicca atthi ramaṇavohāroti āha – “duvidhesupi
analyzed: aham āvuso saraṇaḥ raṭṭha piṇḍam bhuñjinti  vatthu kāma kilesa kāmehi taṇhāya pavatti ākāram paṭicca atthi ramaṇa vohāro ti āha duvidhesu pi
translated: I have eaten the country’s almsfood, friend.”

original: kāmesu taṇhāratisanthava”nti. Mantitanti kathitaṃ. Uppannehi satthupaṭiññehi. Saṃvibhattāti
analyzed: kāmesu taṇhā rati santhavanti mantitanti kathitam uppannehi satthu paṭiññehi saṃvibhattā ati
translated: Because of the way craving occurs in regard to the two kinds of sense desires, namely, sense desires as objects and sense desires as defilements, it is said: “In the two kinds of sense desires, craving is the meeting place” . The meaning of the words “I have met with craving” has been explained.🔽When the Teacher had given his approval, they shared out the requisites.🔽They shared them out by classifying them as profitable, etc., and by classifying them as aggregates, etc.

original: kusalādivasena khandhādīhi ākārehi vibhattā. Sundaraṃ āgamananti svāgataṃ. Tato eva
analyzed: kusala ādi vasena khandha ādīhi ākārehi vibhattā svāgatam eva
translated: “Welcome” means “good to come.”🔽Because of that, he did not come in vain.

original: na kucchitaṃ āgataṃ. Soḷasavidhakiccassa pariyositattā āha “taṃ sabbaṃ mayā kata”nti.
analyzed: na kucchitam āgatam soḷasavidha kiccassa pariyosita ttā āha tat sabbam mayā katam ti
translated: Because he had completed the sixteen duties, he said, “I have done all that.”

original: Maggapaññāyameva tatiyavijjāsamaññāti āha – “tīhi vijjāhi navahi ca lokuttaradhammehī”ti.
analyzed: magga paññā ayam eva tatiya vijjā samaññā ti āha tīhi vijjāhi navahi ca lokuttara dhammehi iti
translated: The path-knowledge itself is called the third true knowledge.

original: Aṅgulimālasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: aṅgulimāla sutta vaṇṇanāya līnattha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the words of the Aṅgulimāla Sutta is completed.

original: 7. Piyajātikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: piya jātika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: Piyajātika Sutta

original: 353. Pakatiniyāmenāti yathā sokuppattito pubbe iti kattabbesu asammohavasena cittaṃ
analyzed: pakati niyāmena āti yathā soka uppattito pubbe iti kattabbesu asammoha vasena cittam
translated: In the regular order, in the order in which they arose.

original: pakkhandati, tāni cassa upaṭṭhahanti, na evaṃ sokassa cittasaṅkocasabhāvato. Tena🔽vuttaṃ “pakatiniyāmena pana na paṭibhantī”ti. Keci pana “sāmantā katipaye na kuṭumbaṃ🔽sandhāreti. Tenāha ‘na sabbena sabbaṃ paṭibhantī’ti” vadanti. Etthāti dutiyapade.
analyzed: pakkhandati tāni ca ssa upaṭṭhahanti na evam sokassa citta saṅkoca sabhāvato tena  vuttam pakati niyāmena pana na paṭibhanti iti keci pana sāmantāḥ katipaye na kuṭumbam  sandhāra iti tena āha na sabbena sabbam paṭibhanti iti vadanti ettha ati dutiya pade
translated: and they do not occur in the way that grief does, which is by the contraction of the mind.🔽Hence it is said, “But they do not occur in the way that is obvious” .

original: Anekatthattā dhātūnaṃ “na paṭibhātī”ti padassa “na ruccatī”ti atthamāha. Na paṭibhātīti
analyzed: aneka attha ttā dhātūnam na paṭibhāti iti padassa na ruccati iti attham āha na paṭibhāti iti
translated: But some say that the meaning of the words “does not occur” is “does not please” because of the plurality of meanings of the verbal root bhā .🔽Or else the meaning of “does not occur” is that the mind does not incline to eating.

original: vā bhuñjitukāmatācittaṃ na upaṭṭhitanti attho. Patiṭṭhitokāsanti indriyāviṭṭhaṭṭhānaṃ🔽vadati. Piyāyitabbato piyo jāti uppattiṭṭhānaṃ etesanti piyajātikā. Piyo pabhuti🔽etesanti piyappabhutikāti vattabbe, u-kārassa va-kāraṃ, ta-kārassa ca lopaṃ katvā
analyzed: vā bhuñjitu kāma tā cittam na upaṭṭhitanti attho patiṭṭhita ukāsanti indriya āviṭṭha ṭṭhānam  vadati piyāyitabbataḥ piyaḥ jāti uppatti ṭhānam etesanti piya jātikā piyaḥ pabhuti  etesan ti piya ppabhutikā ati vattabbe ukārassa vakāram takārassa ca lopam katvā
translated: He says that the “established place” is the place occupied by the faculties.🔽The “kind of what is dear” is that in which what is dear has arisen.🔽What should be said is “the kind of what is dear has arisen” , but the u- of upa is made a va- and the ta- is dropped, and so it is said “the kind of what is dear has arisen” .

original: “piyappabhāvikā”ti vuttaṃ. Tenāha “piyato pabhavantī”ti.
analyzed: piya pabhāvikā iti vuttam tena āha piyataḥ pabhavanti iti
translated: Hence it is said, “They arise from what is dear” .

original: 355. Para-saddena samānatthaṃ ajjhattikabhāvanisedhanatthaṃ “pire”ti padanti āha🔽“amhākaṃ pare”ti. Pireti vā “parato”ti iminā samānatthaṃ nipātapadanti āha “cara🔽pireti parato gacchā”ti.
analyzed: para saddena samāna attham ajjhattika bhāva nisedhana attham āha  amhākam parā iti pirā iti vā paratas iti iminā samāna attham nipāta padam ti āha cara  pira iti paratas gacchāti
translated: The word “others” is a term of exclusion, having the same meaning as “another’s” in the sense of excluding one’s own, he said “others of ours.”

original: 356. Dvidhā chetvāti ettha yadi itthī tassa purisassa piyā, kathaṃ dvidhā chindatīti āha “yadi hī”tiādi.🔽357. Kathaṃ katheyyanti yathā bhagavā etassa brāhmaṇassa kathesi, so ca me kathesi,🔽tathā cāhaṃ katheyyaṃ. Maraṇavasena vipariṇāmo attabhāvassa parivattattā. Palāyitvā🔽gamanavasena aññathābhāvo mittasanthavassa samāgamassa ca aññathābhūtattā.🔽Chaḍḍitabhāvenāti parivattitabhāvena. Hatthagamanavasena aññathābhāvo pubbe savase vattitānaṃ idāni vase avattanabhāvena.
analyzed: dvidhā chetvā iti ettha yadi itthī tassa purisassa piyā katham dvidhā chindati iti āha yadi hi itiādi 🔽katham katheyyanti yathā bhagavā etassa brāhmaṇassa kathesi saḥ ca me kathesi 🔽tathā ca aham katheyyam maraṇa vasena vipariṇāmaḥ atta bhāvassa parivatta ttā palāyitvā 🔽gamana vasena aññathābhāvaḥ mitta santhavassa samāgamassa ca aññathā bhūta ttā 🔽chaḍḍita bhāvena ati parivattita bhāvena hattha gamana vasena aññathābhāvaḥ pubbe sa vase vattitānam idāni vase avattana bhāvena
