original: Ācamehīti ācamanaṃ mukhavikkhālanaṃ kārehi. Yasmā mukhaṃ vikkhālentā hi hatthapāde🔽dhovitvā vikkhālenti, tasmā “ācamitvā”ti vatvā pacchāpi tassa atthaṃ dassento “mukhaṃ
analyzed: ācamehi iti ācamanam mukha vikkhālanam kārehi yasmai mukham vikkhālentā hi hattha pāde  dhovitvā vikkhālenti tasmai ācamitvā iti vatvā pacchā api tassa attham dassentaḥ mukham
translated: Come and rinse your mouth means: make your mouth ready by rinsing it. For when they rinse their mouth, they wash their hands and feet,

original: vikkhāletvā”ti āha. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: vikkhāletvā ti āha sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: and then they rinse their mouth. Therefore, after saying “having rinsed,” he shows its meaning by saying “having rinsed the mouth.” The rest is easy to understand.

original: Piyajātikasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: piya jātika sutta vaṇṇanāya līna ttha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of “the state of being contracted” in the Piyajātika Sutta is finished.

original: 8. Bāhitikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bāhitika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Bahitika Sutta

original: 359. Sāvajjatāya upārambhaṃ arahatīti opārambho. Tenāha “dosaṃ āropanāraho”ti. Bālā🔽upārambhavatthumaññaṃ amūlakampi naṃ āropentā ugghosenti, tasmā te anāmasitvā “viññūhī”ti
analyzed: sā avajja tāya upārambham tena āha dosam bālā  upārambha vatthumaññam amūlakampi naṃ āropentāḥ ugghosenti tasmā te an āmasitvā viññūhi iti
translated: is a ground for censure means: it is worthy of censure because of its blameworthiness. Therefore it is said: “it is worthy of being charged with hatred.” Fools,🔽without any ground, charge one another with this, and so they shout it out. Therefore, without mentioning them, he took the word “wise”

original: idaṃ padaṃ gahetvā pañhena ñātuṃ icchitena atthena upārambhādīnaṃ upari uttaraṃ paripūretuṃ
analyzed: idam padam gahetvā pañhena ñātum icchitena atthena upārambha ādīnam upari uttaram paripūretum
translated: and, wanting to know the meaning of the question, was unable to complete the answer to the charge, etc.,

original: nāsakkhimhā. Taṃ kāraṇanti taṃ uppattikāraṇaṃ. Yadi hi mayā “viññūhī”ti padaṃ pakkhipitvā
analyzed: na asakkhimhā tam kāraṇam ti tam uppatti kāraṇam yadi hi mayā viññūhi iti padam pakkhipitvā
translated: above. The reason for that is: the reason for its arising. For if I had included the word “wise,”

original: vuttaṃ bhaveyya, pañhā me paripuṇṇā bhaveyya, na pana vuttā. Idāni pana taṃ kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: vuttam bhaveyya pañhā me paripuṇṇāḥ bhaveyya na pana vuttāḥ idāni pana tam kāraṇam
translated: it would have been said, my question would have been answered, but it was not. Now that reason

original: uttaraṃ āyasmatā ānandena “viññūhī”ti evaṃ vadantena paripūritaṃ.
analyzed: uttaram āyasmatā ānandena viññūhi iti evam vadantena paripūritam
translated: has been fulfilled by the venerable Ānanda’s saying “Understand” .

original: 360. Kosallapaṭipakkhato akosallaṃ vuccati avijjā, taṃsamuṭṭhānato akosallasambhūto.
analyzed: kosalla paṭipakkhataḥ akosallam vuccati avijjā tad samuṭṭhānataḥ akosalla sambhūto
translated: Unwisdom is called “unskill” because it is the opposite of skill. It is “arisen from unskill” because it originates from that.

original: Avajjaṃ vuccati garahitabbaṃ, saha avajjehīti sāvajjo, gārayho. Rāgādidosehi sadoso.
analyzed: avajjam vuccati garahitabbam saha avajjehi iti sa avajjaḥ gārayhaḥ rāga ādi dosehi sa dosaḥ
translated: Blame is called “blameworthy” . It is “together with blame” because of blame. It is “reprehensible” because it is to be reproved. It is “accompanied by taint” because of greed, etc.,

original: Tehi eva sabyābajjho, tato eva sampati āyatiñca sadukkho. Sabyābajjhādiko nissandavipāko.
analyzed: tehi eva sa byābajjhaḥ tatas eva sampati āyatiñca sa dukkhaḥ sa byābajjha ādikaḥ nissanda vipāko
translated: and “accompanied by trouble” because of that same taint. It is “accompanied by fever” because of the future result of that same taint.

original: Tathā attho vutto bhaveyyāti pucchāsabhāgenapi attho vutto bhaveyya, pucchantassa
analyzed: tathā atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhaveyya ati pucchā sabhāgena api atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhaveyya pucchantassa
translated: The meaning would have been stated thus: “My question would have been answered by the question part too,

original: pana na tāva cittārādhanaṃ. Tenāha – “evaṃ byākaraṇaṃ pana na bhāriya”nti, garukaraṇaṃ
analyzed: pana na tāva citta ārādhanam tena āha evam byākaraṇam pana na garukaraṇam
translated: but the questioner’s mind is not satisfied. Therefore he says ‘But an answer given thus is not satisfactory.’ He means that ‘it is not weighty.’

original: na hoti visārajjaṃ na siyāti adhippāyo. Tenāha – “appahīnaakusalopi hi pahānaṃ vaṇṇeyyā”ti.
analyzed: na hoti visārajjam na siyā ti adhippāyaḥ tena āha appahīna akusalaḥ api hi pahānam vaṇṇeyya iti
translated: It is not weighty, it is not a giving of freedom. He means that ‘it is not a giving of freedom.’ Therefore he says ‘For one who has not abandoned unskilfulness should praise abandoning.’

original: Evarūpo pana yathākārī tathāvādī na hoti, na evaṃ bhagavāti āha “bhagavā”tiādi. Evaṃ
analyzed: evarūpaḥ pana yathākārī tathāvādī na āha evam
translated: But one who is not like that is not one who acts in accordance with his word, and so the Elder said, “The Blessed One is not like that.”

original: byākāsīti “sabbākusaladhammapahīno kho, mahārāja, tathāgato”ti evaṃ byākāsi. Sukkapakkhepi
analyzed: byākāsi iti sabba akusala dhamma pahīnaḥ kho mahā rāja tathāgato ti evam byākāsi sukka pakkhe pi
translated: Thus he answered: he answered thus, “Great king, the Tathāgata has abandoned all unprofitable things.”

original: eseva nayoti iminā “sabbesaṃyeva kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadaṃ vaṇṇetī”ti vutte
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ ti iminā sabbesam yeva kusalānam dhammānam upasampadam vaṇṇeti iti vutte
translated: The same method applies to the bright side: when it is said that he “extols the consummation of all profitable things,”

original: yathā pucchā, tathā attho vutto bhaveyya, evaṃ byākaraṇaṃ pana na bhāriyaṃ, asampāditakusaladhammopi
analyzed: yathā pucchā tathā atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhaveyya evam byākaraṇam pana na bhāriyam asampādita kusala dhammaḥ api
translated: the meaning of the question would be as stated, but such an answer would be too heavy a burden for one who has not yet accomplished the profitable things.

original: upasampadaṃ vaṇṇeyya. Bhagavā pana sammadeva sampāditakusalattā yathākārī tathāvādīti
analyzed: upasampadam vaṇṇeyya bhagavā pana sammat eva sampādita kusala ttā yathākārī tathāvādī iti
translated: But the Blessed One, having accomplished the profitable things rightly, is one who acts in accordance with his word.

original: dassetuṃ “evaṃ byākāsī”ti imamatthaṃ dasseti. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: dassetum evam byākāsi iti imam attham dasseti sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: Bāhitikasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: bāhitika sutta vaṇṇanāya līna ttha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the word “sluggish” is ended.

original: 9. Dhammacetiyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dhammacetiya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The Sutta on the Shrine of the Dhamma

original: 364. Medavaṇṇā uḷupavaṇṇā ca tattha tattha pāsāṇā ussannā ahesunti medāḷupanti gāmassa
analyzed: meda vaṇṇāḥ uḷupa vaṇṇā ca tattha tattha pāsāṇāḥ ussannāḥ ahesunti medāḷupanti gāmassa
translated: The stones there are called “medavaṇṇa” and “uḷuvaṇṇa” because they are prominent there.

original: samaññā jātā. Uḷupavaṇṇāti candasamānavaṇṇatāya medapāsāṇā vuttāti keci. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: samaññā jātā uḷupa vaṇṇā ti canda samāna vaṇṇa tāya meda pāsāṇā vuttā iti keci aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: and the name ‘Ulu’ was given to it. Some say that ‘Ulu’ is a name for the ‘Meda’ stone because of its colour like the moon.

original: pana “medavaṇṇā pāsāṇā kirettha ussannā ahesu”nti idaṃ vuttaṃ. Assāti senāpatissa.
analyzed: pana meda vaṇṇā pāsāṇā kira ittha ussannāḥ ahesun ti idam vuttam assa ati senāpatissa
translated: and the name ‘Pebba’s Stone’ came into existence. ‘Pebba’s Stone’: some say that because of its colour it was like the moon. But in the Commentary it is said: ‘What stones of that colour were prominent here?’ ‘Assaka’s’: of the general.

original: Kathāsamuṭṭhāpanatthanti mallikāya sokavinodanadhammakathāsamuṭṭhāpanatthaṃ.🔽Raññāti pasenadīkosalaraññā. Mahaccāti mahatiyā. Padavipallāsena cetaṃ vuttaṃ. Pasādamarahantīti
analyzed: kathā samuṭṭhāpana tham ti mallikāya soka vinodana dhamma kathā samuṭṭhāpana tham  raññā iti pasenadī kosala raññā mahat ca ati mahatiyā pada vipallāsena ca itam vuttam pasādam arahanti iti
translated: ‘To set the talk going’: to set going the talk of the Dhamma to console Mallika.

original: pāsādikāni. Tenāha “saha rañjanakānī”ti. Yāni pana pāsādikāni, tāni passituṃ yuttāni.🔽Pāsādikānīti vā saddahanasahitāni. Tenāha “pasādajanakānī”ti. “Appābādha”nti ādīsu
analyzed: pāsādikāni tena āha saha rañjanakāni iti yāni pana pāsādikāni tāni passitum yuttāni  pāsādikāni iti vā sat dahana sahitāni tena āha pasāda janakāni iti ādīsu
translated: ‘The king’: Pasenadi, king of Kosala. ‘Great’: with a great (assembly). This is said by a reversal of the words. ‘Inspiring confidence’: inspiring confidence. Therefore it is said: ‘pleasing’. But those that are inspiring confidence are fit to be seen.🔽‘Inspiring confidence’: together with confidence. Therefore it is said: ‘arousing confidence’. ‘Without disease’ and so on:

original: viya appasaddo abhāvatthoti āha “nissaddānī”ti. Aniyamatthavācī ya-saddo aniyamākāravācakopi
analyzed: viya appasaddaḥ abhāva tthaḥ ti āha nissaddāni iti aniyama attha vācī ya saddaḥ aniyama ākāra vācakaḥ api
translated: the word ‘little’ is a word for non-existence. Therefore it is said: ‘without sound’. The word ‘ya’ has the meaning of non-restriction and also the meaning of non-restricted form.

original: hotīti “yatthā”ti padassa “yādisesū”tiādimāha. Tathā hi aṅgulimālasutte “yassa kho”ti
analyzed: hoti iti yattha ati padassa ya ādi sesu utiādim āha tathā hi aṅguli māla sutte yassa kho ti
translated: Therefore the word ‘yattha’ is said to be ‘yādisesu’. For in the Aṅgulimāla Sutta it is said: ‘Yassa kho’

original: padassa “yādisassa kho”ti attho vutto.
analyzed: padassa yādisassa kho ti atthaḥ vutto
translated: The meaning of the word “yādisassa” is stated as “of what kind.”

original: 366. Paṭicchadanti paṭicchādakaṃ. Rājakakudhabhaṇḍānīti rājabhaṇḍabhūtāni. Rahāyatīti raho karoti, maṃ ajjhesatīti attho.🔽367. Yathāsabhāvato ñeyyaṃ dhāreti avadhāretīti dhammo, ñāṇanti āha “paccakkhañāṇasaṅkhātassa
analyzed: paṭicchadanti paṭicchādakam rāja kakudha bhaṇḍāni iti rājabhaṇḍa bhūtāni rahāyati iti rahaḥ karoti mama ajjhesati iti  yathā sabhāvataḥ ñeyyam dhāreti avadhāreti iti dhammaḥ ñāṇan ti āha paccakkha ñāṇa saṅkhātassa
translated: “Conceals” is the concealer. “Royal treasure” is what is the king’s treasure. “Is hidden” is makes secret, the meaning is “he invites me.”🔽“Dhamma” is what is to be borne in mind, what is to be borne in mind as it really is. “Knowledge” is what is called direct knowledge.

original: dhammassā”ti. Anunayoti anugacchanako. Diṭṭhena hi adiṭṭhassa anumānaṃ. Tenāha “anumānaṃ🔽anubuddhī”ti. Āpāṇakoṭikanti yāva pāṇakoṭi, tāva jīvitapariyosānaṃ. Etanti dhammanvayasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: dhammassa ati anunayaḥ ti anugacchanakaḥ diṭṭhena hi adiṭṭhassa anumānam tena āha anumānam  anubuddhi iti āpāṇakoṭikam ti yāva jīvita pariyosānam etat ti dhamma anvaya saṅkhātam
translated: “Following” is what follows. For what is not seen is inferred from what is seen. Therefore he said: “Inference is

original: anumānaṃ. Evanti “idha panāha”nti vuttappakārena.
analyzed: anumānam eva nti idha pana aham ti vutta ppakārena
translated: understanding by inference.” “As far as the tip of the nail” means as far as the tip of the nail, the end of life. “That” is the inference called the continuity of dhammas. “Thus” is in the way stated by “here, however, he says.”

original: 369. Cakkhuṃ abandhante viyāti apāsādikatāya passantānaṃ cakkhuṃ attani abandhante
analyzed: cakkhum a bandhante viyāti apāsādika tāya passantānam cakkhum attani a bandhante
translated: “The eye of those who see without binding” means as if the eye of those who see without binding the self.

original: viya. Kulasantānānubandho rogo kularogo. Uḷāranti sānubhāvaṃ. Yo hi ānubhāvasampanno,
analyzed: kula santāna anubandhaḥ rogaḥ kula rogaḥ sa anubhāvam yaḥ hi ānubhāva sampannaḥ
translated: “Family disease” is a disease that follows the family line. “Powerful” means with influence. For he who is endowed with influence,

original: taṃ “mahesakkha”nti vadanti. Arahattaṃ gaṇhantoti ukkaṭṭhaniddesoyaṃ, heṭṭhimaphalāni gaṇhantopi.
analyzed: tam mahesakkhanti vadanti arahattam gaṇhanto ti ukkaṭṭha niddesaḥ yam heṭṭhima phalāni gaṇhantaḥ api
translated: “One who is attaining Arahantship”: this is a description of the highest type; it includes also those who are attaining the lower fruitions.

original: 373. Jīvikā jīvitavutti.
translated: “Livelihood”: the living, the living of a life.

original: 374. Dhammaṃ ceteti saṃvedeti etehīti dhammacetiyāni, dhammassa pūjāvacanāni. Nanu
analyzed: dhammam ceteti saṃvedeti etehi iti dhamma cetiyāni dhammassa pūjā vacanāni nanu
translated: “Dhamma-cetiyas”: the words “dhamma-cetiyas” are words of veneration for the Dhamma.🔽Aren’t there also words of veneration for the Buddha and the Saṅgha?

original: cetāni buddhasaṅghaguṇadīpanānipi santi? Kathaṃ “dhammacetiyānīti dhammassa cittīkāravacanānī”ti
analyzed: santi katham dhamma cetiyāni iti dhammassa cittīkāra vacanāni iti
translated: How is it said that “the words ‘dhamma-cetiyas’ are words of veneration for the Dhamma”?

original: vuttanti āha “tīsu hī”tiādi. Tattha yasmā buddharatanamūlakāni sesaratanāni tassa
analyzed: vuttan ti āha tīsu hi itiādi tattha yasmā buddha ratana mūlakāni sesa ratanāni tassa
translated: He answers, “In the three …,” etc. Herein, since the other treasures are rooted in the Buddha-treasure, they are to be obtained by means of him.

original: vasena laddhabbato. Kosalaraññā cettha buddhagāravena dhammasaṅghagāravaṃ paveditaṃ,
analyzed: vasena laddhabbato kosala raññā ca ittha buddha gāravena dhamma saṅgha gāravam paveditam
translated: And here the respect for the Dhamma and the Saṅgha is declared by the King of Kosala through his respect for the Buddha.

original: tasmā “bhagavati cittīkāre kate dhammopi katova hotī”ti vuttaṃ. Yasmā ca ratanattayapasādapubbikā🔽sāsane sammāpaṭipatti, tasmā vuttaṃ – “ādibrahmacariyakānīti maggabrahmacariyassa
analyzed: tasmā bhagavati cittīkāre kate dhammaḥ api kataḥ va hoti iti vuttam yasmā ca  sāsane sammā paṭipatti tasmā vuttam ādibrahmacariyakāni iti magga brahmacariyassa
translated: Therefore it is said: “When the Blessed One is venerated, the Dhamma is venerated too.”🔽And since the right practice in the Dispensation is preceded by confidence in the Triple Gem,

original: ādibhūtānī”ti. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: ādi bhūtāni iti sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: it is said: “The first steps in the holy life,” i.e., the first steps in the path-holy life. The rest is easily intelligible.

original: Dhammacetiyasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: dhammacetiya sutta vaṇṇanāya līna ttha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the word “cetiya” in the Dhammacetiya Sutta is ended.

original: 10. Kaṇṇakatthalasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Kannakatthala Sutta

original: 375. Anantarasutte vuttakaraṇīyenevāti “pāsāde vā nāṭakesu vā cittassādaṃ alabhamāno tattha tattha vicarituṃ āraddho”ti vuttakaraṇīyena. Appaduṭṭhapadosīnañhi evaṃ hotīti.
analyzed: anantara sutte vutta karaṇīyena iva ati pāsāde vā nāṭakesu vā citta ssādam a labhamānaḥ tattha tattha vicaritum āraddhaḥ ti vutta karaṇīyena a paduṭṭha padosīnam hi evam hoti iti
translated: “With the business that had arisen”: with the business that had arisen in the way described thus: “Not finding satisfaction in the palace or in the dancing, he began to wander about here and there.” For this is how it happens to those who are not free from passion.🔽“Asked”: asked by the question “He did not send for another messenger.”🔽“He”: the king.

original: 376. Pucchitoti “aññaṃ dūtaṃ nālatthu”nti pucchito. Soti rājā. Tāsaṃ vandanā sace uttarakālaṃ, attano āgamanakāraṇaṃ kathessati.
analyzed: pucchitaḥ ti aññam dūtam na alatthunti pucchitaḥ saḥ iti rājā tāsam vandanā sace uttara kālam attanaḥ āgamana kāraṇam kathessati
translated: “If she were to pay homage to them”: if she were to tell the reason for his coming later.

original: 378. Ekāvajjanenāti ekavīthijavanena. Tena ekacittaṃ tāva tiṭṭhatu, ekacittavīthiyāpi🔽sabbaṃ jānituṃ na sakkāti dasseti. “Idaṃ nāma atītaṃ jānissāmī”ti aniyametvā āvajjato
analyzed: ekāvajjanena ati eka vīthi javanena tena eka cittam tāva tiṭṭhatu eka citta vīthiyā api  sabbam jānitum na sakkā ati dasseti idam nāma atītam jānissāmi iti aniyametvā āvajjato
translated: “By a single adverting”: by a single impulsion in a single cognitive series. He shows that a single consciousness can last so long, and that it is not possible to know everything by a single cognitive series.🔽When he adverts without specifying “I shall know this or that in the past,” he knows whatever past state there is to be known. But when he specifies, he knows only what is specified.

original: yaṃ kiñci atītaṃ jānāti, niyamite pana niyamitamevāti āha – “ekena hi…pe… ekadesameva
analyzed: yam kiñci atītam jānāti niyamite pana niyamitam eva ati āha ekena eka desam eva
translated: “For by one he can know only one, and by another only another.”

original: jānātī”ti. Tena cittenāti “atītaṃ sabbaṃ jānissāmī”ti evaṃ pavattacittena. Itaresūti
analyzed: jānāti iti tena cittena ati atītam sabbam jānissāmi iti evam pavatta cittena itaresu uti
translated: “He knows.” With that cognizance: with the cognizance that occurs thus “I shall know all the past.” In the other two:

original: anāgatapaccuppannesu. Kāraṇajātikanti yuttisabhāvaṃ, yuttiyā yuttanti attho. Samparāyaguṇanti
analyzed: anāgata paccuppannesu kāraṇa jātikam ti yutti sabhāvam yuttiyā yuttanti attho samparāya guṇanti
translated: in the future and in the present. Reason-born and class: the suitability of the state, is the meaning. The special quality in the future:

original: samparāye katakammassa visesaṃ.🔽379. Lokuttaramissakāni kathitāni bodhirājakumārasutte viya lokiyā ceva lokuttarā
analyzed: samparāye kata kammassa visesam  lokuttara missakāni kathitāni bodhirāja kumāra sutte viya lokiyā ca iva lokuttarā
translated: the special quality of the result of kamma done in the future.

original: ca. Yathālābhavasena cettha padhāniyaṅgānaṃ lokuttaraggahaṇaṃ veditabbaṃ. Paccekaṃ
analyzed: ca yathā lābha vasena ca ittha padhāniyaṅgānam lokuttara ggahaṇam veditabbam paccekam
translated: The supramundane and the mixed are stated in the Bodhirajakumara Sutta . Herein, the taking of the supramundane as a principal factor should be understood according to the way of occurrence. But each of them should be regarded as a principal factor,

original: eva nesañca padhāniyaṅgatā daṭṭhabbā yathā “aṭṭhavimokkhā sandissanti lokuttaramissakā”ti.
analyzed: eva na esam ca padhāniya aṅga tā daṭṭhabbā yathā aṭṭha vimokkhā sandissanti lokuttara missakā ti
translated: as in the passage “The eight emancipations are shown as supramundane and mixed” .

original: Lokuttarānevāti cettha yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ parato āvi bhavissati. Padhānanānattanti
analyzed: ca ittha yam vattabbam tam paratas bhavissati padhāna nānattam
translated: If it be said that they are only supramundane, what has to be said will be said later. The diversity of the principal factor:🔽the diversity of the principal factor, is the meaning. The special practice of development:

original: padahananānattaṃ, bhāvanānuyogavisesanti attho. Saṅkhāre parimadditvā paṭipakkhadhamme
analyzed: bhāvanā anuyoga visesanti saṅkhāre parimadditvā paṭipakkha dhamme
translated: having crushed determinations, the special quality of the opposite states

original: ekadesato pajahitvā ṭhitassa bhāvanānuyogo sabbena sabbaṃ aparimadditasaṅkhārassa
analyzed: eka desataḥ pajahitvā ṭhitassa bhāvanā anuyogaḥ sabbena sabbam a parimaddita saṅkhārassa
translated: The development of the meditator who has given up the defilements in part is subtle and hard to see because it is the development of one who has not yet abandoned the opponent of the path in its entirety and who has not yet reached the penetration of the truths.

original: appahīnapaṭipakkhassa bhāvanānuyogato sukhumo visadova hoti, saccābhisamayena santānassa
analyzed: a pahīna paṭipakkhassa bhāvanā anuyogato sukhumaḥ visadaḥ uva hoti sacca abhisamayena santānassa
translated: The development of the stream-enterer is subtle and hard to see because it is the development of one who has reached the penetration of the truths and who has infused his continuity with the noble fruit.

original: āhitavisesattāti āha – “aññādisameva hi puthujjanassa padhānaṃ, aññādisaṃ sotāpannassā”tiādi.
analyzed: āhita visesa ttā ti āha añña ādisam eva hi puthujjanassa padhānam añña ādisam sotāpannassa atiādi
translated: Hence it is said: “The exertion of the worldling is of one kind, that of the stream-enterer is of another kind.”

original: Ayañca viseso na kevalaṃ anariyaariyapuggalato eva, atha kho ariyesupi sekkhādivisesatopi
analyzed: ayam ca visesaḥ na kevalam anariya ariya puggalataḥ eva atha kho ariyesu pi sekkha ādi visesataḥ pi
translated: And this difference is not only between the worldling and the noble disciple, but also among the noble disciples themselves, between the trainee and the non-trainee,🔽because of the difference in the exertion and the difference in the resolution.

original: labbhati abhisaṅkhāravisesato abhinīhārato ca ijjhanatoti dassento “aññādisaṃ sakadāgāmino”tiādimāha.
analyzed: labbhati abhisaṅkhāra visesataḥ abhinīhārato ca ijjhanato ti dassentaḥ aññādisam sakadāgāminā iti ādim āha
translated: The difference in the exertion is due to the difference in the kamma-formation, and the difference in the resolution is due to the difference in the attainment.

original: Na pāpuṇātīti yasmā puthujjano sabbathāva padhānaṃ padahanto sotāpattimaggaṃ adhigacchati,
analyzed: na pāpuṇāti iti yasmā puthujjanaḥ sabbathāva padhānam padahantaḥ sotāpatti maggam adhigacchati
translated: The meaning is that the worldling, exerting himself in every way, reaches the path of stream-entry,

original: sotāpanno ca sakadāgāmimagganti heṭṭhimaṃ uparimato oḷārikaṃ, uparimañca itarato
analyzed: sotāpanno ca sakadāgāmi magganti heṭṭhimam uparimatas oḷārikam uparimañca itaratas
translated: and the stream-enterer, the path of once-return. The lower path is gross in comparison with the higher, and the higher is subtle in comparison with the lower.

original: sukhumaṃ tena pahātuṃ asakkuṇeyyassa pajahanato, iti adhigantabbavisesena ca adhigamapaṭipadāya
analyzed: sukhumam tena pahātum a sakkuṇeyyassa pajahanataḥ iti adhigantabba visesena ca adhigama paṭipadāya
translated: and because of the difficulty of abandoning what is subtle, it is shown that the supramundane path is superior to the mundane path in the matter of the abandoning of defilements.🔽And because of the difference in the degree of penetration, it is shown that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration.

original: saṇhasukhumatā tikkhavisadatā ca viññāyatīti āha – “puthujjanassa padhānaṃ sotāpannassa🔽padhānaṃ na pāpuṇātī”tiādi.🔽Akūṭakaraṇanti avañcanakiriyaṃ. Anavacchindananti atiyānaṃ. Aviñchanaṃ na ākaḍḍhanaṃ,
analyzed: saṇha sukhuma tā tikkha visada tā ca viññāyati iti āha puthujjanassa padhānam sotāpannassa  padhānam na pāpuṇāti itiādi  a vañcana kiriyam an avacchindana nti atiyānam a viñchanam na ākaḍḍhanam
translated: The meaning is that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration because of the difference in the degree of penetration.🔽The mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration because of the difference in the degree of penetration.🔽The meaning is that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration because of the difference in the degree of penetration.🔽The meaning is that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration because of the difference in the degree of penetration.🔽The meaning is that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration because of the difference in the degree of penetration.🔽The meaning is that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration because of the difference in the degree of penetration.

original: niyuttataṃ viniveṭhetvā samantā viparivattitvā samadhārāya chaḍḍanaṃ vā. Tassa kāraṇaṃ🔽taṃkāraṇaṃ, taṃ kāraṇanti vā taṃ kiriyaṃ taṃ adhikāraṃ. Dantehi gantabbabhūminti
analyzed: niyuttatam viniveṭhetvā samantā viparivattitvā sama dhārāya chaḍḍanam vā tassa kāraṇam  taṃkāraṇam tam vā tam kiriyam tam adhikāram dantehi gantabba bhūminti
translated: The meaning is that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration because of the difference in the degree of penetration.🔽The meaning is that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration because of the difference in the degree of penetration.🔽The meaning is that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration because of the difference in the degree of penetration.🔽The meaning is that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration because of the difference in the degree of penetration.

original: dantehi pattabbaṭṭhānaṃ, pattabbavatthuṃ vā. Cattāropi assaddhā nāma uparimauparimasaddhāya
analyzed: dantehi pattabba ṭṭhānam pattabba vatthum vā cattāraḥ api assaddhāḥ nāma uparima auparima saddhāya
translated: The meaning is that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of the practice of the way to penetration because of the difference in the degree of penetration.

original: abhāvato. Yena hi yaṃ appattaṃ, tassa taṃ natthi. Ariyasāvakassa…pe… natthi paṭhamamaggeneva
analyzed: abhāvataḥ yena hi yam appattam tassa tam natthi ariya sāvaka ssape natthi paṭhama maggena iva
translated: The meaning is that the mundane path is superior to the supramundane path in the matter of

original: māyāsāṭheyyānaṃ pahātabbattā. Tenevāti sammadeva viruddhapakkhānaṃ saddhādīnaṃ idhādhippetattā.
analyzed: māyā sāṭheyyānam pahātabba ttā tena iva ati sammat eva viruddha pakkhānam saddhā ādīnam idha adhippeta ttā
translated: because deceit and fraud are to be abandoned. ‘Therefore’: because faith, etc., which are the opposites of the hindrances, are intended here.

original: Yadi evaṃ kathaṃ missakakathāti āha “assakhaḷuṅkasuttante panā”tiādi. Cattārova honti puthujjanādivasena.
analyzed: yadi evam katham missaka kathā iti āha assa khaḷuṅka suttante pana atiādi cattāraḥ eva honti puthujjana ādi vasena
translated: If that is so, how is it a mixed exposition? He says, ‘But in the Assakaḷā Sutta’ , etc. There are four kinds of persons, namely, the worldling, etc.

original: Opammasaṃsandane adantahatthiādayo viyātiādinā kaṇhapakkhe, yathā pana dantahatthiādayotiādinā
analyzed: opamma saṃsandane adanta hatthi ādayaḥ viya iti ādinā kaṇha pakkhe yathā pana danta hatthi ādayaḥ iti ādinā
translated: In the illustration of the simile, the untamed elephant, etc., are mentioned in the dark side, and the tamed elephant, etc., in the bright side.

original: sukkapakkhe ca sādhāraṇato ekajjhaṃ katvā vuttaṃ, asādhāraṇato bhinditvā dassetuṃ
analyzed: sukka pakkhe ca sādhāraṇataḥ ekajjham katvā vuttam asādhāraṇataḥ bhinditvā dassetuṃ
translated: But they are mentioned together in the general sense. To show them separately in the particular sense,

original: “idaṃ vuttaṃ hotī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: idam vuttam hoti itiādi vuttam
translated: ‘This is the meaning’ is said.

original: 380. Sammappadhānā nibbisiṭṭhavīriyā. Tenāha – “na kiñci nānākaraṇaṃ vadāmi, yadidaṃ
analyzed: sammappadhānā nibbisiṭṭha vīriyā tena āha na kiñci nānākaraṇam vadāmi yat idam
translated: right efforts, and the energy that has been released by the attainment of Nibbāna. Hence it is said: ‘I declare no difference between the freedom of the one and the freedom of the other’ .

original: vimuttiyā vimutti”nti. Na hi sukkhavipassakatevijjachaḷabhiññānaṃ vimuttiyā nānākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: vimuttiyāḥ vimuttinti na hi sukkha vipassaka tevijja chaḷ abhiññānam vimuttiyāḥ nānākaraṇam
translated: For there is no difference between the freedom of the bare insight worker and that of the one who possesses the discriminations and the higher knowledges.🔽Therefore it is said: ‘What is the difference between the freedom of the one and the freedom of the other?’ The construction is: ‘Do you not know?’

original: atthi. Tena vuttaṃ “yaṃ ekassā”tiādi. Kiṃ tvaṃ na jānāsīti sambandho. Āgacchantīti
analyzed: atthi tena vuttam yam ekassa atiādi kim tvam na jānāsi iti sambandhaḥ āgacchanti iti
translated: ‘Coming’ means

original: uppajjanavasena āgacchanti. Nāgacchantīti etthāpi eseva nayo. Idaṃ pucchantoti idaṃ
analyzed: uppajjana vasena āgacchanti na āgacchanti iti ettha api eṣa iva nayaḥ idam pucchanto ti idam
translated: they come by way of reappearance. The same method applies to the words ‘do not come.’🔽‘Asking this’: showing that he is asking this.

original: pucchāmīti dassento. Appahīnacetasikadukkhā anadhigataanāgāmitā. Tenāha “upapattivasena
analyzed: pucchāmi iti dassento appahīna cetasika dukkhā anadhigata anāgāmi tā tena āha upapatti vasena
translated: ‘Without having abandoned the mental suffering’: without having reached the state of non-return. Hence he said: ‘come by way of rebirth.’

original: āgantāro”ti. Samucchinnadukkhāti samugghāṭitacetasikadukkhā.
analyzed: āgantāro ti samucchinna dukkhā ati samugghāṭita cetasika dukkhā
translated: ‘With suffering cut off’: with the mental suffering eradicated.🔽‘From that place’: from that place of sovereignty as attained. ‘From that place again’: from that bad destination.

original: 381. Tamhā ṭhānāti tato yathādhigataissariyaṭṭhānato. Puna tamhā ṭhānāti tato duggatā. Sampannakāmaguṇanti uḷārakāmaguṇasamannāgataṃ.
analyzed: tamhā tatas yathā adhigata aissariya ṭṭhānataḥ puna tamhā tatas duggatā uḷāra kāmaguṇa samannāgatam
translated: ‘With the five strands of pleasure fulfilled’: endowed with the highest five strands of pleasure.

original: Tatthāti kāmadevaloke. Ṭhānabhāvatoti arahattañce adhigataṃ, tāvadeva parinibbānato.
analyzed: tattha āti kāmadeva loke ṭhāna bhāvataḥ ti arahattam ce adhigatam tāvat eva parinibbānato
translated: ‘There’: in the sense-desire divine world. ‘As to opportunity’: if he has attained Arahantship, then he has no opportunity to attain extinction.

original: Uparideve cāti uparūpari bhūmivāse deve ca, cakkhuviññāṇadassanenapi dassanāya nappahontīti yojanā.
analyzed: upari deve ca ati upari upari bhūmi vāse deve ca cakkhu viññāṇa dassanena api dassanāya na ppahonti iti yojanā
translated: ‘And in the higher gods’: in the gods of the higher planes of existence. The construction is: they are not able to see by means of the eye-consciousness-vision.

original: 382. Vuttanayenevāti devapucchāya vutteneva nayena. Sā kira kathāti “natthi so samaṇo
analyzed: vutta nayena iva ati deva pucchāya vuttena iva nayena sā kira kathā ati natthi so samaṇo
translated: ‘In the same way’: in the way stated in the question about the gods. ‘That talk, it seems’: “There is no such recluse

original: vā brāhmaṇo vā, yo sakideva sabbaṃ neyya”nti kathā. Teti viṭaṭūbhasañjayā. Imasmiṃyeva
analyzed: vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā yaḥ sakid eva sabbam na iyyanti kathā iti viṭa ṭūbha sañjayāḥ imasmiṃ eva
translated: “They”: Viṭaṭū and Sañjaya.

original: ṭhāneti imasmiṃ migadāyeyeva. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: ṭhāne iti imasmim sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: “In this very place”: in this very Migadāya. The rest is easy to understand.

original: Kaṇṇakatthalasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the word “little” in the Kaṇṇakatthala Sutta is finished.

original: Niṭṭhitā ca rājavaggavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: niṭṭhitā ca rāja vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: And the commentary on the Rājavagga is finished.

original: 5. Brāhmaṇavaggo🔽1. Brahmāyusuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: brāhmaṇa vaggaḥ
translated: The Brahmajāla Sutta

analyzed: mahāsattaḥ mahiddhikaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ iti ādīsu uḷāra tā visayaḥ mahā jana kāyaḥ sannipati iti ādīsu
translated: In such passages as “a great being, of great potency, of great majesty,” greatness is a matter of magnitude. In such passages as “a great multitude gathered,”

analyzed: sambahula bhāva visayaḥ idha pana tat ubhayam pissa attho ti mahatā ati guṇa mahattena api
translated: greatness is a matter of number. Here, however, it is a matter of both magnitude and number. Thus it is said: “Great: great in virtue, great in …

analyzed: mahatā atiādi vuttam appiccha tā ādī iti ādi saddena santuṭṭhi sallekha paviveka a saṃsagga vīriya ārambha ādīnam
translated: little desire, etc. ” The word “etc.” includes contentment, seclusion, non-proliferation, energy, etc.

translated: “By the inclusion of view, virtue, and sameness of purpose” means that the word “etc.”

analyzed: aṭṭhānam etam bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalo sañcicca pāṇam jīvitā
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, for a person who has right view to intentionally deprive a living being of life.

original: voropeyyāti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjatī”tiādivacanato diṭṭhisīlānaṃ niyatasabhāvattā sotāpannāpi🔽aññamaññaṃ diṭṭhisīlasāmaññena saṃhatā, pageva sakadāgāmiādayo. “Tathārūpāya diṭṭhiyā🔽diṭṭhisāmaññagato viharati tathārūpehi sīlehi sīlasāmaññagato viharatī”ti vacanato🔽puthujjanānampi diṭṭhisīlasāmaññena saṃhatabhāvo labbhatiyeva.

And because of the words, “The stream-enterer is incapable of committing any action that would cause him to be reborn in hell, in the animal realm, or in the domain of ghosts; he is incapable of exhausting the life-faculty by way of an action that would cause him to be reborn in the intermediate state” , the stream-enterer is incapable of committing any action that would cause him to be reborn in the four planes of misery.🔽“It is impossible, it cannot happen that a person possessed of right view could deprive his mother of life” , and so on. original: taṃ vā anavasesapariyādānato gamento pūretīti keṭubhaṃ. Vevacanappakāsakanti pariyāyasaddadīpakaṃ,🔽ekekassa atthassa anekapariyāyavacanavibhāvakanti attho. Nidassanamattañcetaṃ anekesampi
analyzed: tam vā anavasesa pariyādānataḥ pūreti iti keṭubham vevacana pakāsakam ti pariyāya sadda dīpakam  ekekassa atthassa aneka pariyāya vacana vibhāvakanti atthaḥ anekesam pi
translated: The “expounder of synonyms” is the one who illuminates the synonyms.🔽The meaning is that he illuminates the various ways of expressing each meaning. But this is only an illustration,🔽for that text also occurs in order to illuminate the fact that many meanings can be expressed by a single word.

original: atthānaṃ ekasaddavacanīyatāvibhāvanavasenapi tassa ganthassa pavattattā. Vacībhedādilakkhaṇā🔽kiriyā kappīyati etenāti kiriyākappo, so pana vaṇṇapadasambandhapadatthavibhāgato
analyzed: atthānam eka sadda vacanīya tā vibhāvana vasena api tassa ganthassa pavatta ttā vacī bheda ādi lakkhaṇā  kiriyā kappīyati etena ati kiriyākappo so pana vaṇṇa pada sambandha padattha vibhāgato
translated: The “analysis of the mode of action” is that by which the mode of action, which is characterized by the division of speech, etc.,🔽is made clear. But that is analyzed in many ways by the analysis of the phonemes, the analysis of the words, and the analysis of the meanings of the words.

original: bahuvikappoti āha “kiriyākappavikappo”ti. Idañca mūlakiriyākappaganthaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: bahu vikappaḥ ti āha kiriyā kappa vikappaḥ ti idam ca mūla kiriyā kappa gantham sandhāya
translated: Therefore he says, “The analysis of the mode of action is analyzed.” And this is said with reference to the root text on the mode of action,

original: vuttaṃ. So hi satasahassaparimāṇo nalacariyādipakaraṇaṃ. Ṭhānakaraṇādivibhāgato nibbacanavibhāgato
analyzed: vuttam saḥ hi sata sahassa parimāṇaḥ nala cariyā ādi pakaraṇam ṭhāna karaṇa ādi vibhāgataḥ nibbacana vibhāgataḥ
translated: for that is a hundred thousand stanzas in length. The phonemes are divided by the analysis of the place of articulation, the manner of articulation, etc.,🔽and by the analysis of the pronunciation. The “analysis of the phonemes” is the analysis of the phonemes of the three Piṭakas.

original: ca akkharā pabhedīyanti etehīti akkharappabhedā, sikkhāniruttiyo. Etesanti vedānaṃ.
analyzed: ca akkharā pabhedīyanti etehi iti akkhara ppabhedā sikkhā niruttiyaḥ etesanti vedānam
translated: “By these” means by the three Piṭakas.

original: Te eva vede padaso kāyatīti padako. Taṃ taṃ saddaṃ tadatthañca byākaroti byācikkhati
analyzed: te eva vede padaso kāyati iti padako tam tam saddam tad attham ca byākaroti byācikkhati
translated: He “expounds” and “explains” each sound and its meaning by means of this, thus it is “expounding” .

original: etenāti byākaraṇaṃ, saddasatthaṃ. Āyatiṃ hitaṃ tena loko na yatati na īhatīti lokāyataṃ.
analyzed: etena ati byākaraṇam āyatim hitam tena lokaḥ na yatati na īhati iti lokāyatam
translated: The world does not strive and exert itself for what is beneficial in the future by means of this, thus it is “speculation” .

original: Tañhi ganthaṃ nissāya sattā puññakiriyāya cittampi na uppādenti. Vayatīti vayo, na
analyzed: tat hi gantham nissāya sattā puñña kiriyāya cittam pi na uppādenti vayati iti vayaḥ na
translated: For, depending on that doctrine, beings do not even arouse their minds to meritorious deeds.🔽“Decay” is decay ;

original: vayo avayo, na avayo anavayo, ādimajjhapariyosānesu katthaci aparikilanto avitthāyanto
analyzed: vayaḥ avayaḥ na avayaḥ anavayaḥ ādi majjha pariyosānesu katthaci a parikilantaḥ a vitthāyantaḥ
translated: “non-decay” is non-decay .🔽He remembers and fulfills those texts, is the meaning.

original: te ganthe sandhāreti pūretīti attho. Dve paṭisedhā pakatiṃ gamentīti dassento “avayo
analyzed: te ganthe sandhāreti pūreti iti atthaḥ dve paṭisedhā pakatim gamenti iti dassentaḥ avayo
translated: Showing that the two negations go back to the original, he said, “Non-decay does not occur” .

original: na hotī”ti vatvā tattha avayaṃ dassetuṃ “avayo…pe… na sakkotī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: na hoti iti vatvā tattha avayam dassetum na sakkoti iti vuttam
translated: Then, in order to show non-decay there, he said, “Non-decay … is unable” .🔽“Heavy” means that it is difficult to go after freeing oneself from it.

original: 384. Garūti bhāriyaṃ attānaṃ tato mocetvā gamanaṃ dukkaraṃ hoti. Anatthopi uppajjati
analyzed: bhāriyam attānam tatas mocetvā gamanam dukkaram hoti anatthaḥ api uppajjati
translated: Harm also arises,🔽such as blame, abuse, and persecution.

original: nindābyārosaupārambhādi. Abbhuggatoti ettha abhisaddayogena itthambhūtākhyānatthe upayogavacanaṃ.
analyzed: nindā byārosa aupārambha ādi ettha abhisadda yogena itthambhūta ākhyāna tthe upayoga vacanam
translated: “Arisen” : here the word “arisen” is used in the sense of “having become such” by the addition of the prefix abhi .

original: Lakkhaṇānīti lakkhaṇadīpanāni mantapadāni. Antaradhāyantīti na kevalaṃ lakkhaṇamantāniyeva,
analyzed: lakkhaṇāni iti lakkhaṇa dīpanāni manta padāni antaradhāyanti iti na kevalam
translated: ‘Characteristics’ are the words of the stanzas that reveal the characteristics. ‘Disappeared’ means that not only the stanzas of the characteristics but also

original: aññānipi brāhmaṇānaṃ ñāṇabalābhāvena anukkamena antaradhāyanti. Tathā hi vadanti🔽“ekasataṃ addhariyaṃ dipaññāsamattato sāmā”tiādi. Paṇidhimahato samādānamahatotiādinā
analyzed: aññāni api brāhmaṇānam ñāṇa bala abhāvena anukkamena antaradhāyanti tathā hi vadanti  eka satam sāma atiādi paṇidhi mahataḥ samādāna mahataḥ itiādinā
translated: other stanzas of the brahmans disappeared one after another through the loss of the brahmans’ knowledge and power. For they say:🔽‘One hundred and one, two thousand and ninety-two, and thirty-two’ .

original: paccekaṃ maha-saddo yojetabbo. Paṇidhimahantatādi cassa buddhavaṃsacariyāpiṭakavaṇṇanādivaseneva
analyzed: paccekam maha saddaḥ yojetabbo paṇidhi mahanta tā ādi ca ssa buddha vaṃsa cariyā piṭaka vaṇṇanā ādi vasena iva
translated: The word ‘great’ should be construed with each of the terms ‘great aspiration’, ‘great undertaking’, and so on. And the greatness of aspiration, etc., should be understood by the method of the Buddhavamsa and Cariyapitaka commentaries, etc.

original: veditabbo. Niṭṭhāti nipphattiyo. Jātisāmaññatoti lakkhaṇajātiyā lakkhaṇabhāvena samānabhāvato.
analyzed: veditabbaḥ niṭṭhā ati nipphattiyaḥ jāti sāmaññato ti lakkhaṇa jātiyā lakkhaṇa bhāvena samāna bhāvato
translated: ‘Fulfilment’ is the result. ‘By the similarity of birth’ means by the similarity of the characteristic of the characteristic.

original: Yathā hi buddhānaṃ lakkhaṇāni suvisuddhāni suparibyattāni paripuṇṇāni ca honti, na
analyzed: yathā hi buddhānam lakkhaṇāni su visuddhāni su paribyattāni paripuṇṇāni ca honti na
translated: For the characteristics of Buddhas are very pure, very clear, and complete,

original: evaṃ cakkavattīnaṃ. Tenāha “na teheva buddho hotī”ti.
analyzed: evam cakkavattīnam tena āha na tehi iva buddhaḥ hoti iti
translated: but those of Wheel-turning Monarchs are not. Therefore it is said, ‘He is not a Buddha by that alone.’

original: Abhirūpatā dīghāyukatā, appātaṅkatā brāhmaṇādīnaṃ piyamanāpatāti catūhi acchariyadhammehi.
analyzed: abhirūpa tā dīghāyuka tā appa ātaṅka tā brāhmaṇa ādīnam catūhi acchariya dhammehi
translated: The four wonderful things are beauty, long life, freedom from sickness, and being dear to gods and men.

original: Dānaṃ piyavacanaṃ atthacariyā samānattatāti imehi catūhi saṅgahavatthūhi. Rañjanatoti🔽pītijananato. Cakkaṃ cakkaratanaṃ vatteti pavattetīti cakkavattī, sampatticakkehi🔽sayaṃ vatteti, tehi ca paraṃ sattanikāyaṃ vatteti pavattetīti cakkavattī, parahitāvaho🔽iriyāpathacakkānaṃ vatto vattanaṃ etassa atthīti cakkavattī, appaṭihataṃ vā āṇāsaṅkhātaṃ🔽cakkaṃ vattetīti cakkavatī, appaṭihataṃ vā āṇāsaṅkhātaṃ cakkaṃ vattetīti cakkavattī,
analyzed: dānam piya vacanam attha cariyā samānatta tā ati imehi catūhi saṅgaha vatthūhi rañjana toti  pīti jananataḥ cakkam cakka ratanam vatteti pavatteti iti cakkavattī sampatti cakkehi  sayam vatteti tehi ca param satta nikāyam vatteti pavatteti iti cakkavattī para hita āvahaḥ  iriyāpatha cakkānam vattaḥ vattanam etassa atthi iti cakkavattī appaṭihatam vā āṇā saṅkhātam  cakkam vatteti iti cakkavatī a paṭihatam vā āṇā saṅkhātam cakkam vatteti iti cakkavattī
translated: By the four means of gathering a following, namely, giving, kind words, beneficent conduct, and impartiality. By gladdening:

original: khattiyamaṇḍalādisaññitaṃ cakkaṃ samūhaṃ attano vase vattetīti cakkavattī. Dhammaṃ🔽caratīti dhammiko. Dhammato anapetattā dhammo rañjanatthena rājāti dhammarājā. Kopādīti🔽ādi-saddena kāmalobhamānamadādike saṅgaṇhāti. Vijitāvīti vijitavā. Kenaci akampiyaṭṭhena
analyzed: khattiya maṇḍala ādi saññitam cakkam samūham attanaḥ vase vatteti iti cakkavattī dhammam 🔽carati iti dhammikaḥ dhammataḥ an apeta ttā dhammaḥ rañjana atthena rājā ati dhammarājā kopa ādi iti 🔽ādi saddena kāma lobha māna mada ādike saṅgaṇhāti vijitāvī iti kenacid a kampiya ṭṭhena

He sets going by means of his own wheel-treasure, and he sets going by means of the wheel-treasure of others, the multitude of beings, thus he is a “wheel-turner” . original: janapadatthāvariyappatto. Daḷhabhattibhāvato vā janapado thāvariyaṃ patto etthāti
analyzed: janapada thāvariya pattaḥ daḷha bhatti bhāvataḥ vā janapadaḥ thāvariyam pattaḥ etthā ati
translated: He has attained lordship over the people. Or alternatively, he has attained lordship over the people because he has a powerful will.

original: janapadatthāvariyappatto. Cittīkatabhāvādināpi cakkassa ratanaṭṭho veditabbo. Esa
analyzed: cittīkata bhāva ādinā api cakkassa rata naṭṭho veditabbo esa
translated: He has attained lordship over the people. The meaning of the jewel of the wheel should be understood as the meaning of “delight” in the sense of delighting, etc.

original: nayo sesesupi. Ratinimittatāya vā cittīkatādibhāvassa ratijananaṭṭhena ekasaṅgahatāya visuṃ aggahaṇaṃ.
analyzed: nayo sesesu pi rati nimitta tāya vā cittīkata ādi bhāvassa rati janana ṭṭhena eka saṅgahatāya visum aggahaṇam
translated: The same method applies in the case of the rest. Or alternatively, the meaning of “delight” in the sense of delighting, etc., is mentioned separately because it is the cause of delight.

original: Imehi pana ratanehi rājā cakkavattī yaṃ yamatthaṃ paccanubhoti, taṃ taṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: imehi pana ratanehi rājā cakkavattī yam yam attham paccanubhoti tam tam dassetuṃ
translated: In order to show what benefit the universal monarch derives from these jewels,

original: “imesu panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Ajitaṃ jināti mahesakkhatāsaṃvattaniyakammanissandabhāvato.
analyzed: imesu pana atiādi vuttam ajitam jināti mahesakkha tā saṃvattaniya kamma nissanda bhāvataḥ
translated: “But as regards these jewels” is said. He conquers the unconquered because of the nature of the result of the kamma that brings about his greatness.

original: Vijite yathāsukhaṃ anuvicarati hatthiratanaṃ assaratanañca abhiruhitvā tesaṃ ānubhāvena
analyzed: vijite yathāsukham anuvicarati hatthi ratanam assa ratanam ca abhiruhitvā tesam ānubhāvena
translated: He moves about in his realm as he pleases, having mounted the jewel of the elephant and the jewel of the horse, because of their power,

original: antopātarāseyeva sakalaṃ pathaviṃ anusaṃyāyitvā rājadhāniyaṃ paccāgamanato. Pariṇāyakaratanena
analyzed: sakalam pathavim anusaṃyāyitvā rājadhāniyam pacca āgamanataḥ pariṇāyaka ratanena
translated: having gone over the whole earth in the morning and returned to the capital.🔽By means of the jewel of the treasurer

original: vijitamanurakkhati tena tattha tattha kattabbakiccassa saṃvidhānato. Sesehīti maṇiratanaitthiratanagahapatiratanehi.
analyzed: vijitam anurakkhati tena tattha tattha kattabba kiccassa saṃvidhānataḥ sesehi iti maṇi ratana aitthi ratana gahapati ratanehi
translated: By the rest: by the jewel treasure, the woman treasure, and the steward treasure.

original: Tattha maṇiratanena yojanappamāṇe dese andhakāraṃ vidhamitvā ālokadassanādinā sukhamanubhavati,🔽itthiratanena atikkantamānusarūpasampattidassanādivasena, gahapatiratanena icchiticchitamaṇikanakarajatādidhanappaṭilābhavasena.
analyzed: tattha maṇi ratanena yojana ppamāṇe dese andhakāram vidhamitvā āloka dassana ādinā sukham anubhavati  itthi ratanena atikkanta mānusa rūpa sampatti dassana ādi vasena gahapati ratanena icchiti chita maṇi kanaka rajata ādi dhana ppaṭilābha vasena
translated: Herein, by the jewel treasure he experiences pleasure by means of the light and so on that it gives, since it dispels the darkness in a region a league in extent.🔽By the woman treasure, since it shows the excellence of beauty that surpasses that of human beings, and so on. By the steward treasure, since it provides the wealth of jewels, gold, silver, and so on, as desired.

original: Ussāhasattiyogo yena kenaci appaṭihatāṇācakkabhāvasiddhito. Hatthiassaratanādīnaṃ🔽mahānubhāvattā kosasampattiyāpi pabhāvasampattisiddhito “hatthi…pe… yogo”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ussāha satti yogaḥ yena kenaci hatthi assa ratana ādīnam  mahā anubhāva ttā kosa sampattiyā api pabhāva sampatti siddhitaḥ hatthipe yogaḥ iti vuttam
translated: By the adviser treasure, since he has the power of energy and the state of being an unsurpassed adviser, and since he has the state of being one who is not obstructed in his vision of a league all around.🔽The elephant treasure, the horse treasure, and the jewel treasure are mentioned🔽because of their great power. The power of the army treasure is established by the power of the steward treasure.

original: Koso hi nāma sati ussāhasampattiyaṃ (uggatejassa sukumāraparakkamassa pasannamukhassa
analyzed: kosaḥ hi nāma sati ussāha sampattiyam ugga tejassa su kumāra parakkamassa pasanna mukhassa
translated: For the army treasure is brought to presence by the power of the steward treasure, which is the power of energy, since it is the power of one who is energetic, who has tender feet and hands, and whose face is clear .

original: sammukhe pāpuṇāti). Pacchimenāti pariṇāyakaratanena. Tañhi sabbarājakiccesu kusalaṃ
analyzed: sammukhe pāpuṇāti pacchimena ati pariṇāyaka ratanena tat hi sabba rāja kiccesu kusalam
translated: By the last: by the adviser treasure. For that is skilled in all the king’s duties.

original: avirajjhanapayogaṃ. Tenāha “mantasattiyogo”ti. Tividhasattiyogaphalaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ
analyzed: tena āha manta satti yoga uti tividha satti yoga phalam paripuṇṇam
translated: and the practice of non-greed. Hence ‘the practice of the three ideas’ is said. The meaning is that the fruit of the practice of the three ideas is fulfilled.🔽With the rest: with the rest of the five Treasures.

original: hotīti sambandho. Sesehīti sesehi pañcahi ratanehi. Adosakusalamūlajanitakammānubhāvenāti
analyzed: hoti iti sambandhaḥ sesehi iti sesehi pañcahi ratanehi adosa kusala mūla janita kamma anubhāvena ati
translated: By the influence of the profitable action produced by non-hate:

original: adosasaṅkhātena kusalamūlena sahajātādipaccayavasena uppāditakammassa ānubhāvena
analyzed: adosa saṅkhātena kusala mūlena sahajāta ādi paccaya vasena uppādita kammassa ānubhāvena
translated: by the influence of the action produced by the profitable root called non-hate, which is a conascent and postnascent condition,

original: sampajjanti sommatararatanajātikattā. Majjhimāni maṇiitthigahapatiratanāni. Alobha…pe…
analyzed: sampajjanti sommatara ratana jāti kattā majjhimāni maṇi itthi gahapati ratanāni
translated: they are born, because they are of a more excellent kind of jewel. The middle ones are the Jewel of the Counsellor and the Jewel of the Treasurer.

original: kammānubhāvena sampajjanti uḷāradhanassa uḷāradhanapaṭilābhakāraṇassa ca pariccāgasampadāhetukattā.
analyzed: kamma anubhāvena sampajjanti uḷāra dhanassa uḷāra dhana paṭilābha kāraṇassa ca pariccāga sampadā hetuka ttā
translated: By the influence of the profitable action produced by non-greed, they are born, because they are the cause of the acquisition of great wealth and the cause of the perfection of giving.🔽The last: the Jewel of the General.

original: Pacchimanti pariṇāyakaratanaṃ. Tañhi amoha…pe… kammānubhāvena sampajjati mahāpaññeneva🔽cakkavattirājakiccassa pariṇetabbattā.
analyzed: pacchimanti pariṇāyaka ratanam tat hi amohape kamma anubhāvena sampajjati mahā paññena iva  cakkavatti rāja kiccassa pariṇetabba ttā
translated: By the influence of the profitable action produced by non-delusion, it is born, because only one of great understanding can conduct the duties of a Universal Monarch.🔽Because of the removal of opponents, they are brave. Hence it is said that they are of a kind not to tremble.

original: Saraṇato paṭipakkhavidhamanato sūrā. Tenāha “abhīrukajātikā”ti. Asure vijinitvā ṭhitattā
analyzed: saraṇataḥ paṭipakkha vidhamanataḥ sūrā tena āha abhīruka jātikā ati asure vijinitvā ṭhita ttā
translated: Because they are established after conquering the Asuras,
