analyzed: pāpa dhammānam ti chattiṃsa pāpa dhammānam sotthānam maggam pāpanena nissesataḥ sodhita ttā  dhammo nāma arahatta maggaḥ kusala dhammesu ukkaṃsa pārami ppattiyā ukkaṭṭha niddesena
translated: “The good Dhamma” is the path to the destruction of the thirty-six bad dhammas. It is called “good” because it is purified by the removal of bad dhammas.🔽“The Dhamma” is the path of arahantship. It is called “the best” because it is the highest among the wholesome dhammas.

original: Tassa anurūpadhammabhāvato anudhammo nāma heṭṭhimamaggaphaladhammā. Yo satthu santike
analyzed: tassa anurūpa dhamma bhāvataḥ anudhammaḥ nāma heṭṭhima magga phala dhammā yo satthu santike
translated: “The Anudhamma” is the dhammas of the lower paths and fruits. One who,

original: dhammaṃ sutvā yathānusiṭṭhaṃ na paṭipajjati, so tathāgataṃ dhammādhikaraṇaṃ viheṭheti
analyzed: dhammam sutvā yathā anusiṭṭham na paṭipajjati saḥ tathāgatam dhamma adhikaraṇam viheṭheti
translated: having heard the Dhamma from the Teacher, does not practice in accordance with the instruction, is said to “harass the Tathagata with a Dhamma-quarrel.”

original: nāma. Yo pana paṭipajjanto ca dandhābhiññatāya kammaṭṭhānasodhanatthaṃ antarantarā🔽bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamitvā anekavāraṃ kathāpeti, so ettāvatā dhammādhikaraṇaṃ tathāgataṃ🔽viheṭhetīti na vattabbo. Na hi bhagavato dhammadesanāya parissamo atthi, ayañca attho
analyzed: nāma yaḥ pana paṭipajjanto ca dandha abhiñña tāya kammaṭṭhāna sodhana attham antar antarā  bhagavantam upasaṅkamitvā aneka vāram kathāpeti saḥ ettāvatā dhamma adhikaraṇam tathāgatam  viheṭheti iti na vattabbaḥ na hi bhagavataḥ dhamma desanāya parissamaḥ atthi ayaṃ ca attho
translated: But one who practices, but who, because of slow direct-knowledge, has to purify the meditation subject by approaching the Blessed One again and again🔽and asking questions many times, cannot be said to “harass the Tathagata with a Dhamma-quarrel.” For the Blessed One has no trouble in teaching the Dhamma,🔽and this matter can be illustrated by the Maha Sudassana Sutta, etc. Therefore,

original: mahāsudassanasuttādīhi dīpetabbo, tasmā – “saccadhammassa anudhamma”nti vattabbe
analyzed: mahāsudassana sutta ādīhi dīpetabbaḥ tasmā sacca dhammassa anudhammanti vattabbe
translated: when it is said that the Anudhamma is the truth of the Dhamma,

original: vuttameva byatirekamukhena vibhāvetuṃ “na ca maṃ dhammādhikaraṇaṃ vihesesī”ti vuttanti
analyzed: vuttam eva byatireka mukhena vibhāvetum na ca mam dhamma adhikaraṇam vihesesi iti vuttam ti
translated: In order to show what has already been said by a different method, he said: “You should not trouble me with a legal issue.”

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tattha parinibbāyīti parakāle cettha parinibbānampi saṅgayhati, taṃ pana
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam tattha parinibbāyi iti para kāle ca ittha parinibbānam pi saṅgayhati tam pana
translated: Herein, one who attains extinction in the interval is one who attains extinction in the interval between the death of the body and the arising of the next body. But that is included in this one,

original: imasmiṃ gahitameva hotīti āha “desanāya arahatteneva kūṭaṃ gahita”nti.
analyzed: imasmin gahitam eva hoti iti āha desanāya arahattena iva kūṭam gahitanti
translated: so he says: “The peak is included by the Arahantship taught.”

original: Brahmāyusuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
translated: The elucidation of the meaning of the brief statement in the Brahmayu sutta is ended.

original: 2. Selasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sela sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sela Sutta

original: 396. Keṇiyoti tassa nāmaṃ, pubbe keṇiyā jīvikākappanatoti vadanti. Jaṭiloti jaṭādharo.
analyzed: keṇiyaḥ ti tassa nāmam pubbe keṇiyā jīvikā kappanato ti vadanti jaṭilaḥ ti jaṭādharo
translated: Keṇiya: this is his name. They say that formerly he made his living by the keṇiya plant. He was a knotted-haired ascetic: he wore his hair in knots.

original: Brāhmaṇajātikattā koṭisāratāya ca brāhmaṇamahāsālo. Payojetvā nissayo hutvā vasati,🔽rattiṃ kāmasampattiṃ anubhavatīti vā yojanā. Susaṅkhatanti sappimadhusakkarādīhi
analyzed: brāhmaṇa jātikattā koṭisāratāya ca brāhmaṇa mahāsālaḥ payojetvā nissayaḥ hutvā vasati  rattim kāma sampattim anubhavati iti vā yojanā sappi madhu sakkara ādīhi
translated: He was a great brahmin because he was of brahmin clan and because he was worth a hundred thousand. He lived in dependence on the king, being supported by him,🔽or the construction may be: he lived in dependence on the king, being supported by him, enjoying the pleasures of love at night.🔽Well-prepared: well-prepared with ghee, honey, sugar, etc.,

original: ceva maricasiṅgīverādīhi ca suṭṭhu abhisaṅkhataṃ.
analyzed: ca iva marica siṅgīvera ādīhi ca suṭṭhu abhisaṅkhatam
translated: and with black pepper, ginger, etc.

original: Paṭikkhepapasannatāyāti ahovatāyaṃ appiccho, yo nimantiyamānopi na sādiyatīti upanimantiyamānassa
analyzed: paṭikkhepa pasanna tāya ati aho vata ayam appicchaḥ yaḥ nimantiyamānaḥ api na sādiyati iti upanimantiyamānassa
translated: ‘In the sense of confidence in refusal’: ‘Surely he is a man of few wishes, since he does not consent to being invited.’

original: paṭikkhepe titthiyānaṃ pasannabhāvatoti. Taṃ kathaṃ? Viruddhametanti “akāraṇameta”nti paṭikkhipati.
analyzed: paṭikkhepe titthiyānam pasanna bhāvato ti tam katham viruddham etat ti akāraṇam etat ti paṭikkhipati
translated: ‘In the sense of confidence in the refusal of those who invite him’: how is that? He refuses, saying, ‘This is contrary to the rule,’ ‘This is not the reason,’

original: 398. Kappasahassehipi…pe… ahosīti idaṃ nānussavasiddhaṃ anumānaggahaṇaṃ sandhāyāha.🔽Padeti uttarapadalopena niddesoti āha “padappamāṇe”ti. Pajjati nikkhipati etthāti
analyzed: ahosi iti idam na anussava siddham anumāna ggahaṇam sandhāya āha  pada iti uttara pada lopena niddesaḥ ti āha pada ppamāṇa iti pajjati nikkhipati ettha ati
translated: ‘For a thousand aeons … has been’ . This is a kind of inference based on what is well known.

original: vā padaṃ pakatiyā pādanikkhipaṭṭhānaṃ, tasmiṃ pade. Kīḷāpasutatādinā pamādaṃ āpajjati.
analyzed: vā padam pakatiyā pāda nikkhipa ṭṭhānam tasmin pade kīḷā pasuta tā ādinā pamādam āpajjati
translated: ‘In the sense of a place’: ‘In the sense of a measure of a place’ is what is said by ellipsis of the middle term. A place is a footing for the placing of a foot. He falls into negligence in that place through playing, yawning, etc.,

original: Bodhisattacārikanti dukkaracariyaṃ sandhāya vadati.🔽399. Paripuṇṇatāyāti anūnatāya. Ahīnaṅgatāyāti avekallabhāvato. Rocatīti ruci, dehappabhā,
analyzed: bodhisatta cārikanti dukkara cariyam sandhāya vadati  paripuṇṇa tāya ati anūna tāya ahīna aṅga tāya ati avekalla bhāvataḥ rocati iti ruci deha ppabhā
translated: ‘In the sense of the Bodhisatta’s conduct’: he speaks with reference to the difficult practice .🔽‘In the sense of completeness’: in the sense of non-deficiency. ‘In the sense of non-loss’: in the sense of non-want. ‘Beauty’ is radiance of the body.

original: sobhaṇā ruci etassāti suruci. Ārohasampatti kāyassa pamāṇayuttauccatā. Pariṇāhasampatti
analyzed: sobhaṇā ruci etassa ati su ruci āroha sampatti kāyassa pamāṇa yuttā aucca tā pariṇāha sampatti
translated: He has beautiful radiance, thus he is ‘endowed with beauty’ . ‘The perfection of height’: the height of the body in the sense of a measure. ‘The perfection of breadth’:

original: kisathūlabhāvavajjitapariṇāhatā. Saṇṭhānasampatti avayavānaṃ susaṇṭhitatā. Cārudassanoti🔽piyadassano tenāha “sucirampī”tiādi. Suvaṇṇasadisavaṇṇoti jātihiṅgulakena madditvā
analyzed: saṇṭhāna sampatti avayavānam su saṇṭhita tā  piya dassanaḥ tena āha su ciram pi itiādi suvaṇṇa sadisa vaṇṇaḥ ti jāti hiṅgulakena madditvā
translated: and free from the condition of being fat or thin. The perfection of shape is the well-shapedness of the limbs. He is beautiful to look upon:🔽he is lovely to look upon. Hence he said: “For a long time” , etc. He has a skin the colour of gold: he has a skin the colour of solid gold that has been placed after being burnished with a polishing wheel

original: silānighaṃseneva parikammaṃ katvā ṭhapitaghanasuvaṇṇarūpavaṇṇo. Mahāpurisabhāvaṃ
analyzed: silā nighaṃsena iva parikammam katvā ṭhapita ghana suvaṇṇa rūpa vaṇṇaḥ mahā purisa bhāvam
translated: and rubbed with a polishing compound of red ochre.🔽The marks of a great man: the marks of a great man are called “signs” because they “signify” , make known, the state of a great man.

original: byañjenti pakāsentīti byañjanāni, mahāpurisalakkhaṇānīti āha “paṭhamaṃ vuttabyañjanānevā”ti.🔽Pubbe vuttanti “surucī”ti pubbe vuttaṃ, “ādiccova virocasī”ti puna vuttaṃ. “Cārudassano
analyzed: byañjenti pakāsenti iti byañjanāni mahāpurisa lakkhaṇāni iti āha paṭhamam vutta byañjanān eva ati  pubbe vuttanti suruci iti pubbe vuttam ādiccaḥ uva virocasi iti puna vuttam cāru dassano
translated: He said: “The same signs mentioned first” .

original: suvaṇṇavaṇṇosī”ti pubbe vuttaṃ, “kalyāṇadassano bhikkhu kañcanābhattaco”ti puna vuttanti🔽imamatthaṃ sandhāyāha “uttaragāthāyapi eseva nayo”ti. Sātisayaṃ uttamavaṇṇe vaṇṇetvā
analyzed: suvaṇṇa vaṇṇo asi iti pubbe vuttam kalyāṇa dassanaḥ bhikkhu puna vuttanti  imam attham sandhāya āha sa atisayam uttama vaṇṇe vaṇṇetvā
translated: He said: “The same method applies to the second verse” , referring to the meaning of this: “You are lovely to look upon, you shine like the sun. You are beautiful to look upon, you have the colour of gold. The bhikkhu is lovely to look upon, he has the colour of burnished gold” .🔽Having described his pre-eminent colour with the words “You are lovely to look upon” , etc., he makes known his existence with the words “You are the supreme beauty” .

original: uttamavaṇṇinoti padena santaṃ pakāsetīti āha “uttamavaṇṇasampannassā”ti. Uttamasārathīti
analyzed: uttama vaṇṇinaḥ iti padena santam pakāseti iti āha uttama vaṇṇa sampannassa ati uttama sārathī iti
translated: He said: “The supreme beauty” , referring to the meaning of this:

original: seṭṭhapurisasārathi. Tattha tattha jambuvanasaṇḍamaṇḍitatāya jambudīpo “jambusaṇḍo”ti
analyzed: seṭṭha purisa sārathi tattha tattha jambu vana saṇḍa maṇḍita tāya jambudīpaḥ jambu saṇḍo ti
translated: the best of men, the charioteer of men to be tamed.🔽There, because it is adorned with the Jambu forest, the Rose-Apple Island is called “the Jambu grove”.

original: vuccati. Issariyanti cakkavattissariyaṃ.
analyzed: vuccati issariyam ti cakkavatti ssariyam
translated: The best of men, the charioteer of men to be tamed. Here, the Rose-Apple Island is called “the Rose-Apple Wood” because it is adorned with rose-apple groves here and there. “Sovereignty” means universal sovereignty.

original: Jātikhattiyāti jātimanto khattiyā. Rājābhirājāti ettha abhi-saddo pūjatthoti āha “rājūnaṃ pūjanīyo”ti.
analyzed: jātikhattiyāḥ ti jātimantaḥ khattiyāḥ rāja abhirājā iti ettha abhisaddo pūjā atthaḥ ti āha rājūnam pūjanīyaḥ iti
translated: “Nobles by birth” means nobles by birth. “King of kings” : here the prefix abhi has the meaning of worship. Therefore he says, “worthy of worship by kings.”

original: Appamāṇāti aparimāṇā lokadhātuyo. “Yāvatā pana ākaṅkheyyā”ti hi vuttaṃ. Dhammarājā
analyzed: appamāṇāḥ ti aparimāṇāḥ lokadhātuyaḥ yāvatā pana ākaṅkheyya ati hi vuttam dhammarājā
translated: “Immeasurable” means immeasurable world systems. For it is said, “As far as he wishes.”

original: anuttaroti ettha vuttaanuttarabhāvaṃ “yāvatā hī”tiādinā pākaṭataraṃ katvā dhammarājabhāvaṃ
analyzed: ettha vutta anuttara bhāvam yāvatā hi iti ādinā pākaṭataram katvā dhammarāja bhāvam
translated: “The unsurpassed King of the Dhamma” : here the unsurpassedness stated is made clearer by the words “for as far as” , etc., and the state of being a King of the Dhamma is

original: vibhāvetuṃ “svāha”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Dhammenāti paṭivedhadhammena. Tenāha “anuttarenevā”ti.
analyzed: vibhāvetum svāha ntiādi vuttam dhammena ati paṭivedha dhammena tena āha anuttarena eva āti
translated: explained by the words “Svāha” , etc. “By the Dhamma” means by the Dhamma of penetration. Therefore he says, “by the unsurpassed” .

original: Anuttarenāti visiṭṭhena uttamena. Imasmiṃ pakkhe dhammenāti paṭipattidhammenātipi
analyzed: anuttarena ati visiṭṭhena uttamena imasmin pakkhe dhammena ati paṭipatti dhammena atipi
translated: “Unsurpassed” means distinguished, excellent. In this case, “by the Dhamma” can also be taken as meaning “by the Dhamma of practice.”

original: saṅgayhati. Pariyattidhammenāti desanādhammena āṇācakkaṃ pavattemīti yojanā. Desanāñāṇapaṭivedhañāṇavibhāgaṃ
analyzed: saṅgayhati pariyatti dhammena ati desanā dhammena āṇā cakkam pavattemi iti yojanā desanā ñāṇa paṭivedha ñāṇa vibhāgam
translated: “By the Dhamma of the totality” means by the Dhamma of teaching. The construction is: “I set in motion the wheel of command.” The distinction between the knowledge of teaching and the knowledge of penetration is

original: dhammacakkameva vā. Appaṭivattiyanti paṭivattituṃ asakkuṇeyyaṃ.🔽Tathāgatena jātoti tathāgatena hetunā ariyāya jātiyā jāto. Hetuatthe karaṇavacanaṃ.
analyzed: dhamma cakkam eva vā appaṭivattiyanti paṭivattitum a sakkuṇeyyam  tathāgatena jāto ti tathāgatena hetunā ariyāya jātiyā jātaḥ hetu atthe karaṇa vacanam
translated: Or it is the Wheel of the Dhamma itself. Incapable of being turned back : incapable of being turned back by anyone.🔽Born of the Tathāgata : born of the Tathāgata as cause, born of the noble birth. The instrumental case is used in the sense of cause.

original: Anujātoti ca vutte anu-saddassa vasena tathāgatanti ca upayogavacanameva hoti, so
analyzed: anujātaḥ iti ca vutte anu saddassa vasena ca upayoga vacanam eva hoti so
translated: If it were said “born after ,” then by the word “after” the Tathāgata would be a mere object of the action of being born.

original: ca anu-saddo hetuatthajotakoti āha “tathāgataṃ hetuṃ anujāto”ti. Avaññātabbabhāvena
analyzed: ca anu saddaḥ hetu attha jotakaḥ ti āha tathāgatam hetum anujātaḥ ti avaññātabba bhāvena
translated: But the word “after” indicates the sense of cause, therefore it is said “born with the Tathāgata as cause.”

original: jātoti avajāto duppaṭipannattā. Tenāha “dussīlo”ti. Tathā hi vuttaṃ kokālikaṃ ārabbha
analyzed: jātaḥ iti avajātaḥ duppaṭipanna ttā tena āha dussīlaḥ iti tathā hi vuttam kokālikam ārabbha
translated: Born in the sense of being born in the state of being incapable of being known : born in the sense of being born as one of bad conduct. Therefore it is said “of bad conduct.” For it is said with reference to Kokālika:

original: “purisantakali avajāto”ti. Putto nāma na hoti tassa ovādānusāsaniyaṃ aṭṭhitattā.
analyzed: avajāto ti putto nāma na hoti tassa ovāda anusāsaniyam a ṭṭhita ttā
translated: “He is a human pest, born in the sense of being born as one of bad conduct.” He is not a son of the Tathāgata because he does not stand in the position of being instructed and advised by the Tathāgata.

original: Evamāhāti “anujāto tathāgata”nti evamāha.
analyzed: evam āha ati evam āha
translated: Thus has he said : thus has he said “born after the Tathāgata.”

original: Vijjāti maggavijjā. Ukkaṭṭhaniddesena vimuttīti phalavimutti. Nanu ca maggo bhāvetabbena
analyzed: vijjā ati magga vijjā ukkaṭṭha niddesena vimutti iti phala vimutti nanu ca maggaḥ bhāvetabbena
translated: Knowledge : the knowledge of the path. By the word “highest” the highest deliverance, i.e., the deliverance of the fruit, is indicated. But is not the path to be developed?

original: gahitoti? Saccaṃ gahito, sabbe ca pana satta dhammā abhiññeyyāti vijjāya abhiññeyyabhāvo
analyzed: gahito ti saccam gahito sabbe ca pana satta dhammā abhiññeyyā ati vijjāya abhiññeyya bhāvo
translated: “Is he caught?” “He is caught,” and the fact that all seven ideas are to be directly known is stated by the words “ by direct knowledge” .

original: vutto. Iminā vā nayena sabbesampi abhiññeyyabhāvo vutto evāti veditabbo. Phalena
analyzed: vuttaḥ iminā vā nayena sabbesam pi abhiññeyya bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ evā ti veditabbaḥ phalena
translated: Or else the fact that all are to be directly known can be understood in this way:

original: vinā hetubhāvasseva abhāvato hetuvacanena phalasiddhi, nirodhassa ca sampāpanena
analyzed: vinā hetu bhāvassa iva abhāvataḥ hetu vacanena phala siddhi nirodhassa ca sampāpanena
translated: because there is no cause without fruit, the fruit is established by the word “ cause” ,🔽and the cause of the path is the bringing about of cessation.

original: maggassa hetubhāvo. Dukkhassa nibbattanena taṇhāya samudayabhāvoti imamatthaṃ saṅgahitameva🔽atthato āpannattā. Yuttahetunāti yuttiyuttena hetunā buddhabhāvaṃ sādheti saccavinimuttassa
analyzed: maggassa hetu bhāvaḥ dukkhassa nibbattanena taṇhāya samudaya bhāvaḥ ti imam attham saṅgahitam eva  atthataḥ āpanna ttā yutta hetunā ati yutti yuttena hetunā buddha bhāvam sādheti sacca vinimuttassa
translated: The fact that craving is the origin is included in the meaning of the words “ the origin of suffering” ,🔽because it is already stated.🔽“ With a reason” : he proves his Buddhahood with a reason that is appropriate, because there is nothing to be awakened to apart from the truth, and because he is awakened to it without remainder by the awakening to the truth.

original: bujjhitabbassa abhāvato saccasambodhaneneva ca tassa anavasesato buddhattā. Atthavacanañcetaṃ,
analyzed: bujjhitabbassa abhāvataḥ sacca sambodhanena iva ca tassa anavasesataḥ buddha ttā attha vacanam ca etam
translated: This is a statement of the meaning.

original: payogavacanāni pana – brāhmaṇa, ahaṃ sammāsambuddho sabbathā aviparītadhammadesano,
analyzed: payoga vacanāni pana brāhmaṇa aham sammāsambuddho sabbathā aviparīta dhamma desano
translated: The statements of the application are these: “Brahmin, I am a Perfect Sambuddha, a teacher of the truth in all ways,

original: sammāsambuddhattā sabbattha aviparītamācikkhati yathāhaṃ sabbamaggadesakoti. Kiṃ
analyzed: sammāsambuddha ttā sabbattha aviparītam ācikkhati yathā aham sabba magga desakaḥ iti kim
translated: because I am a Perfect Sambuddha I teach without error in all ways, as the one who shows all paths.”🔽“ What is the reason?

original: pana bhagavā sayameva attano sammāsambuddhabhāvaṃ ārocetīti? Mahākaruṇāya aññesaṃ
analyzed: pana bhagavā sayam eva attano sammāsambuddha bhāvam āroceti iti mahā karuṇāya aññesam
translated: But does not the Exalted One himself proclaim his own supreme enlightenment? —Out of great compassion for others,

original: mahāvisayato. Tattha “ekomhi sammāsambuddho, sabbābhibhū sabbavidūhamasmī”tiādīni
analyzed: mahā visayataḥ tattha ekaḥ asmi sammāsambuddhaḥ sabba abhibhū sabba vidū ham asmi itiādīni
translated: because his domain is great. Herein, the following sutta passages proclaim his supreme enlightenment: “I am the supreme one in the world with its gods, its Māras, and its Brahmās, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmans, with its gods and men. I am the teacher supreme. I am the one to be honored, the worthy one, the supreme victor.”

original: suttapadāni idameva ca suttapadaṃ etassa atthassa sādhakaṃ.🔽Sallakantanoti sallānaṃ samucchinnattā. Rogassāti kilesarogassa. Tasmāti apunapavattipādanena🔽tikicchanato. Brahmaṃ vā seṭṭhaṃ sammāsambodhiṃ pattoti brahmabhūto. Evaṃ āgatāyāti iminā –🔽“Kāmā te paṭhamā senā, dutiyā arati vuccati;🔽Tatiyā khuppipāsā te, catutthī taṇhā pavuccati.🔽Thinamiddhaṃ tepañcamaṃ thinamiddhaṃ te, chaṭṭhā bhīrū pavuccati;🔽Sattamī vicikicchā te, makkho thambho te aṭṭhamo.
analyzed: sutta padāni idam eva ca sutta padam etassa atthassa sādhakam  rogassa ati kilesa rogassa tasmā iti apunapavatti pādanena  tikicchanataḥ brahmam vā seṭṭham sammāsambodhim patto ti brahma bhūtaḥ evam āgatāya ati iminā  kāmā te paṭhamā senā dutiyā arati vuccati  tatiyā khuppipāsā te catutthī taṇhā pavuccati  thinamiddham te pañcamam thinamiddham te chaṭṭhā bhīrū pavuccati  sattamī vicikicchā te makkhaḥ thambhaḥ te aṭṭhamaḥ
translated: And this sutta passage also proves the same meaning:🔽“I am the one who has crossed, the one who has gone beyond, the one who has reached dry land from the water, the one who has come out from the pit, the one who has been freed from the bonds, the one who has laid down the burden, the one who has reached his own goal, the one who has utterly destroyed the fetters of becoming, the one who is completely cooled.”

original: Lābho siloko sakkāro, micchāladdho ca yo yaso;
analyzed: lābhaḥ siloko sakkāraḥ micchāladdho ca yaḥ yaso
translated: “I am the one who has cut off the bonds of becoming, the one who has cut off the bonds of the disease, the one who has cut off the bonds of the dart. I am the one who has healed the dart, the one who has removed the dart, the one who has attained supreme freedom from the dart. I am the one who has cut off the bonds of the dart, the one who has cut off the bonds of the disease, the one who has cut off the bonds of the dart. I am the one who has healed the dart, the one who has removed the dart, the one who has attained supreme freedom from the dart. I am the one who has cut off the bonds of the dart, the one who has cut off the bonds of the disease, the one who has cut off the bonds of the dart. I am the one who has healed the dart, the one who has removed the dart, the one who has attained supreme freedom from the dart. I am the one who has cut off the bonds of the dart, the one who has cut off the bonds of the disease, the one who has cut off the bonds of the dart. I am the one who has healed the dart, the one who has removed the dart, the one who has attained supreme freedom from the dart. I am the one who has cut off the bonds of the dart, the one who has cut off the bonds of the disease, the one who has cut off the bonds of the dart. I am the one

original: Yo cattānaṃ samukkaṃse, pare ca avajānati;
analyzed: yaḥ cattānam samukkaṃse pare ca avajānati
translated: And he who exalts himself and disparages others,

original: Esā namuci te senā, kaṇhassābhippahārinī”ti. ;🔽Evaṃ vuttaṃ navavidhaṃ senaṃ saṅgayhati. Vase vattetvāti samucchindanena anuppādatāpādanena vase vattetvā. Kutoci abhayo nibbhayo.
analyzed: esā namuci te senā kaṇhassa abhippahārinī iti  evam vuttam navavidham senam saṅgayhati vase vattetvā iti samucchindanena anuppāda tā āpādanena vase vattetvā kutoci abhayaḥ nibbhayaḥ
translated: This is your army, Namuci, that leads you to ruin.”

original: Sayameva daṭṭhabbanti yena yena adhigato, tena tena parasaddhāya gantabbaṃ hitvā
analyzed: sayam eva daṭṭhabbanti yena yena adhigataḥ tena tena para saddhāya gantabbam hitvā
translated: So he combines the ninefold army in this way. Having brought it under his control by taming and subduing it: having brought it under his control by cutting it off and by making it not arise again. From anywhere: from anywhere. Fearless, free from fear.

original: asammohato paccavekkhaṇāñāṇeneva sāmaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tenāha “paccakkha”nti. Pasaṭṭhā🔽diṭṭhi sandiṭṭhi. Yathā rathena jayatīti rathiko, evaṃ idaṃ maggabrahmacariyaṃ sandiṭṭhiyā🔽jayatīti sandiṭṭhikaṃ. Atha vā diṭṭhanti dassanaṃ vuccati, diṭṭhameva sandiṭṭhaṃ,
analyzed: asammohataḥ paccavekkhaṇa āñāṇena iva sāmam daṭṭhabbam tena āha paccakkhanti pasaṭṭhā  diṭṭhi sandiṭṭhi yathā rathena jayati iti rathikaḥ evam idam magga brahmacariyam sandiṭṭhiyā  jayati iti sandiṭṭhikam atha vā diṭṭhanti dassanam vuccati diṭṭham eva sandiṭṭham
translated: To be seen for oneself: except by means of the faith of another, it is to be seen by oneself by means of the knowledge that consists in reviewing without confusion. Hence ‘evident’ is said.🔽The view that is spread out is the view that is extended.🔽As one who conquers by means of a chariot is called a charioteer , so this noble path conquers by means of the view that is extended, thus it is ‘of a kind to be seen here and now’ . Or alternatively, seeing is called seeing; what is seen is seen here and now,

original: sandassananti attho. Sandiṭṭhaṃ arahatīti sandiṭṭhiko yathā vatthayugaṃ arahatīti
analyzed: sandassanam ti attho sandiṭṭham arahati iti sandiṭṭhikaḥ yathā vattha yugam arahati iti
translated: the meaning is, it is seen in this very life. It is fit to be seen here and now, thus it is ‘of a kind to be seen here and now’ ,

original: vatthayugiko. Sandiṭṭhikaṃ phaladānaṃ sandhāya nāssa kāloti akālaṃ, akālameva akālikaṃ,
analyzed: vatthayugikaḥ sandiṭṭhikam phala dānam sandhāya na assa kālo ti akālam akālam eva akālikam
translated: The one who gives a pair of cloths.

original: na kālantaraṃ khepetvā phalaṃ deti, attano pana pavattisamanantarameva phalaṃ detīti
analyzed: na kāla antaram khepetvā phalam deti pavatti samanantaram eva phalam deti iti
translated: The meaning is that it gives its fruit without delay, not after a lapse of time, but immediately next to its own occurrence.

original: attho. Atha vā attano phalappadāne pakaṭṭho kālo patto assāti kāliko, lokiyo kusaladhammo,
analyzed: atthaḥ atha vā attanaḥ phala ppadāne pakaṭṭhaḥ kālaḥ pattaḥ assa ati kālikaḥ lokiyaḥ kusala dhammo
translated: Or alternatively, the meaning is that it is timely, since the time for giving its fruit has arrived, is manifest, in itself.

original: idaṃ pana samanantaraphalattā na kālikaṃ.
analyzed: idam pana samanantara phalat tā na kālikam
translated: But this is not timely, since it gives its fruit immediately next to itself.

original: 400. “Mahāyaññaṃ pavattayī”tiādīsu kevalaṃ dānadhammādīsu yaññapariyāyasambhavato
analyzed: mahā yaññam pavattayi iti ādīsu kevalam dāna dhamma ādīsu yañña pariyāya sambhavataḥ
translated: In such passages as “He performed a great sacrifice” , it is said that the word “sacrifice” is used figuratively for the act of giving and so on.🔽For the brahmans, who have no sacrifice,

original: “brāhmaṇānaṃ yaññābhāvato”ti vuttaṃ. Brāhmaṇā hi “aggimukhā devā”ti aggijuhanapubbakaṃ🔽yaññaṃ vidahanti. Tenāha “aggijuhanappadhānāti attho”ti “bhūrbhuva? Sva?” Iti sāvittī
analyzed: brāhmaṇānam yañña abhāvato ti vuttam brāhmaṇāḥ hi aggi mukhāḥ devā ti aggi juhana pubbakam  yaññam vidahanti tena āha aggi juhana ppadhānā ati bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar iti sa avittī
translated: perform a sacrifice that begins with the kindling of the sacred fire.🔽That is why it is said that the word “sacrifice” is used figuratively for the act of kindling the sacred fire.🔽The word “bhūḥ” is the beginning, the first, of the Sāvitti formula, “Bhūḥ, bhuvaḥ, svaḥ.”

original: pubbakattā mukhaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ. “Mukhamiva mukha”ntiādīsu viya idhāpi padhānapariyāyo
analyzed: pubbaka ttā mukham pubbaṅgamam mukham iva mukham ti ādīsu viya idha api padhāna pariyāyaḥ
translated: And here the word “sacrifice” is used figuratively for the beginning, the first, just as in such passages as “The mouth is the best of all sense bases” .

original: mukhasaddoti dassento “manussānaṃ seṭṭhato rājā ‘mukha’nti vutto”ti āha. Ādhāratoti
analyzed: mukha saddaḥ iti dassentaḥ manussānam seṭṭhataḥ rājā mukhanti vuttaḥ ti āha ādhārataḥ ti
translated: “The word ‘face’ is said of the king as the best of men.” “As the support”:

original: ogāhantīnaṃ nadīnaṃ ādhārabhāvato paṭisaraṇato gantabbaṭṭhānabhāvato. Saññāṇatoti
analyzed: ogāhantīnam nadīnam ādhāra bhāvataḥ paṭisaraṇataḥ gantabba ṭṭhāna bhāvataḥ saññāṇato ti
translated: because the rivers that flow down have him as their support, as their source, as the place to which they go. “As the sign”:

original: candayogavasena ajja asukanakkhattanti paññāyanato. Ālokakaraṇatoti nakkhattāni abhibhavitvā
analyzed: canda yoga vasena ajja asuka nakkhattanti paññāyanataḥ āloka karaṇato ti nakkhattāni abhibhavitvā
translated: because he is known today as such-and-such a constellation by the conjunction of the moon. “As the illuminator”:

original: ālokakaraṇato. Sommabhāvatoti sītahimavāsītavātūpakkharabhāvato. Tapantānanti dīpasikhā
analyzed: āloka karaṇato somma bhāvato ti dīpa sikhā
translated: because he illuminates the constellations. “As the cool one”: because he is the abode of the cool moon, snow, water, and wind. “The shining ones”:

original: aggijālā asanivicakkanti evamādīnaṃ vijjalantānaṃ. Āyamukhaṃ aggadakkhiṇeyyabhāvena.
analyzed: evamādīnam vijjalantānam āya mukham agga dakkhiṇeyya bhāvena
translated: the flames of a lamp, the flames of a fire, the flashes of lightning, etc. “The face of the sky”: the eastern direction, as the first to be worshipped.

original: Dibbacakkhu dhammacakkhu paññācakkhu buddhacakkhu samantacakkhūti imehi pañcahi cakkhūhi.🔽Te saraṇassāti te saraṇassa ca, te saraṇabhāvamūlakattā itaradvayassa ca, yathāvutta
analyzed: dibba cakkhu dhamma cakkhu paññā cakkhu buddha cakkhu samanta cakkhu iti imehi pañcahi cakkhūhi  te saraṇassa ati te saraṇassa ca te saraṇa bhāva mūla kattā itara dvayassa ca yathāvutta
translated: With the five eyes: the divine eye, the Dhamma eye, the wisdom eye, the Buddha eye, and the all-seeing eye.

original: te-padena vuttatthato parassa cāti attho. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – “te tuyhaṃ, itarassa
analyzed: te padena vutta tthataḥ parassa ca ati atthaḥ idam vuttam hoti te tuyham itarassa
translated: “To you as the refuge”: to you as the refuge, and also to the other two, which are rooted in the state of being a refuge. The meaning is: to you, who are stated by the word “you”

original: ca saraṇassa aho ānubhāvo”ti. Āvuttivasena vā te saraṇassāti ettha attho vibhāvetabbo
analyzed: ca saraṇassa aho ānubhāvaḥ ti āvutti vasena vā te saraṇassa ati ettha atthaḥ vibhāvetabbo
translated: And what is the power of one who has gone for refuge?”

original: – tuyhaṃ saraṇabhūtassa ca itarasaraṇassa ca ānubhāvoti. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: tuyham saraṇa bhūtassa ca itara saraṇassa ca ānubhāvo ti sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: Or else the meaning can be illustrated as follows: “The power of one who has gone for refuge in you and the power of one who has gone for refuge in the other.” The rest is easy to understand.

original: Selasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: sela sutta vaṇṇanāya līnattha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the word “slender” in the verse of the Elder Sela is ended.

original: 3. Assalāyanasuttavaṇṇanā🔽401. Aññamaññavisiṭṭhattā visadisaṃ rajjaṃ virajjaṃ, virajjato āgatā, tattha jātāti
analyzed: assalāyana sutta vaṇṇanā  añña mañña visiṭṭha ttā visadisam rajjam virajjam virajjataḥ āgatā tattha jātā ati
translated: The explanation of the verse of Assalayana🔽is ended.

original: vā verajjakā, evaṃ jātā kho pana te, yasmā vatthābharaṇādivibhāgena nānappakārā honti,
analyzed: vā verajjakāḥ evam jātā kho pana te yasmai vattha ābharaṇa ādi vibhāgena nānappakārāḥ honti
translated: The kingdom of the non-Aryan is a kingdom that is not distinguished by the distinction of the Aryan. It has come from the non-Aryan, or it is born there, thus it is the kingdom of the non-Aryan. And they are born in that way, since they are of various kinds by reason of the distinctions of their material form, garments, etc.

original: tasmā vuttaṃ “nānāverajjakāna”nti. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana verajjasseva vasena nānappakāratā🔽vuttā. Yaññupāsanādināti yaññānubhavanamantajjhenadakkhiṇapariyesanādinā. Catuvaṇṇasādhāraṇanti
analyzed: tasmā vuttam nānā verajjakānam ti aṭṭhakathā ayam pana verajjassa iva vasena nānā ppakāra tā  vuttāḥ yañña upāsana ādinā ti catu aṇṇa sādhāraṇanti
translated: That is why it is said “of various kinds of non-Aryan kingdoms.” But in the commentary the various kinds are stated according to the non-Aryan kingdoms.🔽By the performance of sacrifices, etc., is by the performance of sacrifices, by the seeking of merit, by the seeking of gifts, and so on.🔽Common to the four castes is common to the four castes, namely, the nobles, the brahmans, the merchants, and the workers.

original: khattiyādīnaṃ catunnaṃ vaṇṇānaṃ sādhāraṇaṃ saṃsārasuddhipāpatassanaṃ. Nhānasuddhiyāti
analyzed: khattiya ādīnam catunnam vaṇṇānam sādhāraṇam saṃsāra suddhi pāpa tassanam nhāna suddhiyā ti
translated: By the purification of bathing is

original: titthasamuddakhātesu mantajappanapubbakaṃ sāyaṃtatiyaudakorohanādinhānasuddhiyā.
analyzed: tittha samudda khātesu manta jappana pubbakam sāyaṃtatiya audakorohana ādi nhāna suddhiyā
translated: In the case of the fords, the ocean, the plough, the fire, the recitation of the mantras, the three-forked staff, the water-sipping, the shaving,

original: Bhāvanāsuddhiyāti paramajotibhūtāya purisabhāvanāsaṅkhātāya suddhiyā. Vāpitasiroti
analyzed: bhāvanā suddhiyā ati parama joti bhūtāya purisa bhāvanā saṅkhātāya suddhiyā
translated: The purification by development is the purification called “development of a man” which has become the highest light.

original: oropitakeso. Tameva hi siro vāpitanti vuccati.
analyzed: oropita kesaḥ tam eva hi siraḥ vāpitanti vuccati
translated: “The shaved head”: the shaved hair. For the head itself is called “the shaved”.🔽“The one who speaks the truth about the nature of things”: the one who speaks in accordance with actuality.

original: Sabhāvavādīti yathābhūtavādī. Pabbajantāti brāhmaṇapabbajjaṃ upagacchantā, tasmā
analyzed: sabhāva vādī iti yathābhūta vādī pabbajantā ati brāhmaṇa pabbajjam upagacchantā tasmai
translated: “The ones who go forth”: the ones who go forth to the going forth of the brahmins. Therefore,🔽the brahmins said to him, “You have lost, Master Bharadvaja, for you have not been able to establish the brahmins’ method of purification by means of a reason, an argument, or an example.

original: brāhmaṇānaṃ pabbajjāvidhānaṃ sikkhantena bhotā “brāhmaṇāva sujjhanti, no abrāhmaṇā”ti
analyzed: brāhmaṇānam pabbajjā vidhānam sikkhantena bhotā brāhmaṇā ava sujjhanti no abrāhmaṇā ati
translated: The brahmins’ method of purification is without reason, without argument, without example.🔽The brahmins’ going forth is without reason, without argument, without example.🔽The brahmins’ training is without reason, without argument, without example.🔽The brahmins’ heaven is without reason, without argument, without example.🔽The brahmins’ purification, going forth, training, and heaven are without reason, without argument, without example.🔽Therefore, Master Bharadvaja, you have lost.”

original: ayaṃ vidhi sahetuko saupādāno sakkaccaṃ uggahito, tasmā tuyhaṃ parājayo natthi…pe… evamāhaṃsu.🔽402. Laddhibhindanatthanti “brāhmaṇāva brahmuno puttā orasā mukhato jātā brahmajā”ti
analyzed: ayam sa hetukaḥ sa aupādāno sakkaccam uggahito tasmā tuyham parājayaḥ evam āhaṃsu  brāhmaṇā ava puttāḥ orasāḥ mukhataḥ jātāḥ brahma jāti
translated: “The one who speaks the truth about the nature of things” is the one who speaks in accordance with actuality.🔽“The ones who go forth”: the ones who go forth to the going forth of the brahmins. Therefore,🔽the brahmins said to him, “You have lost, Master Bharadvaja, for you have not been able to establish the brahmins’ method of purification by means of a reason, an argument, or an example.🔽The brahmins’ method of purification is without reason, without argument, without example.

original: evaṃ pavattaladdhiyā viniveṭhanatthaṃ. Puttapaṭilābhatthāyāti “evaṃ mayaṃ pettikaṃ
analyzed: evam pavatta laddhiyāḥ viniveṭhana attham putta paṭilābha atthāya ati evam mayam pettikam
translated: The brahmins’ going forth is without reason, without argument, without example.🔽The brahmins’ training is without reason, without argument, without example.🔽The brahmins’ heaven is without reason, without argument, without example.🔽The brahmins’ purification, going forth, training, and heaven are without reason, without argument, without example.🔽Therefore, Master Bharadvaja, you have lost.”🔽“The one who speaks the truth about the nature of things” is the one who speaks in accordance with actuality.🔽“The ones who go forth”: the

original: iṇadhāraṃ sodheyyāmā”ti laddhiyaṃ ṭhatvā puttapaṭilābhatthāya. Ayañhettha adhammikānaṃ🔽brāhmaṇānaṃ ajjhāsayo. Nesanti brāhmaṇānaṃ. Saccavacanaṃ siyāti “brahmuno puttā”tiādivacanaṃ🔽saccaṃ yadi siyā brāhmaṇīnaṃ…pe… bhaveyya, na cetaṃ atthi. Mahābrahmuno mukhato jātoti🔽vādacchedakavādo mukhatojātacchekavādo. Assalāyanoviññū jātiko “nirakkhepaṃ samaṇena
analyzed: iṇadhāram sodheyyāma ati laddhiyam ṭhatvā putta paṭilābha tthāya ayam ha ittha adhammikānam  brāhmaṇānam ajjhāsayaḥ na isanti brāhmaṇānam sacca vacanam siyā ati brahmuno putta ati ādi vacanam  saccam yadi siyā bhaveyya na ca itam atthi mahābrahmuno mukhataḥ jātaḥ ti  vāda chedaka vādaḥ mukhatas jāta cheka vādaḥ assalāyanaḥ viññū jātikaḥ nirakkhepam samaṇena
translated: and I will clear up the debt.” This is the idea of the unrighteous brahmans here. ‘Brahmans are descended from Brahma’s mouth’: if the statement ‘Brahmans are the sons of Brahma’ were true, then brahmans would be born of a brahman mother and father, and so on. But that is not so. ‘Born from Brahma’s mouth’: this is a mere assertion, a mere saying, a mere empty sound, a mere verbal expression, a mere verbal performance. Assalāyana, the wise, the learned, the discerning, do not accept that brahmans are the highest caste, that only they are pure, that only they are the sons of Brahma, born from his mouth, born of his parts, created by him, and heirs to his wealth.

original: gotamena vutta”nti jānantopi sahagatānaṃ brāhmaṇānaṃ cittānurakkhaṇatthaṃ “kiñcāpi🔽bhavaṃ gotamo”tiādimāha.🔽403. Idāni brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇoti vādaṃ bhindituṃ “sutaṃ te yonakakambojesū”tiādi
analyzed: gotamena vuttanti jānantaḥ api sahagatānam brāhmaṇānam citta anurakkhaṇa attham kiñcā api  bhavam gotama uti ādim āha  idāni brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ vaṇṇoti vādam bhinditum sutam te yonaka kambojesu utiādi
translated: and I would clear up the debt.” He stood there hoping for the birth of a son. This is the opinion of the unrighteous brahmins. “The brahmins are descended from Brahma”: if this statement were true, then the brahmins would be descended from the brahmin women, etc. But this is not so. “Born from the mouth of Great Brahma”: this is the “mouth-born” theory, a theory of origin by way of a verbal trick. Assalayana, though he knew that the statement “The recluse Gotama has said that all the brahmins of today are descended from a caste mixture” was a slander, nevertheless said, “Still, Master Gotama,” in order to protect the minds of his brahmin companions.

original: āraddhaṃ. Yadi brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇo, sabbattha brāhmaṇova seṭṭho bhaveyya, atha
analyzed: āraddham yadi brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ vaṇṇo sabbattha brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ bhaveyya atha
translated: Now, in order to refute the assertion that “the brahmin is the highest caste,” he began with the words, “Have you heard why the Kambhojas, Yavanas, and Kambojas are so called?” If the brahmin were the highest caste, then the brahmin would be the highest everywhere. But this is not so.

original: kasmā yonakakambojādijanapadesu brāhmaṇānaṃ seṭṭhabhāvo natthi? Evañhi tattha vaṇṇā,
analyzed: kasmā yonaka kamboja ādi janapadesu brāhmaṇānam seṭṭha bhāvaḥ na atthi evam hi tattha vaṇṇā
translated: Why is it that in such countries as Yona, Kamboja, etc., the brahmins are not the chief people? Because there the people are of a different race,

original: tasmā “brāhmaṇova seṭṭho”ti laddhimattametaṃ. Tesu hi janapadesu janā ekajjhaṃ sannipatitvā
analyzed: tasmā brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ iti laddhi mattam etam tesu hi janapadesu janāḥ ekajjham sannipatitvā
translated: and so the claim that “only the brahmins are the chief people” is mere words. For in those countries the people assemble together,

original: sammantayitvā katikaṃ akaṃsu, dāsaṃ sāmikaṃ katvā itare sabbe taṃ pūjetvā tassa vase🔽vattanti, yo tesaṃ ayyo hoti itare sabbe tassa dāsā honti, te katipayasaṃvaccharātikkamena
analyzed: sammantayitvā katikam akaṃsu dāsam sāmikam katvā itare sabbe tam pūjetvā tassa vase  vattanti yaḥ tesam ayyaḥ hoti itare sabbe tassa dāsāḥ honti te katipaya saṃvacchara atikkamena
translated: and after agreeing on a certain person, they make him their master and all the others serve him, honouring him.🔽After the lapse of some years,

original: tassa kiñci dosaṃ disvā taṃ tato ṭhānato apanetvā aññaṃ ṭhapenti, iti so ayyo hutvā🔽dāso hoti, itaro dāso hutvā ayyo hoti, evaṃ tāva keci “ayyo hutvā dāso hoti, dāso
analyzed: tassa kiñci dosam disvā tam tatas ṭhānataḥ apanetvā aññam ṭhapenti iti saḥ ayyaḥ hutvā  dāsaḥ hoti itaraḥ dāsaḥ hutvā ayyaḥ hoti evam tāva keci ayyaḥ hutvā dāsaḥ hoti dāsaḥ
translated: they see some fault in him and remove him from his position, and they appoint another in his place. Thus one who was a master

original: hutvā ayyo hotī”ti ettha atthaṃ vadanti. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana purimavaseneva tamatthaṃ
analyzed: hutvā ayyaḥ hoti iti ettha attham vadanti aṭṭhakathā ayam pana purima vasena iva tam attham
translated: becomes a slave, and one who was a slave becomes a master. This is how some explain the meaning of the passage, “He who was a master becomes a slave, and he who was a slave becomes a master.” But in the commentary the meaning is given in the first way,

original: dassetuṃ “brāhmaṇo sabhariyo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Vayappatte putte asatīti idaṃ vakkhamānassa
analyzed: dassetum brāhmaṇaḥ sa bhariyaḥ tiādi vuttam vaya patte putte asati iti idam vakkhamānassa
translated: as shown by the words, “The brahmin becomes a slave to all.”

original: dārakassa dāyajjasāmikabhāvassa tāva dassanaṃ. Mātito suddhoti ettha yo mātito suddhattā
analyzed: dārakassa dāyajja sāmika bhāvassa tāva dassanam mātitaḥ suddhaḥ ti ettha yaḥ mātitaḥ
translated: and the fact that the child is a master in respect of the inheritance.🔽As to “pure on the mother’s side”: he who is a slave because of being pure on the mother’s side

original: ayyo, pitito asuddhattā dāso hoti, so eva pitito asuddhattā dāso hutvā mātito ayyo
analyzed: ayyo pititaḥ asuddhattā dāsaḥ hoti saḥ eva pititaḥ asuddhattā dāsaḥ hutvā mātitaḥ ayyo
translated: and a master because of being impure on the father’s side, he is a mixed caste.🔽Others say that he is not a master in every way.

original: hotīti jātiṃ sambhedeti. Sova sabbena sabbaṃ hotīti na sakkā vattunti apare. Ko thāmoti
analyzed: hoti iti jātim sambhedeti saḥ uva sabbena sabbam hoti iti na sakkā vattunti apare kaḥ thāmaḥ iti
translated: What is the proof?

original: mahante lokasannivāse anamatagge atīte kāle itthīnaṃ vā citte anavaṭṭhite dāsā dāsā
analyzed: mahante loka sannivāse anamatagge atīte kāle itthīnam vā citte an avaṭṭhite dāsāḥ dāsā
translated: In the past, in the great world-cycle when there was no turning back in the minds of women, slaves were only slaves and masters were only masters.

original: eva honti, ayyā ayyā eva hontīti ettha ko ekantiko sahetuko avassayo, tassa sādhako
analyzed: eva honti ayyāḥ ayyāḥ eva honti iti ettha kaḥ ekantikaḥ sa hetukaḥ avassayaḥ tassa sādhako
translated: What is the single, causal, reliable, and convincing proof of that?

original: siddhanto, kiṃ nidassananti attho.
analyzed: siddhantaḥ kim nidassanan ti attho
translated: What is the evidence?

original: 404. Sukkacchedakavādo nāmāti “brāhmaṇova sukko vaṇṇo”ti evaṃ vutto sukkacchedakavāro nāma.
analyzed: sukkacchedakavādaḥ nāma ati brāhmaṇaḥ uva sukkaḥ evam vuttaḥ sukkacchedakavāraḥ nāma
translated: The “doctrine of the pure-cut” is the section of the doctrine that is called “pure-cut” because it is stated thus: “Only the brahmin class is pure, the other classes are impure.”

original: 408. Sabbasmiṃ aggikiccaṃ karonteti etena yathā yato kutoci nissayato uppanno aggiupādānasampanno
analyzed: sabbasmin aggi kiccam karontā iti etena yathā yatas kutoci nissayataḥ uppannaḥ aggi upādāna sampannaḥ
translated: “When all are doing the chief duties”: by this it is shown that the fire that is obtained from any source whatsoever, whether from a slave or from a master,

original: aggikiccaṃ karoti, evaṃ yasmiṃ kasmiñci dāsakule jāto upanissayasampanno sammāpaṭipajjamāno
analyzed: aggi kiccam karoti evam yasmim kasmiñci dāsa kule jātaḥ upanissaya sampannaḥ sammā paṭipajjamāno
translated: He performs the duties of a fire-worshipper. Thus he shows that whoever is born in any family of slaves, and is endowed with the necessary conditions, and conducts himself rightly,

original: saṃsārato sujjhati evāti dasseti.
analyzed: saṃsārataḥ sujjhati eva ati dasseti
translated: is purified from the round of rebirths.

original: 409. Pādasikavaṇṇoti antarāḷavaṇṇo. Etesanti khattiyakumārena brāhmaṇakaññāya uppannaputto,
analyzed: pādasika vaṇṇo ti antarāḷa vaṇṇo etesan ti khattiya kumārena brāhmaṇa kaññāya uppanna putto
translated: The colour of the skin: the colour of the skin in the interior of the body. Of these: the son born of a noble youth and a brahmin maiden,

original: brāhmaṇakumārena khattiyakaññāya uppannaputtoti etesaṃ dvinnaṃ māṇavakānaṃ. Matakabhatteti🔽mate uddissa katabhatte. Thālipāketi katamaṅgalabhatte.🔽410. Tumheti jātisāmaññato māṇavaṃ brāhmaṇehi saddhiṃ ekajjhaṃ saṅgaṇhanto āha. Ko
analyzed: brāhmaṇa kumārena khattiya kaññāya uppanna putto ti etesam dvinnam māṇavakānam matakabhattā iti  mate uddissa kata bhatte thālipākā iti kata maṅgala bhatte  tumhā iti jāti sāmaññataḥ māṇavam brāhmaṇehi saddhim ekajjham saṅgaṇhantaḥ āha kaḥ
translated: and the son born of a brahmin youth and a noble maiden. At a funeral feast: at a feast given in honour of the dead. At a dish of rice: at a feast given in honour of a child’s birth.

original: nu khoti avaṃsiro isivādo, tesaṃ brāhmaṇīsīnaṃ asāmatthiyadassanena jātiyā appamāṇataṃ
analyzed: nu kho ti avaṃsiraḥ isi vādo tesam brāhmaṇīsīnam asāmatthiya dassanena jātiyāḥ appamāṇa taṃ
translated: You: he says this to include the youth in the brahmins by reason of their common birth. Who: this is a contemptuous expression. The brahminical doctrine of the Vedas is a doctrine of the brahmins. By showing the incapacity of those brahminical doctrines, he approaches in the guise of a village boy in order to demonstrate the measurelessness of birth.

original: vibhāvetuṃ gāmadārakavesena upagacchi. Tena vuttaṃ “gāmaṇḍalarūpo viyā”ti. Koṇḍadamakoti adantadamako.
analyzed: vibhāvetum gāma dāraka vesena upagacchi tena vuttam gāmaṇḍala rūpaḥ viyāti adanta damakaḥ
translated: Therefore it is said: “as if in the guise of a village boy.” Tamer of the untamed: tamer of the untamed.

original: 411. Janetīti janikā janetti. Janako pitāti etthāpi eseva nayo. Gandhabbapañhanti
analyzed: janeti iti janikā janetti janakaḥ pitā ati ettha api esa iva nayaḥ
translated: “Mother” is one who gives birth. “Father” is one who begets.🔽The question about the gandhabba

original: gandhabbassa mātukucchiyaṃ uppajjanakasattassa khattiyabhāvādipucchaṃ. Dabbigahaṇasippampi
analyzed: gandhabbassa mātu kucchiyam uppajjanaka sattassa khattiya bhāva ādi puccham dabbi gahaṇa sippam pi
translated: is the question about the khattiya-hood, etc., of the being who is to be reborn in the mother’s womb. The art of handling the leech

original: ekā vijjā veditabbā. Tattha kira kusalo yaṃ kiñci āhārūpagapaṇṇapupphaphalabījaṃ🔽antamaso elālukampi gahetvā bhesajjehi yojetvā pacanto sappimadhuphāṇitehi samānarasaṃ🔽katvā sampādetuṃ sakkoti, puṇṇopi tādiso, tena ñātaṃ tvaṃ dabbigahaṇasippamattampi
analyzed: ekā vijjā veditabbā tattha kira kusalaḥ yam kiñci āhāra upaga paṇṇa puppha phala bījam  antamasaḥ elālukam pi gahetvā bhesajjehi yojetvā pacantaḥ sappi madhu phāṇitehi samāna rasam  katvā sampādetum sakkoti puṇṇaḥ api tādiso tena ñātam tvam dabbi gahaṇa sippa mattam pi
translated: should be understood as a single science. It seems that one skilled in it can take any kind of food, such as meat, vegetables, flowers, fruits, seeds,🔽even a single garlic bulb, and by combining it with medicines, cook it in such a way that it can be made to have the same taste as ghee, honey, and sugar. Puṇṇa was also such a one. Therefore the meaning is: “You do not even know the art of handling the leech.”

original: na jānāsīti sambandho. Saddhoti kammaphalasaddhāya saddho, pothujjanikeneva ratanattayapasādena
analyzed: na jānāsi iti sambandho saddho ti kamma phala saddhāya saddho pothujjanikena iva
translated: “Faithful” : faithful by virtue of faith in kamma and its fruits. He is satisfied with the mere mundane faith in the Triple Gem.

original: pasanno. Tenevāha – “upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ…pe… saraṇaṃ gata”nti.
analyzed: pasannaḥ tena iva āha upāsakam mam bhavaṃpe saraṇam gatanti
translated: Therefore he says: “Master … I am a lay follower who has gone for refuge from today forward.”

original: Assalāyanasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: assalāyana sutta vaṇṇanāya līnattha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the brief account in the Assalāyana sutta is ended.

original: 4. Ghoṭamukhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ghoṭamukha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Ghoṭamukha Sutta

original: 412. Khemiyā nāma rañño deviyā ropitattā taṃ ambavanaṃ khemiyambavananti vuccatīti
analyzed: khemiyā nāma raññaḥ deviyā ropita ttā tam ambavanam khemiyambavananti vuccati iti
translated: They say.

original: vadanti. Dhammikoti dhammayutto sabbasova adhammaṃ pahāya dhamme ṭhito. Paribbajati🔽pabbajati etenāti paribbajo, gharāvāsato nikkhamanapubbakaṃ liṅgaggahaṇavasena sīlasamādānaṃ.🔽Etthāti etasmiṃ paribbaje. Sabhāvoti taṃ paribbājaniyaṃ, tehi tehi paribbājakehi
analyzed: vadanti dhammikaḥ ti dhamma yutto sabbaso va adhammam pahāya dhamme ṭhitaḥ paribbajati  pabbajati etena ati paribbajaḥ ghara āvāsataḥ nikkhamana pubbakam liṅga ggahaṇa vasena sīla samādānam  ettha ati etasmin paribbaje sabhāvaḥ ti tam paribbājaniyam tehi tehi paribbājakehi
translated: He is righteous: he is endowed with the Dhamma, he has abandoned all unrighteousness and stands on the Dhamma.🔽He goes forth: he goes forth by this, thus he goes forth; the undertaking of the virtue consisting in the acceptance of the distinguishing marks is preceded by the going forth from home.🔽Herein: in this going forth.

original: anuṭṭhātabbo paṭipattidhammasaṅkhāto sabhāvo. Dhammova pamāṇanti etena mayaṃ ahirimanā
analyzed: anuṭṭhātabbo paṭipatti dhamma saṅkhāto sabhāvaḥ dhammaḥ uva etena mayam ahirimanā
translated: The nature: that nature of the practice called the Dhamma that should be undertaken by these or those wanderers.

original: cittassa yathāupaṭṭhitaṃ kathema, tasmā taṃ appamāṇaṃ, yo panettha avitatho dhammo,🔽tadeva pamāṇaṃ. Adhigatapaṭipattisaṅkhāto sabhāvo atthi, tassa tumhehi tumhehi bahunā
analyzed: cittassa yathā upaṭṭhitam kathema tasmai tam appamāṇam yaḥ pana ittha avitathaḥ dhammo  tat eva pamāṇam adhigata paṭipatti saṅkhātaḥ sabhāvaḥ atthi tassa tumhehi tumhehi bahunā
translated: The Dhamma is the measure: by this we say that the way it appears to the shameless mind is not the case,🔽therefore it is not a measure. But the Dhamma that is true in this matter,🔽that is the measure. There is a nature called the practice that has been reached. You should be here by that much,

original: nānāsandassanādi kammena idha bhavitabbaṃ, bahudevettha vattabbanti adhippāyo.
analyzed: nānā āsandassana ādi kammena idha bhavitabbam bahu deva ittha vattabban ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: by the performance of the various duties of showing respect, etc., and there is much to be said here. This is the meaning.

original: 414. Sārattarattāti sārajjanavasena rattā, bahularāgavasena abhirattāti attho. Attanā
analyzed: sā āratta rattā ati sā ārajjana vasena rattā bahula rāga vasena abhirattā ati attho attanā
translated: He is fond of them in the sense of being anxious about them, that is, he is very attached to them.

original: ñāpetabbamatthaṃ anuggahāpeti bodhetīti anuggaho, ñāpitakāraṇaṃ, saha anuggahenāti🔽sānuggahā. Tenāha “sakāraṇā”ti. Kiṃ pana taṃ kāraṇaṃ? Imassādhippāyo “natthi dhammiko
analyzed: ñāpetabbam attham anuggahāpeti bodheti iti anuggahaḥ ñāpita kāraṇam saha anuggahena ati  sa anuggahā tena āha sa kāraṇā iti kim pana tam kāraṇam imassa adhippāyaḥ na atthi dhammikaḥ
translated: He helps to make known the reason for what he has said.

original: paribbajo”ti mayā vutto, addhā panāyasmā udeno yāthāvato dhammikaṃ paribbajaṃ me
analyzed: paribbajaḥ iti mayā vuttaḥ addhā pana āyasmai udenaḥ yāthāvataḥ dhammikam paribbajam me
translated: He has a reason, he says. But what is that reason? The idea is this: “I said that there is no such thing as a righteous wanderer. But surely the venerable Udena is expounding to me a righteous wandering as it really is.”

original: ācikkhatīti. Tenāha “vuttañheta”ntiādi.
analyzed: ācikkhati iti tena āha vuttam hetat tiādi
translated: That is why he said, “This has been said by the venerable one.”

original: 421. Sabbamidaṃ thāvarajaṅgamaṃ purisakataṃ, tasmā yaṃ kiñci katvā attā posetabbo
analyzed: sabbam idam thāvara jaṅgamam purisakatam tasmai yam kiñci katvā attā posetabbaḥ
translated: All this, whether fixed or moving, is the work of man. Therefore, having done anything, a man should support himself and guard himself.

original: rakkhitabboti lokāyatanissito nītimaggo ghoṭamukhakanto, tasmā āha “etassa kira jānanasippe”tiādi.
analyzed: rakkhitabbo ti lokāyata nissitaḥ nīti maggaḥ ghoṭa mukha kantaḥ tasmai āha etassa kira jānana sippa itiādi
translated: This is the way of conduct based on the world-sphere of the Devas, which is like a mouth-trap. That is why he said, “This is the art of knowing that he has taught.”

original: Sagge nibbatto nāma natthi akattabbameva karaṇato. Devalokapariyāpannadhanaṃ manussānaṃ
analyzed: sagge nibbattaḥ nāma natthi a kattabbam eva karaṇataḥ deva loka pariyāpanna dhanam manussānam
translated: There is no such thing as being reborn in heaven by doing nothing at all. Wealth included in the world of the gods is for men.

original: upakappapuññābhāvato pubbe attanā nihitadhanaṃ “asuke cā”ti ācikkhitvā gato. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: upakappa puñña abhāvato pubbe attanā nihita dhanam asuke ca ati ācikkhitvā gataḥ sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: because of his lack of merit, he had gone away after telling them where the treasure was. The rest is easy to understand.

original: Ghoṭamukhasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: ghoṭamukha sutta vaṇṇanāya līnattha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the word līna in the Ghoṭamukha Sutta is finished.

original: 5. Caṅkīsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: caṅkī sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Caṅkī Sutta

original: 422. Tasminti sālavane. Uttarena opāsādanti opāsādagāmassa uttaradisāyaṃ. Uttarenāti
analyzed: tasmin ti sāla vane uttarena opāsādanti opāsāda gāmassa uttara diśā ayam uttarena ati
translated: In that: in that Sāla Grove. To the north of Opāsāda: in the northern direction from the village of Opāsāda. To the north:

original: ena-saddayogena hi opāsādanti upayogavacanaṃ. Ajjhāvasatīti ettha adhi-ā-saddānaṃ
analyzed: ena sadda yogena hi upayoga vacanam ajjhāvasati iti ettha adhiāsaddānam
translated: for the word ena is used in the sense of “to the north of.” He dwelt: here the prefix adhi- and the root vas are taken as not having a different meaning,

original: anatthantarataṃ hadaye katvā āha “vasatī”ti. Idāni tesaṃ atthavisesabhāvitaṃ dassento
analyzed: hadaye katvā āha vasati iti idāni tesam attha visesa bhāvitam dassento
translated: so he says “he dwelt.” Now, showing the difference in meaning of those two words,

original: “abhibhavitvā vā āvasatī”tiādimāha. Etthāti opāsādapade. Sattussadantiādīsu pana
analyzed: abhibhavitvā vā āvasati iti ādim āha ettha iti opāsāda pade pana
translated: he says “he dwelt having overcome” and so on. Here: in the place Opāsāda. In the words sattussada, etc.,

original: kathanti āha – “tassa anuppayogattāva sesapadesū”ti. Upa-anu-adhi-iti-evaṃ-pubbake🔽vasanakiriyayāṭṭhāne upayogavacanameva pāpuṇātīti saddavidū icchantīti āha “lakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: katham ti āha tassa anuppayoga ttā ava sesa padesu iti upa anu adhi iti evaṃpubbake 🔽vasana kiriyayā aṭṭhāne upayoga vacanam eva pāpuṇāti iti sadda vidū icchanti iti āha lakkhaṇam
translated: he says “because of its uselessness in the other places.” The words upa-, anu-, adhi-, and iti- at the beginning of the words upavāsa, anuvāsa, adhivāsana, and itivāsa🔽are used in the sense of “to dwell” in the place of the verb vas. Those who know the words say that this is the characteristic of the words upa-, anu-, adhi-, and iti-.

original: saddasatthato pariyesitabba”nti. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “upasaggavasena panettha bhummatthe
analyzed: sadda satthataḥ pariyesitabbanti tathā hi vuttam upasagga vasena pana ittha bhumma tthe
translated: For this is said: “Herein, the word ‘earth’ should be understood in the sense of the ground by way of the prefix upa- in the sense of proximity.”

original: upayogavacanaṃ veditabba”nti. Ussadatā nāmettha bahulatāti taṃ bahulataṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: upayoga vacanam veditabbanti ussada tā nāma ittha bahula tā iti tam bahula tam dassetum
translated: “Abundance” is the great quantity there. In order to show that abundance,🔽“many people” is said.

original: “bahujana”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Āvajjitvāti parikkhipitvā.
analyzed: bahu jana nti ādi vuttam āvajjitvā ti parikkhipitvā
translated: Having encompassed: having surrounded.🔽It should be enjoyed like a king’s: it is a royal enjoyment.

original: Raññā viya bhuñjitabbanti vā rājabhoggaṃ. Rañño dāyabhūtanti kulaparamparāya bhoggabhāvena
analyzed: raññā viya bhuñjitabbanti vā rāja bhoggam raññaḥ dāya bhūtanti kula paramparāya bhogga bhāvena
translated: It is a royal gift: it is a gift given by the king as an enjoyment.🔽Therefore it is said: “The meaning is ‘a gift.’”

original: raññā laddhadāyabhūtaṃ. Tenāha “dāyajjanti attho”ti. Rājanīhārena paribhuñjitabbato🔽uddhaṃ paribhogalābhassa seṭṭhadeyyatā nāma natthīti āha – “chattaṃ ussāpetvā rājasaṅkhepena
analyzed: raññā laddha dāya bhūtam tena āha rāja nīhārena paribhuñjitabbato  uddham paribhoga lābhassa seṭṭha deyya tā nāma natthi iti āha chattam ussāpetvā rāja saṅkhepena
translated: Because it should be enjoyed by the royal method,🔽there is no higher gift than the gift of enjoyment. Therefore it is said: “Having raised the parasol, it should be enjoyed by the royal proclamation.”

original: paribhuñjitabba”nti. Titthapabbatādīsūti nadītitthapabbatapādagāmadvāraaṭavīmukhādīsu.
analyzed: paribhuñjitabbanti tittha pabbata ādīsu iti nadī tittha pabbata pāda gāma dvāra aṭavī mukha ādīsu
translated: At river fords, mountain slopes, village gates, forest openings, etc.

original: Nissaṭṭhapariccattanti muttacāgavasena pariccattaṃ katvā. Etesaṃ brāhmaṇagahapatikānaṃ.
analyzed: nissaṭṭha pariccattanti mutta cāga vasena pariccattam katvā etesam brāhmaṇa gahapatikānam
translated: Having given up, having relinquished: having made it given up by way of free generosity, to these brahmins and householders.

original: 423. Ti sannipatitā. Yo koci viññūnaṃ icchito pañho, tassa pucchitassa yāthāvato kathanasamattho pucchitapañhabyākaraṇasamattho.Kulāpadesādinā mahatī mattā etassāti mahāmatto.
analyzed: ti sannipatitā yaḥ koci viññūnam icchitaḥ pañho tassa pucchitassa yāthāvato kathana samattho pucchita pañha byākaraṇa samatthaḥ kula apadesa ādinā mahatī mattā etassa ati mahāmatto
translated: He is able to answer questions, able to explain questions asked, in that he is able to explain in accordance with truth any question that may be asked by anyone who is discerning and who wishes to ask a question. He is a great counsellor in that he is a counsellor of great extent by reason of his family, country, etc.

original: 424. Teti “nānāverajjakā”ti vuttabrāhmaṇā. “Ubhato sujāto”ti ettake vutte yehi kehici
analyzed: te iti vutta brāhmaṇāḥ ubhatas sujātaḥ iti ettake vutte yehi kehici
translated: The brahmans are called “of various countries” . When it is said “of a pure family on both sides” ,

original: dvīhi bhāgehi sujātatā viññāyeyya, sujātasaddo ca “sujāto cārudassano”tiādīsu ārohapariṇāhasampattipariyāyoti
analyzed: dvīhi bhāgehi sujāta tā viññāyeyya sujāta saddo ca sujātaḥ cāru dassanaḥ ti ādīsu āroha pariṇāha sampatti pariyāyo ti
translated: the purity of birth would be understood by means of the two terms “pure” and “family” , and the word “pure” would be superfluous.

original: jātivaseneva sujātataṃ vibhāvetuṃ “mātito ca pitito cā”ti vuttaṃ. Anorasaputtavasenapi
analyzed: jāti vasena iva sujāta tam vibhāvetum mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca ati vuttam anorasa putta vasena api
translated: So it is said “on the mother’s side and on the father’s side” in order to make it clear that the purity is by birth alone.

original: loke mātupitusamaññā dissati, idha panassa orasaputtavaseneva icchīyatīti dassetuṃ
analyzed: loke mātu pitu samaññā dissati idha pana assa orasa putta vasena iva icchīyati iti dassetum
translated: In the world the terms “mother” and “father” are also used for a wet-nurse and a foster-father,🔽but here only a natural mother and father are intended. So it is said “of a pure descent” in order to show that only a natural mother and father are intended.

original: “saṃsuddhagahaṇīko”ti vuttaṃ. Pitā ca mātā ca pitaro, pitūnaṃ pitaro pitāmahā, tesaṃ
analyzed: vuttam pitā ca mātā ca pitaraḥ pitūnam pitaraḥ pitāmahā tesam
translated: The parents are the father and mother. The grandfathers are the fathers’ fathers. The great-grandfathers are the grandfathers’ fathers.

original: yugo pitāmahayugo, tasmā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugāti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo. Yugasaddo
analyzed: pitāmaha yugo tasmā yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā ti evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ yuga saddaḥ
translated: The yoke is the yoke of the great-grandfathers. Therefore the meaning here should be regarded as follows: “as far as the seventh generation of great-grandfathers.”

original: cettha ekasesanayena daṭṭhabbo “yugo ca yugo ca yugā”ti. Evañhi tattha tattha dvinnaṃ🔽gahitameva hoti. Tenāha – “tato uddhaṃ sabbepi pubbapurisā pitāmahaggahaṇeneva gahitā”ti.
analyzed: ca ittha eka sesa nayena daṭṭhabbaḥ ca yugo ca yugā ti evam hi tattha tattha dvinnam  gahitam eva hoti tena āha tatas uddham sabbe api pubba purisā pitāmaha ggahaṇena iva gahitā ati
translated: The word “yoke” should be regarded as a collective term here in the sense of “a yoke and a yoke and a yoke.” For in this way🔽two are included in each case. Hence it is said: “After that all the ancestors are included by the words ‘great-grandfathers’” .

original: Purisaggahaṇañcettha ukkaṭṭhaniddesavasena katanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Evañhi “mātito”ti
analyzed: purisa ggahaṇam ca ittha ukkaṭṭha niddesa vasena katam ti daṭṭhabbam evam hi mātito ti
translated: The word “men” should be regarded as stated by way of the highest number. For in this way the words of the text “from the mother’s side”

original: pāḷivacanaṃ samatthitaṃ hoti. Akkhittoti appattakhepo. Anavakkhittoti saddhathālipākādīsu🔽na avakkhitto. Jātivādenāti hetumhi karaṇavacananti dassetuṃ “kena kāraṇenā”tiādi
analyzed: pāḷivacanam samatthitam hoti akkhittaḥ ti appatta khepaḥ an avakkhittaḥ ti saddhatha ālipāka ādīsu  na avakkhittaḥ jāti vādena ati hetumhi karaṇa vacananti dassetum kena kāraṇena atiādi
translated: are justified. Akkhitto = appattakhepo = anavakkhitto = na avakkhitto in saddhathālipākādīsu.

original: vuttaṃ. Ettha ca ubhato…pe… pitāmahayugāti etena brāhmaṇassa yonidosābhāvo dassito
analyzed: vuttam ettha ca pitāmaha yugā ti etena brāhmaṇassa yoni dosa abhāvaḥ dassito
translated: Jātivādenāti hetumhi karaṇavacananti dassetuṃ “kena kāraṇenā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Ettha ca ubhato …pe… pitāmahayugāti etena brāhmaṇassa yonidosābhāvo dassito

original: saṃsuddhagahaṇikabhāvakittanato. Akkhittoti iminā kiriyāparādhābhāvo. Kiriyāparādhena
analyzed: saṃsuddha gahaṇika bhāva kittanataḥ akkhittaḥ ti iminā kiriyāparādha abhāvaḥ kiriyāparādhena
translated: saṃsuddhagahaṇikabhāvakittanato. Akkhittoti iminā kiriyāparādhābhāvo. Kiriyāparādhena

original: hi sattā khepaṃ pāpuṇanti. Anupakuṭṭhoti iminā ayuttasaṃsaggābhāvo. Ayuttasaṃsaggampi
analyzed: hi sattā khepam pāpuṇanti anupakuṭṭhaḥ ti iminā ayutta saṃsagga abhāvaḥ ayutta saṃsaggam pi
translated: for beings come to be struck down by it. ‘Not crooked’ : this shows the absence of association with the unsuitable.

original: hi paṭicca sattā akkosaṃ labhanti.
analyzed: hi paṭicca sattāḥ akkosam labhanti
translated: for beings come to be reviled because of association with the unsuitable.

original: Issaroti adhipateyyasaṃvattaniyakammaphalena īsanasīlo. Sā panassa issaratā vibhavasampattipaccayā
analyzed: issaro ti adhipateyya saṃvattaniya kamma phalena īsana sīlo sā panassa issara tā vibhava sampatti paccayā
translated: ‘Lord’ : he is of the nature of a lord because of the kamma-result that leads to lordship. But his lordship is evident because of his wealth,🔽and so, speaking in terms of the state of being rich, he says: ‘Rich’ means ‘lord.’

original: pākaṭā jātāti aḍḍhatāpariyāyabhāvena vadanto “aḍḍhoti issaro”ti āha. Mahantaṃ dhanamassa
analyzed: pākaṭā jātā iti aḍḍha tā pariyāya bhāvena vadantaḥ aḍḍho ti issaro ti āha mahantam
translated: He has great wealth,🔽both on the earth and in the sky,🔽thus he is ‘greatly wealthy.’

original: bhūmigatañceva vehāsaṭṭhañcāti mahaddhano. Tassāti tassa tassa. Vadanti “anvayato🔽byatirekato ca anupasaṅkamanakāraṇaṃ kittemā”ti.
analyzed: bhūmi gatañca iva vehāsaṭṭhañca ati mahat dhanaḥ tassa ati tassa tassa vadanti anvayato  vyatirekataḥ ca an upasaṅkamana kāraṇam
translated: ‘They say’ : they say that the reason for not approaching is this.

original: Adhikarūpoti visiṭṭharūpo uttamasarīro. Dassanaṃ arahatīti dassanīyo. Tenāha “dassanayoggo”ti.
analyzed: adhika rūpaḥ ti visiṭṭha rūpaḥ uttama sarīro dassanam arahati iti dassanīyaḥ tena āha dassana yoggaḥ ti
translated: ‘Distinguished in appearance’ : he has a distinguished, excellent body. ‘Worth seeing’ : he is worth seeing. Hence he says: ‘Worth seeing in the sense of being seen.’

original: Pasādaṃ āvahatīti pāsādiko. Tenāha “cittapasādajananato”ti. Vaṇṇassāti vaṇṇadhātuyā.
analyzed: pasādam āvahati iti pāsādiko tena āha citta pasāda jananataḥ ti vaṇṇassa ati vaṇṇa dhātuyā
translated: ‘Inspiring confidence’ : he inspires confidence. Hence he says: ‘Inspiring confidence in the sense of causing confidence in the mind.’ ‘By his beauty’ : by his beauty of complexion.

original: Sarīranti sannivesavisiṭṭho karacaraṇagīvāsīsādi avayavasamudāyo, so ca saṇṭhānamukhena🔽gayhatīti “paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāyāti paramāya…pe… sampattiyā cā”ti vuttaṃ. Sabbavaṇṇesu
analyzed: sannivesa visiṭṭhaḥ avayava samudāyo saḥ ca saṇṭhāna mukhena  gayhati iti paramāya vaṇṇa pokkhara tāya ati sampattiyā ca ati vuttam sabba vaṇṇesu
translated: “Body” is a collection of parts such as hands, feet, head, etc., distinguished by its configuration. And it is apprehended by means of that configuration.🔽Therefore it is said: “with supreme beauty of complexion, with the most excellent, etc., perfection of complexion.”🔽For among all complexions the golden complexion is the most excellent.

original: suvaṇṇavaṇṇova uttamoti vuttaṃ “seṭṭhena suvaṇṇavaṇṇena samannāgato”ti. Tathā hi
analyzed: suvaṇṇa vaṇṇaḥ uva uttamaḥ ti vuttam seṭṭhena suvaṇṇa vaṇṇena samannāgato ti tathā hi
translated: Therefore it is said: “endowed with the most excellent golden complexion.” For thus🔽the Buddhas and the Wheel-turning Monarchs have a golden complexion.

original: buddhā cakkavattino ca suvaṇṇavaṇṇāva honti. Brahmavacchasīti uttamasarīrābho suvaṇṇābhoti
analyzed: buddhā cakkavattino ca honti uttama sarīra ābhaḥ suvaṇṇa ābhaḥ
translated: “Having a body like Brahmā’s” means having a body like the most excellent body, like a golden body.

original: attho. Imameva hi atthaṃ sandhāyāha “mahābrahmuno sarīrasadisena sarīrena samannāgato”ti.
analyzed: imam eva hi attham sandhāya āha mahābrahmuno sarīra sadisena sarīrena samannāgataḥ iti
translated: For with this very meaning it is said: “endowed with a body like the body of the Great Brahmā.”🔽Not in the sense of being of the same substance as Brahmā.

original: Na brahmujugattataṃ. Akhuddāvakāso dassanāyāti ārohapariṇāhasampattiyā avayavapāripūriyā
analyzed: na dassanāya ati āroha pariṇāha sampattiyā avayava pāripūriyā
translated: “Not too small an opportunity for seeing” means not a small opportunity for seeing by reason of the excellence of his height and breadth and the completeness of his limbs.

original: ca dassanāya okāso na khuddako. Tenāha “sabbānevā”tiādi.
analyzed: ca dassanāya okāsaḥ na khuddakaḥ tena āha sabbān eva atiādi
translated: Therefore it is said: “all of them,” etc.🔽He is “virtuous” because he possesses virtue that has the characteristic of restraint.

original: Yamaniyamalakkhaṇaṃ sīlamassa atthīti sīlavā, taṃ panassa rattaññutāya vuddhaṃ vaḍḍhitaṃ
analyzed: yama niyama lakkhaṇam sīlam assa atthi iti sīlavā tam panassa rattaññu tāya vuddham vaḍḍhitam
translated: And that is “developed” by his observance of the Uposatha and other holy days, and “increased” by his observance of the precepts.

original: sīlaṃ assa atthīti vuddhasīlī, tena ca sabbadā samāyogato vuḍḍhasīlena samannāgato.
analyzed: sīlam assa atthi iti vuddha sīlī tena ca sabbadā samāyogataḥ vuḍḍha sīlena samannāgataḥ
translated: He has virtue, thus he is “of mature virtue”; he is “endowed with mature virtue” because he is always associated with it.

original: Pañcasīlamattameva sandhāya vadanti tato paraṃ sīlassa tattha abhāvato tesañca ajānanato.🔽Ṭhānakaraṇasampattiyā sikkhāsampattiyā ca katthacipi anūnatāya parimaṇḍalapadāni🔽byañjanāni akkharāni etissāti parimaṇḍalapadabyañjanā. Atha vā pajjati attho etenāti
analyzed: pañca sīla mattam eva sandhāya vadanti tato param sīlassa tattha abhāvataḥ tesaṃ ca a jānanato  ṭhāna karaṇa sampattiyā sikkhā sampattiyā ca katthacipi anūna tāya parimaṇḍala padāni  byañjanāni akkharāni etissa ati parimaṇḍala pada byañjanā atha vā pajjati atthaḥ etena ati
translated: They say this only of the five training precepts, because there is no virtue beyond them and because they do not know of any.🔽The words are “rounded” because they are complete in every way in respect of the perfection of the opportunity for training and the perfection of the training.🔽Or alternatively, the words are the syllables, the letters, by which the meaning is expressed.

original: padaṃ, nāmādi, yathādhippetamatthaṃ byañjetīti byañjanaṃ vākyaṃ, tesaṃ paripuṇṇatāya
analyzed: padam nāma ādi yathā adhippetam attham byañjeti iti byañjanam vākyam tesam paripuṇṇa tāya
translated: The phrases are the names, etc., by which the intended meaning is expressed.🔽They are “rounded” because they are complete with both of these.🔽Or alternatively, speech is the instrument for the communication of meaning.

original: parimaṇḍalapadabyañjanā. Atthañāpanasādhanatāya vācāva karaṇanti vākkaraṇaṃ, udāharaṇaghoso.
analyzed: parimaṇḍala pada byañjanāḥ attha ñāpana sādhanatāya udāharaṇa ghosaḥ
translated: The words are “rounded” because they are complete with the qualities of the speaker and the meaning to be spoken.🔽The words are “rounded” because they are complete with both of these.🔽Or alternatively, speech is the instrument for the communication of meaning.

original: Guṇaparipuṇṇabhāvena tassa brāhmaṇassa, tena vā bhāsitabbaatthassa. Pūre puṇṇabhāve.
analyzed: guṇa paripuṇṇa bhāvena tassa brāhmaṇassa tena vā bhāsitabba atthassa pūre puṇṇa bhāve
translated: The words are “rounded” because they are complete with the qualities of the speaker and the meaning to be spoken.

original: Pūreti ca purimasmiṃ atthe ādhāre bhummaṃ, dutiyasmiṃ visaye. Sukhumālattanenāti
analyzed: pūra iti ca purimasmin atthe ādhāre bhummam dutiyasmin visaye
translated: The words are “rounded” because they are complete with both of these.

original: iminā tassā vācāya mudusaṇhabhāvamāha. Apalibuddhāya pittasemhādīhi. Sandiṭṭhaṃ sabbaṃ🔽dassetvā viya ekadesakathanaṃ. Vilambitaṃ saṇikaṃ cirāyitvā kathanaṃ. “Sandiddhavilambitādī”ti
analyzed: iminā tassāḥ vācāya mudu saṇha bhāvam āha apalibuddhāya pitta semha ādīhi sandiṭṭham sabbam  dassetvā viya eka desa kathanam vilambitam saṇikam cirāyitvā kathanam sandiddha vilambita ādi iti
translated: He says this to show that her speech was gentle. ‘Unimpeded’ means not impeded by bile, phlegm, etc. ‘All’ means all that is seen, heard, or sensed.

original: vā pāṭho. Tattha sandiddhaṃ sandehajanakaṃ. Ādi-saddena khalitānukaḍḍhitādiṃ saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: vā pāṭhaḥ tattha sandiddham sandeha janakam ādi saddena khalita anukaḍḍhita ādim saṅgaṇhāti
translated: He shows this as if he were pointing to it. ‘Prolonged’ means spoken slowly, drawn out. The reading ‘sandiddha, vilambita, etc.’ is also allowable. Herein, ‘sandiddha’ is that which causes doubt. By the word ‘etc.’ he includes ‘halting’, ‘dragging on’, and so on.

original: Ādimajjhapariyosānaṃ pākaṭaṃ katvāti iminā cassa vācāya atthapāripūriṃ vadanti.
analyzed: ādi majjha pariyosānam pākaṭam katvā iti iminā ca ssa vācāya attha pāripūrim vadanti
translated: ‘The beginning, middle, and end were made clear’ — by this they say he shows the fulfilment of the meaning of her speech.

original: 425. Sadisāti ekadesena sadisā. Na hi buddhānaṃ guṇehi sabbathā sadisā kecipi guṇā🔽aññesu labbhanti. Itareti attano guṇehi asadisaguṇe. Idanti idaṃ atthajātaṃ. Gopadakanti
analyzed: sadisāḥ ti eka desena sadisāḥ na hi buddhānam guṇehi sabbathā sadisāḥ keci pi guṇā  aññesu labbhanti itare iti attanaḥ guṇehi asadisa guṇe idam ti idam attha jātam go padakam ti
translated: ‘Similar’ means similar in part. For no qualities are found in others that are similar in every way to the qualities of the Buddhas.

original: gāviyā pade ṭhitaudakaṃ. Kulapariyāyenāti kulānukkamena.
analyzed: gāviyā pade ṭhita odakam kula pariyāyena ati kula anukkamena
translated: ‘The other’ means the qualities that are not similar to his own qualities. ‘This’ means this collection of meanings. ‘Like the water at the cow’s hoof’ means like the water in the hoofprint of a cow. ‘By the line of the family’ means by the succession of the family.

original: Tatthāti mañcake. Sīhaseyyaṃ kappesīti yathā rāhu asurindo āyāmato vitthārato ubbedhato
analyzed: tattha ati mañcake sīha seyyam kappesi iti yathā rāhu asurindo āyāmataḥ vitthārataḥ ubbedhataḥ
translated: ‘There’ means on the couch. ‘He lay down in the lion’s posture’ means as the asura lord Rāhu does when he is stretched out lengthwise, crosswise, and up and down.

original: ca bhagavato rūpakāyassa paricchedaṃ gahetuṃ na sakkoti, tathārūpaṃ iddhābhisaṅkhāraṃ
analyzed: ca bhagavataḥ rūpa kāyassa paricchedam gahetum na sakkoti tathārūpam iddha abhisaṅkhāram
translated: and he was unable to discern any boundary to the Exalted One’s material body.

original: abhisaṅkharonto sīhaseyyaṃ kappesi.
analyzed: abhisaṅkharontaḥ sīha seyyam kappesi
translated: He then lay down in the lion’s posture.

original: Parisuddhaṭṭhena ariyanti āha “ariyaṃ uttamaṃ parisuddha”nti. Anavajjaṭṭhena kusalaṃ,
analyzed: parisuddha ṭṭhena ariyam ti āha ariyam uttamam parisuddham ti anavajja ṭṭhena kusalam
translated: “Noble” is said in the sense of purity. “Supreme” is said in the sense of being the best. “Pure” is said in the sense of being stainless. “Skillful” is said in the sense of being blameless,

original: na sukhavipākaṭṭhena. Katthaci caturāsīti pāṇasahassāni katthaci aparimāṇāpi devamanussā
analyzed: na sukha vipāka ṭṭhena katthaci catur āsīti pāṇa sahassāni katthaci aparimāṇā api deva manussā
translated: not in the sense of having pleasant results. In some places there are eighty-four thousand living beings, in some places there are immeasurable gods and humans.

original: yasmā catuvīsatiyā ṭhānesu asaṅkhyeyyā aparimeyyā maggaphalāmataṃ pivanti. Koṭisatasahassādiparimāṇenapi
analyzed: catuvīsatiyā ṭhānesu asaṅkhyeyyāḥ aparimeyyāḥ magga phala āmatam pivanti koṭi sata sahassa ādi parimāṇena api
translated: Because in twenty-four places they drink the nectar of the path and its fruits, which are beyond number and measure. Even if they were to be measured in hundreds of thousands of millions,

original: bahū eva. Tasmā anuttarācārasikkhāpanavaseneva bhagavā bahūnaṃ ācariyo. Teti kāmarāgato
analyzed: bahū eva tasmai anuttara ācāra sikkhāpana vasena iva bhagavā bahūnam kāma rāgataḥ
translated: they would still be many. Therefore, the Exalted One is the teacher of many through the power of training in the unsurpassed conduct. “They” refers to the lust for sensual pleasures

original: aññe bhagavatā pahīnakilese.
analyzed: aññe bhagavatā pahīna kilese
translated: and other defilements abandoned by the Exalted One.

original: Apāpapurekkhāroti apāpehi purakkharīyati, na vā pāpaṃ purato karotītipi apāpapurekkhāroti
analyzed: apāpa purekkhāro ti apāpehi purakkharīyati na vā pāpam puratas karoti iti pi apāpa purekkhāro ti
translated: “Free from evil” means not being carried away by evils, or not doing evil in front.

original: imamatthaṃ dassetuṃ “apāpe nava lokuttaradhamme”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha apāpeti pāpapapaṭipakkhe🔽pāparahite ca. Brahmani bhavā, brahmuno vā hitā garukaraṇādinā, brahmānaṃ vā maggaṃ
analyzed: imam attham dassetum apāpe nava lokuttara dhamme tiādi vuttam tattha apāpa iti pāpa papaṭipakkhe  pāpa rahite ca brahmani bhavāḥ brahmunaḥ vā hitāḥ garu karaṇa ādinā brahmānam vā maggam
translated: The words “in the nine kinds of bad and supramundane states” are said in order to show this meaning. Herein, bad is the opposite of good .🔽Brahma is the state of being , or what is beneficial to Brahmā by the doing of respect, etc., or it is the path of Brahmā because one knows it.

original: jānātīti brahmaññā, tassā brahmaññāya pajāya.
analyzed: jānāti iti brahmaññā tassā brahmaññāya pajāya
translated: The brahmin people are the people who have that brahmin .

original: Tiroraṭṭhā tirojanapadāti ettha rajjaṃ raṭṭhaṃ rājanti rājāno etenāti katvā. Tadekadesabhūtā
analyzed: tiroraṭṭhā tirojanapadā ati ettha rajjam raṭṭham rājanti rājānaḥ etena ati katvā tad eka desa bhūtā
translated: In the countries beyond , in the districts beyond , here the countries are so called because kings rule in them, or because they are the means by which kings rule.

original: padesā pana janapado janā pajjanti ettha sukhajīvikaṃ pāpuṇantīti katvā. Pucchāya
analyzed: padesā pana janapadaḥ janā pajjanti ettha sukha jīvikam pāpuṇanti iti katvā pucchāya
translated: But the districts are so called because they are the parts of those countries, or because people are born there and find livelihood there.

original: dosaṃ sallakkhetvāti sambandho. Bhagavā vissajjeti tesaṃ upanissayasampattiṃ cintetvāti
analyzed: dosam sallakkhetvā iti sambandhaḥ bhagavā vissajjeti tesam upanissaya sampattim cintetvā ati
translated: The construction is: having discerned the fault in the question. The Exalted One answers by thinking of their possession of the requisite for the supramundane state.

original: adhippāyo. Navakāti āgantukabhāvena amhākaṃ abhinavā.
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ navakā ati āgantuka bhāvena amhākam abhinavā
translated: The meaning is this. The new ones are so called because they are new to us by way of their arrival.

original: 426. Opāteti nippātetīti attho. Tathābhūto ca tattha pesitā hotīti vuttaṃ “pavesetī”ti. Saṃpurakkharontīti sakkaccaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ karonti. Tenāha “purato katvā vicarantī”ti.
analyzed: opāteti nippāteti iti attho tathābhūto ca tattha pesitā hoti iti vuttam paveseti iti saṃpurakkharonti iti sakkaccam pubbaṅgamam karonti tena āha puratas katvā vicaranti iti
translated: They recite it with a leader: they make the leader go in front. Hence he said “they go about making him go in front.”

original: 427. Sudde bahi katvā raho sāsitabbaṭṭhena mantā eva taṃtaṃatthapaṭipattihetutāya
analyzed: sudde bahis katvā raho mantā eva taṃ taṃ attha paṭipatti hetu tāya
translated: Mantras are so called because they are to be recited in secret, having been put outside the Sutta.

original: padanti mantapadaṃ vedaṃ. Tenāha “vedo”ti. Evaṃ kirāti paramparabhāvena ābhatanti
analyzed: vedam tena āha evam kirāti parampara bhāvena
translated: The Veda is the mantra-text. Hence he said “the Veda.”🔽Thus handed down: handed down by a succession of teachers.

original: ācariyaparamparāya ābhataṃ. Pāvacanasaṅkhātasampattiyāti pamukhavacanamhi udattādisampattiyā.
analyzed: ācariya paramparāyaḥ ābhatam pā vacana saṅkhāta sampattiyā ati pa mukha vacanamhi udatta ādi sampattiyā
