analyzed: vuttam sampādako paripūrako ti ñāyati nicchayena gameti nibbānam tam vā ñāyati
translated: “Accomplisher” is “fulfiller” . It is known by way of the certainty of the knowledge of the path, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of the path, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.

original: paṭivijjhīyati etenāti ñāyo, tato etassa sampādakahetubhāvato ñāyo dhammo ariyamaggo🔽taṃ ñāyaṃ dhammaṃ. Tenāha “kāraṇadhamma”nti. Anavajjanti avajjapaṭipakkhaṃ.
analyzed: paṭivijjhīyati etena ati ñāyaḥ tatas etassa sampādaka hetu bhāvataḥ ñāyaḥ dhammaḥ ariya maggo  tam ñāyam dhammam tena āha kāraṇa dhammanti anavajjanti avajja paṭipakkham
translated: Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.

original: 463. Vaṭṭacārakato niyyātīti niyyānikaṃ īkārassa rassattaṃ ya-kārassa ca ka-kāraṃ
analyzed: vaṭṭa cārakataḥ niyyāti iti niyyānikam īkārassa rassattam yakārassa ca kakāram
translated: Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.

original: katvā. Niyyāne vā niyuttaṃ, niyyānaṃ sīlanti vā niyyānikaṃ, tappaṭipakkhato aniyyānikaṃ.🔽Sā pana atthato akusalakiriyāti āha “akusalapaṭipada”nti.🔽Bahubhāvavācako idha mahāsaddo “mahājano”tiādīsuviyāti āha “mahantehi bahūhī”ti.
analyzed: katvā niyyāne vā niyuttam niyyānam sīlanti vā niyyānikam tad paṭipakkhataḥ a niyyānikam  sā pana atthataḥ akusala kiriyā āti āha akusala paṭipadam ti  bahu bhāva vācakaḥ idha mahā saddaḥ mahā janaḥ ti ādīsu viyā ti āha mahantehi bahūhi iti
translated: Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.

original: Atthoti payojanaṃ. Mahantānīti bahulāni. Kiccānīti kātabbāni. Adhikaraṇānīti adhikārajīvikārūpāni.
analyzed: atthaḥ iti payojanam mahantāni iti bahulāni kiccāni iti kātabbāni adhikaraṇāni iti adhikāra jīvikā rūpāni
translated: Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is the destination of nibbana.🔽Or it is known by way of the penetration of nibbana, and it is

original: Gharāvāsakammameva pañcabalikaraṇadasaatthaṭṭhānabhāvato lokayātrāya ca sampavattiṭṭhānabhāvato
analyzed: ghara āvāsa kammam eva lokayātrāya ca sampavatti ṭṭhāna bhāvataḥ
translated: The work of the house life is a basis for the work of the house life because it is the means of producing the five aggregates, and it is a basis for the round of rebirths because it is the means of keeping it going.

original: jīvitavuttiyā vā hetubhāvato gharāvāsakammaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: jīvita vuttiyāḥ vā hetu bhāvataḥ ghara āvāsa kammaṭṭhānam
translated: Or alternatively, it is a basis for the work of the house life because it is the cause of the maintenance of life.

original: “Appakenapi medhāvī, pābhatena vicakkhaṇo;
analyzed: appakena api medhāvī pābhatena vicakkhaṇaḥ
translated: “Even with a little wit, a wise man can make it grow;

original: Samuṭṭhāpeti attānaṃ, aṇuṃ aggiṃva sandhama”nti. ;🔽Gāthāya vuttanayena cūḷantevāsikassa viya.🔽464. Ayoniso pavattitaṃ vāṇijjakammaṃ viya apāyabhūtaṃ kasikammaṃ nidassanabhāve
analyzed: samuṭṭhāpeti attānam aṇum aggim iva sandhamanti  gāthāya vutta nayena cūḷa antevāsikassa viya  ayonisas pavattitam vāṇijja kammam viya apāya bhūtam kasi kammam nidassana bhāve
translated: He can set himself going like a small fire spreading” .🔽And like the junior attendant in the verse,🔽The work of the house life is like trading wrongly carried out, and the work of the fields is like a pit, in the sense of being a bad destination,

original: ṭhapetvā ayonisomanasikaraṇavasena pavattaṃ gharāvāsakiccaṃ sandhāyāha – “yathā kasi…pe…🔽evaṃ gharāvāsakammaṭṭhānampī”ti. Brāhmaṇabhatto ahosīti so kira bahū brāhmaṇe dhanaṃ
analyzed: ṭhapetvā a yoniso manasikaraṇa vasena pavattam ghara āvāsa kiccam sandhāya āha yathā kasipe  evam ghara āvāsa kammaṭṭhānam pi iti brāhmaṇa bhattaḥ ahosi iti saḥ kira bahū brāhmaṇe dhanam
translated: and the work of the house life is like trading rightly carried out, and the work of the fields is like a good destination, in the sense of being a good destination.🔽He was a brahmin’s servant: it seems that he gave much wealth to brahmins and made them perform a sacrifice.

original: datvā yaññaṃ kāresi. Uparīti “upari upaṭṭhātīti vadehī”ti brāhmaṇehi attano samayena
analyzed: da tvā yaññam kāresi upari iti upari vadehi iti brāhmaṇehi attano samayena
translated: “Say that he is a servant above” : the brahmins said, “Say that he is a servant above.”

original: ācikkhāpitopi yathā upaṭṭhitameva kathetvā kālaṃ katvā niraye nibbatto, atha brāhmaṇā
analyzed: ācikkhāpitaḥ api yathā upaṭṭhitam eva kathetvā kālam katvā niraye nibbattaḥ atha brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: and when he had so done, he died and was reborn in hell. Then the Brahmins,

original: – “iminā amhākaṃ yaññe doso dinno”ti kujjhitvā tassa kaḷevaraṃ susānaṃ netuṃ nādaṃsu.
analyzed: iminā amhākam yaññe doso dinno ti kujjhitvā tassa kaḷevaram susānam netum na adaṃsu
translated: saying “He has spoiled our sacrifice,” were angry and would not let his body be taken to the cemetery.

original: Athassa ñātakehi sahasse dinne taṃ sahassaṃ gahetvā gehato nīharituṃ adaṃsu. Kassapasammāsambuddhakāle
analyzed: athassa ñātakehi sahasse dinne tam sahassam gahetvā gehataḥ nīharitum adaṃsu kassapa sammāsambuddha kāle
translated: But when his relatives gave them a thousand pieces of money, they took the thousand pieces and let them take the body away from the house. In the time of Kassapa Buddha,

original: chattiṃsa itthiyo “ekā vatthaṃ adāsi, ekā gandhaṃ, ekā sumanamāla”ntiādinā taṃ taṃ
analyzed: chattiṃsa itthiyaḥ ekā vattham adāsi ekā gandham ekā tam tam
translated: thirty-six women gave a piece of cloth, a perfume, a garland of jasmine flowers, and so on,

original: dānamayaṃ puññaṃ katvā āyupariyosāne tāvatiṃsabhavane sakkassa devarañño paricārikā🔽hutvā nibbattiṃsu sahassaaccharāparivārikā, sakkassa devarañño vejayantarathaṃ pesetvā
analyzed: dāna mayam puññam katvā āyu pariyosāne tāvatiṃsa bhavane sakkassa deva rañño paricārikā  hutvā nibbattiṃsu sahassa accharā parivārikā sakkassa deva raññaḥ vejayanta ratham pesetvā
translated: and so did various meritorious deeds consisting of giving. At the end of their lives they were reborn in the Tāvatiṃsa heaven as attendants of Sakka, king of the gods,

original: pakkosāpitena guttilācariyabhūtena mahābodhisattena pucchitā taṃ taṃ attanā kataṃ
analyzed: pakkosāpitena guttilācariya bhūtena mahā bodhisattena pucchitā tam tam attanā katam
translated: and they had a retinue of a thousand celestial nymphs. When the Great Being, who was then the teacher Guttila, was sent for by Sakka, king of the gods, in the Vejayanta Palace,

original: puññaṃ byākariṃsu. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “sakalāya guttilavimānakathāya dīpetabba”nti.
analyzed: puññam byākariṃsu tam sandhāya vuttam sakalāya guttila vimāna kathāya dīpetabbanti
translated: he asked them what meritorious deeds they had done. They told him what they had done. It is this story that is referred to in the words “The whole story of the Guttila Palace should be told.”

original: Vaṇijjakammaṭṭhānaṃ vipajjamānanti ettha tassa vipajjamānākāro heṭṭhā vutto. Evaṃ
analyzed: vaṇijja kammaṭṭhānam vipajjamānanti ettha tassa vipajjamāna ākāraḥ heṭṭhā vuttaḥ evam
translated: Thus,🔽the straying of the meditation subject of going forth is also fruitless.

original: pabbajjakammaṭṭhānampi vipajjamānaṃ appaphalaṃ hotīti ānetvā sambandho. Sīlesu aparipūrakārinotiādi
analyzed: pabbajja kammaṭṭhānam pi vipajjamānam appa phalam hoti iti ānetvā sambandhaḥ sīlesu a paripūra kārino tiādi
translated: The words “in the matter of virtue” and so on🔽show the method of its straying.

original: tassa vipajjanākāradassanaṃ. Jhānādisukhanti ettha ādi-saddena abhiññāvipassanādisukhassa🔽viya sabrahmacārīhi saddhiṃ sīlasampadādisukhassa saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Arahattampi
analyzed: tassa vipajjana ākāra dassanam jhāna ādi sukhanti ettha ādi saddena abhiññā vipassanā ādi sukhassa  viya sabrahmacārīhi saddhim sīla sampad ādi sukhassa saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo arahattam pi
translated: The words “the bliss of jhāna” and so on🔽should be understood to include the bliss of the fulfilment of virtue, etc., together with the bliss of the higher paths and fruits, just as the bliss of the jhānas and the higher knowledge is included.

original: pāpuṇāti pageva sekkhaputhujjanasampattiyoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: pāpuṇāti pagā iva sekkha puthujjana sampattiyaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that he reaches even arahantship, not to speak of the distinction of the learner and worldling.🔽“With the spear of generosity”: having made generosity, giving, the chief thing.

original: Cāgasīsenāti padhānabhūtena cāgena dānena taṃ avassayaṃ katvā. Ettha te na koci aphāsukabhāvoti.
analyzed: cāga sīsena ati padhāna bhūtena cāgena dānena tam avassayam katvā ettha te na koci a phāsuka bhāvaḥ ti
translated: “There is no discomfort for you here” means “there is no discomfort for you here.”🔽“Straightforwardly”: without opposition, is the meaning.

original: Ujukaṃ katvā aviruddhaṃ katvā, sampayojetvāti attho. Tapacariyanti aggiparicaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: ujukam katvā a viruddham katvā sampayojetvā ati attho tapa cariyanti aggi paricaraṇam
translated: “Ascetic practices”: tending the sacred flame,

original: tapacariyañca brahmacariyaggahaṇā duṭṭhullabhāvato.
analyzed: tapa cariyam ca brahmacariya ggahaṇā duṭṭhulla bhāvato
translated: and the ascetic practices are included by the words “the life of purity.”

original: 466. Ajānanabhāvanti asabbaññubhāvaṃ. Bhagavato pana sabbaññubhāvo sadevake loke
analyzed: a jānana bhāvanti a sabbaññu bhāvam bhagavato pana sabbaññu bhāvaḥ sa devake loke
translated: “Ignorance” means not knowing all. But the Blessed One’s all-knowing is spread out and established in the world with its deities

original: jalatale pakkhittatelaṃ viya pattharitvā ṭhito, na me idaṃ patirūpaṃ, tato parivattissāmīti
analyzed: jala tale pakkhitta telam viya pattharitvā ṭhitaḥ na me idam patirūpam tatas parivattissāmi iti
translated: like oil poured out on water. It is not fitting for me to do this. I will turn back.”

original: “brāhmaṇo, bho, gotamā”tiādimāha. Paccāharituṃ paṭipakkhena apaharituṃ. Setapokkharasadisoti
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ bho gotama ati ādim āha paccāharitum paṭipakkhena apaharitum seta pokkhara sadisaḥ ti
translated: “A brahmin, Master Gotama,” he said. “To refute” means to refute by a counter-argument. “Like a white lotus”

original: puṇḍarīkapattasadisavaṇṇo. Suvaṭṭitāti vaṭṭabhāvayuttaṭṭhāne suvaṭṭā. Nāmakaṃyevāti
analyzed: puṇḍarīka patta sadisa vaṇṇaḥ su vaṭṭitā ati vaṭṭa bhāva yutta ṭṭhāne su vaṭṭā
translated: means like the colour of a lotus petal. “Well-rounded” means well-rounded in the place where it should be rounded. “Mere name”

original: nāmamattameva vacanamattameva. Tathābhūtānaṃ bhāvassapi abhāvena nihīnaṃ nāma hoti,
analyzed: nāma mattam eva vacana mattam eva tathābhūtānam abhāvena nihīnam nāma hoti
translated: means mere name, mere words. For it is a low name because of the absence of any such state as is described.

original: nāma-saddo nihīnapariyāyo. Tenāha – “lāmakaṃyevā”ti.🔽467. Katamā vācā tesaṃ seyyoti tesaṃ caṅkiyādīnaṃ brāhmaṇamahāsālānaṃ vuccamānavibhāgāsu
analyzed: nāma saddo nihīna pariyāyaḥ tena āha  katamā vācā tesam tesam caṅkiya ādīnam brāhmaṇa mahāsālānam vuccamāna vibhāgāsu
translated: The word “name” is a synonym for “low.” Therefore it is said, “mere lowliness.”🔽“What speech is best for them?” means “What speech is best among the speech divisions spoken by those brahmin householders of great wealth such as Caṅkī?”

original: vācāsu katamā vācā seyyoti. “Seyyā”ti liṅgavipallāsena vuttaṃ. Sammutiyāti avilaṅghitasādhumariyādāya
analyzed: vācāsu katamā vācā seyyā uti seyyā ati liṅga vipallāsena vuttam sammutiyā ti a vilaṅghita sādhu mariyādāya
translated: “Best” is said with a change of gender. “By common consent” means by the consent of good people who do not transgress the rules of good conduct.

original: lokasammutiyā. Tenāha “lokavohārenā”ti. Mantāti mantāsaṅkhātāya paññāya mantetvā
analyzed: loka sammutiyā tena āha loka vohārena ati mantā ati mantā saṅkhātāya paññāya mantetvā
translated: by the world’s usage. Hence he said ‘by the usage of the world.’ ‘Considered’ : after having considered with the understanding called ‘consideration’ .

original: jānitvā. Tenāha “tulayitvā”ti. Atthasaṃhitanti hetusañhitaṃ. Taṃ pana ekaṃsato yuttiyuttaṃ
analyzed: jānitvā tena āha tulayitvā iti attha saṃhitanti hetu sañhitam tam pana ekaṃsataḥ yutti yuttam
translated: Hence he said ‘after having weighed’ . ‘In conformity with the cause’ : in conformity with the cause. But that is in one way suitable to the reasoning .

original: hotīti āha – “kāraṇanissita”nti. Āvutotiādīsu ādito abhimukhaṃ ñāṇagatiyā vibandhanena
analyzed: hoti iti āha kāraṇa nissitanti āvutaḥ ti ādīsu āditas abhimukham ñāṇa gatiyāḥ vibandhanena
translated: Hence he said ‘in conformity with the cause.’ ‘Covered’ , etc.: at the beginning, covered by the obstruction of the course of knowledge facing it ;

original: āvuto, āvariyena visesato ñāṇagatiyā nibandhanena nivuto, evaṃ ophuṭo paliguṇṭhito.
analyzed: āvutaḥ āvariyena visesataḥ ñāṇa gatiyā nibandhanena nivutaḥ evam ophuṭaḥ paliguṇṭhitaḥ
translated: covered by the obstruction of the course of knowledge in particular ; thus, enveloped, wrapped up.

original: Pariyonaddhoti samantato onaddho chādito. Tenāha “paliveṭhito”ti.🔽468. Sace etaṃ kāraṇamatthīti “nissaṭṭhatiṇakaṭṭhupādāno aggi jalatī”ti etaṃ kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: pariyonaddhaḥ iti samantataḥ onaddhaḥ chāditaḥ tena āha paliveṭhitaḥ iti  sace etam kāraṇam atthi iti nissaṭṭha tiṇa kaṭṭhu pādānaḥ aggi jalati iti etam kāraṇam
translated: Surrounded : completely covered, concealed. Hence he said ‘enveloped.’

original: sace atthi yadi siyā, so aparo tiṇakaṭṭhupādāno aggi yadi bhaveyya. Sadoso sādīnavo
analyzed: sace atthi yadi siyā so aparaḥ tiṇa kaṭṭhu pādānaḥ aggi yadi bhaveyya sa dosaḥ sa ādīnavaḥ
translated: If this cause exists, the fire burns with the grass and sticks put into it. If this cause exists, if it were to be, that other fire with the grass and sticks put into it would be with fault, with danger,

original: saparikkileso. Parisuddhoti upakkilesābhāvena sabbaso suddho. Jāti ādīnaṃ abhāvenāti
analyzed: sa parikkilesaḥ parisuddho ti upakkilesa abhāvena sabbaso suddhaḥ jāti ādīnam abhāvena ati
translated: with defilement. ‘Pure’ : completely pure by the absence of defilement. ‘By the absence of birth, etc.’ :

original: jātipaccayānaṃ kammakilesānaṃ niggamena.
analyzed: jāti paccayānam kamma kilesānam niggamena
translated: by the abandoning of the kamma-formations and defilements that are conditions for rebirth.

original: 469. Na niccalā tiṭṭhantīti tattha pakkhipitabbassa labbhamānattā yathāpaññattaṃ hutvā niccalā akampiyā na tiṭṭhanti. Taṃ dosaṃ taṃ ūnatādosaṃ.🔽Aññasmiṃ asatīti atthabhañjakamusāvāde asati. So hi attano santakassa adātukāmatādivasena
analyzed: na niccalāḥ tiṭṭhanti iti tattha pakkhipitabbassa labbhamāna ttā yathāpaññattam hutvā niccalāḥ akampiyāḥ na tiṭṭhanti tam dosam tam ūna tā dosam  aññasmin asati iti attha bhañjaka musāvāde asati so hi attanaḥ santakassa a dātu kāma tā ādi vasena
translated: . “They do not stand firm as fixed” : because of the possibility of the inclusion of this phrase in the preceding phrase, they do not stand firm as fixed, unmoving, in the way they are described. This is the deficiency, the deficiency in the form of a fault.🔽“In the absence of another” : in the absence of the speech that breaks up the meaning, that is, of lying. For the opposite of the state of lying, which occurs by way of the wish not to give one’s own property, etc.,

original: pavattassa akammapathappattassa musāvādabhāvassa viparīto añño idha adhippeto. Tathā
analyzed: pavattassa a kamma patha ppattassa musāvāda bhāvassa viparītaḥ aññaḥ idha adhippeto tathā
translated: and which has become a non-action, is intended here.

original: hi itaro yebhuyyena vaḷañjitabbato voharitabbato vaḷañjakamusāvādoti āha. Na kadāci🔽musāvādīti dve kathā na kathenti. Bāhirakānaṃ anavajjatapasammatāyapi nissitoti vattuṃ🔽āha “sīlavā tapanissitako hoti”ti. Vivaṭamukhā mantajjhenamaṇḍitā sabbaso sajjhāyā
analyzed: hi itaraḥ yebhuyyena vaḷañjitabbataḥ voharitabbataḥ vaḷañjaka musā vādāḥ iti āha na kadāci  musāvādī iti dve kathāḥ na kathenti bāhirakānam vattum  āha sīlavā tapa nissitakaḥ vivaṭa mukhā sabbaso sajjhāyā
translated: Thus the other is called “lying through boasting” because it occurs mostly by way of boasting and talking.🔽“He never lies” : they do not speak two kinds of talk.🔽“The ascetic is devoted to austerity” : he says this in order to show that even that which is considered blameless austerity by outsiders is based on attachment.

original: honti, na itareti āha “pabbajitā niccaṃ sajjhāyantī”ti.
analyzed: honti na itare iti āha pabbajitāḥ niccam sajjhāyanti iti
translated: “The ascetics are always reciting” : their mouths are open and they are adorned with the recitation of the sacred texts, but not the others.

original: 470. Ciraṃ nikkhantoti niggato hutvā cirakāle. Na sabbaso paccakkhā honti satisammohato
analyzed: ciram nikkhantaḥ ti niggataḥ hutvā cira kāle na sabbaso paccakkhāḥ honti sati sammohato
translated: ‘Long since gone forth’: gone forth and long since become a monk. ‘They are not entirely abandoned’ because of confusion of mindfulness.

original: maggānañca aññathā karaṇato. Cirāyitattanti “ayaṃ maggo”ti kathanassa cirāyanaṃ.
analyzed: maggānam ca aññathā karaṇato cirāyita ttan ti ayam maggo ti kathanassa cirāyanam
translated: ‘Because of the alteration of the paths’: because of the alteration of the paths of the three kinds of action. ‘Because of the long standing’: because of the long standing of the statement ‘This is the path’.

original: Vitthāyitattanti asappaṭibhānaṃ. Taṃ pana saupamāha dassetuṃ “yathā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vitthāyi tattanti asappaṭibhānam tam pana saupamāha dassetum yathā itiādi vuttam
translated: ‘Because of the extent’: because of the extent of the non-restraint. In order to show that by means of a simile, he said ‘Just as’ and so on.

original: Balasampannoti kāyabalena samannāgato. Pamāṇakataṃ kammaṃ nāma pamāṇakarānaṃ rāgādikilesānaṃ🔽avikkhambhitattā “pamāṇakataṃ kammaṃ nāma kāmāvacara”nti āha, tesaṃ pana vikkhambhitattā🔽vuttaṃ “appamāṇakataṃ kammaṃ nāma rūpārūpāvacara”nti. Tatthāpi visesato appamaññābhāvanā🔽sambhavatīti āha “tesupī”tiādi. Nirīhakattā yathā appamāṇasamaññā labbhati, taṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: bala sampannaḥ ti kāya balena samannāgataḥ pamāṇa katam kammam nāma pamāṇa karānam rāga ādi kilesānam  a vikkhambhita ttā pamāṇakatam kammam nāma kāma avacaranti āha tesam pana vikkhambhita ttā  vuttam appamāṇa katam kammam nāma rūpa arūpa avacaranti tattha api visesataḥ appamaññā bhāvanā  sambhavati iti āha tesu pi itiādi nirīhaka ttā yathā appamāṇa samaññā labbhati tam dassetuṃ
translated: ‘Endowed with strength’: endowed with bodily strength. ‘Action done with measure’ is sense-sphere action, he said, because the defilements of lust, etc., which are the measurers, are not suppressed.🔽But because they are suppressed, ‘action done without measure’ is fine-material and immaterial-sphere action, he said. And here too the development of the immeasurable is possible in particular, he said.

original: “pamāṇaṃ…pe… vuccatī”ti āha. Na ohīyati na tiṭṭhatīti katūpacitampi kāmāvacarakammaṃ
analyzed: pamāṇam pe vuccati iti āha na ohīyati na tiṭṭhati iti katu upacitam pi kāmāvacara kammaṃ
translated: ‘In them too’ and so on. In order to show how the designation ‘immeasurable’ is applicable because of the absence of measure, he said ‘Measure is … called’ and so on. ‘It does not subside, it does not stand still’: sense-sphere action, even though done and accumulated,

original: yathādhigate mahaggatajjhāne aparihīne taṃ abhibhavitvā āsīdetvā passe ohīyakaṃ katvā
analyzed: yathā adhigate mahaggata jhāne a parihīne tam abhibhavitvā āsīdetvā passe ohīyakam katvā
translated: Having attained the exalted jhāna, without falling away from it, he sees the jhāna as surpassed, as subject to destruction,🔽

original: paṭisandhiṃ dātuṃ samatthabhāvena na tiṭṭhati. Laggitunti āvarituṃ. Ṭhātunti patiṭṭhātuṃ.🔽Pharitvāti paṭippharitvā. Pariyādiyitvāti tassa sāmatthiyaṃ khepetvā. Kammassa pariyādiyanaṃ
analyzed: paṭisandhim dātum samattha bhāvena na tiṭṭhati laggitum ti āvaritum ṭhātum ti patiṭṭhātum  pharitvā ati paṭippharitvā pariyādiyitvā ati tassa sāmatthiyam khepetvā kammassa pariyādiyanam
translated: He is unable to stand in the ability to give rebirth-linking by surpassing and making the jhāna of the exalted type, which he has already obtained and from which he has not fallen away, to be seen as lowly and to be made lowly.🔽“He is unable to stand in the ability to give rebirth-linking by surpassing and making the jhāna of the exalted type, which he has already obtained and from which he has not fallen away, to be seen as lowly and to be made lowly” means that he is unable to stand in the ability to give rebirth-linking by making the jhāna of the exalted type, which he has already obtained and from which he has not fallen away, to be seen as lowly and to be made lowly.

original: nāma vipākuppādabandhanamevāti āha – “tassa vipākaṃ paṭibāhitvā”ti. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: nāma vipāka uppāda bandhanam evā ti āha tassa vipākam paṭibāhitvā ati sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: “He is unable to stand in the ability to give rebirth-linking by surpassing and making the jhāna of the exalted type, which he has already obtained and from which he has not fallen away, to be seen as lowly and to be made lowly” means that he is unable to stand in the ability to give rebirth-linking by making the jhāna of the exalted type, which he has already obtained and from which he has not fallen away, to be seen as lowly and to be made lowly. The rest is easily intelligible.

original: Subhasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
translated: The explanation of the meaning of “līna” in the Subha Sutta is ended.

original: 10. Saṅgāravasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṅgārava sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sangarava Sutta

original: 473. Abhippasannāti abhisamecca pasannā. Tenāha – “aveccappasādavasena pasannā”ti.
analyzed: abhippasannā ati abhisamecca pasannā tena āha avecca pasāda vasena pasannā iti
translated: “Abhippasannā” means “having gone right up to and having confidence” . That is why it is said: “having confidence in the sense of having gone right up to” .

original: Brāhmaṇī vigatamalamaccheratāya “tuyhaṃ deyyadhammaṃ ruccanakaṭṭhāne dehī”ti āha.
analyzed: brāhmaṇī tuyham deyya dhammam ruccanaka ṭṭhāne dehi iti āha
translated: The brahmin woman said: “Give your gift in a place that is pleasing to you” because she was free from the stain of avarice.

original: Maggeneva hissā macchariyassa pahīnattā buddhapakkhabrāhmaṇapakkhavasena ubhatopakkhikā.
analyzed: maggena iva hissā macchariyassa pahīna ttā buddha pakkha brāhmaṇa pakkha vasena ubhatopakkhikā
translated: For she was “on both sides” in the sense of being on the side of the Buddha and on the side of the brahmins because she had abandoned avarice by the path.

original: Kiṃsūti kinti pucchāvacanaṃ. Chetvā anādiyitvā vināsetvā. Sukhaṃ setīti cittasantāpābhāvena🔽sukhena supati. Na socatīti tato eva sokaṃ nāma vināseti. Kodhanti kujjhanalakkhaṇaṃ🔽kodhaṃ. Chetvā samucchinditvā. Sukhaṃ setīti kodhapariḷāhena apariḍayhamānattā sukhaṃ
analyzed: pucchā vacanam chetvā an ādiyitvā vināsetvā sukham seti iti citta santāpa abhāvena  sukhena supati na socati iti tatas eva sokam nāma vināseti kodhanti kujjhana lakkhaṇam  kodham chetvā samucchinditvā sukham seti iti kodha pariḷāhena a pariḍayhamānattā sukham
translated: he sleeps happily, because of the absence of mental anguish.🔽He does not grieve: because of that very fact, he destroys grief. Anger: anger, which is characterized by irritation.

original: supati. Kodhavināsena vinaṭṭhadomanassattā na socati. Visamūlassāti dukkhavipākassa.🔽Madhuraggassāti akkosakassa paccakkosanena, pahārakassa paṭippaharaṇena yaṃ sukhaṃ
analyzed: supati kodha vināsena vinaṭṭha domanassa ttā na socati visa mūlassa ati dukkha vipākassa  madhuraggassa ati akkosakassa paccakkosanena pahārakassa paṭippaharaṇena yam sukham
translated: Having cut off, having eradicated, he sleeps happily, because of not being heated by the heat of anger. Because of the destruction of anger, he does not grieve because of the absence of sorrow. The root of enmity: the root of suffering.

original: uppajjati, taṃ sandhāyeva “madhuraggo”ti vutto. Imasmiñhi ṭhāne pariyosānaṃ “agga”nti
analyzed: uppajjati tam sandhāya iva madhuraggaḥ iti vuttaḥ imasmin hi ṭhāne pariyosānam aggam ti
translated: Sweet-smelling: the happiness that arises through scolding a scolding person, through countering a countering person, is what is meant by “sweet-smelling.” In this context, the end is called “sweet-smelling.”

original: vuttaṃ. Ariyāti buddhādayo ariyā.
analyzed: vuttam ariyā ti buddha ādayaḥ ariyā
translated: The Noble Ones: the Buddhas, etc.

original: Pañhaṃ kathesīti brāhmaṇo kira cintesi – “samaṇo gotamo lokapūjito, na sakkā yaṃ
analyzed: pañham kathesi iti brāhmaṇaḥ kira cintesi samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ loka pūjitaḥ na sakkā yam
translated: He answered the question: the brahmin, it seems, thought thus: “The recluse Gotama is venerated in the world. It is not possible to

original: vā taṃ vā vatvā santajjetuṃ, ekaṃ saṇhapañhaṃ pucchissāmī”ti. So ekaṃ pucchāgāthaṃ
analyzed: vā tam vā vatvā santajjetum ekam saṇha pañham pucchissāmi iti saḥ ekam pucchāgātham
translated: I will ask him one question in a gentle way.” He composed a verse of inquiry,

original: abhisaṅkharitvā “sace asukassa nāma vadhaṃ rocemīti vakkhati, ye tuyhaṃ na ruccanti,🔽te māretukāmosi, lokavadhāya uppanno kiṃ tuyhaṃ samaṇabhāvenāti niggahessāmi. Sace
analyzed: abhisaṅkharitvā sace asukassa nāma vadham rocemi iti vakkhati ye tuyham na ruccanti  te māretu kāmaḥ asi loka vadhāya uppannaḥ kim tuyham samaṇa bhāvena ati niggahessāmi sace
translated: thinking, “If he says, ‘I delight in the slaying of such and such a person,’ I will reply, ‘You wish to kill those who do not please you.🔽Are you not a murderer? Why have you become a monk?’ If he says, ‘I delight in the slaying of no one,’

original: na kassaci vadhaṃ rocemīti vakkhati, atha naṃ tvaṃ rāgādīnampi vadhaṃ na icchasi,🔽tasmā samaṇo hutvā āhiṇḍasīti niggaṇhissāmīti imaṃ ubhatokoṭikaṃ pañhaṃ puṭṭho samaṇo
analyzed: na kassaci vadham rocemi iti vakkhati atha nam tvam rāga ādīnam pi vadham na icchasi  tasmai samaṇaḥ hutvā āhiṇḍasi iti niggaṇhissāmi iti imam ubhatokoṭikam pañham puṭṭhaḥ samaṇaḥ
translated: I will reply, ‘You do not wish the slaying of even lust and the other evil things.

original: gotamo neva gilituṃ na uggilituṃ sakkhissatī”ti evaṃ cintetvā imaṃ payhaṃ pucchi.🔽Tassa bhagavā ajjhāsayānurūpaṃ kathesi. So pañhabyākaraṇena ārādhitacitto pabbajjaṃ
analyzed: gotamaḥ na iva gilitum na uggilitum sakkhissati iti evam cintetvā imam payham pucchi  tassa bhagavā ajjhāsayā anurūpam kathesi so pañha byākaraṇena ārādhita cittaḥ pabbajjam
translated: Therefore you are a monk.’ Thus I will ask him a question that has two meanings, and the monk Gotama will not be able to swallow it down nor to spit it out.” Having thus reflected, he asked the question.🔽The Exalted One preached the Law in accordance with the disposition of the Elder, and the Elder, being satisfied with the preaching of the Law, asked the Exalted One to receive him into the Order.

original: yāci. Satthā taṃ pabbājesi, so pabbajjākiccaṃ matthakaṃ pāpesi. Tena vuttaṃ “pabbajitvā arahattaṃ patto”ti.
analyzed: yāci satthā tam pabbājesi saḥ pabbajjā kiccam matthakam pāpesi tena vuttam pabbajitvā arahattam patto ti
translated: The Teacher received him into the Order, and he fulfilled the duties of a monk.

original: Avabhūtāti adhobhūtā. Adhobhāvo sattānaṃ avaḍḍhi avamaṅgalanti āha – “avaḍḍhibhūtā🔽avamaṅgalabhūtāyevā”ti. Paribhūtāti paribhavappattā. Vijjamānānanti pāḷiyaṃ anādare
analyzed: avabhūtā ati adhas bhūtā adhobhāvaḥ sattānam avaḍḍhi avamaṅgalanti āha  avamaṅgala bhūtāya iva ati paribhūtā ati paribhava ppattā pāḷiyam anādare
translated: “They have become a misfortune” : they have become a misfortune for beings, a bad omen. Therefore it is said: “They have become a misfortune for beings, a bad omen.”🔽“They have become a disgrace” : they have become a disgrace.🔽“Among those that exist” : the word “among” is a term of disrespect.🔽Showing its meaning, he says: “among those that exist.”

original: sāmivacananti tadatthaṃ dassento “vijjamānesū”tiāha. Pakaṭṭhaṃ, pavaḍḍhaṃ vā ñāṇanti
analyzed: sāmi vacanam iti tad attham dassentaḥ vijjamānesu iti āha pakaṭṭham pavaḍḍham vā ñāṇam ti
translated: “Knowledge that is manifest, that has grown” :

original: paññāṇanti bhagavato ñāṇaṃ visesetvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: paññāṇan ti bhagavataḥ ñāṇam visesetvā vuttam
translated: “Knowledge” is said, distinguishing the Blessed One’s knowledge.🔽“Having known by direct knowledge” : having known by knowledge that is distinguished.

original: 474. Abhijānitvāti abhivisiṭṭhena ñāṇena jānitvā. Vositavosānāti katakaraṇīyatāya
analyzed: abhijānitvā iti abhivisiṭṭhena ñāṇena jānitvā kata karaṇīya tāya
translated: “Having lived the life” : having lived the life by having done what is to be done, having brought it to its culmination.

original: sabbaso parisositaniṭṭhā. Pāramisaṅkhātanti paramukkaṃsabhāvato pāramīti saṅkhātaṃ.
analyzed: sabbaso parisosita niṭṭhā pārami saṅkhātanti param ukkaṃsa bhāvato pāramī iti saṅkhātam
translated: “Called perfection” : called perfection because of the state of being the highest.🔽Therefore it is said: “The highest of all dhammas.”

original: Tenāha “sabbadhammānaṃ pārabhūta”nti. Brahmacariyassāti sāsanabrahmacariyassa ādibhūtaṃ.
analyzed: tena āha sabba dhammānam pāra bhūtam ti brahmacariyassa ati sāsana brahmacariyassa ādi bhūtam
translated: “The beginning of the holy life” : the beginning of the holy life of the dispensation.🔽Therefore it is said: “The producer, the generator.”

original: Tenāha “uppādakā janakā”ti. “Idamevaṃ bhavissati idameva”nti takkanaṃ takko, so etassa
analyzed: tena āha uppādakā janakā ati idam evam bhavissati idam evanti takkanam takkaḥ saḥ etassa
translated: “Speculation” : speculation is the conjecture “It is thus, it is not thus.”

original: atthīti takkī. Yasmā so taṃ taṃ vatthuṃ tathā tathā takkitvā gaṇhati, tasmā vuttaṃ🔽“takkagāhī”ti. Vīmaṃsanasīlo vīmaṃsī paccakkhabhūtamatthaṃ vīmaṃsanabhūtāya paññāya
analyzed: atthi iti takkī yasmā so tam tam vatthum tathā tathā takkitvā gaṇhati tasmā vuttam  takka gāhī iti vīmaṃsana sīlaḥ vīmaṃsī paccakkha bhūtam attham vīmaṃsana bhūtāya paññāya
translated: He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.

original: kevalaṃ vīmaṃsanato. Tenāha “paññācāraṃ carāpetvā evaṃvādī”ti. Yathāvuttatakkīvīmaṃsībhāvena🔽takkapariyāhataṃ vīmaṃsānucaritaṃ sayaṃpaṭibhānaṃ evametanti vatvā.
analyzed: kevalam vīmaṃsanataḥ tena āha paññā ācāram evaṃvādī iti yathāvutta takkī vīmaṃsībhāvena  takka pariyāhatam vīmaṃsa anucaritam sayaṃpaṭibhānam evam etat ti vatvā
translated: He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.

original: 485. Aṭṭhitapadhānavatanti aññattha kismiñci puggale aṭṭhitapadhānavataṃ anaññasādhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭhita padhānavatam ti aññattha kismiñci puggale aṭṭhita padhānavatam anañña sādhāraṇam
translated: He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.

original: bhoto gotamassa padhānaṃ ahosi. Sappurisapadhānavataṃ ahosi sappurisapadhānavatādhigatānaṃ
analyzed: bhoto gotamassa padhānam ahosi sappurisa padhānavatam ahosi sappurisa padhānavata adhigatānam
translated: He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.

original: etādisānaṃ arahataṃ acchariyapuggalānaṃyeva āveṇikapadhānavataṃ ahosi. Ajānantova
analyzed: arahatam āveṇika padhānavatam ahosi a jānantaḥ uva
translated: He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.

original: pakāsetīti ayaṃ pucchitamatthaṃ sayaṃ paccakkhato ajānanto eva kevalaṃ saddaṃ uppādetvāva
analyzed: pakāseti iti ayam pucchitam attham sayam paccakkhataḥ a jānantaḥ eva kevalam saddam uppādetvā ava
translated: He is a reasoner because he reasons thus and so about this and that matter.🔽He is a reasoner because he reasons

original: pakāsesīti saññāya āha. Ajānanabhāve santeti ime adhidevāti paccakkhato jānane asati.
analyzed: pakāsesi iti saññāya āha a jānana bhāve santā iti ime adhidevā ti paccakkhataḥ jānane asati
translated: If he did not know: if he did not know these gods by direct knowledge.

original: Paṇḍitena manussenāti lokavohārakusalena manussena, tvaṃ pana lokavohārepi akusalo.🔽Vacanatthañhi ajānanto yaṃ kiñci vadati. Uccena sammatanti uccaṃ supākaṭaṃ sabbaso
analyzed: paṇḍitena manussena ati lokavohāra kusalena manussena tvam pana lokavohāre pi akusalaḥ  vacana attham hi a jānantaḥ yam kiñci vadati uccena sammatan ti uccam su pākaṭam sabbaso
translated: By a wise man: by a man skilled in worldly usage; but you are unskilled even in worldly usage.🔽For one who does not know the meaning of a word speaks anything at all.🔽Well approved: well approved, well known, by all, even by young children.

original: taruṇadārakehipi sammataṃ. Ñātametaṃ yadidaṃ atthi devāti. Tenāha “susudārakāpī”tiādi.
analyzed: sammatam ñātam etam yat idam atthi deva ti tena āha su su dāraka api itiādi
translated: This is known: that there are gods. Therefore he said, “Very well, indeed.”🔽Gods: gods by rebirth.

original: Devāti upapattidevā. Adhidevā nāma sammutidevehi adhikadevāti katvā, tadaññe ca manusse
analyzed: devā ati upapattidevāḥ adhidevāḥ nāma sammutidevehi adhikadevāḥ ati katvā tad aññe ca manusse
translated: The gods above the gods are called gods above the gods because they are gods above the gods by rebirth. Other men are above the gods by rebirth.

original: adhikabhāve kimeva vattabbaṃ. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: adhika bhāve kim eva vattabbam sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: What more can be said about their superiority? The rest is easy to understand.

original: Papañcasūdaniyā majjhimanikāyaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: papañcasūdaniyā majjhima nikāya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: The commentary on the Majjhimanikāya

original: Saṅgāravasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā samattā.
analyzed: saṅgārava sutta vaṇṇanāya līna ttha ppakāsanā samattā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the brief passages is finished.

original: Niṭṭhitā ca brāhmaṇavaggavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: niṭṭhitā ca brāhmaṇa vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Brahmana Vagga is finished.

original: Majjhimapaṇṇāsaṭīkā samattā.
analyzed: majjhima paṇṇāsi ṭīkā samattā
translated: The commentary on the Majjhima is finished.
